38929054.review:
特意选择在2018第一天把《Finding Paradise》通了！
这是一个扮演医生去帮病人解决临终遗憾的游戏，这部作品描述了一个人如何用思想和意志来实现自己的心理满足感，
在虚拟的世界中个人的思想与现实混杂交织，亦梦亦真，游戏中想表达的道理估计大家都懂，但是故事的转折和冲突处理的非常好，在别人的人生中遨游一圈，去感悟和收获，真的是很棒的一种体验。

个人感觉剧情比前作《to the moon》还要触动人心。剧透之类的话我就不多说了，强力推荐。10/10

PS：可以的话建议把《a bird story》也通一遍，无论是玩本作之前还是之后通都没关系，这会让你对于游戏有一个更丰富立体的认识。

38926702.review:
[i] 遗憾吗……是啊，我有很多遗憾。[/i]
[i] 但是……已经没关系了。[/i]
[i] 那些我错过的机会，那些小意外，和我所有未尽的愿望……是的，它们还是我的遗憾……可它们让我拥有了现在的一切。[/i]
[i] 而我所拥有的一切……无论什么都换不走。[/i]

我觉得这才是游戏想要表达的东西，谁都不需要西格蒙德，因为就算不完美的现实，也胜过完美的幻想。
[spoiler] 不过最后修复了科林记忆的人却是法耶，这大概说明幻想也并不是完全没有意义的吧。[/spoiler]

虽然介绍说无需玩过本系列的其他游戏，不过我觉得至少一只鸟的故事是得玩的。[spoiler] 不然在山上法耶张开翅膀抱住科林的那个场景怕是演出效果大打折扣[/spoiler]

此外，去月球的mini episode还没玩过的记得去玩哦。

除了科林的故事之外，其实这一作有另一个让我很兴奋的地方，就是这个系列的主线终于开始有眉目了，[strike] 虽然以前的坑一个没填，反而挖了更多的坑[/strike]。最后瓦茨医生保留了法耶的数据，这么说法耶可能以后还会出场？还有就是这一作已经开始探讨西格蒙德存在的必要性了，所以估计这也是为主线做的铺垫？

好希望这个有生之年的系列可以一口气完结啊。

38926420.review:
Finding Paradise para aqueles que não sabem ou estão em dúvida se vão comprar o jogo é sobre dois doutores que viajam através das memórias das pessoas , que estão morrendo, para realizar seu último desejo. Esse é o segundo jogo sendo continuação direta de To The Moon, porém não é preciso ter jogado o primeiro jogo para jogar este, porque o jogo explica todas as mecânicas e repete algumas informações sobre as personagens, empresa e tudo que envolve aquele mundo.

É um jogo que está seguindo a onda retro do pixelart com uma ou outra cutscene mais elaborada de momentos chaves o que combina com tudo que o jogo quer passar, ele pode ser jogado completa e tranquilamente em um dia por aproximadamente 4/6h em um ritmo tranquilo lendo todos os diálogos e explorando todas as memórias.

A trilha sonora e diálogos são ótimos, as piadas são bem colocadas, assim como, as reviravoltas e os momentos dramáticos estão bem colocados nada que soe exagerado ou Deus-ex-machina. 

Se eu tivesse que apontar um aspecto negativo talvez fosse o  cliffhanger para o terceiro jogo. Óbvio que ele é funcional pois você quer saber o que terá no terceiro jogo, mas temo da fórmula ficar cansativa se não revelar aquilo que foi posto na mesa na história até aqui.

38925883.review:
《To the Moon》带给我们的是一个关于坚守爱情、感动与重逢的故事，而《Finding Paradise》展现出来的则是孤独与苦涩的诀别。

在玩续作之前，我在B站（av3982136）偶然搜到了CCTV对独立游戏设计师高瞰的采访（推荐能看到这条评测的粉丝们都去看一看）。他说，因为年少时随父母远赴海外，因为语言问题无法与同龄人沟通而十分自闭，他总是沉浸在自己的世界里。到了高中高瞰自学了钢琴与作曲，大二开始创作《To the Moon》，注册的自由鸟工作室其实也是他一个人的工作室。制作续作时因为主角Colin是个飞行员，他甚至亲自去学习飞行驾驶。

之所以提起高瞰，是因为想起那句艺术源于生活而高于生活。结合了《A Bird Story》和《Finding Paradise》后，能明显地看出制作人将自己从前在异国他乡的孤独和情感灌注给了Colin，用这个角色来写出了这样一个关于生活的坚守与友情的故事，向玩家描绘、分享自己的世界。

游戏的全流程大概四个小时多点，一口气玩下来不是问题。每一个记忆碎片或许并不如《To the Moon》中的沙包、鸭嘴兽玩偶来得有伏笔有故事，但解谜的过程中通过它们穿插着有趣的互动，再加上它本身并不拖沓的游戏流程，能让你沉浸在这个世界里去解读有关Colin一生的遗憾的故事。

放一下自己很喜欢的最后Colin与Faye诀别的对话，有剧透：
[spoiler]Faye：……老顽固，在找我吗？
Faye：有段日子没见了，对吧？
Colin：……是很长的一段日子了。
Colin：你看起来没怎么变呢。
Faye：你觉得这算谁的错呢，嗯？
Faye：抱歉，我本来打算找个好日子和你见面，但是……
Colin：……我明白。
Colin：我也希望我还能有时间告诉你在那之后发生的一切。
Faye：没事的……我一直都在呢。
Faye：我只是来说再见的。
Faye：只不过……告诉我一件事就好。
Faye：……你现在还有什么遗憾吗？
Colin：遗憾吗……
Colin：……是啊，我有很多遗憾。
Colin：但是……已经没关系了。
Colin：那些我错过的机会，那些小意外，和我所有未竟的愿望……
Colin：是的，它们还是我的遗憾……可它们让我拥有了现在的一切。
Colin：而我所拥有的一切……无论什么都换不走。
Faye：……这正是我希望听到的。
Faye：去吧……他们还等着你呢。
Faye：……是时候回家了。
Faye：嘿，Colin……
Faye：很抱歉，那时的我不得不离你而去。
Colin：……谢谢你。哪怕是谁也不再身边的时候，也有你一直陪伴着我。

Colin在Faye重塑的记忆里最后的时刻亲吻了他挚爱一生的妻子，然后离去。[/spoiler]

38925257.review: A worthy sequel of To The Moon.

38922077.review:
This is the kind of game that's hard to review. It's not because of anything in particular, but more so the fact that trying to describe what makes Finding Paradise so special without spoiling even a minute detail is nearly impossible. It is an emotional rollercoaster that gives incredible insight into one man's life. It is a philosophical debate wrapped up into a series of key questions. It has plot threads just present enough to make you wonder what else there is. And it is just in time to be on my personal favorite list of games for 2017

Finding Paradise is, at this moment, the best thing that Ken Gao has made thus far and it makes me excited to see what is next for Freebird Games.

38921916.review:
I know I'm in the minority here, but I liked this more than To The Moon (and I loved To The Moon).

First of all, while I like the premise and plot of both To The Moon had some painfully bad dialog at times. In Finding Paradise each character has their own voice instead of everyone sounding like the same nerdy teenager. It still squeezes in some comic relief video game and anime references, but handles the much better this time around.

Second, while it has a few action scenes, they don't feel completely broken like in To The Moon. The puzzle minigames also felt like less of an interuption.

And third, the story hit much closer to home for me. I figured out what was what they were going to have to do at the end, even before the childhood friend was introduced. But the specific way those events play out hit me much harder than I expected. Near the end I was like, "So I guess this game won't be sad like To The Moon..." and then those damn onion ninjas caught me off guard. Wow, this story can really make you think about life, love, memories, aging, motivation, truth, and dreams. To The Moon is great, but it's just so specific and sappy where this feels like something most people have experience with.

If there's one fault, I didn't find the music as completely awesome as To The Moon, but it did catch me surprise how much the main theme had grown on me by the end.

38918512.review:
I'm going to put this one up there with the greats in the genre for one reason. It's similar to To The Moon, but not the same. It is for example not as deep or long as Rakuen by Laura Shigihara, but is just as complex in the experience. Could have been longer, but sometimes a story needs telling in one sitting. No doubt there will be more like it from Kan Gao. For anyone who thinks RPG Maker games are basic and rubish, this creation is another inspiration. Finding Paradise will make you see some parts of your own life differently, and maybe understand some of the crazier people you may meet one day too. It's a dangerous piece of ground to tread, but gaming is designed for this kind of ground, and I love that Kan has the guts to go here, and to deliver it via a truly beautifull vehicle.

I love that the whole emotional intelligence genre of gaming is better represented.

38917550.review:
[h1] Absolutely wonderful [/h1]

After having played To the Moon, I thought it would be difficult to find a game that matched its touching storyline and richness. 10/10, would cry to again.

38909805.review:
เราติดตามซีรี่ส์นี้มาตั้งแต่ To the Moon ค่ะ และเฝ้ารอมาตั้งแต่เล่นจนใหม่ๆเมื่อหลายปีก่อน 
ตอนแรกก็กลัวๆว่าตั้งความหวังไว้สูงมากๆ จะผิดหวังรึเปล่า

แต่ไม่เลยค่ะ

ภาคนี้แม้จะไม่ได้ให้ความรู้สึกรู้สึกเศร้า ฟูมฟายมากมายเท่าภาคก่อน
แต่โดยส่วนตัวเรากลับชอบประเด็นของภาคนี้มากกว่านะ พล็อตเรื่องแข็งแรงขึ้น และมีความชัดเจนในตัวเอง
ทำให้เสียน้ำตาจากความอิ่มเอมใจมากกว่าสะเทือนใจ

ในส่วนของเพลงประกอบยังคงเป็นจุดแข็งของเรื่อง ที่ช่วยสื่ออารมณ์ในส่วนที่กราฟฟิคแบบ RPG Maker ขาดหายไป
โดยเฉพาะจังหวะของเพลงยังทำได้ดีเหมือนเดิม

38908222.review:
Certo, eu não sei nem por onde começar. Acho que começarei com um aviso.

[h1][b] NÃO JOGUE SEM SUA CAIXA DE LENÇOS AO LADO! [/b][/h1]

Finding Paradise é a sequência de To the Moon, ambos os jogos sendo verdadeiras [b]obras-primas[/b] do [strike]desgraçado[/strike] supremo Kan Gao. Embora não seja necessário ter jogado o primeiro para entender o que se passa no segundo, recomendo com todas as forças (e armas) que tenho para que você o faça. Um jogo que levou cerca de  anos para ser desenvolvido não poderia desapontar aqueles que o esperavam. E, adivinha? [b][i]NÃO DESAPONTOU NEM UM POUCO.[/i][/b]

A história gira em torno dos parceiros Dr. Neil Watts e Dra. Eva Rosalene, doutores da Sigmund Corp. e que têm um trabalho curioso: Eles viajam por entre as memórias de pessoas quase mortas afim de realizar seu maior desejo. Calma, eu sei que parece estranho, mas não é [strike]tanto assim[/strike]. Para transmitir um sonho presente em algum ponto da vida do paciente, é preciso conhecer toda a história (ou, pelo menos, a parte necessária) do mesmo para entender o porquê do desejo, modificando a trajetória das memórias o quanto for necessário. E é aí que Kan Gao faz você correr pra farmácia da esquina pra comprar lencinhos.

Cada jogo trata-se de um paciente diferente, neste sendo Colin Reeds, um piloto aposentado cujo desejo precisa ser descoberto na viagem dentro de sua cabeça. Não darei spoilers, mas digo que esse é o ponto principal da reviravolta. O enredo é digno de um filme, se quiser saber. E, um ponto chave: Você controla o Neil na maior parte do tempo, ou seja, [b]sarcasmo all the way, baby![/b] Agora, sério, você devia comprar o jogo só pela carisma do Neil. Não que a Eva não seja carismática, mas eu já disse que eu amo o Neil? Enfim, vocês entenderam.

Menção mais-que-honrosa para a trilha sonora sensacional de Kan Gao e Laura Shigihara, que conseguem arrepiar qualquer pessoa em questão de segundos. Cada música se encaixa perfeitamente com o momento e faz você se sentir dentro da história, mesmo que a jornada seja deveras curta (umas 5h, 6h e você termina o jogo). 

Então, é isso. Finding Paradise emociona, faz a espera valer a pena e, sobretudo, é maravilhoso. Se você gosta de uma história boa e emocionante, é seu [b][i]DEVER[/i][/b] comprar este jogo.

100/10

38895058.review:
和你经历过最开始的孤独，只想在生命的终点和你讲述你不知道的故事。
[b] 剧透预警[/b]
[spoiler] 和To the Moon中因为吃药而忘记过去的老先生一样，这位老先生从某种意义上来说也不一般。很多人的童年都会有一个幻想中的伙伴，在自己孤单的时候给自己一些慰藉。然而Colin则把这个幻想的伙伴当做自己唯一的好友（其实想想要不是没得选他也不会这么做），以致于影响了他和他人的交往。那么原因和结果就变得模糊不清了。在遇到后来的妻子Sofia后，只好告别想象中的Faye（说实话这个名字真的很奇怪，可以理解为farewell yesterday吗？)正是这一告别给他留下了无比的遗憾，也就是为什么他想找Sigmud实现愿望了。最后Faye在记忆中为Colin找了一个好基友，并且在最后的记忆中再次和Colin告别，也算是圆满了。 [/spoiler]
[b] 相比去月球而言，本作讲了一个更加复杂的故事，同时也给人更加深刻的思考。音乐和脚本水平在线的同时，其中的小游戏部分也很有趣。[/b][strike] 那个回合制小游戏我死了4次一点也不难。[/strike][b]几次大场面的特效也为游戏添彩不少。[/b][spoiler] 说的就是你Watts的黄金圣衣！[/spoiler]
花了两天一口气通了，还是有些意犹未尽，可能过段时间会再打一遍，去留心一些细节？

It's a captivating series that made me finish both 'To The Moon' and 'Finding Paradise' within a day (with tears and laughter).
It's not about which one is better than the other but the meaning it carries sets both games apart.
At the same time, both games also brought out one point very clearly. How we live our lives are based on our perspective and our choices. Whether you choose to embrace it or run away from it will deeply impact you at the end of the road.

Sometimes, it's not about the graphics. It's also about the story telling and I am glad to be able to play this game.
Definitely recommended. :)

38886451.review:
I have to say, although I didn't finish this game in one sitting, nor did I shed as many tears compared to its predecessor, "To The Moon", this is just as strong a game, if not stronger, than the first game.
SPOILERS AHEAD, READ AT YOUR OWN RISK
This may be the only review I ever write for a game (because I know for a fact that I haven't written one on Steam yet), but this game hit pretty hard for me. Although I can't say that I had a personification/imaginary friend that I took to adulthood, I do know what it's like to see the world through a negative perspective. When Faye always pointed out how Colin is such a downer, I never thought much of it more than an observation. But then when she took full control of his memories and merely shifted them to include the happy memories he made instead of his previous memories that mainly focused on his regrets and mistakes in the later half of his life, it shook me to the core. Because in this game, for me, no major change in Colin's life was made at all, but rather, Faye just gently nudged his memories so that they included the good that sprung from his decisions instead of having him focus on what went wrong in his life, which now seem comparatively trivial in hindsight. Did Colin accidentally spill his drink on his honeymoon? Sure, but he then learned about the usefulness of invisible ink, which he made great use of afterwards. Did Colin hire the wrong guy who can't seem to spell anything for his proposal? Perhaps, but she still married him regardless and loved him deeply for decades afterwards. 
SPOILERS END HERE
Although I can't say I shed any tears for this game (although, the more playthroughs I watch of the game, the more tears I shed, so this statement is no longer valid :P), it definitely hit me where I didn't expect it to hit. When I initially approached this game, I was hoping to have my lacrimal glands destroyed to oblivion. What I got instead was unexpected but also extremely refreshing. As with its prequel, I'd fully recommend this game and am recommending at the moment to anyone, both video game enthusiasts and non-enthusiasts alike. After all, I believe that there's a lesson or two we can always learn from games produced by Kan Gao and FreeBird games and that it doesn't require the most in-depth game mechanics to craft a compelling story, as you have all proved time and time again.
As for the soundtrack, once again, this OST has knocked the ball out of the park yet again. I watched both trailers for this game and was so hyped that I would repeatedly return to them hoping that the story and music will deliver (which they both did). I could never imagine playing any of these games without a tear-jerking theme in the background to match the ambience of the story. There is even a part in the game where music from the first trailer of "Finding Paradise" kicked in, and I was blown away that it took so long to make its appearance. The occasion it was queued for, however, was very fitting. I will definitely purchase the soundtrack for this game, as I have for the first, but that will have to wait until my wallet fills up again.
Until then, I look forward to the next artful masterpiece that will come out and spend the rest of my time acting on the ideas that were presented to me in this delightful game.

38879665.review:
YES! Finding Paradise is here, and once again, I feel like I need to write a review, which I don't do, but this is a special occasion.

Finding Paradise is the "sequel" to To the Moon,  one of my all time favorites. Now, I wrote "sequel" just because the store page says that this game is independent to To the Moon, and you don't have to play it to play this one. In my opinion that is [b]not[/b] how it should be; having played through To the Moon first, along with the minisodes, then A Bird Story and THEN Finding Paradise was a whole experience leading up to this game, and it felt just right, so for anyone looking, I STRONGLY recommend that you play all those before playing this. 

As with To the Moon, this game has very simple graphics, very simple gameplay, but a gripping story, and some heart wrenching moments. I found myself finishing this game in 2 sessions, one was late at night, so I didn't last too long, but the second session I played for 4 hours straight, which is something I never thought I was capable of. 

Writing a review without spoiling much is kinda hard so I'll just say: If you want a damn fine story experience, you should definately play the Sigmund Corp series [i](To the moon>Minisodes>A Bird Story>Finding Paradise)[/i], but keep in mind:

-The game itself is very simple
-The resolution is kinda weird, due to engine limitations
-Have a good amount of tissues next to you


I can't recommend these games enough, they're really worth your time.
I rate this 5 paper planes out of 5 paper planes

38861917.review:
[h1] TL;DR [/h1]
If I was to put this game into a genre, it'll be a point n click adventure with heavy narration and themes. However, I feel like that's definitely not enough to describe how much " Finding Paradise" left me in wonder and awe.

-For a game that only took me 5 hrs to play, it felt like I was actually unfolding someone's lifetime worth of memories. 
-Everything from the whimsical characters , to immersive plot, everything about this game is an experience. 

Note: I haven't played a bird's story, nor did I know that it was a continuation. So do play that first then experience this :)

The order would be : To the Moon, Minisode 1 , Minisode 2, A Bird's Story, Finding Paradise. The minisodes just add a bit more depth to the characters and the Sigmund Organisation etc :) ( I'll update again if I'm wrong)



[h1] First Impressions[/h1]
-Absolutely astounding mix of delicate and whimisical characters , a lot of character development




[h1] Plot [/h1]
-Would you sacrifice a lifetime of memories , for a new set? Or maybe, just to fufill a dream?
- What can you do when a compromise between decisions need to be made?
- What happens when there's a blurred line between dreams and reality , where your dreams can come true?

Simply, you play as the agents from Sigmund- Classic O'Neil and eloquent Dr Eva Rosaline whose goal is to fufill one's final wish at his/her's last breath. That itself isn't a spoiler. 

To do so, you travel back to their past and witness the events of an individual's life unfold. All the emotions felt, all the causes and consequences and "what ifs" revealed in plain sight. It's a surreal experience, to be able to wander through and see why and how the client became who they in their present moment. 



[h1]Gameplay[/h1] 
- Simple click and point , discovery game.
- The goal is to find memory orbs and links to be able to "unlock" a memento. 
- Puzzles involve a lot of switching and matching- The Difficulty definiterly increases
-It's highly philosophical :)
- Depending on the situation, there may be a set of combat options but nothing too grand ( fun easter eggs to be unlocked too, without spoiling ofc :))


[h1] Art [/h1]
-Pixel Art - Beautiful nostalgic and calm art. 
- At times, the pixels can be really detailed too :)
- Reminds me of the classic snes games like zelda, chrono trigger :)


[h1]Music & Soundtrack[/h1]
- I'd describe this as natural sounding music. Everything goes so well with the scenes 
-Loopable themes - Piano :)
- Really serene orchaestral music 
- Transitions to Epic Music occasionally.



[h1]Symbolism[/h1]
- We learn about the client and his/her life through symbolism and interaction with mementos.
- It's basically filled with symbolism, to each of their own :)



[h1] Final Thoughts [/h1]
If one was to abandon all their regrets or chased their "what ifs" , what would become of the current form of themselves? Simply, it would cease to exist. 

This game is purely about acceptance of what is and isn't, but I'll leave that to you to judge. 

I promise you, if you're wandering around, unsure of what to make of your current life, or even just want a surreal experience through another pair of eyes, then I strongly recommend "Finding Paradise". 

P.S. To the Frosty that gifted me this game, you're a legend. What a lovely Christmas present, thank you  :)

38859781.review:
11/10
非常有共鸣，自己心中不也会有这样一个人么
=====================以下内容剧透======================
[spoiler]

虽然整剧最感动的地方应该有三个，漩涡中心的离别、在阳台最后的道别以及最后夫妻在两个不同的世界同时相拥。但对我来说还有一个地方非常感动，那是在eva断开链接，neil把所有控制权交给faye时候的对话。

“你觉得我是否真实？”
“你们是我第一次遇到真正能交流的人，或许这也是colin愿望的一部分”

faye毕竟是colin的想象，所以这些话其实全部来自colin自身。

一个在自己心里活灵活现的人，对自身来说她比现实中每个人都要生动，如果这样一个人只存在在自己心里，那是对她的一种束缚，因为她应该拥有属于自己的生活，应该能与其他人交流，甚至应该存在在这个世界中，被他人所认识，拥有自己的人生。真正的孤单，其实在“她”身上了。

colin真正的遗憾，其实是抛下了faye让她[b]孤单地度过了一辈子[/b]。

==================后面说点跟剧情流程有关的==================

最终boss战是可以战胜也可以不战胜的，而且后面会有一点展开不同的情况

战胜：
回来之后eva会锁住faye，并且从她手里抢过记忆进行跳跃，然后neil会趁faye被锁定的情况下保存她的数据。

战败：
eva锁不住faye，faye从机场内部逃走，然后neil冲进去把faye带到隐私空间，经过双方都有好处的“交易”之后得到记忆球。

个人觉得这里的正确路线应该是neil败给faye。
因为考虑到在紧接着的剧情里eva把所有记忆连起来之后有一段崩塌，在崩塌将要击中eva的时候，一个纸飞机飞过来救了eva。
但当时neil显然没有能力救eva，病人colin本身当然也不可能，所以这个纸飞机只可能是faye放出来的，如果没有“交易”应该不会存在这样的结果。

为了承接两段分支，恐怕交易的内容是：faye把记忆球给neil，neil把控制权交给faye，以及最重要的对双方都有好处的条件是：[b]把faye带到外面的世界[/b]。只有当他们达成交易了，这样才能解释后面为什么会有纸飞机救了eva
[/spoiler]

38847244.review:
Other than movies, it is hard to make me cry at a work of art. I am not claiming it in a masculine undertone, but instead in the methods that work of art impose through a major amount of text. Whenever I read a novel, I never find myself in the verge of tears over an emotional scene. It may, persay, get my heart in a sort of drowsiness, but that's about it. So when I say that I had big droplets coming down at the end of this game, I can safely declare that such a game is a complete masterpiece. 

The concept is already incredible and hard to think about without posing the ethics, the correctiveness, and the technical aspects of it, and regardless, it is still something worth talking about at any given moment. This sequel kicked off just like the original, with a new twist in the mechanics of the machine and an explanation behind said mechanics. Everything ties together and you can tell that Kan Gao is not fucking around when he writes his stories. 

Apart from the side-story with Sigmund Corp., the story itself begun simple to me, and I already had expectations for how it would turn out. Of course, the genius of Kan made you believe certain events would happen, when in reality, it was something completely different. Truthfully, Kan Gao knows how to correctly write a plot twist, and even more, how to write a plot twist that is subtle, but predictable and not spontaneously ex-machina. 

The ending of the story punched me into a muse of thought that shifted itself into one of emotions, and before I knew it I began to cry at the complete melancholy that was this story, this game, this experience.

Finding Paradise is a work of art that cannot be compared easily to other scientific works, but instead deserves a spot at the very top of those of the genre. So much was left for me to think in only four hours of playing it. Truthfully worth every penny, every minute, and every bit of space it uses to convey its story from thought to thought.

I absolutely recommend this game, especially for fans of the first.  

Personally I still feel that To the Moon is the stronger game, but Finding Paradise tries to do something different, which I respect.  There's less tear-inducing drama, and more of a challenge to the doctors' morals.  More of the same would have been a problem for me.  

The comedy was a lot stronger, and the writing and the twists are just as creative if not more so than before.  But most of all, we learn even more about Eva and Neil, and the creators have clearly sewn the seeds for a third installment in the future.

38818485.review:
[i]Finding Paradise[/i] is beautiful, heartfelt and a worthy follow-up to [i]To The Moon[/i].  The light puzzle and exploration gameplay serves to illustrate the story of a man's life, wishes and regrets that shows a keen understanding of human nature.  As a sequel, it improves on the original in length, gameplay, art/graphics, and humour, while also telling a different story.  Despite the multi-year wait I was happy, and recommend it to anyone who likes emotional narrative-driven games.

The gameplay divides into three types: periodic simple puzzles; exploration; and some more arcade-like mini-games later on.  In this regard it follows its predecessor, but I found all three elements improved.  The puzzles are simple, but varied with new mechanics introduced throughout.  The exploration sections divide up the story, and serve to draw attention to the relative importance of different events in Colin's life.  The arcade sections are simple and silly, but fun and less frustrating than the [i]To The Moon[/i] equivalent.

Away from the gameply, the art design is good and the music excellent.  The humour also hit the mark frequently, one area that I felt was much improved over its predecessor.  [i]Finding Paradise[/i] also avoids the sequel trap of telling the same story with the names changed.  This has its downside; [i]To The Moon[/i] was noted for its emotional sledgehammer, but here the story places greater emphasis on mystery and humour.  But it also knows how to play your emotions when appropriate.

Despite my references to the previous game, [i]Finding Paradise[/i] is a stand-alone game.  To those unfamiliar with the SigCorp Universe, this is a satisfying introduction.  Old fans should find this a worthwhile continuation.  I only hope we don't have to wait another six years for episode 3.

38804009.review:
So, Kan Gao mentioned before that Finding Paradise and To The Moon were intended to be two sides of the same coin. By this point, I understand what he means. There are a number of really cool contrasts between Finding Paradise and To The Moon, and I found Finding Paradise to be much more polished, well-written, and personally, more engaging than To The Moon. (This is not to say that I disliked To The Moon; rather, that I liked Finding Paradise so much more.)

What Finding Paradise did well: the entire game just felt more polished as a whole, both in terms of mechanics and in terms of writing (though presumably, part of this can be attributed to the fact it's the second game.) I liked the story a lot more as it felt more relatable, and the banter between Neil and Eva was sharper and more on point; I also appreciated the amount of development Neil got (and to a lesser extent, Eva.) I liked the information portioned out to us about SigCorp, the machine, and whatever is going on with Neil, and learning more about Roxie and Robert was lovely, though I get the sense that some things have transpired in the interim. Finding Paradise also nicely advances the meta-plot, with continued hints that something is--not quite--right with the world as is given to us.

I like the branches as well; clearly, this is not a 'choices have consequences' sort of RPG, but I like how different choices offer you different insights into the shared world and situations of Finding Paradise.

Finding Paradise has heart. It's a different kind of heart from To The Moon -- it's not about love, but about happiness, regrets, and loneliness. To that extent, I find it much more relatable. 

Issues: I found it strange to introduce a mechanic to swap between Neil and Eva -- it's a great mechanic, and I like it, but why introduce it if we can't use it except at the beginning? 

Still, would recommend and am eagerly anticipating (what, in 2023?) the next installment :P

38800634.review:
[b]我很荣幸在2017年的末尾玩到了这款今年最感动我的游戏。10/10。[/b]

对于游戏本身，拥有与《To The Moon(去月球)》一样高的水准，甚至我个人认为在游戏性上比前者更加成熟，是一款原价买都不会觉得亏的游戏。音乐与剧情同样优秀，让玩家很容易进入角色里，整体感非常强，太容易让人感动到了，一如既往的高瞰水准。在最后的立意上，我认为是高于前作的，在讲述浪漫故事的同时，并且关怀到了边缘性群体，前面不能剧透太多。游戏时间不到六小时，却能带你走过一个人的一生。


下文涉嫌剧透警告：（可能会影响游戏体验）


[spoiler]“我从没被谁知道，所以也没被谁忘记。在别人的回忆中生活，并不是我的目的。”——顾城《早发的种子》

我记得我曾经看过一本书叫《再不说就来不及了——纽约客的临终遗言》，书中筛选了数十位临近死亡的人写下的遗书，里面谈到了他们的心愿、他们的悔恨、他们的故事。我一直很好奇在我年近垂暮的时候会怎样来总结我的人生，我有哪些未完成的心愿，我有哪些值得留恋的过往，而游戏里的这家公司就做的正是探寻临终者一生的故事，弥补那些曾经的遗憾。

我相信很多人在孩提时期都会有想象中的好朋友，他/她才是这个世界上最懂自己的人，那些不能与任何人分享的秘密，那些生活里琐碎的事情，都有人耐心地听你讲完，给你加油。Colin作为一个从小不善于与同龄人交往，父母不在身边，很少有人关心的孩子，能在自己的世界里拥有一个可爱又帅气的邻家女孩陪伴着自己，这样的幻想对他而言已经十分满足了。从叠纸飞机，到真正开上航空公司客机，在人生的轨迹里总有Faye的存在，一直鼓励着自卑且自闭的Colin变成更美好的人。从背着比自己个子还高的大提琴，被人暗地里嘲笑；到飞机降落时颠簸，被小乘客数落飞行技术不好，Colin的生活也一直是战战兢兢的，只有在与Faye在一起的时候，他才觉得是自由的、诚实的、快乐的，即使她会笑他蠢，会嫌弃他跑得慢，但她却是唯一一个能够站在Colin的角度，愿意与他交流的人了。

随着渐渐成长，Colin不得不更加贴近现实生活，不得不舍弃掉最了解他的Faye，拥有着属于自己的家庭。但即使是最亲近的妻子Sofia，Colin也很难像对待Faye那样敞开心扉地同她交流，我想这也应该是为什么他希望改变自己的记忆的原因，其实他自己也不明白如今的生活到底有哪些遗憾的地方。那些所谓的失之交臂，都是生长在无人理解的苦楚上的花朵，因此他还一直好好保留着那本用柠檬水写的日记。我想Colin真正的心愿应该就是完成曾经许下的誓言，再见一次Faye，把自己的一生都向她娓娓道来。

再要好的朋友也没有自己更了解自己。我们生活在一个感情可以被量化，关系可以被标签的世界里，有的时候渴求的并不是一段海誓山盟的感情，更不是白头偕老的关系，希望的只是能够把自己的人生全部倾诉给一个能够理解自己的人，这就够了。[/spoiler]

最后的博士间的对话也为之后的剧情埋下了伏笔，期待以后的作品！

38798099.review:
Se c'è un gioco che è quasi universalmente riconosciuto come uno dei più toccanti ed emozionanti degli ultimi anni (se non di sempre), quello è To the Moon. Quando poi esce il seguito di tale gioco, le aspettative sono molto alte!
Ebbene, Kan Gao è riuscito nell'impresa di confezionare un gioco in grado di toccare il cuore dei giocatori e farli piangere come ci era riuscito con il precedente.
Finding Paradise è la naturale evoluzione di To the Moon: stesse meccaniche minimali, stessa grafica a pixel che piace a moltissimi, una nuova storia. O meglio, una nuova vita! Perchè è questo quello a cui partecipiamo: alla vita di un uomo, ai suoi ricordi, alle sue gioie e ai suoi dolori. Ma in Finding Paradise si va oltre: se in To the Moon Johnny aveva un obiettivo fisso, per l'appunto andare sulla luna, in Finding Paradise per Colin è diverso. Lo sviluppo della storia permette di trattare argomenti di una profondità e maturità molto più grandi rispetto al primo gioco e ciò non può che essere un enorme pregio. E nonostante ciò spiccano sempre i momenti anche divertenti di Eva e Neil: i due protagonisti sono così ben caratterizzati che è impossibile non amarli!
Un altro aspetto importante è la colonna sonora che, ancora una volta, è qualcosa di sublime: perfetta in ogni scena, emozionante e di alto livello così come lo era in To the Moon e in A Bird Story.
Quest'ultimo consiglio di giocarlo, dato che dura appena un'ora e racconta un aneddoto nella vita di Colin che permette di capire bene alcuni punti della storia.

In conclusione, Finding Paradise è un altro piccolo capolavoro, un'altra piccola opera d'arte da parte di Freebird Games che merita tantissimo di essere giocata e vissuta. Consigliatissimo!




Piccola postilla: è consigliato avere una buona conoscenza dell'inglese per capire al meglio i dialoghi.

38760936.review:
[Без спойлеров]
Что ж, прошло несколько дней с тех пор как я завершил это приключение и, будучи в состоянии объективно оценить впечатления от игры, пишу эту рецензию.

Думаю, первый вопрос, который заботит человека, заинтересованного в очередном творении от компании Freebird Games: так ли хороша Finding Paradise, как её предшественник? Удалось ли разработчикам не упасть в грязь лицом после сокрушительного успеха предыдущей игры? Сможет ли эта история заставить меня рыдать, как маленькую девченку?

Я не дам вам конкретного ответа на этот вопрос. Скажу лишь, что To the Moon - это шедевр, переплюнуть который наврядли кому либо удастся, включая самих создателей. Отсюда следует вполне очевидный вывод: [i]Главным "недостадком" Finding Paradise является то, что это не To the Moon[/i]. Лишь в этом состоит неминуемое разочарование, которое так или иначе испытает каждый.
Во всём остальном игра отличная: прекрасный пиксель-арт, трогательный саундтрек, увлекательная история и прежние циничные шуточки. Удачного погружения!

38760387.review:
陆陆续续分了两三天通关，作为《去月球》的正宗续作难免会让人在心里有所比较。作为一部视觉小说本作当然仍然出色，只是没有了《去月球》那种让人一口气玩下去的魅力。
玩的时候可以明显感觉到作者改变了叙事手法，新的“螺旋”式记忆回溯方式和多处埋下的伏笔让故事的悬念性增加了很多，可是纵使有这些技巧通关后仍然让人感觉只是喝了一杯白开水——因为整个故事本身就是淡而无味的，平淡的故事甚至让这些故意留下的悬念都显得累赘。
《去月球》的核心是一个荒诞又浪漫的愿望，这个愿望驱使着我们去回溯Johnny的一生，一点点找到它的根源。印象最深的场景是飞往月球的航天器发射成功之时心跳停止的仪器声随之响起，那种虚与实喜与悲的交织——《去月球》真正做到了用像素风打造出电影级别的体验，一种让人沉浸其中的“造梦”体验
而再看本作，Colin的愿望作为本作最大的悬念贯穿始终，而另一个重要的悬念则是Faye的身份，前期吊足了我们的胃口，而谜底却是一个无数小说电影都玩烂的[spoiler]“其实这都是你的幻想”[/spoiler]梗，实现愿望的方式更让人匪夷所思，全权交出控制权意味着前面所有的剧情仅仅就是一个人生回顾而已，二位博士无需从这些经历中找到实现愿望的钥匙，作为玩家的代入感也悉数被剥夺。
看得出作者已经尽力用“孤独”“朋友”“成长"这些容易共情的话题来试图引起玩家的共鸣和制造感动，但说实话，Faye这个核心人物刻画得扁平如路人甲，几场画蛇添足的街机式对战更是与人物形象严重偏离。展现孤独和成长的部分也流于表面，仅仅靠着告别时刻的煽情，恕我实在难以被打动。
仍然给游戏好评的原因，只是因为制作的精良和作者的诚意。《去月球》为我们创造了一个美丽又残酷的梦，而《寻找天堂》仅仅是讲了一个还不错的故事，那种感动可能再也难以重现了吧。

38754011.review:
Nach langem Warten ein wunderschönes Meisterwerk, wie man es von Freebird Games gewohnt ist und den Vorgängern in keinster Weise nachsteht. Die mitunter tiefgründigen Dialoge geben philosophische Ansätze, die zusammen mit der großartigen Musik die immer traurigere und unfassbar ergreifende Geschichte des alten Herrn namens Colin erzählen. Das Gameplay wurde an einigen Stellen versucht abwechslungsreich zu gestalten, doch läuft man meistens noch immer mit Eva und Neil per Pfeiltasten bzw. WASD oldschoolmäßig herum, was ich jedoch nicht schlimm finde. Die verspielte Pixel-Grafik, die lustigen Szenen, Anspielungen und...Wortspiele geben dem Ganzen nochmal eine gewisse Lockerheit, was die erbaute Atmosphäre jedoch ein paar wenige Male zunichte machte, wie ich finde. Das ist aber auch das einzige Manko, was ich Finding Paradise hier ankreiden kann. 

Alles in allem: Eine wirklich wunderbar inzinierte, emotionale Geschichte, welche mit gut geschriebenen Dialogen und großartiger Atmosphäre glänzen kann. Ein Muss für...ja, eigentlich jeden ;)

P.S.: Wer die Vorgänger noch nicht gespielt hat, braucht sie zwar nicht kaufen, um die Story zu verstehen, aber sollte sie sich jedoch noch zulegen, einfach, weil’s wunderschöne Spiele sind! :D

[olist]
    [*]Мы имеем почти тот же старый-добрый "To The Moon".  Главное слово здесь "почти", поскольку геймплей стал чутка бодрее и интереснее да и сюжет здесь не о полётах на Луну.

沐浴更衣，关闭手机QQFB微博等一切通信设备软件，倒上一杯Beerenauslese，灯光明暗调整好，坐定。

用时比统计的平均时间长了将近一半，认真阅读了每一个字，思考了每一个暗喻要表达的含义。
7年的等待换来的是一个非常平凡的故事。平凡到仿佛说的就是身边的每一个人，当然也包括自己。短短的几个小时里体验一个完整的人生是件奇妙的事，感觉自己已经知道高瞰透过这平凡的故事实际要表达的含义，虽然并不完美但懂了。
让自己常年被淬火冰煅外壳偶尔在这大提琴和钢琴的优美合奏中裂一道缝，短暂做一下和平时自己形象不一样的自己。
“是时候回家了，Colin。”
——去月球2【寻找天堂】

38749101.review:
Buy this game. Get it on sale, get it at full price, and get a copy for someone who has an appreciation for complexity in storytelling. 


If you've never played To the Moon, there are two things you should know: (1) you don't need to play To The Moon FIRST in order to love Finding Paradise, but (2) you should play To The Moon (and its two free DLC minisodes) anyway for the complete narrative experience. 

This is a complex, surprising, unpredictable, emotional and rewarding story. This is one that lives just as much in your mind as it does the minds of the characters involved. When the credits roll, and you begin to think of the implications of what you've beheld, you start to realize that the impact of the events which transpire can't help but continue to impact the characters in meaningful ways that we may never get to see, but we can confidently conclude what "it all means." 


JRR Tolkein resolved to create a work that would make the world a better place by simply being a good thing within it. He penned the world of Middle Earth; this was his contribution to improving the overall net worth of our rock floating through space. And improve it he did. 


Kan Gao and his team have done something similar; they have taken the medium and used it to bring their audiences to emotional highs and lows with enormous skill, insight and charm. Innovative isn't the word to use here; wisdom, vulernerability and "heart" are more appropriate. If aliens ever invade our planet and have to decide whether the human species deserve to continue to exist, they will likely conclude that we don't - however, Freebird Games will certainly tip the scales in our favour.

10/10, would Rudog again.

38733894.review:
终于盼来了Finding Paradise，作为见人就安利To The Moon的脑残粉充满了期待。一个下午玩完还是熟悉的感动，但是这次又多了很多对前作的明示暗示和其他梗，还有更多的思考。就像很多评测和其他各论坛的评价一样，这次续作可能少了那么一点感动但是却多了更多思考。全程从旁观者的角度去感受Colin的一生，看到最后与Faye告别，与Sofia吻别，多了一份平静的感动（其实那几幕还是差点泪崩的触动也不小）。准备二刷英文版了全面地再看看各种梗，说实话一遍体会全部是真的不够的~（Dr.Manhattan和龟派气功圣斗士什么的真的笑死了，啊对还有狗狗捡回来丢的鞋子然后一起战斗太TM吊了..）。
再聊聊和前作的关系和Kan Gao的铺垫这么久的续作大棋吧。首先前段就多次提到To The Moon，从医生那里的对话到重回熟悉的学校，甚至Colin都自己提到那个同桌过的奇怪的女生（也就是我们的River，哎想想就难过啊）。然后就是比较明显的A Bird Story，毕竟明说了我们的主角就是当年那个脑洞超大的小男孩（现在一回想确实孤单又想象力丰富才能造就Faye啊）。在山顶告别那段经典场景里我真有一瞬间想到Faye就是当年的那只小鸟报恩这种剧情...还是很感动的。最后说说Kan Gao挖的涉及两部正传，两部DLC的超级大坑。记得当时玩To The Moon就很纠结最后Neil的屏幕闪红，再到两个DlC里各种埋坑，现在这部又多了拉人入伙和Faye这段Bug般的程序，真的很好奇也很期待后续作品会带给我们的解释（当然这种有生之年系列好怕被鸽啊啊啊）。
总的来说真是一段美好的游戏体验，期待Kan Gao和Freebird Games的后续作品吧，顺便自己有空二刷找更多细节和体会~ 满分给Finding Paradise!

38726546.review:
Paradise Found

We live in times of much hate and misconception; of much unjustified violence and rage. Instead of understanding the other, we want to erase them. Instead of looking at the darkness inside, we blame everyone and anyone for the lack of light. We live in difficult times.

And in times like these, a game like Finding Paradise is nothing short of a wonder.

But you know, I was afraid.

I was afraid, I confess. Afraid of what kind of game this would turn out to be, afraid of how I would perceive it. Six years ago, maybe more, To The Moon made a huge impression on me. Better saying, it hit me like a battering ram, broke every single defense I had and left me completely exposed and vulnerable. To this day, when I hear “Everything’s Alright”, a lot of those same emotions come back. It is not only due to how well the story is written (fantastically well, I must say) but also due to my own personal experience that helped me relate so much with almost everything presented in To The Moon.

Needless to say, it was one of the most important games I ever played, and one of most amazing works of art I ever experienced. 

But a lot of time passed. I grew older, a lot of hardships came and I am more cynical and bitter than six years ago. And tired. Much more tired. And while I did enjoy quite a lot A Bird’s Story, for me this game right here was the real deal.

So yeah, I was afraid. Afraid that, in the end, I would not be able to live the same experience as before. That I had changed too much to care anymore.

And I was partially right. It wasn’t the same experience as before. This time, it went beyond.

While To The Moon will always have its’ place in my heart for being such a intimate and relatable story, Finding Paradise has a place in my very being. It is not just relatable, it is constructive, it fills us inside. This time I didn’t finish the game feeling vulnerable; instead I felt gratitude, I felt happy for who I am and who I was. The tears came, of course they came, but it wasn’t the desperate waterfall of before. They were warm, comforting.

To me, Finding Paradise shows what kind of man Kan Gao is. He understands people, he is sensible and understands humans and their conflicts, their difficulties. Loneliness, regret, denial, trauma, fear, defense mechanisms, coping mechanisms, all the hardships that we constantly face on a deeper level within us are present in his simple games. Simple, but not simplistic.

And the silly humor of his characters and their mannerisms, their personalities so well defined, brings us even closer to them. It helps us care about a bunch of pixels in such a way that so many huge developers, with their huge sums of money spent on mo-cap and thousands upon thousands of polygons per character, never seem to achieve.

But most of all, Kan Gao was able to mature, was able to grow during this six years window between the two games. He didn’t just make a sequel that feels the same but with a different color. He made a game that stands on its’ own while building itself on top of his predecessor. While To The Moon main theme was “Who you really are”, Finding Paradise main theme is “What is really important”. Going from one theme to another, while keeping the soul of the games pure, intact, that is maturity, that is growth. More than that I cannot say.

What I can say is this:

As we dream and as we grow
We have to learn to let things go
But let the wonder never fade
Though we’ve turned 10,000 pages
Flying high or stuck below

38724487.review:
Il seguito di to the moon porta con se un fardello di aspettative enorme, quasi soverchiante, e alla fine ne esce comunque fuori a pieni voti. il secondo gioco dei freebird games è un'altro capolavoro.

sarò onesto, non mi ha dato la stessa enorme sensazione di inaspettata quanto letale pugnalata al cuore come è stato in to the moon.. in questo capitolo della saga (perchè si, è una saga e ci saranno molto probabilmente altri episodi) il tutto non è taciuto fino all'ultimo per poi rilasciare tutto in solo fragoroso botto, no. qui il tutto è spalmato lungo tutta la storia e il finale, seppur non ai livelli del primo in quanto ad emozioni suscitate, è la degna conclusione di questo capitolo, per come è stato strutturato. 

rispetto al precedente capitolo troviamo una grafica molto più curata (parlando di un gioco sviluppato con rpg maker), che fa un uso assai sapiente di parallax, weather effect, dissolvenze, giochi di luce e sfondi. il tutto accompagnato da una soundtrack che fa egregiamente il suo dovere, esaltando lo specifico contesto di ogni evento del gioco.

il lavoro fatto nel creare sprite unici per ogni scena è stupendo, per chi conosce che tipo di lavoro c'è dietro capisce che la cura e la passione che è stata data per creare questo gioco è stata davvero, davvero tanta, e ciò si vede soprattutto nella qualità e nella ricchezza di particolari che popolano ogni scena.

parlando delle musiche, la qualità è altissima e troviamo dei bellissimi pezzi che ho subito provveduto ad acquistare ma, per mio modesto gusto personale, non riescono ad avere quel "qualcosa in più" che caratterizzava le musiche del primo capitolo. non ho trovato nessun corrispettivo emotivo ad una "the river" o "everithing will be alright" per intenderci, ma ciò non vuol dire che la qualità non sia la medesima.

conclusione:
finding paradise riesce nell'intento di tenere testa al suo famigerato predecessore, seppur toccando corde diverse e creando pertanto una propria peculiare personalità (che potrà piacere o meno a seconda dei gusti), scelta a mio avviso perfetta fatta in modo da non ricalcare pari passo le orme del primo capitolo e dare comunque una sensazione di evoluzione della storia generale.

se poi, i rumor e le teorie dietro alla sottotrama generale della saga si riveleranno corrette, potremo dire che kan gao ha ideato, creato e orchestrato una saga che dire geniale ed emozionante è un eufemismo. il tempo ci dirà la verità.

【写在五小时的情感之旅后】
“As we dream and as we grow
We have to learn to let things go

童年时人们常常有一个只存在于幻想中的朋友。然而这个朋友随着他们的成长悄然离别，他们也慢慢放弃了想象。这样一来，人生就有了遗憾，而这可能阻碍他们体验人生中的美好。《寻找天堂》讲的就是和这有关的故事：主人公临终前在记忆中和这位好友重逢，亲口告诉她自己度过了幸福的一生。而通过对他一生经历的探索，玩家会被触动，甚至泪崩。

38722332.review:
Kan Gao and all the folks at Freebird Games have proven themselves masters of a few things:
[list]
[*]Expressive, creative pixel art, for both characters and backgrounds
[*]Music. FANTASTIC music. It hits all of your feels from every angle
[*]Solid writing. Clever, imaginative, funny, and honest as well as feeling realistic and shedding light onto the characters
[*]Unconventional storytelling. Telling such poignant and emotional stories is a bold move, but even bolder is telling them in the form of a video game.  And on top of that, the stories themselves are told unconventionally: in To the Moon told the story backwards, A Bird Story had no dialogue and almost no words whatsoever, and Finding Paradise [spoiler] jumps back and forth from old Colin to young Colin.[/spoiler]  Initially these unique storytelling methods might be troubling, but they were expertly done, and the stories would not have been nearly as effective without them. 
[/list]
Some Steam reviews have expressed their disappointment with Finding Paradise's ability to make them cry. Some have said, "good game, but it's no To the Moon," or something of the sort. But of course it isn't--Freebird Games already made To the Moon. What I mean to say is, they already made a simplistic and sweet story about life, memories, the nature of storytelling, and what we choose to hold dear and why. Finding Paradise has a decisively different feel but deals with the same themes in a new and equally brilliant way. The game was confusing, exciting, lively, and fun while also being heavy and blindingly clear when it needed to be. While To the Moon felt like a night spent gazing at the sky, Finding Paradise feels like an airplane adventure. 

Finding Paradise is not To the Moon. It's an outstanding sequel. And I for one (likely along with at least 2000 other people judging from the positive reviews Finding Paradise already has) will be anxiously awaiting the next chapter in the story. We'll be expecting laughs, tears, thrown shoes, kamehamehas, and more tears again. 

TL;DR: If you think you'd like Finding Paradise, play it. Play To the Moon and A Bird Story while you're at it, if you haven't already

38718727.review:
Ich bin an dieses Spiel mit extrem hohen Erwartungen herangegangen.
Ich bin ein absoluter Fan von To the Moon und würde TTM als eines meiner 3 Lieblingsspiele bezeichnen.
To the Moon war ein ganz besonderes Spiel. Es transportierte Gefühle besser als jedes andere Spiel, das ich bis dahin gespielt hatte, hatte genau die richtge Menge Humor und erzähle eine Geschichte, die so tragisch, herzergreifend und emotionals war, wie nur wenige Spiele oder auch Filme allgemein es geschafft haben. Und das mit so wenigen Mittel und dieser Grafik. Kan Gao hat dabei bereits gezeigt zu welchen Leistungen er Fähig ist und was für ein genialer Gechichtenerzähler er sein kann.
Doch genug von To the moon und kommen wir zu Finding Paradise.
Der erste große Nachfolger von TTM (es gab mehrere kleine Zwischenepisoden) ist wiedermal ein Brett was das Geschichtenerzählen und die Musik angeht. Auch dieses mal gibt es eine schöne tragische Geschichte, die von wunderbarer Musik genau richtig untermalt wird. Und auch dieses mal hat Gao wieder an die genau richtige Menge Humor gedacht, bei der ich teilweise laut auflachen musste und in die Hände geklascht habe.
Doch erreicht Finding Paradise nicht ganz das Level des Vorgängers. Dabei war ich am ehesten von der Geschichte sowas wie enttäuscht. Dabei darf man das aber nicht überinterpretieren. Die Geschichte ist immer noch hervorrgend. Doch übernimmt sich Gao meiner Meinung nach etwas dabei die Tragig in die Geschichte zu bringen. Bis zur Mitte des Spiels war ich noch voll dabei, aber im weiteren Verlauf verliert die Geschichte etwas an Bodenhaftung und verpasst es so echte Gefühle auf den Niveau von To the moon hervorzurufen. 
Aber alleine daran, wie lang dieses Review bereits ist und dass ich es um 2 uhr nachts schreibe erkennt man wie gut das Spiel dennoch geworden ist. So ist Finding Paradise immernoch ein extrem gelungenes Spiel und eine weitere Darstellung des Talentes des gesamten Teams von Freebird Games. 
Und so kann ich nur jedem, der dieses Review tatsächlich bis zum Ende  durchgelesen hat (Hallo du einziger verrückter Kerl ;) ) nur empfehlen: Kauf dir Finding Paradise und falls du es noch nicht gespielt hast, spiel zuerst To the moon!

38718667.review:
[h1]Кан Гао всё ещё гений[/h1]

[i]Преамбула: не обращайте внимание на число часов — я отходил поспать, а игру не выключал. На самом деле, на Finding Paradise уйдёт часов 5-6.[/i]

Вторая часть вселенной [i]Sigmund Corp.[/i] всё никак не могла заманить меня, хоть я и недавно прошёл минизоды к [b][i]To The Moon[/i][/b], до которых всё никак не доходили руки. Но за 4 дня до Нового года, ввиду отсутствия какого-либо праздничного настроения, захотелось чего-то волшебного. Ну, что тут сказать. Лучше [b][i]Finding Paradise[/i][/b] для этой цели едва ли что-то найдётся.

Кан Гао взял всё самое лучшее из своих предыдущих нарративов: шикарный юмор, атмосферную музыку, пробирающие до мурашек диалоги и вот эту утончённость и детскую наивность вкупе с рядом глубоких философских тем. Вообще игры Кана Гао напоминают мне хорошие детские книжки, которые мне читали родители, когда мне было лет 6-7: Джанни Родари, Льюис, Туве Янсен — книжки, полные взрослых идей и смыслов, но написанные для детей. Будучи карапузом, ты восхищаешься персонажами, интересными историями, а эти самые идеи укладываются у тебя в подкорке, и через такую форму становишься умнее, добрее и искренней.

[b][i]Finding Paradise[/i][/b] вряд ли будет понятна детям, но она в свою очередь отправляет как раз туда, в эти мои шесть лет. После вечернего чая я ложусь под тёплое одеяло, мама берёт «Мемуары Муми-папы», и мы с ней отправляемся в этот уютный забавный мирок, из которого не хочется возвращаться в реальный мир — максимум в сны, где можно будет продолжить мечтать. И не сожалеть ни о чём.

38705071.review:
[h1]Finding Paradise[/h1]

Beim Nachfolger von "To The Moon" hatte ich für meinen Teil sehr hohe Erwartungen. Wie kann man ein Spiel schlagen, welches ohnehin schon fast perfekt scheint? Kleine Vorwarnung: Es wurde nicht geschlagen, es hat genau dasselbe Level an Storytelling, Gameplay und Character Development beibehalten, wie man es erwwartet hat. Einige Veränderungen in Punkten Steuerung und Gameplay wurden vorgenommen, welche aber nicht weiter beschrieben werden müssen

Doch auch wenn die Geschichte eine andere ist, ist es noch lange kein neues Spiel. Wenn man den Vorgänger gespielt hat, weiß man eigentlich schon, was auf einen zukommt. Packende Story, unerwartete Wendungen in der Geschichte und grandiose Charaktere. Doch auch, wenn dieselben Hauptprotagonisten, in Form von Dr. Eva Rosalene und Dr. Neil Watts, ein großartiges Comeback in diesen Teil feiern, reicht es meiner Meinung nach nicht aus. Die Geschichte regt zum Nachdenken an und wirkt auf den ersten Moment emotional, doch die vielleicht letzte Spielstunde war meiner Meinung nach ein kleines bisschen zu übertrieben aufgesetzt.

Mehr kann ich dazu auch leider nicht schreiben, trotzdessen ein guter Nachfolger.

-

BEWERTUNG

[h1]8 / 10[/h1]

38704758.review:

Oh yeah and the soundtrack is beautiful.

38703055.review:
Godny następca "To the Moon". Gra nadaje więcej sensu swojej poprzedniczne, "A Bird's Story" (chociaż tej nadal nie polecam) i choć historia Colina nie była tak wzruszająca jak poprzedniego pacjenta, to nadal wycisnęła ze mnie łezkę. Bardzo mi się podobało podjęcie przez autorów trudnego tematu [spoiler]schizofrenii (?) i związanych z nią urojeń, co bardzo fajnie wygląda zwłaszcza w grze, w której wędrujemy po pamięci.[/spoiler] Dodatkowym atutem jest tutaj rozwinięcie wątku Wattsa i Rosalene, zwłaszcza tego pierwszego, ale historia ewidentnie nie jest jeszcze zakończona (czekam zatem na trójkę :D). Humor i nawiązania do popkultury są jeszcze lepsze niż ostatnio.

Cieszy dodanie paru nowych minigierek i kilku kosmetycznych rozwiązań. Jeśli miałabym się czegoś przyczepić, to można byłoby popracować nad interfejsem, bo wskaźnik myszy nie zawsze "trafia" na postać, z którą da się porozmawiać czy obiekt do obejrzenia. Nie psuje to jednak zabawy z gry.

"Finding Paradise" jest krótka, ale mocna. Niecierpliwie czekam na wieści o kolejnej części.

Si os gustó To The Moon, por fin salió la segunda parte (sin contar especiales de navidad, y A Bird Story). El juego ya te avisa que es "story-driven", es decir, que nosotros solamente avanzamos por la historia y ya, no espereis ninguna jugabilidad, e incluso los puzles que hay son sencillísimos. Aviso antes que nada, por el tema de que no es un juego para todo el mundo. Sin embargo, para los que hayan jugado To the Moon y se pregunten si tienen que volver a sacar los kleenex para llorar... Bueno, siempre depende de cada uno, y aunque creo que el juego tarda mucho más en arrancar, a mí sí me ha acabado emocionando. 

Secuela digna, con alguna vuelta de tuerca, y continuidad al argumento de los doctores de ciencia ficción capaces de ofrecer una última voluntad a un moribundo. Sabiendo todo esto, si te gustó To The Moon y esa mezcla de humor con referencias frikis y ataques traicioneros a los feels, probablemente éste también te guste. Está en inglés, aunque supongo que con el tiempo caerá algún parche en castellano como con To The Moon.

38700587.review:
죽기 직전인 고객의 기억을 조작해 자신이 원하는 삶을 살았다고 느낄 수 있게 만들어주는 회사 지그문트 코퍼레이션의 요원 로잘린 박사와 와츠 박사가 To the Moon에 이어 또 다른 노인 Colin의 소원을 들어주려 동분서주한다는 내용의 Finding Paradise입니다.

게임이 전하고자 하는 메시지는 간단합니다. 살면서 겪게 되는 후회들도 결국 삶의 일부이며, 그것을 굳이 고치려 하지 않아도 된다는 것이지요. 삶은 일필휘지라는 것. 망할 붓질은 한 번에 끝내야 한다는 어떤 장군님의 말이 생각나는 게임이었습니다. 게임이 말하는 교훈은 받아들일 만 합니다. 공감할 수 있는 이야기죠. 거기까진 좋습니다.

To the Moon 때도 그랬지만, 프리버드의 게임을 할 때면 참 이상하다는 생각이 듭니다. 사람들은 정말 감동적인 게임이라고 말하고, 게임도 뭔가 '난 감동적인 게임이야!'라는 느낌으로 스토리를 이어가지만, 클라이맥스라고 할 만한 일러스트가 나오는 장면을 볼 때도, 발코니에서 두 캐릭터가 대화하는 엔딩 씬에서도 흘러나오는 잔잔한 BGM을 들으며 내가 지금 울어야 하는 건가? 라는 생각이 들 정도로 그다지 감동적이라는 느낌은 없었습니다. 투더문에서 그리 감동을 느끼지 못하신 저 같은 분들이라면 파인딩 패러다이스가 그보다 덜하면 덜했지 더 큰 감동을 가진 게임은 아니라는 것을 알아두셨으면 합니다.

투더문에 이어서 BGM만은 정말 훌륭합니다. 게임 플레이는 차라리 유튜브나 스트리머의 방송을 통해 보시고 사운드트랙만 구입하는 쪽을 오히려 권할 것 같군요.

38696462.review:
While not as good as To the Moon, this game still manages to be its worthy successor. It wasn't quite that emotionally devastating and impactful (I'll explain why later in the spoiler section), but on the other hand it has improved quite a bit in its presentation. The character animations, for example, are great, plentiful and surprisingly detailed. You can tell that the success of To the Moon allowed the devs to spend more resources on them. With To the Moon, it felt like it was made in the simplistic ways of RPG maker out of necessity. This time around, it feels more like a deliberate artistic choice. The music is beautiful as well.

Still, I'd definitely rank To the Moon above Finding Paradise and here is why:

[spoiler]While it still got me a little teary eyed at the end, it was nothing compared to the emotional trainwreck that I'd become towards the end of To the Moon. It was still a very pleasant experience to go through, but nowhere near as impactful. I understand that Kan Gao didn't want to make yet another tragic sappy story (after all, To the Moon at times felt like it was trying REALLY hard to make the player cry, almost to the point of going too far, but still managed to keep it together somehow) so he went different route, but I still think there was more that could've been done to make players care about the characters.

I am, of course, talking about Faye/Colin "relationship". I spend half the game expecting something terrible happening to Faye. I mean, it was obvious that something must've happened to her since she was absent from all of the more recent memories. And it turned out, she wasn't really there and was "just" Colin's imaginary friend. Okay. Fine. But then I got to the end and all of a sudden, there were these emotional scenes where I was clearly supposed to care a lot about Faye "leaving" and what not. And I did to some extent, but it just didn't feel that satisfying.

The thing about To the Moon is, that it's really sad and happy at the same time in many ways. Johnny, in his head at least, goes to the Moon with River and they live a happy life. But in reality, River dies knowing that Johnny, even after years of her trying to make him remember, doesn't in fact remember their first meeting. Sure, she says she's happy as long as Anya is taken care of, but you can't help but feel sad for her. So you get this kind of happy ending, but then you realise that it's not actually all that happy because River got none of it. After River dies, Johnny wants to go to the Moon because... well, because somewhere deep inside he actually does remember from their first meeting that, were they ever lost from each other, they would reunite on the Moon, so he wants to go there just to meet her again. Which is extremely sweet but again, River is dead at that point so she doesn't get the satisfaction she deserves. So it's all very bittersweet and it stays with you for a long time.

In Finding Paradise however, it doesn't come together quite as nicely. Colin is imagining Faye because he's lonely. And then he just kinda stops doing it because he doesn't need her anymore. I feel like, in an attemp to hide the great plot twist about Faye being fictional to the very last moment possible, her importence in Colin's life gets kind of underplayed. Sure, as said in the game, she gets a lot of screentime and many of the scenes are very beautiful and touching, but it still left me feeling like there was supposed to be more to it. There is no conflict, no tension, no reason to be torn about her leaving other than "she was here, we had a good time and now she's gone".
[/spoiler]

It could be that that was the very intention. After all, most important life decisions aren't really that dramatic. They too just kind of happen, often without us realising it. And I really get that Kan Gao wanted to say something different with this game, something else than "just" another great tragedy, so I don't wanna be too critical about it, because I very much enjoyed it. However, it did left me feeling little bit lackluster in the end so there's that.

To the Moon was 10/10 for me, Finding Paradise is more like 8/10. If you haven't done so yet, go play them both (and A Bird Story). You won't regret it!

38695457.review:
Still as thought provoking as its predececor. 

I was really happy to go on another adventure with doctors Watts and Rosalene. Whether the story is better than To The Moon's is debatable, but both are well worth experiencing if you care even a little bit about games as an art form.

There is great music, funny and well written characters, and the story gave me goosebumps as much as it made me smile and laugh. 

If you've played TTM, you know the gameplay. It's essentially a walking simulator. There are a few puzzles in there, but they aren't too hard, and sometimes feel a little out of place. That said, they don't really detract much from the experience either. 

One thing that felt kind of jarring, and broke the immersion somewhat is the dialogue between some of the children. They sometimes used words that I wouldn't expect nine year olds to use in casual conversation. 

Still, any critisism I have toward this game is minor, and none would keep me from recommending this game wholeheartedly. If you haven't played TTM, I recommend doing that first.

Now we just have to wait for episode three, which will probably be released around 2024.

38693069.review:
이전작과 연관되는 내용으로 다가선 프리버드의 새로운 작품. 몇몇 새롭지만 자잘한 기능도 추가하는 등 노력의 흔적이 꽤나 보인다. 하지만 여전히 게임성으로는 좋다고 말하기는 그렇고, 게임이 아니라 한 편의 영화를 본다는 생각을 하고 관심을 가져야 할 것이다. 이 이유로 투더문도 어 버드 스토리도 이 게임도 호불호가 꽤나 갈려 몇몇 게이머들에게는 그래픽 등의 이유로 질타를 받고 있기도 하다.
그래도 이전과 같이 BGM과 스토리는 탄탄하고 잘 만들었다. 프리버드 게임을 구매하면서 정가이든 아니든 무조건 사운드트랙도 구매하는데, 그럴만한 이유가 있다. 사운드트랙도 살지 고민한다고? 무조건 사라. 돈 없다고? 그래도 사라.
아, 물론 한글화가 안되어있어 스토리 이해에 영향이 갈까 의심스럽다.
뭐 당연히 영어 해석은 어느정도 가능하다만... 왜 스토리를 진행안하고 머뭇거리냐하면...
몇 년을 기다린 명작이니만큼 아껴두면서 하고싶다는 생각밖에 들지않는다.. 
한글화가 나오면 완벽하게 해볼까 생각하고 있긴한데, 이 상태로 봐서는 2주내로 엔딩을 볼 것 같다. 그냥 영어로 1번 보고 한글로 한... 4번 봐야겠다. 투더문은 4번 봤으니까.


결론 : 호불호가 갈리는 게임은 여전한 이유로 지인들에게 추천하기 힘들지만, 어쨌든 프리버드 만만세!

38692049.review:
*I am not a professional review writer. I just love video games, and here is my opinion.*
First of all, do not play this unless you have played To the Moon and A Bird Story. If you do not, some of the dialogue and plot will not make sense.
I absolutely adore To the Moon. A Bird Story and the minisodes were also lovely. I found Finding Paradise inferior to these. Yes, the soundtrack is gorgeous, the art is beautiful, the dialogue is engaging and comical, and the story has some heartfelt life lessons. 

However, the plot did not affect me at all. I absolutely bawled throughout To the Moon, but I did not cry once during Finding Paradise. I could not relate to the main character. The plot twist made me think, "...Really? Are you serious? An old man with ...... That's just weird."
By the end of the game, I absolutely hated the puzzles when activating momentos. They became more complex and tedious, thereby ruining the player's immersion in the plot. The puzzles in Finding Paradise felt like road blocks, whereas in To the Moon, the puzzles were simple and felt more connected to the story. 
(Also, the game ran very poorly in regards to lagging. That might have been an issue with my own computer, but it was quite annoying and nauseating. It especially became a problem during the combat sequences which were clever but completely frustrating and out-of-place.)

Overall, the soundtrack, art, and dialogue was beautiful. When the story finally came to a meaningful moment, I did not even pay attention because I was so enraged by the immersion-breaking puzzles and combat.
However, I will always recommend To the Moon and support the developers because it is a masterpiece. Unfortunately, it is nearly impossible to make a sequel on par with a masterpiece.

38668815.review:
(10/10)

While less of a game and more of interactive media, the story of "Finding Paradise", and it being a follow-up of its excellent predecessor "To The Moon", has been masterfully written. There are moments where there are lapses in the story to compensate for silliness, or so it would appear until you reach the ultimate goal [no spoilers provided.] Everything related to the humour of the game, excluding the very beginning, plays into the necessity of explaining the ending, and at nearly every turn you will find something that will shock you as a revelation of something you had likely previously viewed as either insignificant or minute in its complexity as part of the story.

This is gaming that has been steered away from the 'game' aspect, and more towards the story teller's side. This is not a bad thing innately, because there are games that do this in much the opposite manner, but if you are looking for something that's treated as a game where everything is explicit in its results immediately, you are at the wrong place. "Finding Paradise" is, at its core, a refined cinematic work of art. Feeling as though it lacks smaller facets of investigation on a personal level unlike "To The Moon", it still catches on with its linear figure and reducing the amount of general confusion that was accompanied by some parts in previous series entries.

Only thing, again mostly spoiler free, is that the title is misleading to the actual story telling that is provided, because you do not necessarily go looking for Paradise, but that's a minor caveat of interpretive art. All-in-all, Finding Paradise helps tie in new pieces of this beautiful series, and I can scarcely wait for the next entry to grace us. If you like story telling, or liked "To The Moon", buy this as soon as you can...

She's waiting.

游戏的剧情就跟我玩游戏的过程一样，表面波澜不惊，内心翻江倒海。

恬淡而惬意的氛围充斥着游戏的始终，解锁一幕幕主人公的生平记忆宛如挖掘着自己的写照一样，因为这些记忆都平淡而实际，让我们觉得真实而可信，游离的过程总是免不了反思自己的生活。

感人至深的不一定是悲剧，非得把美好的东西粉碎给我们看；扣人心弦的不一定要轰轰烈烈，非得有血脉贲张的事迹炫耀给我们听。因为我觉得，美好的东西本身就是通彻心灵的感动，无论平凡，无论喜悲。

colin躺在草地上，天空一朵朵云变幻出贯穿他生平轨迹的物件在他眼前飘过，faye在一旁诉说着人生真谛般的话语，伴随着宁静的音乐，即使引擎简单如rm，这样的场景仍让我觉得如梦似幻。而那时留下的眼泪，并不代表我难过，也不代表我开心，只是一种感悟。

正是因为那些遗憾，才让我有了现在所拥有的一切。

38659780.review:
如果说《去月球》是一个浪漫的悲剧，那么《寻找天堂》的结局可以说是一个朴实的 happy ending 了。《去月球》更像是一个传奇故事：[spoiler]不平凡的梦想，美妙的风景，命运的邂逅，异想天开的约定，罕见的病症，不幸的事故，一生无法想起的人……[/spoiler]许多戏剧性的元素交织在一起，呈现出一个似乎离我们很遥远的幻想世界。而《寻找天堂》的主人公，是和我们一样平凡的普通人；这些人之间发生的故事，也没有那么跌宕起伏、波澜壮阔，而是平淡得好像随时有可能发生在我们身边。

然而平淡的故事也可以是一个好故事。打个比方，这就像是你看了很多日剧，逢人便说新垣结衣美如画wlp——然而回到现实中，你会觉得班上那个坐在你斜前方的土妹子才是世界上最可爱的人。正是这些平淡的故事和平凡的人给了我们切实的希望，让我们相信美好的东西是触手可及的，而不是只存在于虚无缥缈的幻想里。

这部作品叫做《寻找天堂》，我认为是名副其实的。希望你在玩过这款游戏之后也能有所感触，找到属于自己的天堂。[spoiler]Faye在与Collin做最后的道别时说： Go home 。她大概是想说，天堂就在那里吧。[/spoiler]

感谢高瞰以及所有参与游戏制作的人们。《寻找天堂》是2017年最好的圣诞礼物。

38657924.review:
《寻找天堂》并不比《去月球》有哪些改进，游戏性方面除了日常的走路寻物，前作的连连看变成了消消乐，虽然在第三幕加了RPG、STG和FTG，但是因为篇幅太少而且手感差到屎做不了加分项。音乐方面仅主题曲而言也没有前作那么引人入胜，可能是因为前作的主题曲和剧情连接太紧密的关系吧，不过本作倒是和一个关键伏笔有关系。人物方面两位主角的冲突也没第一部那么强烈。但我觉得《寻找天堂》依旧是一部比《去月球》更优秀的交互小说。
	光看名字就知道“寻找天堂”没有“去月球”那么有目的性，它是虚无缥缈的，然而它所讲述的故事与《去月球》相比却更实际，没有前作的爱情童话、没有前作加强剧情冲突的“韩剧梗”、也没有《for River》到《to the moon》的精彩转变，有的是和主题曲《Time is a place》般的宁静、平和、娓娓道来的人生故事。
	本作的两位主角甚至没有起到任何“作用”。仅仅就是带着玩家回顾了Colin的一生。但就像最后Faye 对两位主角说的那段话：“你们做的不只是对人们的记忆胡作非为。你们也是我第一次遇见的，能和我交流的人。听起来有点傻……但或许这也是colin真正的愿望之一吧。”这个明明有着幸福人生却始终觉得抱有遗憾的男人，这个在临终回顾记忆时没有出现过一次将其改变的家庭但又却深深地爱着自己妻子和孩子的男人，终于愿意在弥留之际向亲人讲述自己的过去了。虽然“无论我们做了什么，总有其他东西值得一试，总有另一条路值得一走。所以到最后……我还是必须选择于我所选择的路。”，但是“……是啊，我有很多遗憾，但是……已经没关系了。那些我错过的机会，那些小意外，那些我所有未竟的愿望……是的，他们还是我的遗憾……但是他们让我拥有了现在的一切。而我所拥有的一切……无论什么都换不走。”
	另外有几点题外话吧：1.关于两位主人公的主线不填坑反而挖得更多，感觉要变成有生之年了？2.《finding paradise》和《a bird story》有一个遥相呼应的点很有趣，就是《a bird story》刚出的时候由于过于意识流好像评价不是很高，正好和《finding paradise》中Faye所说的那样：不是每个人都觉得那只鸟至关重要（靠记忆写的，大概是这个意思吧）。3.我觉得可能稍微有点内向倾向性格（MBTI中I分类）的人可能对本作的故事更有感触。

38653637.review:
Again, Reives takes us on a dazzling trip through the memories of an old person who wishes to fix something in their life, and once again, it's not as straightforward as it seems. Both his storytelling and his music are still top-notch, and I greatly enjoyed the tale he wove. [i]A Bird Story[/i] gave an excellent preview of what to expect from the memories of a person whose childhood was a muddled mix of fantasy and reality, and this final look at the same person's life did not disappoint.

The memory-unlocking minigames, though, were a little bit of an annoyance. Whereas they were interesting but not too hard to solve in [i]To The Moon[/i], they felt a bit like they interrupted the story flow at intense moments, in this one. On the other hand, the 'boss fights' in this game were absolutely great, and a lot more inspired than the Infinite Hallway of Doom (and Zombievas) in [i]To The Moon[/i] was.

Besides that, I only have one remark on the game, really, and that's that in my opinion, it is not, in fact, independent from [i]To The Moon[/i], as the info text claims. Admitted, I [i]have[/i] played both, so maybe this is hard for me to judge, but in my opinion, the concept of a memory dive going drastically wrong like this would not really have the same effect if the audience hasn't experienced the (semi-)normal flow of these events as depicted in [i]To The Moon[/i].

But these were both minor things. This game is still absolutely what I expected from it, and a marvel to experience first-hand. And the tactical inclusion of the creepy theme from "The Mirror Lied" was a [i]very[/i] pleasant surprise :)

38653626.review: Честно говоря, у меня нет слов. По началу я думал, что напишу длинную рецензию, где разгребу все плюсы и минусы, но сейчас я не могу. 38640965.review:
I have mixed feelings about this game. 

Although it claims to be an independent game and not part of a series, there were some jokes and references back to previous games so it helps if you've played the previous ones. As such, it functions as a pretty good sequel, and it's nice how they did a rearrangement of one of the background songs from To The Moon for this game since it nicely connects the two. [spoiler] The story is about the main character in A Bird Story, so it connects the three main games very nicely. [/spoiler] However, I find the plot to be a bit too unrealistic in the way it includes superhero and supernatural elements. I think the charm of To The Moon lies in the simplicity of the story, but how it is still relatable and touching. There are a lot of cucumber references, which I also believe relate back to To The Moon, and although funny I find them to be used a bit too frequently. 

I like how they added the element of changing between two character perspectives, since it improves the gameplay experience and it reminds me of the game Rakuen (which was created by one of the composers for Finding Paradise and To The Moon and inspired by the two). The game builds up suspense very well to get you hooked and provided 4 hours of gameplay, so I think it’s well worth your money. Although I listed a lot of criticism above, if you’re looking for a sequel to To The Moon, then this is it. Finding Paradise will take you on a crazy ride and although it didn’t suit my taste, the game is well made and most of my complaints relate to my personal preferences.

38637662.review:
隐藏的都是充满个人偏见的剧透，没玩过的朋友敬请不要看。



本身这游戏，我只想躺在床上单手操作看剧情，可却有几段不明所以的战斗，让我很不爽。

剧情方面我是不满意的。无非就是讲了[spoiler]一个患有轻度精神分裂的孤独人士，在知道能在死前能让自己的所有遗憾都能被修改之后，脑海里就一味放大自己的遗憾，而忽略掉自己经历过的美好，就是这样一个故事而已。[/spoiler]

[spoiler] 这样一个对系列大背景提出质疑的剧情，真的应该放到第二集就讲吗？我本来以为西格蒙特就是一个剧情道具，结果现在埋了这么些伏线，后面的续作还能好好讲故事吗？我只希望不要步子太大扯到蛋了。毕竟本作埋伏线的做法已经很生硬了。[/spoiler]

[spoiler]关于他的精神分裂，原因很简单。我就不信colin能靠faye的鼓励就能考上飞行员，却还是能让faye来占据他脑海的主导。faye大概是只有他孤独时才会出现的、一个关于他小时候提到的那只鸟的幻想。但colin并不像一个自闭儿童，他真的有需要度过一个孤独的童年吗？难道父母很忙的孩子就一定要孤独吗？这也太欺负人了吧？哪怕退一万步讲他是一个偶然发生的例子，但只是为了讲述后面的道理的话，有必要让案例发生在一个这样特殊的人身上吗？我觉得完全可以分开两个故事来讲。[/spoiler]

[spoiler] 我极度讨厌faye黑化的那一段。就像给我的粥里倒了半瓶辣椒酱，混淆我的味觉，使我想吐。[/spoiler]

我不想看那些深入解析的评测然后假装自己很享受这个剧情给我带来的感触，去月球用简单粗暴的方式就能让我哭得稀里哗啦，而寻找天堂做不到这一点。他只讲了一个大家耳熟能详的道理，只不过套在一个比较特殊的人身上而已。

如果你玩过去月球，并满心欢喜地期待这个游戏，却很不幸地在玩之前就看见我的评测，那我很高兴能让你的期待值稍微下降一些。

不过我还是希望推荐这款游戏。虽然音乐本身也没有去月球惊艳，但还是很不错的。尤其放在游戏里，对气氛的营造能让绝大多数的电影汗颜，手法比去月球成熟得多，能让你舒舒服服度过四个小时，然后感悟一点道理，找到一些幸福。

我自己都很烦为什么一定要这么反复强调跟去月球的对比，但我觉得自由鸟是逃不过这道坎的，至少在做出一个能让人忘掉去月球的优秀作品之前。

I loved To the Moon.
(That means I cried.. a lot.)

Finding Paradise is great, but it lacks some elements of the grand success that was the first episode.

This I have to say up front.

Nevertheless Finding Paradise is a gorgeous game in its own right. It features the same style of narrative and graphics as To the Moon did and stars the same main characters; Eva and Neil. This game is set somewhere in the not too distant future, something like 3 or 4 patients after Johnny (I forgot the exact number - It is mentioned).

Missing the somewhat deeper narrative of living life with Asperger's syndrome, it features the life of a lonely boy:
How he copes with loneliness and the trouble that come along with it. This story is still emotionally packed and relevant - Don't get me wrong - But I personally could connect better with River in the first part.

All that said, some tears slipped my eyes in the end and once again I am left behind, waiting anxiously for the next part.

I will be back :D

38632738.review:
[h1]Hra roku 2017[/h1]
Kan Gaovi se to zase povedlo. To the Moon bylo úžasné, A Bird Story se mi bohužel nelíbilo, ale Finding Paradise... to je naprosto perfektní. Opět sledujeme dva doktory (Neil je zase naprosto boží postava, který sype z rukávu jednu hlášku za druhou a díky němu tu je hromada vtipných scén), kteří se snaží splnit poslední přání umírajícímu Colinovi. Tentokrát je ale vše jinak, hra se zaměřuje na trochu jiné téma, než tomu bylo u To the Moon. Myslím si, že je to dobře, protože dvakrát řešit to stejné by prostě nedávalo moc smysl. Kan Gao zde jde tak dál, že vás nutí se i pozastavit a přemýšlet nad vašimi akcemi ve hře.

Jak je Colinovo přání zvláštní, tak je i zvláštní celá tahle hra. Bez spoilerů se to strašně těžko popisuje, ale zatímco To the Moon bylo hlavně o romantice, tak tenhle druhý díl je zaměřený spíše na život. Nejen na život těchto virtuálních postav, ale i na váš. Závěrečná pointa vás pak s největší pravděpodobností totálně odrovná a pokud neuroníte ani jednu slzu, nejspíše nejste ani člověk.

Hratelnost je víceméně stejná, hodně se tu mluví, chodí, je tu pár lehkých miniher, ale vše to tak krásně do sebe zapadá, že by mě ani nenapadlo zde hledat nějaký zápor. Dokonce i délka hry, která činí zhruba pět hodin, je vyhovující a tak akorát. A jelikož je hra stavěná na RPG Makeru, není problém ji rozjet i na hodně starém počítači. K tomu si připočtěte, že se již dělá na češtině a prostě není o čem přemýšlet.

Finding Paradise je naprostá pecka, která dokázala překonat mé extrémní nároky, jež byly budovány přes 4 roky. A to už o něčem vypovídá. Pro mě je tohle hra roku 2017 a musíte si ji koupit.

[h1]Plusy[/h1]
+ vše...

[h1]Mínusy[/h1]
- teď budeme muset čekat zase několik let na třetí díl

[h1]Konečný verdikt[/h1]
[b]Mé hodnocení: 10/10[/b]

Neuvěřitelně povedená hra, kdy jednou budete dojatí až k slzám, zatímco jindy se budete smát nad absurdními situacemi nebo hláškami jedné z postav. Příběh je parádní a jeho závěr je opravdu silný. Osobně se mi tahle hra líbí více než To the Moon a to i díky tomu, že nese určité poselství.

PS: Omlouvám se za to, že jsem víceméně nic neodhalil o příběhu, postavách a tak, ale je to hodně podobné To the Moon a navíc čím méně toho víte, tím více si tu hru užijete.

38632077.review: My god, a game has never made me this emotional...

38631427.review:
Si te gustó "To the moon" este no defrauda. El contexto del juego es muy similar pero toca un tema muy distinto al que tocaba su predecesor, desde mi punto de vista, un tema mucho más universal.

Para quien no haya jugado "To the moon" jugar "Finding Paradise" supone perderse algunas referencias pero el juego es disfrutable igual. Es importante que sepáis qué tipo de juego es este: aunque esté hecho con RPG-Maker no es un RPG, es una historia interactiva que te permite avanzar a tu ritmo, disfrutando de su exquisita OST pero con casi nada de jugabilidad. Sus puzzles son una excusa para poner un pequeño punto y seguido en la historia y no hay grandes decisiones que tomar ni que tengan importancia en el final del juego. Pero esas decisiones SÍ permiten obtener pequeñas informaciones extra que ayudan a configurar el conjunto de su historia (teorías de la conspiración incluídas).

Es recomendable haber jugado "A bird story", una minihistoria que sirve como precuela de este juego, ya que dicha historia forma parte de los primeros años de vida del personaje protagonista que quedan fuera de este juego por formar parte de los recuerdos de esa infancia que todos olvidamos. No es imprescindible, pero hay detalles importantes que permiten entender mejor el final de este juego (insisto en que no es imprescindible).

La duración de este juego es muy similar a la de To the moon y el nivel de emotividad es igual o incluso mayor en función de las vivencias de cada uno.

38631375.review:
В наше время выходит очень много игр, но найти среди них ту, которая зацепит тебя своим сюжетом с первых минут почти невозможно.Однако, Кан Гао умудрятся сделать это во второй раз.После выхода To The Moon хотелось наградить автора наградой, как создателя одной из лучших игр десятилетия. Он показал, что для создания шедевра тебе не требуется многомиллионное финансирование или огромный офис, с командой в 100 человек. Но предугадать то, что он повторит свой успех, я никак не мог.Игра не просто дотягивает до планки To the Moon, она уверенно обходит её. В игре идеально соблюдён баланс между юмором, грустными сценами, множеством отсылок к аниме и фильмам, но сверх всего этого автор смог вложить очень интересную мысль в основу сюжета этой игры. Так-же не могу не отметить, что помимо развития внутриигрового сюжета одновременно идёт развитие и сюжета серии игр в целом.Проходя игру вы не раз обратите внимание на отсылки к To The Moon и Bird`s story.
Подводя итог хочется сказать, что в игре всё сделано на твёрдую 10, начиная от диалогов, заканчивая музыкой, которая сможет выбить вас и колеи и заставить проронить слезу.
10/10.
Огромное спасибо Кану Гао за то, что создал эту игру.Благодаря таким людям как он, игровая индустрия будет жить.

38628863.review:
(建議搭配Wish My Life Away一同服用這篇心得文)
原本以為一直到心電圖變成一條線的時候還沒有大哭，應該就可以平平安安度過
看來，我太天真了
真正的最大淚點被藏在更後頭...

與To The Moon不同的是
To The Moon是一款兩個人之間的互動與故事
而Finding Paradise更偏向於自己對自己的對話、檢視
如果你們有過真正打從心裡的孤獨過，你會發現Finding Paradise是多麼的可以打動你心底的故事
當你已經理解了唯一可以陪伴自己走過一輩子的，只有自己以後，這個故事將會變得極度具有力道
他不是一款關於人世間情愛的故事
而是一個在幫助我們檢視人生意義的故事

當然，無可避免的也許是他並無法像To The Moon這樣的働人
但，他更像是貼近現實的存在，更貼近我們的人生與生活
音樂、劇情依舊無可挑替
值得一提的是，這次的緊張度與有趣的部份大勝前作
(但我相信沒有任何事物可以撼動To The Moon在大家心中的地位啦XD)

五年了，
我想，玩To The Moon時的我們、玩A Bird Story時的我們、現在正在玩Finding Paradise的我們
都更成長了一些，看到了更多社會的現實、更多了人生的體悟
我想，作者也是如此的伴著我們一起成長吧!

這次依舊是會讓我推薦給所有人的作品
探討的議題不同、自然會有不同的感動
我希望得不到共鳴的朋友們也能耐著性子，等著
也許幾年過後，你突然想起了Finding Paradise
希望你再給他一次機會，點開他，花個6個小時的時間
也許你的人生會因此而有所不同。

下一個五年，你會在哪裡?我又會在哪裡?
不變的將會是我們對這個系列的愛，對Kan Gao與Freebird Games的愛與期待
在此，獻給大家
2017/12/25 聖誕快樂!

38628861.review: Preferably play To The Moon first. (Then maybe A Bird Story). This game is definitely worth the wait. If you enjoy To The Moon, you'll enjoy Finding Paradise. If you're looking for 4-6 hours of a story-driven game, these games are perfect for you.

38628809.review:
依旧是一流的演出，一流的音乐，然而这一作的剧情却不再具有太大的震撼力，更像是一碗鸡汤，有些强行的说教。
通关之后感慨良多，这是我第一次愿意为一个作品写长评。
以下大量剧透
[spoiler] 我觉得Finding paradise没有To the moon那种震撼的主因，是作者被自己制造的这个“系列”陷进去了。To the moon围绕“去月球”这个“奇怪”的愿望展开故事，一步步追溯记忆找到根源，最后一举完成愿望，给玩家以充分的满足感。主角两人组进行的这个工作，或者说这个世界观设定基本就是为了这个故事服务的。然而到了Finding paradise，老人其实根本就没有愿望，在这个前提下强行套进这个世界观，就显得无比尴尬。
抛开世界观和背景不谈，单论这个故事本身，其实水平不差。起承转合都很到位，这点上和to the moon水平相差不大甚至在立意上比to the moon更高，然而finding paradise最为欠缺的一点，就是老人本身没有“愿望”，这一事实就让整个故事如同空中楼阁，没有丝毫的沉浸感。玩家开始还会觉得老人“真正想要”的东西是这个故事的核心谜团，然后在“转”的地方被告知其实根本没有愿望，最后发现确实没有愿望，修正后的记忆里老人就没和主角所在的公司有任何接触，这一点足以毁掉玩家一切成就感。
从故事本身来说，老人其实没有愿望这件事就是这个故事的立意，所以这点无可指责，如果把这个故事换个背景换个设定，我觉得完全可以更加出彩。事实上，通关这个故事后，我觉得a bird story在我心中的水平更高了，如果能将前传a bird story和这一作有效地结合，剔除无用的主线，我觉得甚至可以超过To the moon。这也是为什么我一开始说作者被自己的“系列”陷进去了。两个目的是实现他人愿望的人，从一开始，到结尾，始终在研究一个没有什么愿望的老人的一生，这太尴尬了。[/spoiler] 
再谈点其它的。
[spoiler] 从To the moon开始，到A bird Story，再到本作，我感觉Gao Kan本人应该是对天空有着相当的憧憬。这三作无论哪一作都离不开飞行。这时我意识到，作者早已将这件事告诉我们。Gao Kan-望着高处，望着天空，这个名字就表达出了作者对天空的向往与浪漫。我不知道作者是否只在这一领域有充分优秀的驾驭力，希望不是这样，因为再来更多的同一主题是会腻的。[strike]有人评论说他在几作的曲风相差不大，新作的曲子不再惊艳。我感觉这可能是因为这些曲子都是在描写天空（不是很懂音乐的人的胡乱点评）。[/strike][/spoiler] 
最后说说系列主线。
[spoiler] 我感觉男主吃的药是真的药，也就是说男主其实命不长了。因为自知大限将至，才会自己去改造机器，才会去copy一个自律人格。男主或许是想在自己临死时能让自己实现自己的遗憾？又或是想要自己死后能留下一个人格，一段程序在网络里行走，帮助更多的人？我比较倾向于这两种猜测。[/spoiler] 
最后的最后，无论如何，就冲着它顶级的演出和优秀的音乐，好评，推荐。

38625749.review:
Joguei o primeiro jogo que antecede esse o To the Moon e é incrível ver como a qualidade aumentou.
É uma tamanha sensibilidade nos diálogos, na pixel art, no humor, na caracterização dos personagens.
Algo que é engraçado notar é que dessa vez até a Dra. Eva faz piadas o tempo todo o que não era muito comum.
Existem várias referências à Street Fighter, Dragon Ball em formas de trocadilhos.
A música é sensacional, o RPG Maker foi usado apenas como um esqueleto para contar uma história incrível.
Posso dizer que Finding Paradise é um jogo que as pessoas afirmam como sendo RPG Maker feito do jeito certo.
A preocupação de fazer um jogo bem feito nos mínimos detalhes explica a demora para ser lançado, mas valeu a pena.
Acho que Kan Gao tem um talento incrível em fazer títulos tão únicos com tanta simplicidade e riqueza ao mesmo tempo.

O que define a qualidade de um jogo na minha opinião é o coração que as pessoas que trabalham nele e olha acho que todos tem corações enormes porque se você não sentir nada depois de jogar esse jogo do começo ao fim é porque tem algo errado com teus sentimentos.

11/10

Prós:
-Pixel Art Original
-Animações
-HIstória boa
-Engraçado e divertido
-Feito pelo Kan Gao
-Superou o To the Moon na minha opinião
-O tipo de jogo que usou 100% da capacidade do RPG Maker, se não mais por ter ido além 

Cons:
-Haters
-Você pode acabar se emocionando
