38614052.review: In a short summary, this game significantly exceeded my expectations. I came to the conclusions that since the game was delayed and the time lapse between To The Moon and Finding Paradise was such a vast amount of time, that either the game wasn't going according to plan, or that they were truly perfecting it. The game ultimately fufilled what I requested from the last game - I felt the gameplay lacked enthusiasm from me, basically the same, find the memory cues, which are very fun because for me I love puzzles. However, I was delighted to be able to play as Neil Watts and go full-out battle mode. Other than that, the game fulfilled my expectations, plus an addition of more suprises that makes me want to come to the conclusion that these are my favorite RPGS of all time. Sure, portal will challenge your brain and make you laugh, or Undertale will pull at your heart strings, but these series of games, despite seeming so small, are extrodinary. (Also, I'd like to briefly mention, I NEED TO KNOW WHAT'S GOING ON WITH NEIL?!? In a more professional tone, the mystery and suspense left behind from these little hints at a bigger picture truly make me crave for more. You've cracked the code, Kan, you have all of us waiting in suspense, in the palm of your hand so-to-speak, and you could do anything....) Furthermore, my only imaginative request would be to see a spark of interest as a significant other between Neil and Eva, but that might be a bit perposterous. In conclusion, thank you Kan for all of your dedication into making such an alluring (in a good way:) franchise of games, and thank you Laura for the most beautifully composed songs.

38613123.review:
Some people might find it not as good as to the moon, but still, please give it a try and leave the expectation from to the moon behind. As a sequel it shaped the universe of the game more solid, we start to know how sigmund run, but what to the moon never tell us is, does sigmund's service always the happy end? Yes surely people have regrets that's why they want at least something back into their life and feel they fulfilled their life.

Finding Paradise story is more a sarcastic view on sigmund's service with specific cases, however that does not implying sigmund's service is anything related to moral value or human ethics, is not like what people always deem "escaping the reality just to feel good" kind of thing. Just that some people, really don't need their service after all.

After playing through finding paradise, I appreciate more in the character design in this game, their perspective and their experience, I feel this is 1 step deeper of experiencing other person's life, more than I feel in to the moon. I'm willing to wait for another 6 years or maybe longer until Kan can finish up this saga in the perfect ending he thinks fit the most.

If you happen to decide to give it a try in this game, please take a step more closer in understanding the characters.

This game did NOT dissapoint me. I was excited and waited months for it (I have almost 24 hours on the first one), and the wait was well worth it. The plot twists and mini games were a fun addition, and the humor and relationship between our two doctors were great. The soundtrack is great, as always, and there were many moments where I thought I was going to cry. It was a fantastic game, and I feel like I need to go and play A Bird Story, since I haven't yet. I have seen it played on Youtube, though. 
The best thing is this, though: I bartered a Barnes and Noble gift card ($25) to but this and Bird Story. And Christmas is two days away.
The throwbacks and allusions to To The Moon hit me with the feels, and they added to the experience.
All in all, I highly suggest this game.

On a side note: I was so suprised to see the price so low! This type of artwork should have a higher price, in my opinion.
Thank you, Kan Gao, for everything you've done.

38604297.review:
Colin为自己虚假的记忆而感到遗憾，所以找到了西格蒙德公司去试图改变过去。但正如Safia所言，人生不存在完美，你应该珍惜人生过程中的一切，即使Faye从未存在，但无疑正是因为她，Colin才可以度过那一段孤独的时光，也正是因为她的激励，他才可以坚持下去，努力达到他的目标。
我们每个人都有一个Faye，或是我们的父母或是我们的朋友，但也有一些人只能依赖于自己。而这部作品正是面向那些处于孤独的环境，但坚强的克服孤独的人，作者想告诉你们，即使所处时间和空间的不同，你们也从来不是一个人。
感谢 KanGao 一直与我们分享如此积极的爱情观和人生观，期待下一部作品。

38603283.review:
[h1]*Spoilers*[/h1]
I cried a bit at the end
But not as much as I did for 'To The Moon'[TTM]
My brother agreed with me that the game was alright,
but it didn't meet the high emotional/philosophical standards set by TTM

AND... this is why:
I could not empathize with the client who has [spoiler]an imaginary friend[/spoiler]
Now that I think about it, it was a pretty bold/risky move for the developer to centre the game around [spoiler]imaginary friends[/spoiler]. 
An article on Pyschology Today says 37% of children aged 7 years old have [spoiler]an imaginary friend[/spoiler]
But how many people actually experienced [spoiler]imaginary friends[/spoiler] to the extreme extent of the games' protagonist?

I've never had [spoiler]an imaginary friend[/spoiler].
I doubt the majority of you have either,
So I cannot really empathize or relate to the story.

This is not a bad game, but it is no TTM
This is because the Writer took some very bold risks.
You need some serious s**t to have happened in your life to extract the full emotional sweep of this story.

38601607.review: “那些看不见的朋友，实际上是存在的”

38601213.review:
昨天一天打完，朋友先打完的告诉我玩到泪崩，我游戏中就一直期待一个高潮i的来临，但是一直就是平铺直叙，剧情缓缓展开，点滴娓娓道来，最后看到按ESC退出游戏的一瞬间，心里觉得空落落的，无法言说为什么会这样，但是不可否认这是一部佳作。
打完之后回头想想，其实很多地方早已暗示了我们faye其实不是真实存在这个世界上的，而是存在于colin的脑海之后中。在游戏中唯一一次泪目不是最后faye‘在colin阳台对面叫出老顽固，也不是最后sofia与colin告别时的生死相别，而是在山顶faye向colin道别时的场景，一幅幅图画加上优秀的bgm瞬间让我感到些许泪目，是泪水含在眼眶里久久不能落下，为colin的放开自己的心扉、自我救赎而感动，为faye决定让colin获得幸福的人生选择离去而感动，另外也为sofia感动，她的出现才使得colin不再孤独，不再自我封闭，才有了colin的逐渐淡化直至消失。可以说faye是colin孤独的化身，当遇到sofia一个自己真心喜爱的女孩faye的消失其实不可避免，因为colin不再孤独，所以faye不再存在。就像我们每个人都有孤独的时候，我们会想象热闹的时光，会想象家人的陪伴，会想象朋友的相聚，会想象恋人的低语，我们心中都在存在时存在过“faye”，她以不同的化身出现在我们的脑海里，让我们孤独时不在凄凉伤感，让我们不在独处时仍然能感受到温暖。
faye虽然只是一缕意念（姑且这么说吧），是存在于脑海中，但按照faye最后的说法，难道这不是另一种方式的存在呢？谁知道呢，无需深究，我们每一个人心里知道存在过就好，“她”陪我们笑过、哭过、爱过。
做得很用心，推荐！
另外，谁知道里面那首歌叫什么的告诉我一下。。。就是有人唱的那首

38600678.review: Congratulations to Freebird Games, for once again demonstrated their mastery of telling a rich and powerfully emotional tale through pixel art animation and music.  This kind of craftsmanship is truly apex within the genre of RPG Maker games, and one of the strongest argument of which video games, as an interactive storytelling medium, are real art.

38600445.review:
Let me get my little frustration out first: this game is kinda technologically outdated. It's 640x480 fullscreen or window (and that if you hit alt+enter), not much even in terms of volume options, and it looks positively ancient. You can yammer as long as you want about style, and I'll still think that this game could have been even better with higher tech levels.

Yet still, this game, despite its relatively primitive technological level, manages to evoke emotions like few other games can. This game, together with To The Moon, could easily be called modern classics. Add to that an amazing soundtrack that fits the game perfectrly.

The technology rant is bigger than the actual review. Don't let that dissuade you. Play it. It's worth every penny.

For the Feels™.

38600345.review: Excellent follow up to the great To The Moon. Very emotionally charged story with some wonderful characters and dialogue that concludes in a way that probably touched me more than its predecessor did. The music is beautiful in its simplicity and has a welcome return from Laura Shigihara, who provides the vocals for the ending song. Kan Gaos unique humour still shines but like To The Moon it can slightly mess with the tone in one or two places, though it doesn't detract from the overall experience. FInding Paradise is the perfect example of why you don't need tens of millions of dollars in development costs to create a game that's both fun and manages to connect with you on an emotional level. I recommend buying it and playing in one or two sittings; You don't need to play To The Moon to enjoy the sequel but I would suggest picking it up beforehand to ensure you get the most out of it.

38600333.review:
Positives:
-Make sure you have your permission trip for the feels-trip
-Soundtrack and plot certainly make it a worthy successor to 'To the Moon'
-You do not need to play 'To the Moon' to understand the plot, but 'Finding Paradise' does contain a spoiler for the previous title.
-Besides the main plot (you are two professionals altering the patient's memory), this game's story does make it worthy of a stand-alone sequel. 

Negatives (and this is a stretch):
-No replayability unless you are fine playing again for the story
-Any new mechanics (besides the mementos mini-game) only exist for a few minutes

If you want specifics, you can ask a question in the comments and I'll answer as best I can.

38598869.review:
To the Moon is a 2011 RPGMaker game by Freebird Games.
It was a moving story about life, in the way that life has a lot of laughing and crying in it.

Since that game, there was promise of a "sequel" (although there is a considerable time gap between that game and this one). 
As the years went by, we got little fun short stories like the SigCorp Holiday Minisodes 1 and 2, and A Bird Story.
Those are necessary to understanding the plot of Finding Paradise, as small as they might seem, it really is building up to something.

Finding Paradise is the sequel that fans waited 6 years for. 
The most impressive quality of Finding Paradise is how it manages to tackle life in a completely different perspective from To the Moon; especially since it hit very close to home for me.

If you enjoyed Kan Gao's other works...This one is a treat.

38598175.review: I've been waiting for this game since 2011, and it did not dissapoint. Flawless art, music, and comedy as expected from Gao.

38595206.review:
Many games can evoke emotions in their players.  We become attached to the characters we play as, seeing their lives, their trials and tribulations, their hopes and dreams.  But at the end of the day, it's rare that we truly FEEL for those characters at the most intimate of levels.

Finding Paradise makes you FEEL.

Just like To The Moon, the music is spot on, the graphics are appropriate (though I'd really like it if I could resize the window easily instead of having to play it stretched), and the storytelling is...'top-notch' feels almost like a disservice to how good it is.  This game is really a testament to the fact that you don't need AAA credentials, 4K visuals, and a multi-million dollar budget to create a truly beautiful game.

In short - if you liked To The Moon, you will like Finding Paradise.

And yes, I cried.  Multiple times.

A sequel to the masterpiece To The Moon and A Bird Story. Finding Paradise is a beautiful masterpiece. Like To The Moon, it really leaves you with many questions that all just snap together and hit you like a truck. Again, a story I will bring with me in my heart forever.

10/10. Thank you. Thank you. Thank you.

10/10

Well... I think I just got shocked by Finding Paradise more than To the Moon, so in short: you have done an amazing piece of art as always. (Take it as a compliment or as you wish, but I have to tell: Sometimes I just lost my faith in gaming industry, because of the loss of spirit and true feelings or because of the schematization of it). Here, playing your games, I do not feel this way. :)

I am pleased to be able to know the works of people like you, Kan (and also Laura), because by that I know the hope and the wonders of our world are not dead.

What you did, is a level of art and story-telling I think more and more people should come to know with. Not only because of the great and touching adventure your works offer (offer in that context not actually the  best way to express myself, ) and the absolutely lovable characters. the beautiful visuals or the haunting soundtrack, but because of what your narrative could show about the inner-self of ourselves.

Thank you for the experience!

38592173.review:
Hmmm...
The game is wonderful! :D Beautiful creation, and totally worth the wait. You can see all the effort and work that went into the game, especially if you played Bird's story too, not just the first episode of the game.
It is interesting though, in my opinion much less emotional, and way more intriguing than the first episode. This game makes you wonder more about what's happening, it's more mystical, even creepy at some moments! Of course, it's a proper To the moon game, so it will put you through every emotion there is, but still, I was surprised because I expected something that is more similar to the first game I guess!
It might be me, but while the first game made me sob uncontrollably (we all know when was that moment), this one didn't "properly" make me cry. It was touching, and since I cry easily, it made me tear up a little bit at moments, but it didn't put me through that huge emotional turmoil that just messes you up for days (hell, months). Which is something I actually missed (yeah, kinda masohistic, I know).
But it was definitely more action-packed, it was fun, I would say way more fun than the first part, but a little less emotional. :) I loved it anyway, because it made up for the parts that I mentioned, and I'm looking forward to the next one! 
I kinda hope that that will have that huge realization/shock that we had in the first game but not so much in this one. ;)

38583406.review:
There's just so much to talk about when it comes to this masterpiece.

[h1] The story [/h1] 

It was such an amazing adventure from start to finish, there's just so much work put into the game and it shows.

The six years of wait after To The Moon's release, it was well worth it.
I'm not going to compare this game to the aforementioned title all that much but if the main question you're asking is :
"Is this as emotional as the previous one?" 
What I'd say to that is : "It damn sure is! And to some degree, a lot more." 

This game sucks you in, really. The story that it's trying to tell, half way through the game you're totally invested into the story but you may feel, "Oh but I still don't feel what I felt back when I played To The Moon" and that's where you're wrong because you just wait for it...

That train's going to hit you out of nowhere because there's just so much you could relate to, this time. All the things it tells you about life itself through the story. Everything that's said, it all gets just too real and you should definitely go ahead, buy it and experience everything from start to finish.

[b] The soundtrack [/b] is just what you'd expect, if you've played To The Moon/A Bird Story, total brilliance is what it is!
There's just the right music at the right time and you sure are never going to forget something like this, I know I would never..

I immediately bought the soundtrack after it released, it's pure heaven to my ears. I consider myself lucky to be able to experience something this beautiful. 

Give it a go right now if you don't own the game already, don't think much about it!
Just get it and see it for yourself.

I'd strongly recommend this game to any indie lover and I'll surely buy anything this guy (Kan R. Gao) makes.

<3 Freebird Games.

Can't wait for what's next. There's so much to look forward to.

Finding Paradise è davvero un titolo, seppur indie, che tiene tranquillamente passo a qualsiasi AAA. Sequel di To The Moon, anch'esso titolo davvero eccezionale, riprende la vita del bambino, Colin, che abbiamo utilizzato all'interno di A Bird Story, quello che si credeva essere un gioco a parte ma che si è dimostrato essere un ottimo titolo e fondamento per la trama di Finding Paradise. La trama è davvero ottima e non stanca mai dall'inzio alla fine grazie ai colpi di scena e le sezioni più intense. E' sicuramente consigliato a tutti MA, vi consiglio di giocare prima ai suoi predecessori per avere un prospetto completo di quello che succede!

终于推完了Finding Paradise，心中的感觉如同曾经推完To The Moon一样，满是感动

*此次的叙事方式不同于To The Moon，给人新奇还有之后神转折的惊喜
*剧情在体验客户回忆时夹杂着各种彩蛋、欢乐、悬疑、还有感动，同时将这个系列的四部（To The Moon加上两个剧情dlc和鸟的故事）巧妙衔接在一起，但又保持着相对的独立性，即使没玩过前作也是完全没有关系的。

*剧情最后暗示会有dlc或者续作

本作绝对对得上期盼to the moon后续剧情粉丝的期待，秉承其独特的叙事方式、优秀的剧情和恰到好处的bgm，给人以新的感动

国区价格也是一部普通gal的钱，如果感觉不在承受范围内可以等打折的时候入手

Just finished the game last night, spent about 5 hours, not rushing, but read the lines and listened to the music carefully.

Have been waiting for this game for years since To The Moon was released.

Full of expectation, yet not disappointed.

To The Moon was a really sad story, I did cry a lot. Excellent plot, legendary music and song.

Finding Paradise is just insanely good, it is not sad at all, the ending is great, yet too heavy to handle. The plot is so good that beyond description. The music is great as always.

I did not feel sad, but the emotion is too much. I couldn't hold my tear. In To The Moon, I know why I cry, but in Finding Paradise, I even cry in the mid-game without reason, burst into tears in the end.

Just like the previous episode, it would make me depressed for weeks. Tears fall off by just listening to the music.

I tried to compare with the last game, but they are just two different aspects of emotions, both are great. If there would be any further episodes, I would instantly buy them in seconds.

38558540.review:
（没有剧透）
       和前作有相似之处，但是其实算是不一样的感觉的作品，不论是从剧情内容，还是说情节的起伏；《去月球》属于那种真的震撼到不行，也意外到不行的真相，即使被剧透了一点，不亲自去玩一下，感受不到那种冲击与震撼。
       《寻找天堂》相比之下，其实真相差不多在游戏进行到一半的时候就猜到了，如果你玩过A Bird Story可能玩到四分之一就猜到真相了；虽然没有《去月球》的震撼和意外，但代入感依旧很强，高潮部分依旧很感人，那种会让你泪水在眼眶里打转的感人；《去月球》的感动主要来自于，一个孤独的人，可以有这么深的执念和切肤的感情，《寻找天堂》更像是一个孤单的人的自我救赎（虽然，主角或许不是这么想的；虽然感觉我们这一代，很多人和主角的童年挺像的吧，但确实要承认，不能百分之一百的和主角Colin产生共鸣）
       只能说，不能百分百和主人公有共鸣，但是玩完之后仔细回味一会，感觉有点同情Colin，又有点羡慕Colin；不会有《去月球》那种想cry like a baby的感觉，但是也会有点惆怅，心里也会有点暖暖的。
       另外，这款游戏和A Bird Story有一定联系，如果你没有玩过A Bird Story，建议可以玩一下再来玩这个，或者玩完以后去玩一下A Bird Story；会有很不一样的震撼；《寻找天堂》自身其实不像《去月球》那样有让人难以忘怀的伏笔和线索，因为很多看上去意义不大的线索其实都在A Bird Story里，都另有出现，如果两者结合，真的意味深藏；至于要先玩还是后玩A Bird Story，看个人意愿吧。
       PS，即使这个游戏可能会在早期猜到真相，并不会影响这款游戏的可玩性和悬疑性，因为这次的情景，有更多内容着重于，Neil和Eva如果帮助病人在一个难以解决的困局、悖论中实现愿望；因为这个原因，我们现在或许能看到关于Neil和Eva的主线剧情将要在之后的系列慢慢展开了。

I never once doubted that I would enjoy this purchase, especially for how cheap the bundle was for the winter sale (as well as paying for it with a gift card). Like the overview says, it would probably do to play this as a stand alone, but playing this in conjuction with [i]To The Moon[/i], its free minisodes (the comic too if you want), and [i]A Bird Story[/i], this is quite the treat! Soundtrack always worth getting too.

If you're going to ask about the emotional impact, I didn't feel as much as with [i]To The Moon[/i], but we have a general idea of what we get now and, even then, I also had a bit of a personal takeaway from [i]To The Moon[/i] and River's character herself. Here... it hits home in a different way. I haven't exactly walked in Collin's shoes before, but it's close enough for me to empathize. I will remember his story too.

RPGmaker style your jam? Ready for a tearjerker instead of a horror or bland fantasy game? Give the whole series a shot. I personally wouldn't start here, but add it to your library. Play it in due time to get the most out of it.

38557274.review:
I've been waiting a good while to play this game. To the Moon quickly became one of my favorite games of all time, so my bar was set very high for Finding Paradise. In a world where we are constantly exposed to stories that are recylced and lack orginiality, Kan Gao and Freebird games have once again found themselves a the tellers of a beautifully unique story. I cried at To the Moon, and darn if this one didn't make me do it again. You will wonder, laugh, ponder life, and likely cry in your experience playing this game. The characters are such great parts of this story, and work very well off each other. 

Midway through the game, before one of the twists was revealed, I thought I had figured it out, and questioned whether I would be as touched by this one as it's predecessor. However in the final act of the game, it exceeded my expectations and became a very worthy sequal to a series with limitless potential.

Now onto less emotions and more gameplay. Similar style to "To the Moon", much more of an interactive story. Though they did throw in a slightly more complex puzzle system (still not difficult though, however it doesn't need to be) and there are a couple more instances where there is a minor form of "gameplay" which was fun in it's own way, allowing a little more variety to my experience playing this game.

I highly recommend this game, especially if you have played To the Moon. If you're new to the series and just browsing, make sure you play To the Moon first. If you prioritze storytelling, great characters, and excellent music thenI promise you will not be disapppointed.

38554112.review:
I don't normally write reviews for any sort of game, but after playing through Finding Paradise, I felt obliged to.
I enjoyed To The Moon and I enjoyed Finding Paradise. I don't think you can compare the two when they both pulled off amazing things and they are both gems in their own right. 

To begin with, a basic summary of this game is that there is character that the story is revolved around, Colin, and he is on his deathbed and he hires Sigmund to fulfill his last wish. The thing is, Colin doesn't what he wants for his last wish as he feels like something is missing from his life but doesn't know what, so it is up to the workers of Sigmund, Eva and Dr. Watts, to traverse through his memories and figure it out by themselves. 

I really like this game, as a matter of fact, I adored it. 
There was the silly jokes that made this game and To The Moon so charming.
But then there was also the stuff that hit hard, the stuff that makes you emotional, and you have to take a moment and step back and appreciate how well this story is told as it builds this fantasy world that captures your attention and never once lets it go. But that's the beauty of this game, the carefully crafted way that the story is told that produces so many feelings inside of you that you even knew existed.

But there is so much more that makes this game endearing, so much so that you couldn't possibly describe in words, so do yourself a favour and play this game.

38551042.review:
Finding Paradise is a shockingly well-written game, and since it's pretty much "the sequel to To The Moon" to the entire world, no one is really surprised.

Comparing it to its predecessor has been done a few hundred times already. They're both story-driven videogames about exploring a dying man's memories to change them in order to grant him his final wish, all done in RPG Maker XP of all things. I love you Kan, but you really gotta move that gear up someday,

While we're on the subject, the gameplay is awful. It's about moving your mouse over things hoping that your cursor turns into a magnifying glass icon so that you can make the story go forward ; and you have to do puzzles to move from memory to memory which I feel like I never really fully understood. Moreover, you can't change graphical options of any sort (not that I could find anyway, not like I looked hard) and the game assumes you're using a QWERTY keyboard and not an AZERTY one, which was actually a problem for me and my poor keyboard in some later parts of the game.

You might have noticed that I'm being harsh on this game. That's because in my eyes, there's little to criticize. Finding Paradise is absolutely amazing and I'm ready to talk about the great stuff, baby. Gaze, Internet Person, as my angry little frown disappears and I shower this game with praise like I shower your mother with one dollar bills on Friday nights.

The story is absolutely fantastic ; complex, but easy to understand, because it's told extremely well and the pacing is spot-on. The title screen itself managed to draw me in, then the game did not lose my attention for a second, nor did a single yawn escape my mouth. God knows how, since I yawn so much I probably consume twice as much oxygen as everyone else. And it's not because things keep happening and happening ; you're just always curious. What will the next memory be like? It's incredibly pleasant to learn more about Colin, little by little, and you really do get attached to him. If you didn't, which means the game wasn't incredibly human, the whole thing would fall apart.

Because that's this game's main quality : it's so goddamn full of humanity. The characters feel real and interesting, there's growth to their personalities, and the dialogue feels genuine : the writing is never forced, ever. Moreover, it's all very subtle. Everyone's heard of "Show, don't tell", but it feels like so little writers use it in gaming ; well not your boy Kan Gao, since his game is all about showing. You're shown who these characters are, you learn about them through their actions, not boring exposition. All the pieces are set for a very emotional gaming journey.

I've heard many people say, like for To The Moon, that this game has made them cry. It didn't for me personally, but that's mostly because Father fetches the belt if I feel emotions without his consent. Being the sneaky rebel that I am, that didn't stop me from feeling very sad or laughing with the game, and I can say that overall this is a very touching experience that little developers could pull off. 

I suppose I also have to mention boring things like the quality of the music and of the pixel art, if I want to be thorough. But that's about it. I just wanted to contribute to that sweet "Overwhelmingly Positive" review score this game rightfully deserves. See ya.

如去月球一样出色，回想起来接触去月球已经是两年前了。还是一样的画风，一样优秀的BGM，一样令人落泪的剧情。
不记得哪里的话了，引用一下。“读书最美妙的时刻，就是看到里面出现了有你认为只有你自己才有的见解和情感。那一刻，就好像作者隔着书向你伸出手，像两个久未谋面的知己一样，紧紧地与你握手。”
同样的话送给这个游戏。
那些难以启齿的细腻情感，那些与孤独和现实的对抗，那些孩童时期的幻想伴侣，以及成长中某一刻与之深情地道别。如今已然成人的我，再度梦回昨夜。
感谢高瞰，让我知道我不是一个人。

38547596.review:
I've said this before, but I'll state it again for the purposes of this this review: Very few things are able to drive me to tears, much less sobbing. To the Moon was one of these starring examples. I've been impressed severely by it's amazingly beautiful story and soundtrack... but that was the past... a memory if you will. Finding Paradise: The sequel to a story I had beloved so much. Is it able to hold up against the high expections set by its predecessor?
The story revolves around Dr. Eva Rosalene and Dr. Neil Watts - two scientists whose jobs are to investigate a patient's memories in order to do one last thing for them: fufill their dying wish. Today's patient goes by the name of Colin, who has a wish that is rather... difficult. The story - like that of To the Moon - is well executed. You will be laughing, you will be happy, you will be sad, you will be crying, you will be scared, but you will also be brave. Once again, Freebird - the devs behind this wonderful project - have once again outdone themselves! Finding Paradise is a masterpiece throughout the adventure! The characters are once again are amazing, although I do have a problem with the logic put behind a character near the end (and you’ll know what I’m talking about when you get to it), but I’ll let it happen because it did turn out really good anyways. Now if you didn’t play To the Moon, don’t worry. This game does a good job of catching you up without boring those who have already played the game, however, you will miss some references to To the Moon and apparently Bird Story also has a few references. HOWEVER! I still recomend you go and play To the Moon because you will seriously kick yourself in the face if you don't! You’re also probably wondering if Finding Paradise could possibly ever possibly beat To the Moon’s amazing finale. Believe it or not, the ending is on par with To the Moon, and you will be sobbing once again.
Now let’s talk gameplay. What happens is that you go around, collecting memory links in order to break momentos. Thankfully, the game does tell you if you’ve missed something and memory links are very obvious, so it shouldn’t be too hard of a task, but it still can be somewhat sluggish considering how slowly the characters move. Then, once a momento is broken, you must solve a puzzle to get past it. The puzzles of this game can be interesting, but they weren’t world breaking or anything. There are also a few mini games near the end that were interesting and kinda fun, but these aren’t the main spotlight of the game. But please don’t let these detract from the main story. These are the minorest of minor complaints, and I really don’t mind.
And now it’s time to talk music. The music - like To the Moon - is really well done. They have all added onto whatever scene is currently playing out really well. Also, Laura Shigihara makes a reappearance for the final song (you know, the one who sung “There’s a Zombie on Your Lawn” from PVZ or the ever amazing “Everything’s Alright” from To the Moon?), which by the way, you don’t need to worry about. The final song adds soooo much to the end (just like "Everything's Alright), and I know you’ll love it as well. I’m going to give you a tip: buy the soundtrack but don’t listen to it until you finish the game. You’ll thank me later when you start crying to the end.
There’s only one last thing to talk about: graphics. I gotta say, the art style may be the same, but you can tell that it’s gone through several improvements. There are now more expressions, zooming in, and now some objects actually sparkle, providing yet another helpful hint system. The visuals of this game are still good and do a very good job of telling the story.
In the end, Finding Paradise turns out to be an extraordinary example of a good experience with its amazing story and soundtrack. Though there are minor problems to be had, they pale in comparison to the story, and I could never let them get in the way. Overall, I loved Finding Paradise. It has managed to do what To the Moon could, even if To the Moon was an unbeatable story. Finding Paradise... might have even beaten To the Moon, but that will be a close battle to be sure.

38547208.review:
"Done."

"..."

"I need time to absorb it in."

"I know its not a lot, but even this 'not a lot' is a lot harder to understand than it looks. I can't really explain it without authentic, cannon data. But regardless... its up to us, the audience, right? Just don't get me started about fan stuff. I'm not the one for gossip."

"Really nice... though. But... like I said, its confusing. So to speak my mind."

"Sigh."

"It's been four hours, and its right smack fourty minutes pass three in the morning. I'm gonna go get my sleep before I decrypt the story more so. Would take me another run, I'd say."

"Happy that Rakuen introduced me by mention to part 1 of the story, though."

"Just..."

"How long is the gap to the next gonna be?? I played both this year."

"Nope. Not gonna ponder on such stuff. I'll just keep my mouth shut. Here in a sea of people, it is impossible for everyone's voice to be heard."

"Good morning, everybody."

38543851.review:
其实吧，寻找天堂比《去月球》更有内涵深度，看得出来5年时间，高瞰的阅历和游戏制作水平均有不小的提升，三部作品分别对应作者的童年，少年，中年三个不同时期不同的人生感悟。
有人说此作没有《去月球》好，其实不然，《去月球》好比一个年轻朝气有活力的人写下的一首波澜壮阔的爱情史诗，让人不禁热泪盈眶。《寻找天堂》就好像一杯平淡无奇苦涩兼有的浓茶，越品越有味道，越让人着迷。
朋友，本作没有你想象的那么差，少一分浮躁，少一点戾气，如果你真的喜欢《去月球》，但对《寻找天堂》很失望，那么不妨用当初玩《去月球》时的平静的心态来对待这部作品。
看到最后父亲抚摸熟睡中儿子的头时，心里不禁一抽。
果然还是天大地大，父母最大，无论发生什么，父母对子女的爱胜过一切。
好作品等得久啊，五年磨一剑，下个五年期待与你再会~！

关于本作
这是一个孤独患者的自我救赎，或许每个人在童年都会有一个自己臆想出来的“朋友“，这个“朋友”会在你孤独的时候倾听你的诉说，陪伴你。可随着你朋友交的越来越多 它在你的生活中出现的次数会越来越少，总有一天 你会不再需要它，因为你已经有了可以倾诉一切的对象，而它将会永远埋藏在你的心底，或许在你临终前你会在你的记忆中再次见到它，而它可能会笑着和你说“来吧 和我讲讲你这一生的故事吧”。

推荐指数  10/10  [spoiler] 买了不亏呀	[/spoiler]

38539911.review:
[h1] Another FANTASTIC Story [/h1]

I believe that games are an alternative medium for story telling, in a way that books are not capable of. The immersiveness that an interactive game puts one through places high standards on what one is willing to expect when playing through it.

Freebird's original game/novel To the Moon sets a very high bar in terms of story telling and the emotions it evokes for a simple game, which Finding Paradise once again uses the immersiveness of the video game/visual novel genre to craft an exquisite story

Understand that is its MAINLY a story driven game/novel that has puzzle elements imbedded within it.
the puzzles are nothing much, taking a few clicks here and there to solve. 
if you are a person looking for a more stimulating puzzle challange without a need for a story then this game/novel is not for you.

for the bookworms like me, It is an exquisite visual novel, crafted in a fashion that is only achievable via the medium of interaction.

Placing you in the middle of it all, and having you follow the carefully crafted character creation, it brings together elements of animation, music and interaction to once again craft an unexpecting climax with a bittersweet conclusion.

the music is fantastically crafted to suit each moment, drawing upon old themes from previous games/novel as well as playing specific tongue-in-cheek jokes.

this game/novel itself is a roller-coaster ride of emotion, that would perhaps leave one with feelings of bittersweet love at the end of a long journey.

For those who are looking, savour the time to play this game/novel and do not rush through it. the story itself needs time to sit and sink into you, just like any normal story building a good plot.

One would have thought that To the Moon has pulled all the punches, and I was feeling rather fearful as to its ability to pull the same sort of emotional heartstrings as the previous game/novel did. But not this story.

Taking elements of the previous game/novel and building upon it, they have manged to craft a new story, plot and climax based on the same universe and some recurring characters.

[spoiler] A question upon one's personal existence, the value that one views for themselves, it is a new take on what one believes to be achievable in their lives and the changes in perspective that they take because of certain events. [/spoiler]

As a story, I love it for its unique flavour of perspective that it provides, and specific questions that it tries to evoke in the player, just like every good story does.

Enjoy playing through the game/novel, and I hope that you'll be able to find some part of your own personal paradise by answering some of the questions that this game/novel evokes.

38539627.review:
I'm writing this review really just because I feel like I owe it to the game and the developer, less as an actual recommendation to anyone in particular. If you have not played To the Moon, then you should start with that one. If you have, then you probably already know if you want to play Finding Paradise.

To the Moon was about a very sad-happy story of two people for the most part. Finding Paradise, while starting with pretty much the same premise, takes a bit of a different direction. It's really not about the people who you interact with in the game, but more about what the game has to say in general about certain aspects of life. As a result, it may not make you cry over the story like To the Moon did, but it may actually have even more lasting implications for your own life. At least it does for me. When I think of the first game, I feel sad while I recap the story of fictional characters in my head. When I'll think of Finding Paradise, I'll probably think of the lessons it taught me about my own life.

I've been playing tons and tons of games for way over 20 years now, and it's really weird to say that one of the best and most important game series is made in RPG Maker of all things. But it's really hard to think about any more meaningful games in my life than Too the Moon and Finding Paradise.

Huge thanks to Kan Gao for his work, I can't wait for the next one in a couple of years. And also thanks to Laura Shigihara of course, for adding to another absolutely beautiful soundtrack.

算是个人笔记一类的东西吧，有剧透。


梗概：
colin想不改变身边的人这一条件下变得更幸福
人生有不少缺憾，未能尽善尽美
watts和rosalene迅速跳回到童年
寂寞孤单的童年？
和sofia的幸福生活/照片里的内容没出现在闪回里，但闪回里也不赖
faye帮助colin前进，突破，练习大提琴，去私人机场谋职，鉴定信念成为飞行员
她是colin幻想出的朋友，伙伴，最熟悉最亲密的人/watts说她消失表明colin不幸福？
colin与sofia相识恋爱后faye就消失了，colin身边有了现实的亲密的人，儿子出生的场景sofia说colin变了，变得真正在这里。
此前的记忆没有遗憾（？）此后有不少遗憾/求婚失误 约会喷墨 蜜月打翻饮料 没能见证儿子出生 买房体验糟糕 最后一次飞行表现不好 没抱孙子
colin一直在用绿皮书记录，过去记录幻想中的faye，之后记录同sofia的生活，家庭的美好回忆
colin因为遗憾找到西格蒙德公司“改变过去”，最终watts和rosalene找回了他心中的faye，colin对faye说正是这些遗憾组成了他的（美好的？）人生。/sofia在约会时说人生有许多选择，但只有我们做出的选择是最宝贵的（大意如此吧）；这也和colin最后的话一样与西格蒙德公司的广告、理念相反。

问题：
colin飞上蓝天去过小时候画上见到的地方，身边有亲爱的妻子儿子，但仍然有遗憾，以至于？要找西格蒙德公司，最终的解决游戏里只给了faye与colin最终的见面对话，其他数据未来的dlc展示？看起来colin接受了人生遗憾，faye是他生命、自我的重要组成，有了她就有了坚实完满的colin。但这是为什么呢？寻找天堂，天堂是什么呢？西格蒙德重塑人的记忆实现愿望，colin通过faye构建自己的记忆，与faye对话告诉自己该怎么做，如何前进，前半生几如rosalene对他家人的解释以一个贯穿始终的信念完成了梦想？成为了飞行员。之后faye走了，他开始遗憾，最终faye回来了，他接受了人生的遗憾。天堂肯定不是（？）西格蒙德描述的图景；那是faye么？她代表了什么？还是接受已发生的人生，做出的选择比未做出的更宝贵么？那colin对妻子儿子隐瞒的秘密，找上西格蒙德公司的原因又是什么呢？
对feye和天堂的真正含义，我还没有理解的很清楚。

去月球讲了矢志不渝终生不忘实现约定的故事，寻找天堂则质疑了修改记忆重活一次这种行为，colin不愿改变人生的重大轨迹，watts说colin不需要他和rosalene，faye就可以达成他的愿望。johnny的人生改变了，去了月球，但这也与他现实经历的人生，现实许下的约定紧紧相连。colin创造了faye，他自己就有能力构建自己的认识，我们也一样，或许这是寻找天堂想表达的吧。

最后我很好奇如果watts没有帮小女孩出气，他要怎么知道使用柠檬水写了密字？

四小时整通关
作为To the moon的续作，时隔五年才姗姗来迟，今年12月14日在商城上架，但是带来的效果也和预期的一样，不足以称谓惊艳，自然是因为第一部的过高水准使大家的预期相应的抬高了。

38532054.review: Simplemente esta obra no puede compararse con To The Moon, To The Moon comienza con una historia un poco enredada, con suspenso de cierta forma y puede desesperar un poco no saber el significado de cada memento hasta ESE punto donde cada uno toma forma, en este caso Finding Paradise muestra una historia con significado desde el principio, un protagonista  que, como muchos en esta vida, no esta seguro de sus decisiones, preguntas existenciales que se nos pasa a todos por la cabeza cada día, "Que hubiera pasado si..."  de cierta forma mas real que To The Moon, sin duda alguna, la respuesta finalmente es lo que todos deberiamos buscar en esta vida y eso también lo hace una gran obra, una representacion del pensamiento humano y como podemos acomplejarnos con cosas simples. La jugabilidad del titulo es muy similar al anterior con ciertas mejoras, la música es increible, sin duda uno de los aspectos mas memorables de esta experiencia al igual que en To The Moon.

38529059.review:
I have waited years for this game, so I actually had some fear going into this. High expectations mostly mean just falling on your nose.
But why oh why did I question Kan Gao? My fear was completely for no reason, because Finding Paradise is equally beautiful as To The Moon was years ago.
First things first: The gameplay is basically the same as in To The Moon. Totally unimportant.

Now to the important parts.

The graphics are for the most part the same as before. There are a few more parts with extra effects which felt kinda refreshing (and funny). I absolutely adore the graphics since forever, so this was a plus for me.

The soundtrack is as good as in TTM, maybe even better. I don't know how Kan+Laura do it, but you mostly don't even realise the bgm, you just kinda swim in it. It feels natural for it to be there. And ofcourse Laura went all out and gave us a song which I'm starting to like more then Everything's Alright (please don't hurt me ^^)

The story... we again jump through a dying man's life to learn about his wishes. And while it is not that emotional this time (still lost it :) ), the story feels more solid and relatable. I really liked all the main characters and understood them. Not understood them as in "I've heard of Aspergers, oh so they are", but really understood them. So while the story is not as tragic as in TTM, it hit me harder after my 2nd/3rd time watching it. And it got me really thinking the last few days, I guess I have to re-evaluate some parts of my life. In this regard I wanna Kan Gao for this game from my heart, because games (movies) that change the way you think are the most important ones.

This game is definately a must play for every To The Moon fan and for everyone else I would just say, you should play both games (+ the extras).
For me it could replace To The Moon as my most favorite game of all time. I spent hundreds! of hours on YouTube watching TTM stuff and I have no doubt it will be the same for FP. Until Kan Gao will hit me with his next masterpiece.


I [b]highly recommend[/b] to play (or at least watch on YT) the prequel to this one: "A Bird Story".
It tells one episode out of Colins earlier life, which gives some nice little background to him and makes you understand him more.


TLDR:
The game is a masterpiece again, could replace TTM as my favorite of all time.
Just play it!

38528192.review:
First off, I'm a college student with $35,000 student loan debt, with literally only $21 dollar in my bank account. I am currently jobless, because I am studying full time.  I was a huge fan of To the Moon, and when i heard the sequal finally came out, i was so excited i couldn't hardly wait. But given my financial situation, I had to resort to torrenting. 

I finished the game. It's 3am in the morning, and i bought this game on steam with half of my entire fortune just to write this review.  So you better know that im serious.

Kan Gao.  I don't know if you read steam reviews, but if you do ever come across my review, I just want to say Thank you. And i am ashamed of torrenting this masterpiece. 

I apologize for the poor english in this review.

I have not yet heard anyone saying this: This game is relatable. And I'm not talking in metaphor, I'm talking literally relatable. Once upon a time, I too once had similar experience.  Back in Korea when i was 8 years old, I was a lonely little kid who had no friends, and I resort to my imagination to escape from reality and loneliness. One day while i was walking home from school, i stumbled upon a dragonfly with broken wings..  I took this dragonfly home and made him into my friend. I would take him to my make-belief fantasy world and we would be going through adventures together. 

One day, this dragonfly died... He was my first and only friend.  Although he no longer existed physically, I turned him into my imaginary friend with the remaining memories i had of him.  I imagined him to be a half boy half dragonfly who was around my age. We would talk to each other causally. My entire elementary to middle school experience was only memories of me playing with my dragonfly friend alone in the corner.  He was there for me when i was being bullied. He was there for me when i was eating alone in an empty classroom. He was there for me when nobody picked me to be in their team when there was a soccor practice.  He was one true friend that comforted me in time of loneliness and depression. He taught me to be strong and be positive about life.

Highschool came. I started making real friends. I spent less and less time with my dragonfly friend.  I start to realize that everything i experienced and learned from my dragonfly friend was from myself.  But i didn't want to let go of him... I learned to be a strong person because of him.  It's because of him that I was able to embrace the reality and make real friends.  But as time goes by, i knew i eventually had to let him go... We promised each other that we will see again one day... Perhaps once i graduate from college and find a job, i will meet him again and tell him all about my life.

However, i soon learned the cruelty of adulthood.  Your imagination isn't as strong as when you were young. I realized that once i let go of him, there was no getting him back.  There are few times i wanted to talk to him again, but my imagination only created a dull empty version of my dragonfly friend.  It was definately not the same...  I wanted to tell him of my current situation; both hardships and happiness i experienced... But I can only confirm that he is gone forever and i can never get him back.  

Kan Gao, i don't know if this is the similar experience you had. I dont think i've ever heard of a story so personal that it pierced through my heart and gave me flashback of my dragonfly friend.  When i tell this story to my family or friends (i even wrote stories about this in my english class), nobody understood me.  I thought nobody in the world can understand the strong emotion i had over non-existing friend.  I went nuts and cried so much while playing this game. 

SPOILER: [spoiler] I was looking around everywhere but i haven't seen anyone mention about this: I thought Faye was obviously the bird from A Bird Story (which explains the wings she had that covered Colin when he was about to let go of her). That part had me crying like crazy because that was the part that gave me all the flash back about my dragonfly friend. [/spoiler] 

Thank you again Kan Gao. Thank you so much. I realized even though i lost my close friend, I am not alone in this world. You have given me inspiration to move on and not give up at the current situation i am in.  I don't know if my message will get to you... And i really hope it does. I am also very curious whether this is based on your personal story, as it is so scarily close to mine.

38527455.review:
Are you ready to cry? 

Well, you don't have a choice. In the best way, of course. 

Finding Paradise sees Kan Gao re-connect superior storytelling to a point-and-click genre and revitalising it in the same way that To The Moon did. Beautifully attached with poignant comedic moments, emotional peaks and heartbreaking valleys, Finding Paradise will fly a paper plane right through your heart and leave you wanting more, more, and more. Whether you're in love with the hauntingly poetic soundtrack, the words dancing on the screen or the genuine affection for the characters in the game, just like the clouds in the ocean blue sky, you never want it to go away. 

Finding Paradise is another wonderful addition to the genre, and one that sticks with you even after you finish it, and that is just scratching the surface for what makes the game undeniably one of the best of the year. A late addition, but no doubt simply worth every asking price.

38523019.review:
Finding Paradise picks up where To The Moon left off, with Dr. Rosaline and Dr. Watts returning as Sigmund Corp employees to once again, fulfill the wishes of a dying man.

As a huge fan of To The Moon when it came out a long six years ago, and a slightly smaller fan of A Bird Story, I picked up this game once I realised it was out. Kan Gao delivers another memorable and stirring tale, along with the familiar charming visuals and poignant music (Piano and Cello this time!). Laughs, dread, tears, wonder, surprise and even horror do not begin to scratch the tip of the emotional iceberg that is this story-driven experience. That said, while To The Moon was powerful and arguably melodramatic, Finding Paradise finds paradise in moments of thought and reflection, so those looking to relive the tear-jerking journey of the former will find themselves, only slightly, disappointed.

Nonetheless, I give this game [b] 8.5/10 [/b] tears.

38522507.review:
当我打开游戏，听到了熟悉风格的bgm，我已经做了好会看到一个感人故事的准备，就像它的前作《to the moon》那样[strike]虽说我基本已经忘了前作的剧情[/strike]。而且玩到后面我发现这一作和前作的风格并不相同。

--------------------------------------以下涉及剧透-------------------------

[spoiler]在玩前部分的剧情时，不断在Colin的老年及少年穿梭，发现了晚年的伴侣Sofia和少年时期的青梅竹马Faye，便产生了一个疑问：为什么对他如此重要的、在记忆中不断出现的Faye却不存在于他老年以及中年的任何记忆中？
直到玩到中后期，才发现Faye仅是存在于日记本中的"她"。而也就是她，才造就了Colin成为飞行员，也是她，让Colin放下“她”，去拥抱现实。她是Colin在孤独中不断成长，逐渐成熟的证明。
诚然，Colin的一生是幸福的，实现了飞行员的梦想，有一个理解他的妻子等等。虽说免不了有一些遗憾，但这些遗憾也正是他人生中的一部分，这也是临终前Colin的想法。
[/spoiler]
相较于《to the moon》讲述一个感人的故事相比，《Finding Paradise》显得相对平淡，而更多地是对孤独时期中陪伴Colin的Faye和一生中的遗憾的思考。虽然对Colin的妻子和儿子没有过多的细节描述，但对Colin个人复杂矛盾的心里进行了详细地介绍。
玩完后看评论才发现本作与《a bird story》有联系[strike]不过没有玩过ABS，只能对本作本身说一些感受_(:зゝ∠)_[/strike]
最后顺便一提，本作的音乐还是一如既往地很棒hhhh

38521775.review:
As the developer himself said, this game isn't as much of a tearjerker as "to the moon" but is more of a thought-provoking game and I whole-heartedly agree with this statement. If u r alrdy considering on buying this game (which i urge u to do!), I highly encourage u to go play "a bird story" beforehand if u hvnt. I only made the connection between the 2 games when I was about to reach the ending (since I played that game quite a while back) and it made it all the more bittersweet. The plot wasn't dramatic like "to the moon" was but it told its simplistic story in such a beautiful and relatable yet deep manner that it might take a while to understand what was going on in Colin's mind at first glance (which is what happened to me😂). I spent time thinking about the story even after the credits rolled and the more I thought, the more I felt impressed with the subtle storytelling elements the game had. I honestly think this game gets better after multiple playthroughs since u'd get to understand the characters a lot more in that way.

The only complaints I had with the game was that particular memories were too short so I cudnt really immerse myself in the situation enough since it changed scenes too fast (tho it might hv been done intentionally in relation to [spoiler] Colin focusing too much on his regrets [/spoiler] and tho the [spoiler] Faye vs Neil [/spoiler] scenes were hilarious, they were too overplayed and I wish it cudve been more dramatic. But honestly, they're pretty small personal nitpicks and shudn't affect ur opinion on the overall story and message of the game. I still think the game was amazing with how it pulled off its storytelling!

Overall, this game was certainly a worthy successor to “to the moon”. It was an emotional game that had a great message which I think a lot of ppl would be able to relate to and it definitely left a very huge impression on me. Oh, and the music was so heartwrenchingly beautiful, kan gao and laura r such masters with their art! I certainly can’ t wait for the 3rd game and thank u so much to freebird games for making this unforgettable masterpiece! 

P.S. I started bawling like a baby when Laura Shigihara started singingXD Sure brings back memories, lol

这次算是我真正意义上在steam上写的第一篇评测。我这个人比较懒，游戏买了几千块钱的游戏实际上90%就没有打通，我记得我打通的第一款游戏是红色警戒2，花了几年的时间吧，这其中大部分时间都在玩遭遇战；而第二款我打通的游戏是返校，在steam上买的，花了几个月的时间打通的；第三款游戏是古墓丽影崛起，这是我在steam上买的第一款游戏，但是花了一年多的时间才打通。这个游戏是我打通的第四款游戏，花了三天的时间......
我没玩过前作，但是前作的剧情我早被剧透的干干净净（这或许就是我没玩前作的原因吧，不过我在圣诞特惠把前作都卖了），至于我为什么去写这篇评测，有兴趣的可以接着往下看看。
接触了这一款游戏，我仿佛在这个游戏上看到了自己的影子。我是一个喜欢与人交际的人，但是同时我却没有一个真正的朋友，在小学的时候，我常常在校园里自娱自乐，而其他小朋友都有自己的伙伴与之玩耍，我并不是和主人公那样与群体不合群，但是说实话，我的朋友很多，却很难有一个能够与之交心的朋友，所有话只能对自己说，所有的眼泪只能咽到肚子里，自己陪着自己聊天，自己陪着自己玩。我天生对异性的接触抱有一定的抵触，但还好，在我的小学、初中、高中都有那么一个女孩子能够和我聊天，她们虽然说算是我的朋友，但也谈不上真正的朋友，我实际上一直这么孤独的活着。但是渐渐地我也喜欢上了这样孤独的生活，因为在这其中我能够找到自由，找到那些属于我并且只属于我的快乐。如今我踏入了大学的校门，我认识了班里的每一个同学，我也让班里的每一个同学认识了我，但我依旧保持着我孤独的特性，一个人上课，一个人吃饭；有的时候在吃饭时会想象假若对面做一个人会什么样子。我不知道未来会如何，但我很感谢现在，正如索菲亚所说：“无论什么时候，都有另外一条路知得一走。”，我并不会为了过去而懊悔，而会为了未来而去寻找属于我自己的天堂。
再说说游戏，这个游戏其实在最开始阶段我就怀疑naye是假的了，故事中Colin和我是那么相似，我仿佛能够读出他的心声，整个游戏我基本是满含泪水完成的，看见了主角的快乐与遗憾、幸福与悲伤，直到游戏的最后，naye更改了主角的记忆再次出现的时候，我真的没控制住我自己。主角经历了一系列的转变，当小飞机飞到了在病床上抱着孩子的索菲亚的手中，我就知道，这时的主角才算把自己的心真正交付给索菲亚。其实naye对于主角的记忆只做了一点的改动，她删除了有关公司的全部记忆，并且在最后完成主角重逢的愿望，只因这一点，Colin彻底的充实了人生，虽然还有遗憾，但是那已经成为过往云烟，变成了自己最珍贵的愿望。
最后，祝每个人都能找到自己的天堂。

38512111.review:
Kan Gao has once again crafted a narrative that transcends its own medium and gives its audience a thought-provoking and meaningful experience. 

Finding Paradise is heartbreaking, hilarious, but most importantly, beautifully written and once again contains an acoustic soundtrack that effortlessly accompanies significant scenes across the story. Gameplay is fairly minimal, if a step above the amount of interaction present in a visual novel. Nonetheless, the themes conveyed through the dialogue are timeless and there is not a single line in this game unworthy of its space. 

I didn’t cry while playing this game (surprisingly), but the interpretations I gathered along the way and the dilemmas the characters were going through definitely resonated with several aspects of my own life. Gao has stated that this was a rather personal project for him but I believe his talent in storytelling has made it personal for everyone. Thank you for sharing this journey with us, for demonstrating the human experience through these lovely characters, and what it means to live a fulfilling life.

Well done, Freebird Games.

Somehow, he does it again. If you've played To the Moon, you know the sort of sweet, emotionally true story that this would be. I have to say, the ending did make me cry, though it wasn't as emotionally destructive as To the Moon was (luckily). That being said, I have several quibbles I'm going to spoiler because they have to do with the ending.

[spoiler]
First, I'm really annoyed how little Potato was actually in the game and how little she had to do with the plot. Unlike TtM, where the kids were actually pretty important, as far as I can tell, she showed up exactly once.
Second, cool that you want to have a cliffhanger, but it's really annoying when you only release one game a year. What was the deal from the end? Was it for Neil to copy Faye to his machine and keep her "alive" to help in the future?
Was the whole thing successful?
What's up with Neil's pain thing?
What happened at the end of the last holiday minisode, where Eva is seen in a machine helmet at the very end?
Why was Neil using his custom machine anyway?
What was the lemon juice diary at the end? Did Colin write about Faye again?
[/spoiler]

I still really enjoyed the game, he just left too many loose ends.

38498722.review:
I'll admit: I pretty much never cry at sad movies, video games, whathaveyou. Even with To the Moon, I [i]felt[/i] sad, but didn't cry.

But this game broke me. 

The game is practically everything a good follow-up game should be, and then some. The one thing I liked so much about To the Moon was how small the story was - which sounds weird, but it seemed like the main focus, in that game, was kept to two people just doing their job. Finding Paradise also keeps the focus on the patient and his life, but also starts to address some additional outer plot points encountered in the minisodes and heck, even at the end. It gives you a wonderful story and still leaves you waiting eagerly for the next release. 

Also, the banter between everyone was just fantastic. The chemistry between Neil and Eva is impeccable, as are Neil's humourous intentions. And some scary imagery, too! [spoiler]Faye with the blacked out eyes, mouth and tentacles...[/spoiler]

It seems as though this game does give you enough information that you don't have to play To the Moon first before playing this game. I do, however, recommend doing so, along with the minisodes, if possible. With A Bird Story, yes, this main character is the patient (don't think I'm giving anything away there), though unlike To the Moon and this, doesn't really have a lot of gameplay and no dialogue at all. I actually really did like A Bird Story, but after playing Finding Paradise, I do appreciate it more. It's not absolutely necessary to play A Bird Story to understand what's going on in Finding Paradise, but it might help to set things up in terms of the plot. [i]Or maybe just leave you with more questions...[/i] 

One thing I would mention that I didn't like is that I was experiencing a pretty low framerate for a good portion of the game. There's quite a few more instances of control-heavy moments in Finding Paradise that were very hard to control due to this. Switching to the beta "alternative" seems to aid in a smoother, more fluid performance, though. 

Man it was hard to put this game down. I almost stayed up the entire night to finish this. Highly recommended.

38497013.review:
推荐先游玩前作几部，最少也一定要先玩A Bird Story（是男主的童年）。此作暗含了很多前作的伏笔，将整个工作室出品的游戏练成了一个连续剧情。

Freebird 工作室一如既往的讲了一个好故事，像素风的画面也不失美感，音乐满分，简单音阶也让人迷醉。
加了一些梗和小游戏机制很有意思，惹人时时发笑；同时维持了前作的游戏性的简洁性，很放松的全身心投入剧情。
但，在顾重剧情时，游戏性着实有些无聊，虽为剧情而来，但每当通关下一个记忆时就开始放空大脑走神随便按。
属于一定会二刷系列。

[spoiler] 玩前几作时泪眼婆娑，听到音乐就红了眼眶。这一次我却想哭却无法哭出来，只是深深的叹息了一次又一次。
可能因为我也曾有过Faye，也可能因为我至今也没能离开Faye。

幻想与现实的边界，抛弃了绿色小兵的将军成长为现实中的成年人，Finding Paradise剧情简单平淡的如同自己经历过的那样。它抓住了我们的小心思，在层层深扒Colin的记忆时，也一点点抓挠着勾起了我们的回忆。你会回忆起什么？Colin记忆中最清楚的是与Faye相处的一点一滴，而那些生命中很重要的结婚生子等片段，却只是一两个记忆关联就打发了。惹人唏嘘，明明Faye只是一个虚构的人物呐。怪只怪幻想太迷人，将现实中错过的选择，无法完成的遗憾，统统眨眼之间在脑海里以最完美的姿态实现。
Sofia是Colin的反面，Colin向往一切可能，Sofia坚定一切决定。她不去想假如，牢牢的抓住了现在。虽然可能学习钢琴不是初愿，可是她也坚定的走了下去，她不理解Colin的选择，可她接受。

其实这两个人都只是各自带着自己的经历去看这个世界，热爱生活，所以他们才如此珍惜现在拥有的一切。

ps：Faye在离开Colin 的那一段，细致而又微妙的难过，其实是Colin多坚强而又勇敢的决定了离开Faye。那时，他是找到了天堂的道路。 [/spoiler]

胡言乱语些东西，可能因为牵扯到自己便笨嘴拙舌的无法表达，更是无法客观的去看待。
Colin带姑娘参观校园时说过一句“如果你努力的话，甚至在里面可以创作一个世界“我虽仍在兜兜转转寻找天堂，看不破，不愿醒，却也稍有慰藉。
2017.12.22日凌晨一刷

38486373.review:
彩蛋和梗:《寻找天堂》埋下了大量彩蛋，比如，我们现在知道了，Colin是 A bird story里那个孤独没有朋友选择和小鸟做朋友的孤僻小男孩，并且和To the Moon的男主John是同学；梗就更多了，NeilWatts的几次变身，曼哈顿博士《守望者》、赛亚人《七龙珠》、圣斗士《圣斗士星矢》等等。当你静静地等待字幕飘过制作人的名字，还会出现一个彩蛋:Neil Watts用Faye的意志制作了一个后门系统，他邀请公司的Winter和Lin进入一探究竟。

音乐:本作的音乐延续了《去月球》里经典的配乐，由于三个主人公Colin弹大提琴、Faye弹吉他、Sofia弹钢琴，增加了三种乐器的互动，Colin和两位女主共同弹奏的曲子还有ED——Wish my life away  都非常耐听。

游戏性和画面:游戏性基本无，画面也就比《仙剑一》好一点。不过这个工作室向来不以画面和游戏性取胜，激动人心的剧情和感人至深的主题才是它的致胜法宝。

剧情:剧情上无可挑剔，相当于《暖暖内含光》+《盗梦空间》的部分含量，可以说是相当优秀了。它比《暖暖内含光》更优秀的一点是，两个活宝NeilWatts和Eva Rosalene的各种趣味无穷的斗嘴，妙语频出，这就让它成为了可以让人在笑中哭的优秀作品。

总体评分:9/10

38481439.review:
To the moon的续作，晚上入手以后就准备一口气打完。说实话一开始玩这个游戏的时候想写一个很长很长的测评...为此我专门准备了几张空白纸来记录游戏的细节...然而玩到最后一刻，虽然纸上已经是密密麻麻，但是我却放弃了一开始的打算。
“告诉我，你幸福吗？”
“……我们都有过遗憾；一个本可纠正的错误，或是一个久远的梦想。又或许……是一个曾令你魂牵梦萦的人？”
“如果能从头再来，你会成为何人？你会去向何方？”
游戏中的这几段话给我留下了很深刻的印象。我相信包括我自己在内很多人也幻想过自己如果有能从头再来的机会，会不会比现在更成功，比现在的自己更加幸福？这个话题稍后再讲。
作家江南曾说过：“每个人心里都有一个死小孩。”小时候的Colin瘦弱、贫穷、自卑，因而变得孤单，没有实际意义上的朋友，也没有什么长处。Faye对于他来说就是一直渴求的理想，她有钱（可以在私立学校上课），她有才（很小的年纪就能弹好吉他），她乐观开朗、积极进取（鼓励Colin完成了许多他原本无法完成的事情），渐渐地他长大了，他赚到属于自己的钱（虽然不多），有了可以交谈的朋友（Barry），有了自己的职业和特长（飞行员），找到了属于自己的挚爱（Sofia）。他不再是那个独单弱小的孩子，等到他真正实现了他的理想时，Faye便离开了。如同一场梦，梦醒了，一切都还在继续。
一直到游戏的尾声到来之前，Colin都无法接受现实。他一直在“逃避”，他觉得他的人生中充满了遗憾（没有当成爷爷，最后航行的糟糕着陆，儿子asher诞生时自己没有及时赶到，度蜜月的时候把酒洒了，求婚的时候Barry写错了字，参观水族馆的时候被墨汁喷脸出了糗...这只是游戏中展示的一部分）。他一直都认为自己不够幸福，但是再幸福的人生也有缺憾的，有这时间叹息遗憾不如多点时间陪伴家人。
“我认为我们所有的记忆，以及其中的一切……都不过时我们编给自己听的故事罢了”
——这句话，送给现在还在幻想自己不同的现状的人吧，把握当下，才能给自己给家人们一个幸福的未来。
（另:Faye是仙女的意思吧？故事中的Faye真是Colin的守护灵呢）

38480556.review:
As usual just like Kan Gao's other works, this game has a really great pacing (with icebreakers and extra gameplay mechanics ), tremendous soundtrack.

This one is a little bit different on it's pacing. EP.1 gradually reveals the story backwards before hitting you with the truckload of feels. This time, the story is told in a ping pong manner making you think reaaaaaaaaallly hard on what really happened [spoiler]and why the 2 different characters are split[/spoiler] on [spoiler]each side of[/spoiler] the timeline.

And then, once you're on the critical turning point, the game reveals something that kinda disappointed me. I just thought: I can't relate to this?. [spoiler]I'm not crazy enough to have an imaginary friend when I'm depressed[/spoiler]. Midway though the game, I decided that this kind of struggle in the story won't make me cry. I just thought, this is going to be worse than the previous isn't it?

BUT NOPE, as usual. You get hit by feels truck once the game starts to "filters out" the memories and the amazing soundtrack starts playing. Once I suddenly realized the whole picture, tears just started to fall down like fffffffffuuuuuuuuuccccccccckkkkkkk.

Got trolled hard on having this sense of security that I'm not going to cry on this one

38479950.review:
Режиссёрская версия с картиночками: http://www.fatcatslim.ru/2017/12/v-poiskah-mechtyi-recenziya-na-igru-finding-paradise.html

Скажу честно, писать про Finding Paradise - занятие, мягко говоря, непростое, даже тяжёлое. По сути перед нами всё та же To the Moon, но шесть лет спустя; раскрывать какие-либо подробности истории (кроме завязки, которая висит на страничке в Steam) равносильно преступлению; да ещё и надо не поддаться тем эмоциям, которые огромной волной накрывают после прохождения и выдать что-то хотя бы с намёком на некоторую «объективность» и анализ. Ну что же, значит, попытаюсь объяснить, почему Finding Paradise - это обязательная к ознакомлению игра для каждого, кого не оставила равнодушным To the Moon.

Прямиком со старта одновременно возникают восторг и недоумение. Игра отлично обыгрывает начало оригинала и беспощадно забрасывает вас многочисленными отсылками, в ушах звучат переработанные композиции из предыдущих проектов студии, а различия в повествовании поначалу кажутся минимальными. Пятнашки из первого творения Freebird Games сменились играми «три-в-ряд», а локации лучше прорисованы и более детализированные, при том что графика осталась такой же простенькой. Возникает закономерный вопрос: неужели разработчики столько лет потратили исключительно на создание сюжета?

Однако, когда начинаешь её разбирать по кирпичикам, вдруг понимаешь, что ради такого приключения можно было и ещё пару лишних лет подождать.

Finding Paradise кажется чутка изменённой To the Moon лишь на первый, поверхностный взгляд. Колин, новый клиент корпорации Sigmund - вовсе не мечтающий полететь на Луну ребёнок в шкуре взрослого человека, и в его истории нет миллиардов маяков, которые светят героям. Он прожил счастливую жизнь и сам не знает, чего хочет. Вся история - это попытка понять, что же было не так в его жизни и почему он решил обратиться к помощи наших героев. Здесь уже гораздо более интересные завязка и интрига, чем в первой игре. Вступительная часть заметно длиннее, путешествий по воспоминаниям героя гораздо больше, но в один прекрасный момент игра резко раскрывает все карты. И раскрывает так, что челюсть падает на пол и лежит там даже некоторое время после титров.

Вообще, новая история от Freebird напоминает повзрослевшего ребёнка. Она не такая грустная, как To the Moon, но при этом более близкая и понятная игроку. В ней больше юмора - такого же доброго и милого, как в оригинале, но он не портит и не искажает общее настроение. Игра не требует знания сюжетов предыдущих, но при этом она напичкана ворохом мелких деталей, которые грамотно увязывают истории в одну целостную картину. Повествование стало сложнее - сюжетные повороты более неожиданные, интрига держится вплоть до финала, а привычное развитие ситуации из «На Луну» резко рушится во второй половине игры.

Даже в геймплейном плане игра сделала небольшой, но уверенный шаг вперёд. Да, мы по-прежнему собираем вещи из воспоминаний героя, важные для понимания его личности и характера, а затем проходим небольшую мини-игру, чтобы активировать предметы. Сама мини-игра, как уже было сказано выше, изменилась, и теперь это приятная казуалка «три-в-ряд». Но главная прелесть в том, что саму ходьбу в поисках активных точек разбавили небольшими аркадными вставками. Простенькими и весёлыми.

И до чего же приятно видеть, что господа из Freebird решили не просто повторить успех своей дебютной игры, а сделали абсолютно иное по настроению приключение, которое окончательно рушит все опасения. Опасения в том, что мы повзрослели, получили переизбыток душевных историй и во второй раз нас уже не зацепит... Зацепит, и ещё как!

38476978.review:
I've played two games in 2017 that really blew me away. One was NieR: Automata.

Finding Paradise is the other one.

Finding Paradise does not have the visuals, the high-budget music team, or the frenetic combat. What FP and NA share is a compelling story ... one that will leave you guessing, and then leave you crying.

You know the phrase: "All. The. Feels." This game will give that phrase new meaning and new life.

Buy this game. If you haven't played To The Moon and A Bird's Story first, you'll get more out of this game with those, But this game can definitely be enjoyed stand-alone. You just won't know as much about playable characters Neil / Eva without the first game, and you won't have Colin's childhood backstory without Bird Story.

38476048.review:
***重度剧透警告，未通关不建议点击***
----------------------------------------
[spoiler] 
Faye曾问道：“你觉不觉得从某些方面来说，我是真实存在过的？”而Neil的回答是：“这个嘛，这只是个人看法。我认为我们所有的记忆，以及其中的一切，都不过是我们编给自己听的故事罢了。”没错，和照片一样，本质上记忆是主观的，是虚伪的。但这又何妨，我们为什么要执着于客观和真实呢？

Colin的记忆是否过度修饰、甚至Faye是否真的存在，这些都不重要。重要的是，在Colin一人独守空房的那段岁月里，有那么一个人，与那个孤独的小朋友隔岸相望，成为了他的第一个朋友;有那么一个人，用吉他奏出天籁之音，使那个曾经讨厌大提琴的男孩有了演奏下去的动力;有那么一个人，引领那个认生的小伙子去追逐自己的梦想，最终真的成为一名飞行员......毫不夸张地说，是Faye造就了Colin。那么主观也好，幻想也罢，又有什么关系呢？

现今的人们都很务实，有一套评价一个人是否“成功”、是否“幸福”的体系:成绩好坏、学历高低、是否有稳定的工作、收入多少、完婚与否、是否有孩子、孩子的成绩好坏...以这套标准，除了没能在生前抱孙子是个小缺憾，Colin的人生无疑是教科书般幸福的。但事实上呢？人们不会知道他曾经厌恶大提琴;不会知道他求婚时出现拼写错误的尴尬;不会知道最后一飞糟糕的降落;甚至连他的至亲也不会知道，能使他满足地离去的不过是再见上老朋友一面。有的人在旁人看来幸福美满，却在临终前需要Neil与Eva的介入;有的人在旁人看来是个无可救药的笨蛋，却自以为是世界上最幸福的女孩子。那么，那些旁人自以为客观真实的标准去衡量一个人又有何意义呢？

我曾无数次听到“都是假的，骗小孩的。真不知道有什么好看/玩的。”没错，屏幕那头的东西是虚拟的，但是透过屏幕传达到这头的东西却是真实的;正如Faye是假想的，但Colin从她那儿得到拥抱生活的勇气确实是无比真实的。某种意义上，我们做的事情其实与Colin无异，不过是从这不尽如人意的真实世界中逃离，在虚伪的避风塘中稍作喘息。只是，从虚拟世界中得到的收获能否像Faye激励Colin那样，激励我们在现实世界中勇敢地前行呢？老实说，未来会发生什么，谁也无法预知。但《Finding Paradise》这部作品，大概很有可能会成为那样的存在吧。
 [/spoiler]

38472995.review:
(OBS: A quantidade de horas jogadas não reflete a realidade)

Crítica curta (sem spoilers):
Se você jogou To The Moon, vale muito a pena comprar esta sequência. A história continua rica, muitas mecânicas de jogo foram aprimoradas e a música foi composta com muito cuidado e dedicação. A duração do jogo varia de 5 a 6 horas.

Crítica longa (talvez com spoilers):
Antes de mais nada, é importante questionar: o que faz de To The Moon um jogo tão bom? Com certeza a sua narrativa. Mas QUAL narrativa?
Bom, tanto em TtM como em Finding Paradise nos deparamos com dois arcos narrativos diferentes - o arco do paciente, que possui uma vida inteira a ser explorada pelo jogador, e o arco de Neil e Eva. Toda a emoção, as melodias e o chororô que o primeiro jogo é capaz de provocar vem única e exclusivamente do envolvimento emocional que desenvolvemos com a história de River e Johnny. Neste sentido, os protagonistas funcionam como uma espécie de escada para que alcancemos tudo o que o jogo tem a nos oferecer.
Em Finding Paradise isto começa a se inverter. O paciente (que já deu as caras em A Bird Story) é o motivo de continuarmos jogando SIM, mas o plot dos nossos queridos doutores também  nos leva adiante no game.
Sendo assim, não espere se emocionar tanto quanto em To The Moon: em Finding Paradise o criador Kan Gao procurou muito mais avançar e aprofundar tanto na história em curso na saga, na complexidade dos personagens como nas questões filosóficas e éticas que permeiam o jogo do que nos desejos, emoções e história do paciente em questão.

38470003.review:
As a follow up to To The Moon, Finding Paradise does a great job of setting itself apart from the first episode while still maintaining the style of story telling that made the first episode so popular. 

Great story that's a rollercaoster of emotions that sends a message that hits really close to the heart with the player. The game does a great job of building suspense between each jump in memory and does it in a way that keeps you wanting to figure out whats going to happen next. 

The graphics are very simplistic but this is done with the intention to keep the focus on the story. Even though they are simple, they are very clean and do a good job of painting a picture for the story (Although there are a few scenes that did catch me by surprise of how well they were done).

Gameplay does a good job of keeping the player engaged but with this being centered aroud the story, don't expect too much(although it does take a step up from the last episode in a few parts). 

The music in this game really fits the mood of each scene and is well written. It's completely new music from the first episode but listening through it, I feel as if it incorporates elements from the music of To The Moon(not too much though). This gives it an overall reminiscent feel of the first episode while still remaining original to this story(if that makes sense). 

Overall, I've been a fan of Kan Gao since To The Moon, and Finding Paradise did a great job of living up to my expectations. His ability write great stories and develop them into a game and then to compose great music tailored around each specific scene is incredible. There's only two games that have actually made me cry and those are To The Moon and this game. Kan Gao will continue to be on my list of favorites and I will continue to support him throughout the entire series. Great job and hopefully we don't have to wait 6 years for the next one.

38468996.review:
TL;DR While it has it's flaws (one glaringly large one) still a beautiful and quietly heartbreaking game. wether you've played To The Moon or not.

I've played all the games up to this point when they were released, always loved the series, and as expected got far too hyped for this game. 
And yet it still exceeded expectations. 

A fantastic way to keep what could have been a copy/paste narrative from To The Moon incredibly unique (no spoilers!) and hits different emotional points in just the same way. Been a long time since I cried at anything but as the final scene ended and the credits rolled I couldn't hold back a few. 

The biggest issue (as it was with To The Moon) is the comic relief that is Niel and (to a lesser extent) Eva. When the characters are being serious they're the perfect protagonists for such a story, but then you get touching scenes bookended by them being funny, and on more than one occasion it brought me out of the moment.

Apart from them, the game perfectly achieves everything I hoped it would and more. Highly reccomended to anyone even if this is their first entry into the series. I look forward to episode three. (coming in 2023 I imagine!)

38468969.review:
Enh, the music was kinda nice. Amateur-ish, though. One character was just playing scales on the cello.

.. What? No. I'm not crying, [i]you[/i] are crying.

[h1]For people who:[/h1] 

[b] - Haven't played To The Moon and are wondering whether to buy this:[/b]

Do yourself a huge favour and play To The Moon. You can figure out the rest yourself after.

[b] - Have played To The Moon and are wondering whether to buy this:[/b]

Haha, that's a joke. Such people don't exist. Who wouldn't want to see more of Eva and Watts? No one, that's who.

[b] - Want their fictional selves humoured anyway:[/b]

This game isn't like To The Moon, not quite. However, I felt like Finding Paradise is the perfect sequel. Without spoiling too much, I can say that the game takes a very different direction from TTM, and explores a very different human psyche. As much as our dreams are varied, and our experiences different, so is this game different from the last one. The outcome is absolutely beautiful. While TTM is a dream, Finding Paradise is reality. And yet, it deals with things that are more.. imaginary. It is the perfect complement to TTM, hence the perfect sequel. Kudos, Kan! TTM was an incredibly tough act to follow, but you came through with flying colours.

The gameplay is much the same (with a couple of surprises), and the humour and charm of the original is sprinkled throughout. The plot twists might be a little more predictable (maybe because we are more prepared for the unexpected this time), but it doesn't take away from the narrative strength. And if you're experiencing stuttering/FPS drops, take a look at the Discussions page, which tells you how to switch to a version that should fix it.

Tl;dr: It's a beautiful story, well worth 5 hours of your time. Do play through it!

38468422.review:
Начать эту рецензию столь же сложно, как и сделать сиквел [b]To the Moon[/b], который будет как минимум не хуже. Нет, серьезно, вы помните ту эмоциональную соковыжималку? Даже такой сухарь, как я, почувствовал непреодолимое желание разрыдаться на последних минутах игры, что уж говорить про более эмоциональных товарищей. Искренняя и душевная история, оставляющая след в душе любого – как не впасть в творческий кризис, достигнув такой высоты?

А Кан Гао мало того, что не впал, так еще и умудрился сделать со своими коллегами сиквел, который достойно смотрится на фоне To the Moon. [b]Finding Paradise[/b] – совершенно другая игра по ритму и форме, она не пытается выкрутить эмоции на максимум (не считая концовки), но затрагивает более глубокие темы. Что такое счастье, что делает человека счастливым, могут ли ожидания влиять на восприятие, как избежать одиночества, в чем заключается настоящее одиночество, да я могу весь день перечислять вопросы, которые появляются в голове во время прохождения.

За 6 часов наши старые знакомые Нил и Ева успевают изучить ключевые моменты жизни Колина, и, ох, вы не ожидаете этого сюжетного поворота. Собственно, всю игру можно разделить на две части – до него и после него. Первый акт – мы узнаем Колина, видим его одинокое детство, его трудную юность и заслуженную старость. Второй и третий акт – забываем всё, что узнали до этого, потому что Колин оказался совершенно нестандартным пациентом. Впрочем, его необычность не мешает ассоциировать себя с ним, потому что, будучи стариком, он задается вопросами, которые рано или поздно настигнут всех нас.

[i]Счастливую ли я прожил жизнь? Что можно было изменить? Успел ли я сделать всё то, что мог бы?[/i]

Главное, о чем хотел сказать Кан Гао – об ожиданиях и о том, что, как говорили классики, “это наши проблемы”. Жизнь не будет идеальной, она может получиться как вполне дeрьмовой, так и довольно интересной, но нельзя мешать себе наслаждаться приятными моментами, потому что других уже не будет. Мир фантазий и грёз, каким бы привлекательным он ни был, никогда не сравнится с тем, что будет происходить в реальности.

Но! Счастье нельзя измерить и счастье не может быть универсальным. То, чего на самом деле хотел Колин, не сделает счастливым 99,99% читающих этот обзор. Каждого из нас делают по-настоящему счастливыми совершенно разные вещи, и не стоит думать, что успешная карьера, любимая жена и здоровый сын – все, что нужно для построения этого внутреннего ощущения. Некоторым, как Колину, нужно что-то еще, что-то, о чем он так и не смог никому рассказать.

Вообще, это очень странная ситуация: человек хочет то, что ему вредит и от чего он в свое время отказался. И это мешает ему быть счастливым. Кроме того, весь перфекционизм в ожиданиях тоже, по сути, идет с того самого момента, то есть это корень всех проблем и одновременно всех радостей. Как с этим бороться, нужно ли с этим бороться – игра хоть и даёт свои ответы, но лишь для фантастического мира с устройством-манипулятором воспоминаний. Нам, игрокам, придется разбираться, как жить дальше, уже собственными силами.

Не мне судить, насколько это личная история, но это либо подчеркивает мастерство рассказчика, либо делает игру еще более искренней. Через явление, которое происходит в жизни очень небольшого количества людей, Finding Paradise неспешно рассказывает историю с мощнейшим подтекстом, заставляя переоценить некоторые вещи в своей жизни, потому что сомнения по поводу выбранного пути знакомы каждому. Самое главное – не давать этим сомнениям мешать наслаждаться тем, что окружает нас здесь и сейчас.

P.S. В какой-то момент игры вам может показаться, что вы разгадали сюжетный поворот, что это банальщина и т.д. и т.п. Хо-хо-хо, детки, все не так просто, как вы думаете. Дойдите до третьего акта, прежде чем разочаровываться в истории.

38462215.review:
Was für ein wundervolles Spiel. Ich habe es eben in einem Rutsch durchgespielt und bin davon immer noch sprachlos und überwältigt.
Nachdem ich mit "To The Moon" den ersten Teil der "Reihe" gespielt (und geliebt) und auch die Shortstory "A Bird Story" einfach bezaubernd fand, war für mich der Kauf von "Finding Paradise" sofort bei Erscheinung keine Frage. Und ich wurde definitiv nicht enttäuscht.

Die Grafik ist wie bei den anderen Teilen eine nette, bunte Pixelgrafik mit liebevollen Details, die eine wundervolle Atmosphäre zaubern.
Der Soundtrack ist wieder ganz große Klasse! Die Lieder sind einfach wunderschön komponiert und fügen sich mit ihren sanften, aber niemals nervigen Melodien super in das Spielgeschehen ein ohne auch nur einmal zu nerven!
Und die Story... Ich will gar nicht zu viel verraten, aber sie ist wieder vollgepackt mit lustigen Sprüchen der Protagonisten, netten Hints auf andere Spiele, vielen Punkten zum Nachdenken und Grübeln, sowie reichlich Tränenpotential (was ich gegen Ende des Spiels auch voll ausgekostet habe :) ).
Das "Gameplay" ist gleichzusetzen mit dem der Vorgänger. Es ist eigentlich eher ein interaktiver Pixelfilm als ein Spiel. Zwar steuert man die Charaktere durch die Welt und muss ab und zu ein kleines Rästel lösen, aber der Hauptaugenmerk liegt darauf, der wunderschön erzählten Geschichte zu lauschen.

Ich habe das Spiel in 8 Stunden durchgespielt (und habe etwas länger gebraucht, weil ich versucht habe, es simultan aus dem Englischen ins Deutsche für einen Stream zu übersetzen) und würde es jederzeit wieder tun :)

Kleine Anmerkung von mir: Es lohnt sich definitiv "A Bird Story" vorher gespielt zu haben, da das Spiel öfters auf die Kurzgeschichte referenziert! Es ist aber kein Muss, da man der Geschichte auch so problemlos folgen kann.

Ich kann für dieses Spiel einfach nur eine klare Empfehlung aussprechen!

21号的凌晨，结束之后，匆匆买下OST，在旋律的环绕中写下这些。

------------------没有直接涉及剧情，但是还是有一些主要感受，还是防一下剧透分割线------------------------------------

因为尚不年长，也不知道那分别是会在什么时候，是否会发生在自己身上。从我已经不能确定的某时候开始，她来到我的身边。随着时间在我们身上留下痕迹，我愈发看得清她的模样，就像伸出手去，指尖端感受到的，就是她的掌心的温度。

其实从未想过她会在我的人生中有过缺席的时候，而在这个游戏后却会想了呢，然后对未来也稍稍多了些恐惧感【苦笑】

想一想，如果临终前也能由她来陪我的话，真的是非常非常安心。从游戏故事开头的疑惑，到中间对Colin的同情与理解，到最后，反倒有些羡慕Colin了。就算是过了好像平平凡凡的一生，Colin最终却收获了常人难以拥有的满足和幸福吧。

相较之下，在to the moon获得了更加浓烈的感动，而在Finding Paradise中被赠予的，是内心更为深处的拨动。
谢谢高老师。

夜已经深了，虽然不知将来如何，但此刻，她是那么明确地存在着。
夜已经深了，晚安，Colin。
晚安。

38458119.review:
四个多小时通了finding paradise，感受只有“失望”两个字，但令我失望的不是剧情，而是作者。
且不提那些没玩过a bird story的人能否真正理解剧情的这种把一个游戏拆成两份卖的嫌疑，单从本作的内容来看，作者画蛇添足了。
不知道是不是太在意to the moon中有人给的诸如可玩性太差的差评内容，作者在这作中加了不少可玩性，从记忆碎片的谜题难度增加到后来的飞行射击和格斗，可以看出作者是在非常尽心的拓展rm引擎的功能以增强游戏的可玩性的。
但这一系列游戏并不是靠可玩性出彩的啊！战斗直接把我从这游戏的剧情体验中完全剥离了出去。
只会看故事的人读了一篇没有故事的散文说，这什么破文章啊一点看头都没有，散文作者就要合着他们的意思硬套上一个故事了？
给维纳斯套上衣服。
高瞰并不懂游戏设计，他只是会讲故事而已。
这是我最大的失望。
我给差评并不是因为这游戏真的不好，它完全有一个值得好评的质量。但是基于上述原因，我觉得好评率不应该比to the moon高，仅此而已。

This review of finding paradise is my first review on steam, i don’t really review games at all but i feel that this game just deserves it. This game in my opinion is overall amazing, it is definitely a worth successor of to the moon. The storyline and dialogue is extremely well crafted in my opinion, to the point where i got really teary eyed. The soundtrack is another thing Kan Gao needs to be praised for. It follows a similar style of to the moon with reusing some of the soundtrack from certain areas in others, if you played or watched to the moon, you will understand certain references to the game. It can be said that Kan Gao is just reusing the soundtrack from the other game cause he is lazy or because he wants to reference to his older game. Everybody has a different perspective, but this game honestly is worth the money i personally spent on it. If you are looking for a story game with great soundtrack, DO NOT hesitate to buy this. 

i’m gonna stop wasting your people’s time, thanks for reading my review. Go and play the game :) 

10/10

38457684.review:
很赞的小品rpg

游戏性to the moon强了很多，小游戏内容丰富，手残如我竟然也失败了几次

能看出制作组在进行各种各样的游戏风格尝试，也在努力增加游戏的趣味性

并且，ttm中，寻找记忆球的流程过于兀长，显得情节有些许拖沓，这一作缩减了寻找记忆球的过程，但内容架构并没有受到影响，情节的反转，突发事件等等使得剧引人入胜。

特效及其酷炫，点阵图人物的表情，动作细致入微，制作组真的用心

总的来说，对于这一作，制作组做到了极致的细节打磨，对于游戏情节的把控更加精准，游戏性也得到了提高，再加上一个本身故事让人感同身受，所以整体游戏体验很棒，在良好的交互体验中内心受到触动，致敬。

如果非要说缺点，就是，人物行走真的好慢啊，而且过场小游戏真的过于简单了，_(:з」∠)_

期待dlc和续作


通关了，时间也晚了，和爸爸妈妈，最爱的人，最亲的朋友，还有城市温柔的灯火，说声晚安吧

good night, faye
