相比to the moon来说，fp由于其故事主旨的原因，让人感动的话需要一点门槛，可以（也是强烈建议）先行游玩abs再来玩fp，体验会更加完整，也更容易产生共鸣。

总的来讲，游戏整体都延续了kan gao一如既往的细腻处理，可以说完美的继承了to the moon的优点[spoiler]（也完美的继承了缺点）[/spoiler]，口语化的台词依旧是非常顺口且有趣，neil和eva之间的吐槽拌嘴让玩家在旅程中的无聊度大大降低，即使把它当成一本有声小说来看也没有关系。[spoiler]（所以这游戏的载体，也就是游戏本身，根本不重要...）[/spoiler]

音乐这个角度其实不大好讲，毕竟喜好是很个人的，就我自己而言的话整体没有to the moon的那么抓耳，但也有几首非常好听的。

画面就不用说了，2107，不，没几天就2108年了！虽然我们作为玩家不应该只看一个游戏的外在，而是内在（非常耳熟），但我觉得即使是点阵风格的，即便是用rm之类的软件做的游戏，也是有发展的空间的...（不过不知道是不是我的错觉吧，好像人物的动作细节相比to the moon多了，赞一个）

剧透注意！：[spoiler]说真的，别的评论已经有无数的剧透，我再写剧透感想就没意思了，再说你都已经到了商店的界面了，为什么不先买了体验体验呢？祝你在游戏中找到属于自己的天堂！[/spoiler]


kan gao算不上是天才的游戏制作人，但在游戏制作人这个头衔之前，他其实是一位真诚的，心思细腻的讲述者。他用自己独特且带些幽默的讲述形式为我们娓娓道来了一个又一个夹带着遗憾却仍旧让人欣慰和感动的故事。

而我们也很乐意去倾听。


[u]评分：8.5/10（to the moon我大概给9.5）[/u]

38456075.review:
Мы ждали эту игру шесть лет, и Кен Гао всё-таки сумел "сдержать планку" - Finding Paradise получился почти так же хорош, как и To The Moon. 

Сложно оценивать такие игры хоть с каким-то оттенком объективности, поэтому поделюсь своими впечатлениями: игра оказалась немного хуже To The Moon, потому что на этот раз  [spoiler] мне не захотелось пореветь в кульминационной сцене игры, поскольку показаны взаимоотношения героя со своим воображаемым другом, а не реальной девочкой. Эта история лишена трагизма жизни Ривер, которая вситретила Джона в глубоком детстве и ждала его на ярмарке год за годом, а тот не пришёл, потому что страдал амнезией из-за бета-блокаторов, в итоге, сам того не зная, женился на Ривер, не помня тот эпизод из его детства, что глубоко травмировало Ривер на всю её жизнь. Переживать за несуществующих даже в рамках игровой вселенной персонажей у меня не получается [/spoiler] . К тому же некоторые неожиданные сюжетные повороты игры были предугаданы мной заранее. 

Итог:  игра не прыгнула выше To The Moon, но, тем не менее, всё ещё хороша. Если Вам понравилась первая игра серии И вы владеете английским хотя бы на среднем уровне (русской локализации пока что не существует), берите Finding Paradise не задумываясь, тем более продаётся игра совсем задёшево.

高瞰这个作者 , 依然用rpgmaker这个软件描绘了如此深刻的故事 , 在像素画风上 , 将人物情感完完全全赋予了每个角色 , 剧情的发展会让你的思想完全沉浸到故事中 , 你会敏感地体会到每个角色的内心世界 , 而不是代入到具体一个 , 非常恰到好处配合氛围的动听bgm , 简直让你担心每个细节剧情的发展 . 在游戏的前一部分 , 和to the moon一样有着朴实的情感着色和悬疑铺垫 , 到了中后期 , 故事迎向了高潮 ! 众多的疑点和紧促的剧情就像是命运石之门的动漫看到了第7集的那种感觉 ,  突然紧凑的剧情发展让人大呼过瘾 , 这是to the moon没有的特点 .寻找天堂比起前几作 , 少了一些浪漫色彩 , 更多的是现实感 , 更成人向 , 内容思想更深层.

建议玩过to the moon , to the moon DLC , a bird story再来玩本作
想起来to the moon就是初恋安利给我玩的 , 让我知道原来游戏世界还有这么多精彩的内容 , 我仍记得那些时光 
寻找天堂我刚放愿望单   一朋友就送我的了, 感谢这位老哥给我的圣诞礼物

自从 To The Moon 是自己的最爱,续作一出便激动不已地买下了.今天玩完续作,大概因为自己的期待太高,又因为自己虽不热爱社交,但仅仅是因为自己享受独处,并没体验过那极端的孤独感,也因为玩到一半,猜出了好几处情节而没有了想一探究竟的急迫感.所以这部作品总体给我的感悟并不十分深刻.

38453253.review:
(This review has also an english translation at the end for those who are interested but don't speak italian)

Dopo To The Moon (che considero uno dei giochi più belli a cui abbia mai giocato), e la sua emozionante storia d’amore in questo capitolo verrà affrontata una storia molto più matura, che metterà a dura prova i nostri dottori preferiti, Eva e Neil, che avranno a che fare con un paziente molto singolare, Colin, il quale ha un desider- oh, sto correndo troppo? 

Scusate. Per chi non conosce le basi di questo gioco, c’è un’associazione chiamata Sigmund Corp. che ha inventato una macchina capace di alterare i ricordi di una persona che sta per morire, in modo tale da realizzare il suo può grande desiderio ed eliminare i possibili rimorsi della vita vissuta. 

Dunque, dove eravamo? Ah si, Colin. Il desiderio di Colin è “semplicemente” di essere felice. Colin ha avuto una bella vita, è sposato ed ha un figlio. Tutto sembra essere normale. Allora, come mai ha contattato la Sigmund? Che cosa nasconde in realtà? Tocca a noi scoprirlo. Il giocatore dovrà navigare nei ricordi di Colin per scoprire che cosa non va, e cercare di realizzare il suo desiderio, viaggiando nella vita del paziente finché egli è ancora in vita.

Questo capolavoro realizzato da Ken Gao, provocherà al giocatore tante risate ma anche tanti momenti di riflessione, di gioia, di tristezza e anche di tante lacrime in alcuni (me compresa, lo ammetto).

In questo seguito, si tratteranno argomenti come la solitudine, il bisogno di un amico ed il desiderio di comunicare, che non sempre è una cosa facile nella vita di alcune persone. Sarà molto facile immedesimarsi nel paziente, perché tutti noi abbiamo dei rimorsi, e tutti noi ci siamo sentiti soli almeno una volta nella vita. E questo renderà il gioco ancora più interessante ed emozionante per tutti noi. 

I due dottori saranno elettrizzanti e molto divertenti come sempre, ma ancora una volta la cosa che mi ha colpito di più in questo gioco (oltre alla storia fantastica ovviamente) è la musica, ma chi ha già giocato il capitolo precedente sa bene cosa intendo. Senza di essa, si perderebbe metà della magia del gioco.

Se volete acquistare questo gioco, consiglio vivamente di giocare a To the Moon e A Bird Story prima, per avere una visione completa di questo gioco, e dei prossimi che ci saranno.

Cos’altro dire.

Giocateci, amici. Lo consiglio veramente, se volete vivere una storia molto intensa che vi farà emozionare.

Voto 9.5/10

---------------

And now, for my english speaking friends, a translation for you:

After To The Moon (which I consider one of the most beautiful games I've ever played), and its exciting love story, in this chapter a much more mature story will be tackled, which will put a strain on our favorite doctors, Eva and Neil, who will have to deal with a very singular patient, Colin, who has a wish- oh, am I running too fast?

Sorry. For those unfamiliar with the basics of this game, there is an association called Sigmund Corp. which invented a machine capable of altering the memories of a dying person, so as to realize his great desire and eliminate every possible remorse of the lived life.

So where were we? Ah yes, Colin. Colin's desire is "simply" to be happy. Colin has had a good life, is married and has a son. Everything seems to be normal. So, why did he contact Sigmund? What does he hide in reality? It's up to us to find out. The player will have to navigate Colin's memories to find out what's wrong, and try to fulfill his desire by traveling through the patient's life while he is still alive.

This masterpiece made by Ken Gao, will cause the player many laughter but also many moments of reflection, joy, sadness and also many tears in some (including myself, I admit).

In this follow-up, topics such as loneliness, the need for a friend and the desire to communicate, which is not always an easy thing in the lives of some people, will be discussed. It will be very easy to identify with the patient, because we all have remorses, and we all felt lonely at least once in our life. And this will make the game even more interesting and exciting for all of us.

The two doctors will be electrifying and very funny as always, but again the thing that struck me most in this game (in addition to the fantastic story of course) is the music, but who has already played the previous chapter knows what I mean. Without it, you would lose half the magic of the game.

If you want to buy this game, I highly recommend to play To the Moon and A Bird Story first, to have a complete view of this game, and the next ones that will be there.

What else to say.

Play this game, friends. I really recommend it if you want to live a very intense story that will excite you.

Rated 9.5 / 10

一句话简评的话，大概是：“谢谢你在我孤身一人的时候一直陪在我身边。再见。”

多说点的话，大概这游戏的玩家挺多都是《去月球》的粉，等了好多年才等到的这部吧。所以没啥好黑的。。。首先Dr. Watts果然是继续承包了游戏内的笑点，不过总感觉是印度人的Dr. Rosalene在这部里的冷静理智的性格没有继续深造。游戏的剧情虽然说不上是想不到，但是果然这种脱离现实的故事好赞。说点有剧透的[spoiler]“我一直想创造属于我的tulpa，但是一直没能成功。如果有天我有了她，却又重新开始融入现实。我想我和Colin会一样吧。大剧透（我猜）的话，作品中暗示Faye就是男主小时候救的鸟，关联哪部作品你们都懂了。。暗示的地方挺多的包括翅膀啊小时候的记忆啊啥的。”[/spoiler]因为能理解那种心情，所以我这个30岁的中年人才会泪目不止吧。感谢作者又让我经历了一场充实而有遗憾的情感之旅。另外啊，笑点担当的伏笔。。。下一部能出现吗？或者说，下次作品会是多少年后啊。。。心碎。。。
作为一个把《去月球》通了3遍还打算继续的人来讲。。。这部作品我也打算多玩几次。。但是啊，我觉得这部的音乐没那么洗脑。。而且某些感情算不上是爱情，所以可能有些人群感动不到。（比如我，想用亲情线感动我的话基本不可能。。）那么满怀想被爱情感动的人请考虑是否要入。

最后，我还想说点什么。。。唔，就是有没人一起讨论讨论剧情什么的。。这世间最苦楚的就是无法分享了吧。╮(╯▽╰)╭没能分享这种感动的人，果然我需要一位Faye。

거두절미하고, 전작의 To the moon에 비교해 큰 복선이나 이야기의 복잡성 등이 있는것은 아닌 작품이었습니다.
하지만 여전히 같은 '죽기 직전의 환자들에게 마지막으로 원했던 것을 돌려주는' 소재의 이야기를
훌륭하고 잔잔하게 이끌어 나갔다는 점에서 아주 큰 가치가 있다고 생각하였습니다.

초반부는 조금 루즈한 편이고, 이 작품의 극적 장면에서는 감동이 매우 크게 다가왔던것은 아니지만,
그건 어디까지나 이전작과 비교했을때 얘기고, 충분히 값어치를 하는 얘기였고 훌륭한 작품이었습니다.

여전히 아름다운 사운드트랙은 말할것도 없구요.

또한 이전작과 동일하게 엔딩크레딧 직전의 연출과 잔잔히 남는 여운은 항상 제작자분을 존경하게 만들었습니다.

언어의 압박때문에 아직 못하신분들은 한글패치가 나오면 꼭 해보시기를 권장드립니다. 
같은 값어치로 한권의 책보다 더욱 아름답고 와닿는 연출과 음악으로 넓은 세계를 마주할수있는 기회라고 생각합니다.

항상 게임의 시리즈에서는 1이 너무 빼어나면 2에대해 자동으로 실망에 대한 불안감을 깔고 들어가기 마련인데, 이 작품은 저의 그런 의혹을 기분좋게 무시하네요.

3편도 즐겁게 기다려집니다.

38449999.review:
这一作，也许是我太期待，也许是前作太美，我总觉得这一作让我有点失望。诚然，一直写出让人听到BGM就能哭出来的剧本是很难的，但这一作，对于我而言，故事的感动程度比起To the moon可以说是差远了。

像我玩过的朋友说的，这一作“太现实”了。合理的剧情，合理的离开，比起to the moon那种像童话一样的展开，总觉得太过理所当然……和无聊了。为了现实必须走出自己的幻想？我个人也很讨厌和人交往，如果觉得很孤独，我会找其他东西排遣比如玩玩游戏看看动画，而当我觉得我应该走出自己的世界时，我也会这么做，不需要一个陪我排遣的东西，比如游戏和动画，来告诉我这些。我追求的是一个感动我的故事，而不是一个或许玩游戏的人多多少少都经历过的，沉浸在自己的世界里然后放弃走出去走向现实的故事。我不会被自己所做的事情感动，所以这一作基本没有让我有所感伤。随着成长放弃一些事情是……理所当然的。事实上我很同情colin的处境，但是正因为这种处境太过现实，所以从现实的角度考虑也有其他各种各样的解决方法。不过说实话，从小到大我也没试过一个朋友都没有，所以可能真的没法体会到那种只有自己一个人的感受吧。很高兴我能和她们做了这么久的朋友，真的很谢谢你们，还能一起分享游戏和动画的快乐。虽然你们应该看不到就是了。=x=

后面稍微有点感伤的还是faye出现在阳台，和回顾一生的时候吧。但其实我觉得男主的人生已经相当圆满成功了，比起现在的我而言……哎。

对了，这一作虽然说感人和美丽的程度大大不如to the moon，但watts的吐槽又升级了，我真的是……啊啊啊谁在意你穿什么袜子啊走开啦！以及能把非无敌化后的faye都打败的我感觉自己棒棒哒，扔鞋子也棒棒哒（x）。亏我还真能发现出扔鞋子的作用。。真的是惊呆我了……不要过高地期待一个美丽而感动的故事，喜欢男女主角互相吐槽的话，还是会很满足的。

38449809.review:
刚刚打完带着无法平静的心情，写给还没入手特别是没接触过freeebird的玩家。
如果你看到像素风就开始打退堂鼓，你可能真的要错过一个世界了。
首先，这是一独立游戏，而且，人家靠剧情打动你，就算是模糊得脸都看不清，就算连配音都没得，音乐一出来，你们都特么给我哭。
既然是一款靠剧情的游戏，在游戏性上就稍一稍，当然你要是跟我说游戏里那几段neta传统游戏的战斗场景很有游戏性，我也不否认，至少我是当小说看的。游戏整体的节奏偏慢，但是他就是能吸引你能接着玩下去，推动剧情的找东西和移方块相当于白送，毕竟制作商也考虑到不能让游戏难度影响游戏剧情的节奏的对玩家情绪的调动，所以直接采取了最简单粗暴的方——没有难度。
不得不说这让游戏整体的节奏把握相当好，看剧情看累了就动动手，手差不多也暖和了就给你来个剧情的反转让你继续，并且配合几乎满分的音乐全程让你感动与好奇并在，在享受极致服务的时候还能被字幕游戏中的梗逗笑，在故事接近尾声阶段，让你彻底陷入欲罢不能极度渴望故事后续的状态，成功治好了我的急性子让我耐着心子看完了职员表。
该作是该公司另外一部作品《to the moon》的续作，同样与《a bird story》有很大关系，所以如果之前先了解这两部作品对游(观)玩(看)本(小)作(说)有一定的帮助。
当然这两部作品的质量也是不用说的，很多人(包括我)就是被《to the moon》拉进坑的，记得当初我一挺能绷的大老爷们看完大桥上那个场景之后，静静的喝了一口水，去洗了把脸，然后躺在床上花了半天才缓过来。
哦，对了，我不是托，你看看这下面满满的好评，我会骗你么？

38446212.review:
Amazing. This experience left me with tears, a sense of accomplishment, and, most notably, a newfound appreciation for... well... life in general. There are a lot of things we wish we could change and a lot of things that make us wonder "what if?". In Finding Paradise, Kan Gao and the Freebird Games team manages to address this aspect of our lives in a heartfelt and touching masterpiece that I'd reccomend to just about anyone. As a sequal to "To The Moon", I'd say that Finding Paradise sets its own name and purpose, but also gives us the nostalgic To The Moon experience and a truly wonderful story that I don't think I'll ever be able to forget. Not even with the help of Sigmund Corp. themselves, heh.

All in all, I believe this, as well as Kan's other works, is a well loved story with heart and soul poured in from every angle. Pick this up, and To The Moon, if you can. You won't regret it.

Also I love Potato. She is adorable.

38444406.review:
If you played To the Moon, you more or less know what to expect. Great pixel art, fantastic music (though it kind of bothers me that the diagetic music doesn't actually match what the characters describe it as; just because it's all in one octave doesn't make it a scale), feels, laughs, token gameplay, lots of hints to a larger mystery, [spoiler] a big plot twist near the end of the second act [/spoiler] - it's all here.

As for what's different: it has more of a sci-fi edge to it than To the Moon did - in To the Moon, the memory traversal thing was mostly just a plot device, but this one really uses the premise to explore some deeper philosophical ideas about memory, consciousness, and happiness, as well as some of the ramifications of its technology. It isn't quite as much of a tear-jerker for me as To the Moon was, but your mileage will probably vary; plus, "slightly less sad than To the Moon" is still pretty darn sad.

POTENTIAL MASSIVE SPOILERS AHEAD: [spoiler] I did like this one's twist better than To the Moon's. It really emphasizes the theme of coping with loneliness that both this and To the Moon are largely about, while To the Moon's twist was mostly just going for shock value. It's also a lot more cleverly hinted at than To the Moon's twist, pulling some Sixth Sense level writing tricks to dangle it right in front of you without giving it away. Plus, where To the Moon used its twist to explain all the previously obscure plot details and character motivations, this uses its twist as a turning point, taking the plot in a very unexpected but very welcome direction. [/spoiler]

Long story short: really good game. About on par with To the Moon. Definitely play it.

So for anyone worrying that it would either be a carbon copy of, or unable to recapture the spark that so energized To the Moon... don't worry.  Its beautiful.

38440203.review:
I loved To The Moon. I loved the story, loved Eva and Watts, loved the charm and quirks of the game, loved everything about it. If you love To The Moon, you will absolutely adore Finding Paradise.

Finding Paradise, in my opinion, has everything that makes To The Moon great but goes even further with it. It had a previous game linked to it called A Bird Story, that introduces us to our new protagonist Colin, but it's not necessary to play that game (although it's great for how short it is). We have a much more elaborate story with the new patient, we have a more in depth subplot with what has been going on with Watts, the humor is even better, the characters are fantastic. This game will make you laugh, cry, think, etc. I highly recommend this game and I can't wait for what Freebird Games comes up with next.

38439840.review:
so idk if this is gonna be in-depth or what but there's gonna be major storyline spoilers (all games)

to summarise - i really recommend this game to anyone who likes a game that's very storyline and soundtrack oriented, has likable main characters, and occasional random humor.

the game and the main series has a very unique plot and it is twisted in the best possible way.

a lot of the time it's like you're left on the edge of a cliff just waiting for what's going to happen next. this series is very unpredictable and you don't know when it's going to throw off your logic. another reason to love the dev.

it's also a very good idea to play to the moon and a bird story before playing this game. many things would make more sense and wouldn't be questioned if you go in the sequence order. 


**SPOILERS FROM HERE**

-




i played to the moon and i played a bird story, and ive been a fan of kan gao's work since maybe 2012/13? 

everything about these games are very well done and unique. the plot, the storyline, the soundtrack and most of all, neil watts. 

NEIL WATTS???

i do very much love dr watts but i also think that hes a closed book. i get a very norman jayden from heavy rain vibe from him. (the pills, and how he feels like he needs them) at the end of to the moon, everyone was wondering what was up with neil. its been somewhat confirmed that he uses pills to cope with some sort of tremor or ache that he has. it's also strange with his development of the machine. why would he do it? and why is he so secretive? we don't know. this is why neil is a very big focus point in the game, without being the center. 

in regards to the story of this game, i think that it exceeds a bird story pretty easily (although it is a very good game), considering it's basically a direct sequel to it depending how you look at it (and the actually length) . when it compared with to the moon, in my opinion, was a lot more psychologically understandable. 

thinking about colin and his potential schizophrenia (?) was a little harder to comprehend than river's asperger's syndrome.

when coursing back and forward through colins memories, it was easy to make assumptions about faye and sofia, whether one of them were out of place; and how faye suddenly just leaves once sofia joins the picture. which could also lead to a bunch of theories about why she felt like her time was done, and why she didnt return. (maybe due to colin no longer feeling alone- after talking about sofia to faye)

there's also the fact that on the balcony, faye asked when colin was going to finish 'the story' and 2 parts of the story can be found during the game (only the obvious places if there are any that i walked by) since the pages were blank in his book, i still do wonder if he finished the story but in lemon juice- which is also hinted towards the end, when they heat the pages with sofia.

moving away from the theories and such, i really did enjoy this game in all of it's hours, for the amount of time i've waited, i really think this worth every month. i also wish that it wasn't on sale. i want to be able to buy this game for it's intended price, because that's literally what it deserves. 

the soundtrack was amazing as usual- the remakes of some of the songs in cello made me so happy, it felt nostalgic. im also extremely hyped that laura shigihara did another song for this series.  whenever there's a lyrical piece in the game, it's always so emotional, and fitting to the moment. in this case, the song connected to colins situation perfectly. i wasn't able to understand how something 4 minutes long could summarise something i'd been searching for in a game for 5+ hours. colin's 'regrets' 

again, i love this game so much. and i'm so freaking happy that this came out. all of my support goes out to freebird and their work. good job my dudes

这是一首写给孤独者的诗。
和前两部相比，这一部更像是高瞰的内心独白。没有to the moon那么曲折，这部看上去似乎有那么一点点平淡，但是慢慢品的话就会发现，这一步讨论的比去月球深得多。
遗憾是什么，是那些我们一直想要实现又实现不了的愿望吗，也许我没有办法代替所有人回答，而且这个问题也可能没有一个确切的答案。只是，如果我们的人生是一个没有遗憾的人生，那这样的人生是不是也在某种意义上变成了一种遗憾呢。
这作的音乐还是和前两作一样没得说，OST一出肯定会买的，音乐和画面的结合极大地增加了玩家的带入感（反正我是直接入了戏23333）。不过游戏前期的秦国话然我稍微有点跳戏2333不过部影响游戏本身的素质，只是会让懂梗的玩家会心一笑，不懂梗的玩家感觉有点莫名其妙吧2333
总之，现在还能像这样安安静静地讲一个故事的厂家不多了，好的剧情真的不需要太高的画质啊。
Freebird的这份答卷岁谁不能让全部玩家满意，但是已经足够诚意了。
不过感觉这作结尾挖了一个巨大的坑啊，不知道会怎么继续呢。
期待下一作~~~~~~

38435188.review:
If you at least liked To The Moon or are like me and are one of the few who appreciated the unorthodox nature of story telling behind A Bird Story then you will definitely enjoy this. Review done, go check it out!

If you want something more in depth, here's a slightly longer review for you: The good old doctors Eva and Neil return and their banter is just as enjoyable as it was in TtM. There are playful little nods and references to previous games in the series that if you happen to be playing this one first, you might be lost on 1 or 2 of the comments but it's nothing severe. The soundtrack is, of course, very pleasant. There were several moments in the story where I didn't want to progress solely because of how good the music was for that particular segment. And without delving too deeply into spoiler territory, the story does a pretty good job at presenting its morals and themes without feeling too heavy handed. 

If you enjoy story driven games and really like good music, I really recommend FP (as well as its predecessors). Easily one of my top 10 games this year.

38433713.review:
O que te motiva a jogar um jogo?

Pra alguns, é a ação e a aventura. Outros só querem ter alguma coisa pra atirar. Hoje em dia os jogos tentam agradar todos os públicos.Justamente por isso, eles não conseguem deixar pra traz uma marca. Algo que a pessoa que está jogando consiga parar no tempo e lembrar do que aconteceu enquanto jogava. Isso não acontece só nos jogos, mas em todo tipo de arte.

Finding Paradise, assim como seu antecessor, To the Moon, te oferece o tipo de experiência que você vai ter poucas vezes na sua vida.

Você, mais uma vez, encarna o papel da Drª Eva Rosalene e do Dr Neil Watts. Seu objetivo é realizar um ultimo desejo de Colin Reeds, um senhor de idade à beira da morte. 

Novamente, é uma experiência como nenhuma outra. 

É incrivel que, com tão pouco recurso, Kan Gao e a equipe da Freebird Games consigam fazer um jogo desses. Como eles conseguem transmitir tanto sentimento, tanta emoção, só usando a música e algumas palavras é algo que simplesmente não dá pra entender. 

Finding Paradise não é um jogo comum, que você simplemente joga e sai ileso. Esse é um daqueles jogos que tira um pedaço de você e deixa em você um pedaço dele. Muitas vezes nós passamos pela vida com tanta pressa que não conseguimos admirar as coisas boas que nós deixamos para trás. 

Se vale a pena? Cada centavo. Se eu recomendo? Tudo o que puder recomendar.

Finding Paradise certamente não é infinito. Mas ficará pra sempre na memória daqueles que se derem uma chance e pararem com calma, para admirar tudo ele tem a oferecer.

38432628.review:
[h1]Finding Paradise[/h1]
Recommended for those are into story- rich games, nice soundtrack and old- school pixel art.

[b]TL;DR version[/b]

[table]
    [tr]
        [th]Items (Alphabetically)[/th]
        [th]Score (1-3/3)[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Control and Gameplay[/td]
        [td]2/3[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Fun Factor[/td]
        [td]3/3[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Graphic[/td]
        [td]3/3[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Replayability Value[/td]
        [td]1/3[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Sound[/td]
        [td]3/3[/td]
    [/tr]
     [tr]
        [td]Story[/td]
        [td]3/3[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Value for Full Price[/td]
        [td]3/3[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]    

[b]LONG VERSION[/b]

1. Control and Gameplay : using some basic movement (walk using arrow or ASDW, menu is X and choices made using C). So far I haven't found the "Option" for the game key rebinding. There is several game mode included, making it a little more interactive than the usual story- based rpg games. The only downside is that the characters move pretty slow (there is no run button?)

2. Fun Factor : for me, personally it has to be the graphic and the interface system. The tiniest details is drawn very carefully and every single action for the characters is noticeable. The story is great (especially if you expect heartwarming stories). Also one thing that worth mentioned is the music. While rarely I spot bad music for games, this one is nice (there will be free dlc for the OST).

3. Graphic : This might be of personal sentiment but, I find these kind of pixel art is amusing. It feels so nostalgic compared to the sleek look of 3D's. Also the tiny details make me smitten at times. The interface is so simple and easy to learn.

4. Replayability Value : unless you want to enjoy the music and the good scenes from this game, then no. Too bad the story has no branch and no real Steam achievement (you only get one for finishing the game). This kind of story offers no replayability value for me because, very deep and memorable ones already carved in my minds, so...

5. Sound : the music is good and nostalgic, it puts the story and feeling in tunes. Can't say more, but without the music, the story might have less impact for me.

6. Story : people who are hired to help some old man fullfill his last wish through his own memories. There is some sci-fi ish theme in the story, makes it quite unique.

7. Value for Full Price : to support the great developers out there, why not? I got this one as a Christmas gift from my friend and I really am grateful to know this one game. There is complexity in both the game design and gameplay, so it will worth for a full price.

8. Others : I want to try the prequels now.

Tested with:
Acer Aspire E1 -471G
1366 x 768/ Windows 7/ 64-Bit
Intel Core i3 2348M (2.3 GHz)
NVIDIA GeForce 710 M (1GB VRAM)
4GB DDR3 RAM

Thank you for reading!

38431809.review:
Bardzo długo czekałem na ten tytuł i mogę z czystym sumieniem powiedzieć: nie zawiodłem się.

Mogę też powiedzieć "to nie jest To The Moon", ale tego też się spodziewałem. Nie znaczy to jednak, że się zawiodłem. Zdawałem sobie sprawę, że poprzedniczka postawiła poprzeczkę fabularną tak wysoko, iż ciężko będzie przeskoczyć ją jakiejkolwiek grze.

Z grami tego typu problem jest taki, że nie mogę praktycznie nic powiedzieć, żeby nie spoilować Tak jest i tym razem. Więc powiem tylko:

Historia jest niezwykle wzruszająca, lecz spodziewałem się przebiegu wydarzeń. Byłem dogłębnie poruszony, ale nie uroniłem łzy. Zapamiętam, ale jako bardzo dobrą grę a nie rewelacyjną.

Na oddzielną linijkę zasługuje jeszcze muzyka - jak zwykle rewelacyjna. Poza, już klasycznymi, klawiszami dochodzi teraz jeszcze wiolonczela. Kompozycja niezwykła, trafiająca prosto do serca, ale dalej: to nie To The Moon i "Dla River". Niemniej: polecam bardzo, bo to dalej świetna gra i wiem, że w kolejną część też zagram i tak samo się nie zawiodę, jeżeli będzie trzymała tak wysoki poziom jak Finding Paradise.

38431192.review:
FREEBIRD 这个公司目前做了三款游戏  To the moon, Bird story 和最近刚发布的 Finding Paradise。 作为一个小玩家，想给大家说点游玩后的感受。
首先我从To the moon 开始玩起，嗯...起初游玩的时候，游戏的画面真的很让我感受到了年幼时玩GBA的感觉。然后记得在遇到松鼠时竟然还出现了战斗画面，瞬间让我出戏以为我在玩口袋妖怪，可这只是作者开的一个小小的玩笑。
呃...仔细想了想剧透貌似不大好，所以我还是说下我对于这整个系列游戏的一个脑洞的想法吧。
目前作品的主人公除了病人就是Watts和Eva了，首先他俩的名字真的就会很随便的让我想到机器人瓦力。嗯，然后那是一个很美好的爱情故事。
回归主题，在To the moon的结束之时，在Watts准备回归之时，画面周围突然变红了，然后Watts停下了，并且四处看了看，由于游戏的设定，画面周围变红意味着病人即将走向终点，但是这时他并不在病人的回忆之中，所以这很耐人寻味，只有两种可能，一是Watts进入了Eva的记忆中在帮她完成遗憾，To the moon这整个剧情是Eva在健康之时处理的一个案件，但是结果可能并不完美，所以Eva会在回忆中将这段重演。还一种可能是Eva在帮Watts完成这个遗憾。而且Eva在整个流程中有好几次欲言又止，所以，这也并不是不无可能。
在玩过Finding paradise之后，我现在有一个很强烈的想法，众所周知，西格蒙德公司的产品目前只会给那些即将死亡的人使用，对于健全的人是没有服务的。我现在的假设是Eva的确由于某些事故的确濒临死亡，Watts作为一个喜欢Eva并且和Eva共事许久的人，为了完成Eva的遗愿，应该是将自己的记忆与Eva的记忆连接在了一起，但是又由于Watts是一个健全的人，意识会更加坚强，如果进入两人共同的记忆可能会处于领导地位，不得已，只有服药来降低自己对于整个记忆的控制。这样才能让Eva领导整个记忆的走向。是药肯定会有副作用的，如果我之前的猜测成立，Watts也会在Eva走之后也步入结局。
当然了，这只是我的一个脑洞，游玩这类游戏我最喜欢的就是无限的猜测，然后再无限的推翻，因为的确很喜欢To the moon 和Finding Padarise。所以厚颜无耻写了下来，大伙看看就好。
呃，最后想说下，这个学校乃至这个小镇真的不是非正常人类研究中心吗？

38429552.review:
Fiding Paradise:
游戏时长：4.8小时
《To The Moon》的续作，《A Bird Story》应该算作它的前传。
本作仍然讲述了西格蒙德公司的两位博士的一次工作经历。他们的工作就是藉由改变委托人的记忆，来完成将死之人的愿望，让他们记忆中的一生如自己期望的那样。而这次的工作甚至不像TTM那样，至少有个明确的目标：“请帮我度过充实的一生，但尽量不要对它做出什么修改。”看得出来，Colin(委托人)对自己的爱人和孩子都很是满意，他已经度过了幸福的一生。但，为什么觉得这一生不够充实呢？或许，那本书页全是粘回来的，一片空白的日记，会是委托人留下的线索？从ABS中，我们得知，Colin的父母为了维持生计，要经常出差，不能经常陪小Colin。而小Colin又没有什么朋友，形单影只，只有一只玩偶和那本日记在身边，显得十分孤独。虽然Eva（女博士）打赌说，“不是什么事都和女孩子有关”，但这次看来可能是她错了。小Colin遇到了一个叫Faye的女孩。从此，他们一起上学，一起练习乐器，一起分享生活中的点点滴滴。但似乎，小Colin有且只有这么一个朋友。她鼓励他，支持他，帮他当上了飞行员，也帮他找到了余生的伴侣，Sofia。但Faye，却突然消失不见。。。
当然，故事还未结束。
或许，这，才是故事的开始。
游戏性方面。。。似乎并没有比TTM好到哪里去。。。但是还是比TTM好一些吧。。在此不做过多评价（毕竟核心在于故事）。。画面。。。没什么大的改观。。倒不是说像素风不好（比如Undertale应该说是有自己的艺术风格了吧），而是真的没什么变化（我不知道这算不算艺术风格。。艺术4分还是不做评论了。。）。。音乐方面还是为本作增色不少。本作的音乐不像TTM那样，有十分明显的主旋律（也可能是艺术4分听不出来。。），而且玩过前两作的话，会对一些旋律感到有些熟悉。作者为本作专门创作的音乐仍然是十分的切题（毕竟是量身定做）。仍然由Laura Shigihara进行演唱的《Wish My Life Away》也仍然好评（可能跟我个人比较喜欢钢琴+女声有关系吧。。）。
[spoiler]或许很多孤独的人，都会有个第二人格吧（请原谅我还是剧透了。。）。因为没有朋友，就只能和另一个自己聊天。在和另一个自己的相互扶持中，熬过那些孤独、冰冷而又黑暗的时光。直到有一天，温暖的光照射进TA的生活，而那陪伴TA许久的老友却离TA而去。少了这样一个朋友，生活中的一些琐事，一些缺憾，一些不幸，便没有人可以诉说。毕竟，对于孤独过的人，有些话，还是只能说给自己听吧。如果人不能接受自己，那也很难过得充实吧。
孤独的人，即便看起来不再孤独，也很难摆脱另一个自己吧。
那么，为什么不接受TA呢？
也许，随着生活的不断继续，那本日记的内容会不断地更新。
但是，它仍然是写给那个朋友的吧。
TA可是一直都在注视着你啊。[/spoiler]
[quote=Finding Paradise]“我认为我们所有的记忆，以及其中的一切……都不过是我们编给自己听的故事罢了。”[/quote]

38427999.review:
*如同《去月球》一样，《寻找天堂》是一个独立完整的游戏，无需玩过任何本系列的游戏即可充分体验。
两作的联系的确只有二位博士和它们的作者，把它们放在一起在比较我看来或许有失公允。但毫无疑问的，二者都具有着极其杰出和精彩的故事性，正是有像这种游戏的存在，才真正向我们展示了什么才是第九艺术，不是通过华丽梦幻的场景，不是借由精妙写实的引擎，而是通过那些简单的，冰冷的像素点和文字，将我们真切的拉进其中，通过游戏内虚拟人物的视角，引发我们对现实的喟叹。
又可能正如Dr.Watts所言，“或许那里还暖一点。”
[spoiler]Kan（han） Gao（hua）同（zu）学是真的喜欢搞事情。 而且他一定喜欢玩星际争霸。 别问为什么，我猜的。[/spoiler]

38427824.review: This game is probably the game that I waited for the most in the past few years. I was touched by To The Moon, intrigued by the minisodes and hyped by A Bird Story, so I was expecting a lot from this game. And I can assure you, it lived up to my expectations. Kan Gao did an amazing job with this game, following perfectly the story of the previous games. And that soundtrack! Although this game did not hit me as much as To The Moon, it surely will stay, i my mind, as one of the best games I've ever played. Plot-twists gallore, theories popping up in our mind as we traverse Collin's memories, and a really surprising end that opens up to a third installment that, I hope, will soon come to us, this game is a masterpiece. I DEFINITELY recommend it to each and every one of you.

和ABS相同的是，这次的故事着眼于讲述一个孤独孩子的内心世界，所以没经历过孤独、没有过孤独感的人自然是得不到共鸣的，也就不会对本作有太高的评价。ABS可以看做是FB的前传了。

[strike]然而我并没有获得和Colin 一样幸福美满的一生啊……（苦笑.jpg[/strike]
------------
幸福就是接受你所拥有的一切。

但没有那个梦境，你就不可能成为现在的你。
她让你开心，让你对未来抱有憧憬，让你为之奋斗。
你不能没有她，但也不能沉溺在她的世界里。[/spoiler]

Fantastic sequel. The first game, To the Moon, completley amazed and surprised me with its story. Even now I think back to it and the emotions I felt the first time playing it. I am glad to say that Finding Paradise does that again.

In terms of gameplay, it feels a lot quicker compared to the first one. It seems that the story was the main priority, making it so that the small gameplay portions are quick and easy to progress through. 

In the end, everything about this game was great and fatastic. If you are a fan of To the Moon, then absolutly purchase this game!! Even if you have not played To the Moon, you will not be dissapointed by this game's story.

38423990.review:
Пройдя полностью игру можно точно сказать одно, Кан Гао смог сделать достойное продолжение, которое конечно было длительным, стоящим ожидания.

"В поисках рая" - продолжает историю двух сотрудников, Мисс Розамунд и Мистера Уоттса, Корпорации Зигмунд, которые помогают осуществить последнее желание людей, находящихся на краю своей временной линии.

Примечательна история тем, что в очередной раз нам показывают человека, который в жизни и выглядит тихим и спокойным на вид человеком, в головек же у него происходит непонятные ситуации, которые приносят интересное развитие в сюжете игры.

Так как это вторая часть, то с самого начала фильма ты начинаешь искать подвох и найти разгадку. В начале игра ничем не удивляет - вы бродите от одной памяти к другой пусть в странном порядке - но чем дальше в лес, тем гуще и богаче становится сюжет, а в конце таки выбивает из тебя слезу.

По сравнению с первой частью, где все таки центральной мыслью была любовь между двумя людьми, то в это части все немного подругому. Наверное цепляет она меньше, но интерес к этому остается прежним.

Больше всего для себя в новой части я ожидал развития сюжета с персонажем Нила, у которого как мы все помним из первой части не все было просто. Во второй части мы получаем некоторые ответы, но не все.

Было очень приятно пройти игру, и как же неприятно чувствовать горечь в груди от того, что следующую часть мы наверное получим еще через лет шесть.

Спасибо автору и его команде.

38423679.review:
人生那么短暂，无论我们做了什么，总有其他东西值得一试，总有另一条路值得一走。《Finding Paradise》继承了前作的设定，继续给我们讲述关于人生遗憾的故事。而这次他们要帮助另外一个短篇《Bird Story》中男孩Colin，他已长大结婚并且抚育一子，如今垂垂老矣，行将就木，但是似乎对曾经的人生留有遗憾，因此他签订了Sigmund公司的合同。而执行任务的员工依旧是我们在《To the moon》中遇到过的熟悉的老朋友Dr.Rosalene和Dr.Watts。Colin的愿望并不确切，他的妻子Sofia和儿子Asher对此爱莫能助。第一个悬念设下，故事由此展开。

Dr.Rosalene和Dr.Watts开始了他们的工作——在Colin大脑的记忆里探索，这些记忆涵盖了Colin的一生，从Colin的孩童时期到人生暮年，他们将重新扮演Colin的上帝，让Colin虚拟的一生重来一次，以期弥补他的遗憾。作品的游戏方式固然淳朴老旧，依然是依靠简单的寻物以及三消的小谜题来推动整个游戏剧情发展。然而我们很快便会发现，尽管Colin的确有遗憾，但是Colin的记忆却游走在满足和失意之间，这并非是剧作家第一次这样设计，因此波澜不惊的老玩家们或许已经开始进行激烈的大脑风暴，但是私以为《Finding Paradise》是一个更为侧重感受而非推理的作品。所以尽管可能新玩家并没有游过前两作，但是依旧不会对这部作品的审美产生偏差。为了避免更多的剧情透露，我想还是在此刻打住，盛宴理应交由观众们自己独自去品尝。

[b]注意，以下内容均含有剧透。[/b]

[h1]Colin[/h1]

在这种巧妙的犹如走钢丝般轻巧的剧本创作中，Kan Gao最后讲述的故事颇为简单。简单并非意味着低级，《Finding Paradise》的叙事节奏以及人物刻画依然保持了系列一贯的高水准。Kan Gao以他忠实的笔触，细腻的情感和生动的幽默刻画所见之物，并且把精妙绝伦的想象力加诸其中，让他自己以及我们都为此而感动。故事就像是一面镜子，史铁生曾说过：“写作者，未必能塑造出真实的他人，写作者只可能塑造真实的自己。”，放在游戏剧本的创作中依然成立。故事主角Colin的儿时经历无论怎么分析都绕不开Kan Gao自己的童年。在关于他制作《To the Moon》的某次采访中，如此介绍道：在他11岁时，来自山东的小男孩高瞰，跟随父母移民到了加拿大多伦多，环境变化让他非常不适应，他想要和周围的人交流，却不知道怎样开始，在搬到加拿大的最初岁月里，他度过了人生中最抑郁的一段时光，不知道为什么，变得越来越内向。在这样一段折磨人的岁月里，高瞰的脑海中很多想法不能跟外人表达，他开始创作故事，还迷上了钢琴。他尝试一边编写故事，一边加入自己弹奏的音乐，在利用了两年大学的课余时光后，他终于制作出了《To the Moon》。Colin儿时的孤寂正好是Kan Gao自己亲身经历过的事情，所以我们在玩游戏时才会觉得如此生动可感，才会明白为什么Colin会幻想出另外一个Faye做自己最要好的朋友，帮助自己的成长。本质上来说，我们当然可以大言不惭地说道“你是世上最出类拔萃的动物群体中的一员，你要理解自己的动物本性，并接受它。孤独就是与生俱来的一种本性，你要忍受它。”但是实际上因人而异，约翰.克里斯朵夫少有。我相信有不少人产生过喜欢一个人，甚至把他/她当作自己的整个精神偶像，并且加以顶礼膜拜然后才能忍受漫长人生旅途一段路上的孤独，如同鲁滨逊也需要星期五陪伴一样，Colin的幻想无可指摘。Faye是Colin的另一面，是期望中的自己的好友。Colin因为迟到被迫选择了最为笨重的大提琴，如同伍迪.艾伦在《傻瓜入狱记》的角色般笨拙演出一样，他只会演奏音阶，Faye则是一位技艺精湛的吉他高手，同属弦乐器，她让Colin不要放弃大提琴，同时让年幼的他拥有了第一个梦想，并且指引他为自己的梦想付诸实践。《Finding Paradise》是一个有关自我成长的故事，但是他们心中依旧有对过去的留恋，这种心境犹如盖茨比追逐缥缈的绿光般。事实上，我们也会对过去的人与事有一种想当然的狂热，或许Faye本身就存在每一个玩家身边，【1】是一个只可远观的友情或者说爱情对象，她对于那些曾经身陷爱情囹圄失恋过的人，或者正在处于热恋时期亦或者单单只是青涩的暗恋初恋者尤为吸引，她动人的气质和美丽难以捉摸，让人神魂颠倒，且她几乎可能弥漫于人生中的任何时刻。所以，我们也从Colin和Faye的故事中窥见自己，隐约看到了曾经孤独的我们，曾经有些抑郁的我们。小圆想起来，曾经有次，朋友的一个仅仅只有9岁的小侄女忽然问我：“你是不是有些事情不高兴啊，我感觉你有些忧郁。”对于一个九岁的孩子来说，我不知道忧郁对于她来说意味着什么，不过那一刻虽然在场的我们都在欢笑，不过我的内心却为之一颤。《Finding Paradise》让我回忆起了那段时光。故事最后的处理颇为梦幻，工作人员并没有改动Colin的记忆，选择把Colin交付给了Faye，这是Neil和Eva对Colin（Faye）勇气的认可，也是作品中最感人的一处。实际生活中，见到那些孤单甚至有些抑郁的人们，我们还是应该尽己所能去温暖他们。

[h1]Sofia[/h1]

幸运且有些童话的是，Colin最终找到了理解和包容他的伴侣Sofia。尽管Sofia对于最初的Colin的抉择有些怀疑，甚至对工作人员有些抵触，但是最终她还是选择了理解，同时作为Colin的爱人，她也不愿去窥探Colin内心柔软敏感的地方。Sofia是一位钢琴高手，因为Kan Gao认为“钢琴是有合声的音乐，所以不会让人觉得孤单。”，她不仅弥补了Colin爱情上的缺陷，同时也让Colin完成了自我成长和“自我救赎”，使他从虚拟的Faye梦境中走了出来，进而拥抱真实残酷的世界。我们可以这样认为，正是因为过去那些孤独的时光，使我们变得更加有趣，使我们最终能够遇上同样有趣的人。就像是同样会拉大提琴的加州理工实验物理学家Leonard面对母校毕业师生时所讲的那样：“或许你在学校格格不入，或许你是学校里最矮小，最胖的，或者最怪的孩子，或许你没有任何朋友，其实，这根本无所谓，重点是，那些你一个人度过的时间，比如组装电脑或者练习大提琴，其实你真正做的是，让自己变得有趣。等别人有天注意到你时，他们会发现一个比他们想象中更酷的人。”所以，《Finding Paradise》也是一个等待与希望的故事，Sofia对于Colin全身心的信任让这份爱更加梦幻和可贵。在生活的琐事逐渐磨平我们对爱情的热切期盼的时候，《Finding Paradise》让人又不禁重燃对美好爱情的向往。【2】

[h1]Neil & Eva[/h1]

故事中还有两个至关重要的配角，同时他们也是剧情发展的主要推动者，我们同时也是以他俩的主观视角去审视这个故事。他们就是Dr.Rosalene和Dr.Watts，Neil照旧保持了一贯幽默搞怪的风格，承担了游戏中的大部分的Neta和包袱，而Eva则负责捧哏和吐槽。除了这个最基础的关于“笑点”的矛盾之外，游戏深层次的矛盾在于他们二人对待自己工作时不同的看法。在《To the Moon》中，他们就River最后的处理办法就曾发生过激烈冲突，并且藉由这个冲突引发玩家们深层次的思考。而这次，Kan Gao故伎重演，不过他做出了一些改变，让角色人物在不断成长。Eva的职业道德修养主张以合同为主，而Neil则更侧重以人的隐性需求为主，为了满足需求，有的时候不得不做出违反合同的事情。在这个案例中，Neil主张把及机器的操作权限完全开放给病人的心理机能，也就是Faye，因为对于拥抱现实也需要心理斗争的客户而言，医生们的存在其实是一个不受欢迎的喇叭，仿佛在时刻强调虚构和幻想，时刻在表示现实并非无足轻重。而Eva则认为这会带来法律纠纷和伦理上的问题。Kan Gao这次也没有给与我们冲突的答案，而是折衷巧妙给了我们一个完美结局。而这次是Neil力排众议，在《To the Moon》中被Eva吐槽的“不愿冒险”的Neil这次扳回一城。由此我们可见，作为一部续作，而且考虑到Kan Gao可能在未来继续完善自己的作品，比如做一个三部曲。Kan Gao在构思人物性格时并非一成不变，而是让游戏角色随着经历也在共同成长，同时游戏中埋下了一些伏笔，比如说Neil的药等等。我非常希望看到第三部作品时他们的下次蜕变和成长，继续和他们进行下一次的探索。

[h1]作品缺陷[/h1]

诚然，《Finding Paradise》并非完美的作品，除了倍受诟病的游戏模式之外，RPGMAKER在如今高清分辨率下多少显得有些乏力。然而这些并非是游戏的重大缺陷，私以为，对作品评价构成主要伤害的有两点，其一是作品的人物虽然凹凸有致，在纷繁复杂的众生纷纭中，塑造了几个让我们印象十足的小人物。但是整体故事内容却有些漂浮，让人觉得太过虚假。其二则单指本地化问题，作品前半段大量出现形如“摸鱼”、“很勇哦”、“惊了”等一些较为突兀的话语以及一些蹩脚的比喻，这些不恰的“本地化”让原本严肃的文艺游戏反倒不那么接地气了。

然而，我仍然要为Kan Gao进行辩护一番，也即是对我刚才提出缺陷的第一点进行反驳。一旦进入了游戏奇异的世界，接受了Kan Gao带给我们的这份最为纯真的美好和感动。在故事的人物和冲突的背后，我们找到了我们自己。我们玩游戏，从而进入到一个令人痴迷的新世界，设身处地去体验初看起来似乎并不同于我们但其内心却和我们息息相通的另外一个人的生活，去生活在一个虚构的现实中，从而照亮我们日常的生活现实。我们并不希望借此逃避生活，游戏可能给了我们一个暂时的避风港湾，我们之所以喜欢Kan Gao的作品，因为我们对美好生活的向往。正如游戏中的Colin一样，我们最终会从Faye的影子中走出来。我们会选择去发现生活，去拥抱生活，用一种焕然一新的试验性的方式去使用我们头脑思想，去激荡我们情感，去欣赏，去学习，去增加我们生活的深度。最自由的旅人，卡萨布兰卡咖啡馆内拉着巴赫的大提琴演奏家，支着台灯披着方巾的女画家，抱着吉他不谈音乐梦想安静唱着民谣的歌手，在人潮汹涌的地铁中金鸡独立的武术高手，还有自谓大西洋而来的赌徒，每个人都身陷孤独，但却恣意妄为，天风浩然，潇洒不羁，我想，人呢，只要看穿了这个世界的矫饰，世界便会属于你。

[spoiler]9/10[/spoiler]


[h1]备注：[/h1]

【0】全文对于游戏的引文因为记忆力的原因并不保证完全符合原文。
【1】剧情中有对此的暗示，Faye说道：“你觉不觉得从某些方面来说，我是真实存在过的？”对此Neil的回应则是“这个嘛，这只是个人看法。我认为我们所有的记忆，以及其中的一切，都不过是我们编给自己听的故事罢了。”且游戏中多次暗示过Colin的记忆可能存在着粉饰和美化。
【2】不过，Faye曾经对Neil和Eva说道：“你们不只是来对病人的记忆胡作非为，你们虽然只来了一天，可是在他的一生中，从没有人能够像你们这样，以他的视角看待这个世界。而且，那个你们也算是我[b]第一次[/b]遇见的，能够相互交流的人。”Colin从没有对Sofia说过Faye的存在，说起他当飞行员梦想来由的时候也巧立名目，因此Faye和Sofia之间自然不可能会存在交流。如果我们站在Sofia的角度来看，可能会觉得有那么一丝别扭。

最后，谢谢杨柳送的礼物~

38423632.review:
How to begin a review of Finding Paradise?  So many facets go into making a great game.  What often makes for some of the best game experiences are those which find a single gem, one aspect, and focus all elements around it.

Enter Ken Gao and everyone at Freebird Games.

With great care and dedication, this team has delivered yet another powerful experience.  Utilizing the unique strengths of SNES era RPG style pixel-art, combined with masterful narrative construction, Finding Paradise is a pleasure through and through.  This team clearly knows their strengths and plays to those.  Our main characters from To The Moon return, wit and all.  [spoiler]The life of Colin leaves the player pondering very real questions about what it means to have lived life well.[/spoiler]  I count myself blessed to have gotten a chance to experience the journey that has been this series so far.  While I can barely contain my excitement at future installments, I very much ask that Ken and his team take all the time they need to maintain the high level of quality they have domonstrated thus far.

Please, do yourself a favor if you've not played these.  Buy To the Moon.  Play it.  ~5 hour play time.  Find all of the side stories, play them.  Then buy Finding Paradise (or buy it now in anticipation).  ~7 hour play time.

Thank you Ken for the work you do.  I really enjoyed your game.

Now the long awaited sequel of To the Moon has come! What do we get? Something actually very good but not on par with its predecessor. To the Moon had a story that was truely made you care about the main character but also the spouse of that main character that we find has shaped his life in so many ways. The affects of this character on the main characters fate is what makes us so sad when the main character (not really a spoiler) dies. This is not the case for the second game. The main character in this story is potraid as a dreamer. It makes the character pretty uninteresting for the first 1/3 to 1/2 of the game. Not only that but the implications of a girl that he liked in his childhood that we think is the cause of his modern day sorrow caused me to even look at him like he was selfish, just a bit. Of course in the "twist" this is turned on its head. but in a way that is so bizare and wierd that it is kind of hard to even relate to the main character.

That being said the humour, the music, the soft moments are all there. In the end it makes for a good story, but not one that creates feeling of sadness. What kind of saddness am I talking about? If you ever loved a story so much that when it concluded you cried, that is the sadness I am talking about. But I did not experience that here. I was very pleased and content.  But, I did not yearn for more.

One last thing, the music. The music is beautiful but takes TOOO much inspiration from the previous game. This is a new story, but I heared too many old themes from the previous game. Adding a little quitar here or some Cello there is not gonna do it! Sadly I could barely tell what the theme of the main character was. The theme for To the Moon was so clear that everytime you heared it you could guess what scene you were in. That wasn't the case here :(

But enough of my rant! buy the game! as soon as a discount comes ;)

I'm new to steam, and I'm so glad I found To the Moon, because it lead me to this wonderful masterpiece. I started and finished this on a plane flight. WARNING: do not play this in a public place. 38409761.review:
Finding Paradise is a bit of a mixed bag for me.

Throughout the story, I was able to get emotionally invested in Colin's life. I like how Colin's wish is handled and how unorthodox his last request is. I enjoyed seeing how the smaller seeming moments added up in his life, as well as the little regrets of things that he may have wished could have gone better. It made his story more resonant and relatable. I honestly wish a greater emphasis was placed on this, even though there was already a great emphasis on it in the game.

It does seem misleading to say that this is a standalone game. While you technically would be able to play the game and understand the story without playing either To the Moon, the Minisodes, or A Bird Story, there are references to them or plot points that they brought up that are so blatant and difficult to ignore that this game might run the risk of being confusing to completely new players. That being said, I absolutely enjoyed the references to A Bird Story, even though that game did not do much for me on its own. It was a sweet and heartfelt touch for this game.

The pop-culture references were my least favorite part of To the Moon, and it seems as though there were more added in Finding Paradise. When the playstyle shifted in these moments, it felt so jarring that it sucked me out of the experience. However, the mechanics themselves were not bad in and of themselves. They just felt disracting to me as a part of this particular game.

The ending is where I have the most problems. The spoiler in this section is fairly detailed about important reveals toward the end of the game, so I advise that you don't read it if you are already planning to play Finding Paradise. [spoiler] I had suspected that the faded person that was in Colin's later memories had something to do with Faye, but I had thought that they had drifted apart or that she moved away, and that rift needed to be solved somehow by the end. When the records showed that Faye didn't exist, I immediately jumped to schizophrenia, which would have been interesting and possibly have explained a lot about everything that had occurred in the game. Unfortunately, when the character's bring this theory up, it is immediately dismissed in favor of the true cause of everything: Faye was an imaginary friend so complex as to have a consciousness of her own that appears to be separate from Colin's. While developing an imaginary friend to cope with stress does happen, that isn't the same as creating a separate conscious entity. The explanation of the modification of the device can only go so far. I also disagree with Dr. Watts's speech toward the end, but that may say more about my thoughts than about the actual game. [/spoiler] I'm sure some people could either suspend disbelief at these parts or just not think as much about them in general, but it was a problem for me and my enjoyment of many of the ending portions of this game. It also sucked a lot of the emotion out of the end of Colin's story that I feel could have otherwise left me in tears.

The soundtrack is amazing, as it was with the other games before it. It was beautifully composed, and it is a pleasure to hear throughout this game. I will buy the soundtrack in a heatrbeat once they have that option here.

The game itself can run slowly at times, though I don't remember any significant moments of lag that hurt the overall experience of the game.

In spite of it's flaws, I do not regret having played this game. I played through it from start to finish with only an occasional restroom break getting in the way of one long continuous play. I look forward to to seeing whatever new game Kan Gao comes up with next for this series.

[b] TL;DR [/b]
I don't think this is a great game, and your mileage may vary with some plot points and pop-culture references, but I am glad I played it and reccomend it to others. Though they mention that you don't have to play any previous games before playing this one, playing To the Moon and the Minisodes (and maybe A Bird Story, if you're so inclined) beforehand would be a good idea to understand the full picture.

Finding Paradise no decepciona, al contrario, me ha sorprendido no haber derramado ni una lágrima con él, pero para bien.
Me alegra que Kan Gao haya optado por otro tipo de historia, pues amo To the Moon, y no quiero que otro juego, aún siendo del mismo creador, trate de repetir la fórmula e intente causar los mismos sentimientos, porque está claro que no lo haría.
Esta secuela trata temas mucho más profundos, como [spoiler] la soledad, el huir de la realidad creando un mundo que sólo existe en nuestro interior hasta tal punto de condicionar nuestro futuro, el poder dejar ir las cosas para poder pasar página y ser felices, etc [/spoiler]
¿Es mejor o peor que To the Moon? Es diferente, no tratemos de comparar ambos juegos porque aunque sean los mismo protagonistas y tal, no tienen nada que ver. Cada uno es único por su magia en lo que intenta presentar y exponer al jugador, en los sentimientos que transmite, y en los pensamientos que genera una vez te lo pasas.

[b] RECOMENDADÍSIMO [/b] si te gustan las buenas historias, y si ya has vivido (o vives) una situación como la del protagonista, sin duda este título se quedará en tu corazón y en tus pensamientos por mucho tiempo.

Gráficos 6. Aunque las animaciones, los escenarios, y las secuencias han mejorado, sigue estando un poco flojete en este apartado.

Nota final 10. La historia y la música se folla a todo lo demás. Es lo que hay.

38407054.review:
Dopo aver amato, e giocato più di una volta To The Moon fino alle lacrime, l'ho consigliato con orgoglio a mia madre e ai miei migliori amici, tutti l'hanno amato e mi hanno ringraziato infinitamente per averglielo fatto conoscere. 

Per Finding Paradise tante tante tante aspettative, forse troppe. Tecnicamente è sicuramente un titolo migliore e più esteso di TTM, ci sono più minigiochi, più sprites, più effetti visuali e in generale il gioco è più "cinematografico" rispetto al primo capitolo, dal punto di vista del gameplay leggermente meno lento. Unica nota di gameplay che non ho gradito molto sono i "puzzles" tra un ricordo e l'altro, che mentre ero preso dalla trama anche se molto facili li avrei preferiti ancora più immediati come in TTM, anche se interessanti.

La trama purtroppo non mi ha preso molto.. l'ho trovata quasi scontata, alcuni colpi di scena me li aspettavo e non mi hanno scioccato come invece ha saputo fare quasi di continuo TTM, i due dottori Neil e Eva fantastici ancora di più, meglio caratterizzati e più protagonisti, mentre i veri protagonisti dell'episodio purtroppo non mi hanno lasciato un gran segno.. Non che sperassi di piangere quanto con To The Moon (o forse si??), però in questa storia, per quanto toccante e molto molto ben scritta, ho visto pochi colpi di genio.. poche idee capaci di prendere il cuore del giocatore/spettatore. 

Comunque sia chiaro, giocatelo, soprattutto se conoscete il primo episodio amerete molte citazioni in questo secondo, che vi faranno tornare alla mente bellissimi ricordi.

"Você ainda possui regressos?"
Não sou de fazer análises,mas esse jogo merece com ctz. Ja conhecia as obras de Kan Gao, como To the Moon e A Bird Story, e esperei tanto pela sequência, que chegou perto do Natal e foi o melhor presente que podia ter nesse ano
O jogo te intriga, fascina e te faz refletir sobre a vida, possui personagens maravilhosos, enredo interessantíssimo, trilha sonora perfeita e cenários lindos.
O jogo ainda te faz pensar em uma pergunta simples mas tão complicada; Você mudaria alguma coisa em sua vida? Parece uma pergunta com uma resposta obviamente afirmativa, porém esse jogo fará o jogador encontrar uma resposta muito mais intrigante e bonita.
O paciente, Colin, é extremamente humano e parecido comigo, e possivelmente poderá ser parecido com você, o que fará se colocar no jogo e ver que o amadurecimento as vezes machuca, e muito.

38404985.review:
虽然系列的反人类操作多年来都没有改进，但直到玩完第二幕，我依然认为这是一款值得推荐的神作，层层推进、环环相扣的剧情可谓吊足胃口，恰到好处的疑点和笑点设置也让人更加沉醉其中。但第三幕是彻头彻尾的叙事灾难，过多的中二街机战斗和Eva的消失让剧情推进受到阻碍，出现了漫长的情感空白期，使得前两章来之不易的浪漫及悬疑氛围连同Faye的形象与人物深度一起毁于一旦，变得荒唐而滑稽。如果单独拿出来，倒也算好玩；但这前后的高反差让游戏体验如方枘圆凿一般别扭。情绪一旦被打破，就很难再投入其中了。

剧情的收尾也不令人满意。简单地用“The Fiction We Tell Ourselves（某首BGM标题）”来解释整个故事有点浪费前面的铺垫，也没能给出什么科学的理由，远不如《去月球》的故事令人信服。尽管用上了象征主义手法，注重于个人感情的主观感受而略去对现实世界的忠实刻画，强调“记忆不靠谱”的特点，但Colin在阳台说出那句“我有时会把白日梦和现实混淆”时就已经把谜底揭开。而后续的剧情发展也落入窠臼，没有出乎意料之处，带来的情感也就有些俗套了。结局“让法爷接管整个世界”可谓剧情的脱轨和自暴自弃，看来跳票并未能把失败的结局扳回正确的道路。总体上，故事的结构和处理方式都不如《去月球》别出心裁，因而伴随的情感冲击弱了几档；配乐的总体品质不错，但仍有所倒退；加之操作方式没有明显进步，Eva和Watt的故事也几无进展，比起预期是较为失望的。

彩蛋：
找到记忆碎片之后的音效来源于《去月球》音乐《Moongazer》片段。

游戏中很多配乐使用钢片琴（Celesta）演奏，celesta意思就是“天上之音”，和《寻找天堂》的游戏标题相契合。

38403758.review:
第一次写测评，与其说是安利不如说是心中的情绪想要发泄出来，想和玩过的人交流一下……隐藏的就是涉及剧透啦，慎重点开，不知道为什么特别有感触写了这么多，估计bug无限多吧，求大家手下留情……
身为一个被之前作品赚去无数眼泪的玩家，这一代游戏发售的第一时间就购买了，但是一直没有开始玩，还清晰的记得看过一条关于《to the moon》的评论：玩去月球的下午，是我大学中最美好的回忆。所以我一直在等一个大段的空闲，留给这部期待已久的续作。恰好今天打球的时候戳到了手指，于是鸽了基友的dota，女友的的“骚扰”，开着空调抱着抱枕，开始享受这一道不知道会是什么口味的大餐。流程比《to the moon》要久一点，整体来讲很相似，进入记忆→发现问题→修改，但是创新也是显而易见的，涉嫌剧透的就不说了，但是绝对会给老玩家带来很多惊喜，新作的游戏性提升了很多[spoiler]但是对于手残而且手真的受伤的我来说，真的好难打啊啊啊啊啊每次都是被faye欺负到爆啊啊啊啊心态崩了啊啊啊啊真的是对不起库里的黑魂啊……[/spoiler]情节上也有一定的改变，不像《to the moon》以一条明显的“爱情”主线贯穿，辅以亲情友情种种，而这一代，开始就是很模糊的，你会随着进度产生各种新的猜测，让你对结局真相的渴望越来越期待[spoiler]也许有人会说主线还是爱情啊，两个女主与男主之间究竟发生了什么，但是我不这么认为，男主一直强调自己没有不幸福不希望忘掉家人只是有一些遗憾，所以我一直坚定的相信妻子就是妻子，青梅竹马就是朋友，这部分情感与男主的遗憾应该无关，我觉得男主没什么该遗憾的……好吧事实证明猜对了一半，爱情线确实没问题，但是与faye的情感还是很重要的，最后整体看下来，我突然想到了《追逐繁星的孩子》，这两部作品给我的感觉很接近，前面模糊的叙事到最后用一句话就可以基本概括“其实我只是太孤独了啊”。感觉这部作品，虽然很明显是虚构的却又真实的可怕，孤单寂寞的童年时光我想大部分人都有过，被孤立被排挤我想很多人也以旁观者或者参与者的角度感受过，我一直就是个很胆小很自卑的人，我从小也幻想过有个朋友在我身边给我鼓励陪我玩耍，不过没游戏中这么浪漫，我幻想的是个男的……作者高瞰也说过，自己是个很孤独的人，貌似还有轻微抑郁症来着?我想 ，虚构的背后，更多的是作者亲身经历和感悟吧。正是这份真实，才让结局变得那么催人泪下，我本人很喜欢虐的作品，tothemoon之后我也在坚持训练自己，所以当faye消失的时候，我只是留下了泪水，但是当《wish my life away》结束，faye突然出现说出“老顽固，你是在找我吗”的时候，我还是控制不住失声痛哭，失而复得的惊喜，生命最后的欣慰，最后呈现出的修改过得记忆，完全摧毁了我前面对这部作品的疑问，它用了一种与《to the moon》完全不同的方式，征服了我[/spoiler]
[spoiler]不过最后的最后，对我来说，我还是喜欢一代那样仿佛看电影的感觉吧，可能是因为我比较懒还想收集全剧情……就比如飞机和格斗我都输给了faye用尽了挑战次数，但是短时间内我是不可能再去玩一遍打过的线啦，去问了朋友知道了大概就满足了。这次的创新有目共睹，我还是表示支持的态度好了，感谢作者的付出，毕竟不可能做的让所有人都觉得完美嘛[/spoiler]
总之 喜欢上一作的完全值得来试试这一部新作 我反正 就等着入正音乐包了 最后的歌曲听不懂真是遗憾啊……附上官方的链接好了[spoiler]我反正是挂了代理才能点开的，复制粘贴是干不出来的，所以辛苦你们了[/spoiler]https://steamcommunity.com/app/337340/discussions/0/2549465882915909401/
感觉单词也不是很难，但是当时脑子晕晕的加上听力能力low爆还是根本没听懂错过了好多泪点很难受……心疼我周六睡过头没去考的四级……明年在努力吧……

38402947.review:
TL;DR version:

If you don't mind pixel art, love a good story and narrative, love good music, and/or loved to the moon, get this game.

Long version:

To keep my memories fresh, I played to the moon again before getting this game just to compare gameplay, soundtrack, and narrative elements. Finding Paradise is very similar to To the Moon gameplay and graphics wise, for better or for worse. Soundtrack is wonderfully exceptional, as expected; there are some scores from Finding Paradise that I prefer to To the Moon, and vice versa. Overall verdict for soundtrack is comparable to To the Moon if not better. Story wise, how to begin, is phenomenally exceptional. Probably one of if not the best narrative in video game I have ever witnessed, again, comparable if not better than To the Moon in terms of narration and story telling. This game will hit your feels, hard, and relentlessly.

They included some references to To the Moon and A Bird Story in the game; it is a completely standalone game but I would recommend playing those 2 if you care so much for references. I did not play the 2 minisodes and I think there are some references to those as well.

(SPOILER BELOW)

This game deals with loneliness, childhood fantasy, regret, "what ifs", and other complex emotions really well. Just as To the Moon dealt with being in a relationship with someone in the autism spectrum (I imagine, haven't actually had the experience) really well, Finding Paradise will hit your feels hard even if you can't relate to it 100%. The details they put in the game regarding the lack of key memories from his latter life that is not in sync with the photo album is amazing. They do not really display all of the emotions that they want to convey in your face, but they are still presented very elegantly and very clearly, it was clear that even after living a long and full life, Colin still had difficulty appreciating life as it is, even if he is "not as aloof" as he was. In the end, what Faye did by (what I imagine to be) changing his core memories from his fantasised memories with her to his actual memories regarding his family is brilliant, and hits the home. Too often we disregard what is going on in our everyday life as we are too obsessed with our fantasies. This game teaches a valuable lesson about life in that regard, and I can see myself returning to this game every so often and pick up new lessons from it.

The subplot regarding Neil is equally interesting, and leaves you wanting more. In To the Moon, we were presented with the information that Neil keeps a bottle of painkillers, but we didn't know if they were prescribed or if he is addicted. In this game, we learned a little bit more about Neil, but nothing concrete can be drawn from him yet. We also learned a little bit more about his relationship with Eva (they have been friends since childhood), which is really nice. I would really love to learn more about Eva as she is an equally intriguing character, but sadly we don't learn much about her here. However, the cliffhanger at the end about Neil leaves me screaming for answers, good job Kan Gao.

38402713.review:
（视频通关后补票）
Faye是那只鸟，更是Colin自己。Faye说过“那些你不知道的事情，我教不了你，那些你不愿意做的事情，我也帮不了你”，“我能做到的，你一定也能做到”。就像Eva说的，Faye可能就是一种心理保护机制。就像普通人在伤心，沮丧，孤独的时候内心也会有个声音鼓励你走出来，重新面对生活。通常来说那个声音来自“正能量的自己”。只是Colin特殊的经历（a bird story）和超凡的想象力把他塑造成了Faye（我觉得可能也是整个系列承上启下的关键）。Faye这个角色就像Neil说的，特别鲜活，她不是一个单调的圣母，他鼓励Colin，但是也会嘲弄他的小毛病，开他的玩笑，特别是第一次爬山的时候，她模仿Colin闹别扭的样子，特别可爱。最后一次爬山和那一段经典的对白，其实是Colin人生中最重要的一次思想斗争，他不想Faye离开，但是他也知道Faye必须离开了，其实事情早有先兆，每次Colin投入到那些爱好中的时候，Faye就会呼呼大睡，后来甚至主动提出不参加音乐会。只是Faye的形象让人感觉像是挚友之间的离别，加上和那只鸟的形象联系，Faye的那些话和最后那句“在很久，很久以前”特别催人泪下。其实这个游戏对我最大的启发就是，可不可把那个总是鼓励你的“正能量的自己”当成Faye呢？她了解你的一切，那些好的，不好的，她知道你做的所有事情，“我一直都在呢”，在伤心，沮丧，孤独的时候她总是鼓励你走出低谷，当年真的走出来的时候可能理所当然的忘了她。现在，在下次相遇时，可以好好的谢谢她了，那是你最好的自己。

38401272.review:
[h1]游玩前请备好纸巾与柠檬水，在故事结束后把秘密写给你最爱的人[/h1]
这是关于西格蒙德公司的故事的第二部
一个服务于濒死之人，通过篡改记忆实现愿望的公司
想一想，浏览一个人一生最重要的片段，看过他一生的爱恨别离，并改变他的(记忆中)人生轨迹
本身就极具吸引力的这一切，搭配上该系列一贯优秀的脚本与音乐

五个小时的电影般享受

—————————————————————————

就如同前作《to the moon》，把记忆旅行这个题材发挥的非常优秀，各种细节伏笔布置巧妙，剧情冲突非常精彩又能有合理的解释，加上自由鸟一脉相传的BGM以及其中掺杂的各种搞怪捏他，这部《Finding Paradise》也一样是一部像素剧情RPG中的佳作。

不过不同于《to the  moon》的那个忘记又忘不掉、表达不出却一直都在的爱情故事，《Finding Paradise》的故事更加普遍，几乎是每一个（曾经）孤独的人都有过的体验，而当你走出孤独回首一生时，你能正视那些曾经的遗憾吗么。故事或许不如前作那样轰轰烈烈，但是触及心灵的感觉却毫不逊色。

不过结局处理上感觉过于仓促又留下太多伏笔，并没有前作结局那么大的震撼感[spoiler]可能是因为我的Faye还没有走出我的生活[/spoiler]

人物塑造同前作一样的完美，每个npc的性格都十分鲜明，不说公司的两位老朋友和两位新朋友，长大后爱捋头发的Faye，睡姿感人的Sofia（笑，就连龙套的两个熊孩子、熊孩子妈、隔壁房客的性格细节也非常丰富。

而且相比前作单纯地讲故事，本作还通过与病人家属与社区龙套的交流，从侧面探讨着这个如同死神引路人一样的公司的伦理意义，Colin不是Johnny，他不是一个独居的孤寡老人，而这项服务对服务对象的亲人、对周边社区的人都有什么影响，在这部里面都有一些反映。

这些背景的补完，与大量的伏笔[spoiler]摩托车主/捞熊的人/镇定后的交易/Dr. Watts的药与秘密等[/spoiler]真的让我十分期待故事的后续，下次同样强烈支持~


顺便这部的搞怪与捏他是真的多，真的是一边哭一边笑一边心惊肉跳地玩过来的233
[spoiler]话说有一幕有个足球场，足球场上有三个人在不停的传球，嗯，我盯着笑了半天，不知道便利店的薯片是不是半价的[/spoiler]

38400973.review: Finding Paradise是Freebird Game制作组继To the moon之后的独立故事续作。Finding Paradise是一款像素轻微解谜剧情游戏，通过参与整个故事来体验游戏，或许它也不能叫一款游戏，因为需要手动去操作的环节甚少，剧情很感人题材很罕见，再加上超赞的BGM到后面的剧情简直就是连环催泪弹一般！像素游戏虽然在画面上无法与如今的主流游戏媲美但这种原始质朴的风格太适合讲述这种走心的故事！扎心了...建议各位老铁们体验一下...

38400860.review: Incredible game! If you liked To The Moon, you will love this. The atmosfere, the soundtrack, the story, everything is great. Truly an amazing sequel.

38400562.review:
点进来才发现是 to the moon 的续作，没有丝毫犹豫就买了，因为我知道这游戏买的一定值，哦，不应该说是一款游戏，更应该说是一个艺术品，一件跟你讲了一个让你感动，让你震撼的故事的艺术品。
游戏进行到孩童时期，惊然发现是 a bird story 里面的小男孩，瞬间全身起了一身鸡皮疙瘩。强烈推荐玩本作之前按照顺序从 to the moon 到 Minisode1 、a bird story、Minisode2玩一遍，更能理解本作中关于以前事迹的小彩蛋，其中 a bird story 是必须要玩的。
高瞰的故事和音乐每部都无需多说，绝对令你震撼、感动。不过本作故事结局并不像 to the moon 那样容易理解，也许结局的意义更深，但我浅显的人生阅历只看出了现实与虚幻之间的挣扎，放手和重逢。故事很好，适合找一个下午，一个人坐在电脑前面慢慢欣赏。配乐也非常到位，代入感也很好。
评分的话满分十分我会给十分，对于像我这样的普通玩家来说，已经是神作了。期待续作，出了就继续买买买。

玩完了以后思考了很久，首先要明确的是，findin paradise确实不如to the mmon 给我带来的感动多，而且游戏玩完以后对整体故事的理解有些不明确，但是看了很多评测之后终于理解了，colin在放弃FAYE人格后的生活并没有纠结于FAYE，FAYE最后存在的意义是让coloin明白，他所犯过的小错误，所制造的遗憾，是他人生的一部分（我的理解有别于作者说的“正是遗憾造就了我们”），尽管这些遗憾带给我们的影响不一定是积极的，但无法否认的是这确实是我们生活的一部分，这些零零碎碎的东西组成了我们的生活。相比于to the moon玩完之后带给我巨大的感动与陈思，这部作品显得更加温情一些，river可能是带着遗憾去世的，但是colin和他的妻子都不会有任何遗憾。

38399874.review: If you loved To The Moon you will most certainly enjoy Finding Paradise. It finally answers the questions to Bird Story, and even offers more questions to the ethical side of things in Eva and Neil's business. 38399513.review:
如果，有一天，我们老了，回首过去，年幼时的无知，年少时的轻狂，成年后的现实，还有面对痛苦时的无奈，这些，这些，都组成了我们彼此与众不同的一生。Faye就像是我们心底最美好的理想那样，而Sofia，则是我们面对的现实。
壮美，情深意切；细腻，有爱相随。
如果有那么一天，我笔下的姑娘儿出现在我的面前，问我这一辈子是不是有所遗憾……
我会告诉她，有，有很多，但正因为有那么多的遗憾，才造就了这样脾气的我，才铸造了这样性格的我，才创造了这样与众不同的我……我创造出她们，是因为我喜欢书写；我创造出她们，是因为我爱着将文字堆砌成故事。
我畏惧着死亡，不是对于长眠的畏惧，而是害怕着这一觉之后，再也不能读，再也不能写，再也没有梦，再也不会有欢笑，再也不会有悲伤……
但是我知道，总会有人陪伴着我，就像Faye之于Colin，就像Sofia之于Colin。
早安，地球。晚安，各位。
11/10

38396158.review:
期待了很久的作品。在14号睡前看手机，还有1小时解锁，等着等着睡着了，第二天一醒来买了下来。断断续续的几天内，省下所有一个人独处的时间，终于通关。
游戏一如既往的感人。
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------正经的分割线，剧透相关的会盖住

每一次的游戏体验，都像是和作者高瞰的一次对话。
从To the Moon初次被他讲的故事感动，到A Bird Story，更加进一步走入作者的内心，
这一次的Finding Paradise，更像是面对内心深处的自己。

其实从ABS起就开始出现了不同的声音。有些人认为无法打动自己，给出差评。现在的Finding Paradise也是一样，有很多人说不及To the Moon带来的感动多了。
要知道，这故事本来就是讲述的“不被世界理解”的人，它是讲给孤独的人听的。如果你不曾有过那种经历，不曾有过那种体会，自然是无法感同身受的。
[spoiler] 总是有很多人指责ABS没有一句台词，不够丰满，非常平淡。
一个没有朋友，孤独的孩子，要怎么表达情绪？[strike] 对着空气说话吗？[/strike]喜怒哀乐都无法被倾听，一个人呆在空荡荡的房子里，只能和玩偶玩耍。所有无法排解的情绪，都只能向内发散，直到在心里孕育出一个世界。
直到他第一次和一个生命相遇。温热的，有回应的生命，放在手心还可以感受到脉搏的生命。第一次感受到了“陪伴”。第一次不再孤单。
可能有些人会觉得毫无操作可言，面无表情地按下放飞小鸟的→和↑，一边想着：游戏就这样结束了吗？
而有些人，颤抖着按下那两个按键的时候，早已泪流满面。[/spoiler]

可能在评价这款游戏的时候，我的评测是不理性的。没有站在所有玩家的角度来看。但我就是要给它满分，无视它的所有瑕疵，因为它所带来的的“意义”已经超过了作为评测游戏标准的条条框框，让它显得无比珍贵。

[u] 为什么我不会向周围人随便推荐这款游戏	[/u]
对一个玩家而言，一个没有游戏性的视觉小说，如果从剧情上无法给自己带来感动，那么对它的评价自然也不会高。
所有人都不希望自己喜爱的东西被贬低，所以我不会向身边的人盲目推荐这款游戏。
希望不再有人拿它和To the Moon比较了，因为它们根本就是面向不同群体的两个作品。
也希望玩过了这个作品的你，如果你没有被它打动的话，也请你把它当作一个了解一种人群内心世界的独特体验。经历过后，可能当你再次看到身边沉默寡言，不合群的人的时候，也会想到他们内心有这样丰富多彩的世界的可能性。温柔相待。

希望真正爱着这部作品的人，可以从中获得一丝温暖的力量，让你有动力继续前行。
你要相信，这个世界上有这么多爱着这部作品的人，正在此刻，也许就在屏幕前泪流不止。
也许他就在你的身边。

也许，终有一天，你们会发现彼此。


[u] 关于遗憾[/u]
每个人的一生中都有各种各样的遗憾。
每个人都会想“如果当初没有/不是那样就好了……"
本作主角Colin的临终愿望就是，弥补人生中的遗憾。
可是，当重新走完了这一遍之后……

[spoiler] [quote=author] Faye:“……你现在还有什么遗憾吗？”
Colin:“遗憾吗……”

I pray to God, though I have never been pious before
我向上帝祈祷，尽管我此前从不虔诚
「My world is as dark as my living room, the sound of the cello echoes in the room」
「我的世界和我的客厅一样黑暗，大提琴的声音回荡在房间」

首先，中文版介绍简直是欺骗消费者，这个故事真的没那么简单。
这个故事会唤起很多孤独的人内心的共鸣，不管是因为什么原因变得孤独。

38395585.review: Finding Paradise tells a different story, never beating around the bush, nor attempting to rush anywhere. It’s there for as much as it needs to be, gently pulling in anyone experiencing it. Colin’s plot may be the main focus, however the two doctors get their fair share of dialogue as well. On top of being an emotional experience, Finding Paradise also steps into cerebral, contemplative territory. Despite attempting some variety, the gameplay and visuals don’t stand out too much. The great thing about it is that they don’t impede the narrative either, as I quickly found myself invested in and caring about the life story of a bunch of fairly standard-looking pixel sprites. It’s this brilliant mixture of wonderful music and touching narrative that made To The Moon a game I can recommend to anyone. It’s why I’ll do the same with Finding Paradise’s admittedly different, yet still powerful tale.[url=http://www.noobfeed.com/reviews/1390/finding-paradise-pc-review] Full Review[/url].

刚刚通关，不知所措。不知道自己该是什么心情。
我们纵览了主人公的两辈子，看到了美好的记忆，还有种种遗憾，最后使之完美，然而完美的结局背后是一声长长的“滴~~~”，主人公最终还是离开了我们，当然我们早就知道。
人的一生短暂而渺小，当终点近在眼前时，以前的种种回忆却那么漫长，珍惜和所爱的人在一起的时间，这大概就是去月球系列带给我们的吧。

38394839.review:
看到支持简体中文的那一刻真的是高兴到爆炸，之前看的时候还显示的是不支持中文，结果第二天一看就有了。感谢汉化的各位让我不用啃生肉了，真的感谢各位汉化的大大们！！！！！

啊真是的又一次赚足了我的眼泪啊啊啊QAQ，虽然没有去月球那时候的震撼，可是依旧很感动的啊有没有！！感觉本作的主题应该是[spoiler]“成长是孤独的。”这句话吧[/spoiler]

可能是因为前作太强大，所以这一作的体验并不是很惊艳。不过依旧是满满的感动和温情。

Kan Gao的剧情总是温情之中糅合着一丝悬疑，有时候配合着BGM还来点小小的惊悚。剧情的转折一向是Kan Gao非常拿手的地方，至于究竟有多意外，那还是需要自己去感受拉。不过揭开谜底之后真的是那种温情中又带着那么一丢丢遗憾的感觉，但这种遗憾才是精华所在啊！！哦对了，这次里面真的可以玩那种小游戏，袜子博士真的是笑死我了。

这一系列的BGM从来就没有让我失望过，前作不用说，这一作的BGM可以说是非常的恰到好处了。刚进游戏界面Free Birds图标的鸟鸣声配合着BGM的吉他真的在那一瞬间惊艳到我了。刚才看了一下DLC的原声，居然写着2025年开放，估计是个BUG，希望能早日把DLC原声放出来。

以下涉及剧透，慎看哦~
[spoiler]话说Faye是不是前传里的那只鸟啊？到最后看见她展开翅膀了，一瞬间以为是那只鸟，但是我又觉得应该只是Colin的想象，因为跟鸟有过一段难忘的经历，所以潜意识里面Faye才会是类似于鸟一样拥有翅膀。
然后是罗萨琳和袜子博士，这对CP真的是有毒，明明两个都很担心很在意对方的，非要嘴硬死不承认。而且袜子博士头疼（？不知道是不是）的原因到现在依旧没有揭露出来。游戏最后出现了系列的总览，一个大大的省略号表明这个系列还没有完结，恭喜续作加入有生之年系列豪华套餐。希望Kan Gao可以给这俩一个圆满的结局（我好希望可以撒点糖QAQ）。

其实我在想可能每个人心中都有一个像Faye一样的存在，我们看不见他，却一直陪伴着我们成长。[/spoiler]

38394799.review: If To The Moon was like a 95%, this would be like a 93%. The only reason it isn't as good as the original is because it's hard to beat the first one. Incredible game. Beat it in one sitting.

38394727.review: Moving story and beautiful soundtrack. This certainly lived up the expectations set by To The Moon. Can't wait for the next game.

38394705.review:
It's hard not to compare this game to its predecessor, To the Moon, and I'm afraid it doesn't quite reach the height of the previous game. The story is more on the weird and creepy side, the tone can be a little bit inconsistent. The game play is still almost non-existent, but if you are considering this game you are probably ready for that.

That being said, not many games can compare to To the Moon, and this game is one of the best games I've played this year. Soundtrack is amazing as always, story telling is intriguing, art is great for the its low-res format, ending will surely make you shed a tear. As for the overall story, while kind of weird, still delievers something for you to think about for a long time.

The game ended on a cliff-hanger. I would look forward to further expansions.

Also, a side note, it's kind of annoying that we don't get the soundtrack for the game.

38394674.review:
[h1] 这是一个关于Colin的救赎的故事，还是关于Faye的斗争的故事？（涉及剧透）[/h1]    
        玩到这个游戏的时候还是特别亲切的，耍宝加吐槽二人组，似曾相识的套路 ，以及一个贱贱的开头。于是我默默掏出了一袋薯片…
        看了将近五个小时的电影，恩，怎么说呢，这次的故事本身其实相比于《去月球》来说要简单的多，也平淡的多。如果说《去月球》是万万人中只有一个 的故事，那么《寻找天堂》则几乎能让半数以上的人都或多或少得有所共鸣。
        一个缺乏自信的，孤僻的孩子的心路历程。   
        我之所以能这么快对号入座，是因为故事中的Colin实在太像我童年时候看到的那个大雄了，哆啦A梦没有出现之前的大雄。不自信，喜欢抱怨，做事半途而废，还总给自己一些借口。所以接下来，哆啦A梦的出现也就顺理成章了 。恩，Faye来了。
        她像一团只属于男主的火，帮他树立目标，排遣寂寞，改变自身，让一切步入正轨。然后，实现梦想的男主有了自己的爱情和家庭，生儿育女，晚年幸福 ，而Faye则在一个合适的时间，默默消失，一如那只机器猫。
        那么让我们归于现实，Faye是否存在？
        答案是是的，存在，但一定只在Colin的世界中存在。正如长大之后的我们再去看哆啦A梦，更喜欢把它看作野比大雄的黄粱一梦。
        所以主线故事就很清晰了，孤僻的小Colin创造了“Faye”，并在这样的暗示下成功走出了封闭的世界，然后他让Faye消失，开始走他的人生。但Colin 依然是那个不自信的Colin，他在意一切不如意的憾事，总是想要改变它们， 最终鬼使神差地，冒着家庭不睦、晚节不保的风险请来了“二人组”。“二人组”不负众望地把事情折腾的扑朔迷离，并和宣誓领土主权的Faye打的不亦乐乎。直到最后，Faye被认同，救赎了Colin，让他学会珍惜所经历的一切。
        然而这就是整个游戏的意义所在么？其实不是，或者说只是一方面。它是在引出一个更大的论调。如果说《去月球》还看不出什么端倪的话，那么《寻找天堂》就已经让它昭然若揭了。
        [b]“西格蒙德这家公司的服务，真的如同他们描述得那么完美么？”[/b]  
        Faye是第一个跳出来否定它的，她那句经典的话我印象很深：[b]“有些事情，对你来说很真实，很重要，但是旁人会觉得它无关紧要，因为他没有经历过，无法感同身受。”[/b]所以我说这也是一个关于Faye的斗争的故事，她反感那些擅自进入别人记忆并武断地生杀予夺的“陌生人”，她坚信能救赎自己的东西只可能来自自身。最后Faye败了，也赢了，事实也证明她并没有错，她拯救了Colin。
        而有了质疑，变革也就应运而生，没错！！二逼眼镜男主，说的就是你！！他藏得很深，可以说是幕后大佬，Faye的出现也是他一手造就的，稳定器可不是白卸的。最后他保存了Faye的阶段意识，如果我没猜错，下一部作品里面男主大概会搞个大事情，心疼未来即将一脸懵逼的女主。
        嘛，虽然是一部铺垫意义的作品，但是故事本身也很值得推敲，感情细腻流畅发人深省，剧情也是一如既往的幽默无厘头，玩起来很舒服，在此向作者大大们致敬。
        期待下一部的高潮迭起！

38391616.review:
I'll recommend this, but with two major caveats.

First, I think you'll appreciate this game much more if you *haven't* played To the Moon yet. The story in this one is decent, and at times touching, but in my opinion To the Moon set the bar so impossibly high that there was never really any hope that a sequel could top(or even match) it. So that's my suggestion: maybe play A Bird Story first, but definitely save To the Moon for *after* you've played this if you haven't done so already so that you don't go in with impossible expectations.

Second, this and the events of the two Chrismas DLCs for To the Moon have caused me to hate - and I mean utterly detest - one of the main characters, as well as a prominent side character. [spoiler]Dr. Watts is making unlicensed modifications to the memory machine, and those changes are strongly hinted to have contributed to some of the weirder events that take place in FP, mostly by leaving the OS open to attack from the patient's own mental processes. He has *not* disclosed this to his partner, Dr. Rosalene, who's also using the machine, so he's literally placing her mind and health at risk for "mysterious reasons." One of their coworkers - Winters - knows something about this, and she hasn't disclosed anything to Rosalene either, so she's complicit,[/spoiler]

Other than that, I have no objections. Great original soundtrack, great use of pixel art, fun(if simplistic) explore and find adventure gameplay. Just dont' go in expecting To the Moon levels of story complexity or emotional depth because you won't find it here.

38391453.review:
This contains content that may be considered spoilers.

TL;DR
While not as profound as To the Moon, Finding Paradise provides a valuable experience that not only forwards the plot, but is nearly as enjoyable as the first.  9/10

-------------------

I'll try not to spoil the plot-twists details, but I will review other mechanics and details that could ruin some of the fun.

Before playing this game, it is very essential that you play both of the SigCorp Holiday Minisodes (included with To the Moon), and while playing A Bird Story definitely adds to the story, it's not essential.  In addition to being part of the overarching plot, the minisodes provide both important background on how some things came to be as well as some character introductions.  

The game's premise is very similar: a call to a dying patient.  This patient, Colin, has an unconventional wish to [spoiler]die with no regrets, while also changing none of the major aspects of his life[/spoiler].  Eva and Neil navigate through Colin's memories in a mechanically similar way to To the Moon, but [spoiler]instead of following a linear path from recent memories to old memories, the memories constantly slingshot across his life[/spoiler].  Neil has some secrets that are discovered, and he struggles to keep them under control.  

Finding Paradise is significantly less depressing than To the Moon.  The heavy-hitting emotions arrive near the end, where everything is coming together and Colin is in his final moments, but the story isn't as tragic as Johnny's.  I do not see this in any way as a bad thing- it's a different game, different person, and not every life has to be tragic.  The comedy in this game is arguably better, as I found myself laughing pretty hard in some sequences.  With great art and music old, new, and remixed, the atmosphere in this game easily matches that of To the Moon.

Mechanically, this game is very similar to To the Moon.  You can either play in a small window or fullscreen.  The launch menu is identical, just with different music and art.  The controls are nearly the same, with some sequences requiring keyboard control.  In any interaction, always try to exhaust the dialogue; just because they stopped talking does not mean they don't have more to say.  I believe it is better to play with a mouse, because you will be able to find interactable components that you wouldn't find with keyboard controls.

Try not to expect the same thing as To the Moon.  If you play this game expecting to feel emotionally ruined at the end, you may be disappointed.  In fact, this game is much more optomistic.  Johnny died with a life made happy, which was bittersweet because in reality, he was a very tragic man.  Colin, on the other hand was already content, he just wanted to have no regrets.

This game ended me. It wasn't anything I was expecting, but it was everything I never thought I needed.

My heart hurts, I'm bloated with emotions right now. For a moment I thought it was going downhill, but it did a complete 360 and turned out to be just astounding. 

I wish we had more peeks into why Colin was alone, I wouldn't have minded that the reason was a little cliche if it meant that we got to see more of the struggle in that specific part; mostly we got to see the struggles that branched out from the root cause, but I feel that the revelation of the reason was a little compressed and I wasn't given enough time to relate and get attached to it.

tl;dr. The stories Kan writes, man. He needs to make hundreds more of this. The soundtrack has hell frozen all over. I wish there were at least three 'Yes' buttons for recommending this game.

Во-первых, шутки были всегда к месту и заставили меня подавится кофе и обхохотаться до коликов в животе. Да, драмматичных моментов тут не так много, но это даже хорошо.

38390212.review:
当我们有着孤独的生活，想象着那些不可能的事物，让他们与我们作伴……他们令人留恋，但走出这些想象或是我们拥抱现实的唯一方法。
我们固然不愿意再孤单一人，而孤单也总是会来……这或许就是人生的一部分，它让我们好好去爱所爱的人，让我们的回忆无比珍贵。还能让我们找到从未遇见的东西……外面有一个更大的世界。
有些事物注定会伴随我们，也有些注定会离开……
人生难免有遗憾，那些我们错过的机会，那些小意外，和我们所有未竟的愿望……
是的，它们是我们的遗憾……可是它们让我们拥有了现在的一切。
而这一切……无论用什么都换不走。

Gao Kan的《寻找天堂》作为《去月球》的续作，用简单的制作工具，朴素的画面和动人的剧情及绝佳的BGM再一次向我们诠释了游戏作为第九艺术的魅力所在。

Quando iniciei esse jogo fui com uma expectativa muito alta. Tendo sido fã de To the moon, e jogado e me emocionado com todos os jogos desse autor até o momento, não via a hora de jogar a sequência... e confesso que no começo duvidei da capacidade da história me comover.  
A motivação do personagem principal a princípio não me parecia algo interessante, parecia no mínimo simples demais. Mas eu estava errado, não que a história não fosse simples, na verdade achei o tema de Finding Paradise muito mais cotidiano e simples que To the moon, mas mesmo sendo simples a história ultrapassou o limite do interessante, deu outra lição de vida, me emocionou mais uma vez e, mais que isso, justamente por ser um tema cotidiano atingiu forte e foi de encontro aos momentos pelos quais passo na vida.
Acho que mais que To the moon, Finding Paradise é uma história que toca em pontos que atingem qualquer pessoa que já viveu um pouco na Terra. Ter o jogado, de certa forma, contribuiu para mexer um pouco em como eu vejo minha própria vida e acredito que muitos se sentirão assim também.
Além disso só tenho a dizer que as referências foram mais uma vez surpreendentes e sensacionais e a música é parte do que torna o jogo tão emocionante, é algo tão importante, mas tão importante no jogo, que joga-lo sem a música não causa 1/5 do impacto que o jogo causa. Impressionante como os sentimentos dos personagens são captados e expressos através das músicas do jogo.
Overall: 10/10

38386965.review:
Is it good? Definitely.

Is it better than "To The Moon"? It depends.

If you're looking for a good shedding of tears, "To The Moon" provides the much necessary chopping of onions type of story to have a good cry. "Finding Paradise" does not share that sentiment.

In "Finding Paradise", you will find more scenes that will make you laugh, with the witty banter between the two player characters, the numerous video game and movie references (Even "The Godfather" makes an appearance), and the insanely fun scenarios and mini-games our heroes find themselves in along the journey.

While it is good fun, it doesn't tell a story with the same impact as "To The Moon" did. The plot is fairly disjointed in places, and pacing got really rushed in the last two hours.

Still, it is a story worth playing, especially for the price. Credits to Kan Gao and the Freebird team for yet another great game, and here's hoping for more from them in the near future.

38384717.review:
Recently I've been in not a very good place in my life, despite what it might seem from the outside point of view.
I still remember how shockingly moving was my experience of playing through To the Moon, and that was the reason I decided to hold this one for a while until I get at least a little bit better, taking into consideration that it might have been a trigger to get even worse.
Needless to say, I failed miserably, and feeling extremely down, I decided to stay in for the day and play through the whole game, which took me about 5 hours of gameplay and 1.5 hours of staring at the screen and listening to the beautiful music.
This story is different, while still being very emotional and personal, although from another perspective. The storytelling mastery of Kan Gao, paired with his touching piano and cello tunes, is still working wonders to gamers with empathy. I fell in love with the characters rather quickly, and by the moment of saying goodbye to them it got... well, emotional on a rather personal level. 
The important thing about this one is that while still being able to make you tear up a bit, it can also give you hope, if you're responsive to the thought that's central to the plot of Colin's story. It can make the shadows around you seem a little bit less dark and everlasting. It can make you think that we are indeed the writers of our stories, and there still are a lot of wonderful things interlaced into our lives.
Thank you, Reives, for making me believe that everything will be alright, even if it's just for a moment.

38384647.review: Sin palabras. La historia, la música, los personajes. Una obra maestra. En mi opinión supera a To The Moon, que ya me parecía un juego excelente.

38384431.review:
Когда я впервые услышала о том, что Кан Гао приступил к разработке продолжения To the moon, я, признаться, запаниковала. Потому что когда автор выдает шедевр...по чистой случайности - то есть он просто написал то, что считает нужным и люди это принимают - это одно. А продолжение - когда люди от тебя ждут повторение твоего шедевра - это другое. Когда ты пишешь в свое удовольствие - шедевр получить проще, чем когда от тебя люди уже будут чего то ожидать...

Начиная игру я постоянно думала, что где то подвох. Не верила, что будет так же, как с To the moon. Потому что когда я играла в To the moon я вообще ничего от нее не ждала. Но она оказалась одной из самых мощнейших игр на моей памяти. Мне до сих пор хочется сочувствовать тем людям, которые ее не прочувствовали.

За Finding Paradise я садилась в полной готовности придираться ко всем и до середины игры у меня это вполне получалось. Не то, чтоб там было к чему придираться, но мне казалось, что все развивается не в том ключе...Я не ставила перед собой задачу испортить себе впечатление, просто я очень настороженно отнеслась к этой игре. Потому что я боялась, что после To the moon ничего хорошего не выйдет.

Резюмируя: это не To the moon. Но у них снова все получилось. Не знаю как, но получилось. На титрах хочется как после хорошего кино встать и аплодировать авторам. Игра шедевральна. Наверное можно найти какие то недочеты, но, честно, после концовки не хочется их искать. Нижайший поклон за такие игры, их сейчас очень мало.

38383997.review:
Six Years ago, FreeBirdGames gave us To the Moon. An experience that many of us remember as the emotional roller coaster that brought tears to our eyes. And now, 6 years later, we've been given it's sequel, Finding Paradise.

"Was it worth the wait?" "Is it the sequel we've been hoping for?" "Is it better than To the Moon?"

It's hard to give an unbiased answer to these questions.
"Hitting close to home," is what I think made To the Moon so successful. It pains me to say that Finding Paradise did not have the same impact on me as To the Moon did. "So it's a miss?"

Hell no.
Finding Paradise still packs quite the emotional punch. FreeBirdGames sends us off on yet another wild ride. And all though to me it's not as impactful as To the Moon, it is a memorable ride nonetheless.

So, to answer those previous questions.
"Yes," "yes" and "you'll just have to find out yourself."

38383725.review:
He aquí la continuación oficial de "To The Moon" (con permiso de los minisodes y A Bird Story) donde la Dra. Rosalene y el Dr. Watts prosiguen sus andanzas. Sorprendentemente el señor Kan Gao ha conseguido mejorar en casi todos los aspectos que componen el título de una forma considerable. Mayor variedad de escenarios y diseños, efectos, animaciones y minijuegos, todo mucho más natural y diverso donde se hace patente el mayor esfuerzo de la puesta en escena. Además de una genial banda sonora, como no podía ser de otra manera.

Lamentablemente no ha sido posible siquiera acercarse al nivel de la historia del juego original, lo cual sin embargo no me sorprende ya que el listón estaba demasiado alto. Y eso que es una historia mucho más rica y elaborada, pero no consiguió despertar en mí sensaciones similares. No obstante es muy buena, pero por obvias razones no entraré en detalles para justificarlo. Realmente si te gustó el estilo de su autor esta entrega es compra obligada porque está más que presente, y vuelvo a repetir que además continúa la historia secundaria de nuestros intrépidos doctores de Sigmund Corp, que no es más que otro incentivo a tener en cuenta.

Una pena que aún esté en inglés, pero imagino que es algo que cambiará eventualmente como ocurrió con To The Moon.

38382604.review:
Эта игра первая, которую: я купил без скидки, которую я купил на следующий день релиза, которую я ждал и реально обрадовался когда увидел её тизер и это первая игра, на которую я решился написать обзор.

Рассказывать, о чём эта игра я смысла не вижу, ибо об этом уже в других обзорах предостаточно написали, в крайнем случае через переводчик описание игры пропустите, поэтому скажу сразу: эта игра великолепна и стоила каждого дня ожидания. 5 лет это довольно немалый срок скажу я вам.Ну ладно, не буду врать. Я ждал только 4.

По мне, довольно таки нудно каждый раз решать головоломки, однако без них тоже нельзя, тык что к минусу я их отнести не могу. Многовато ходьбы, но спустя какое-то время прохождения бесить перестаёт. Красивейшие локации, по которым видно сколько много в них вложено сил. 

Сюжет просто великолепен. Даже придраться ни к чему не получается. Хорошо гармонирует и смешные, которые реально  разбавляют сюжет игры, и печальные моменты, которые меня заставили сидеть с платком в руках последний час, ну или около того, ибо проходил я её тупо на одном дыхании все 7 часов не вставая. и не обращая внимания на время.

Музыка это просто что-то с чем-то. Кто то говорит что не так цепляет, как саундтрек To The Moon, однако меня наоборот больше зацепил саундтрек именно FP. Ну не знаю чем. Просто мне лично он показался интереснее что ли. 

Цена игры на мой взгляд слишком низкая. Вторую копию купить что-ли, а то стыдно даже всего 200 рублей за такую игру отдавать. Я уж калаш свой из контры за косарь продал за неделю до выхода.

Забыл добавить: Перед прохождением обязательно пройдите To The Moon и A Bird Story (вот её прям обязательно, ибо является частью сюжета, маленькой, конечно, но тем не менее; стоит всего 100 рублей, а сейчас вообще за 19 рублей купить можно, да и проходится за час)

Итог: 11/10. Шедевр. Ниже оценку назвать язык не поворачивается.
Если с английским не очень, то подождите выход русского языка, разработка которого кстати сейчас идёт, Ибо в игре столько реплик и диалогов, что вы устанете лазить в переводчик.
Надеюсь, что следующая часть хотя бы на год раньше выйдет, а то я помру от ожидания.

38382585.review: Haven't finished it yet, but the soundtrack is fantastic (on par with To the Moon), the writing is still excellent, the animation updates are cute and add a new level of richness to the game. Well worth the money and well worth the wait.

38382504.review:
Non credo che starò molto qui a descrivere questo gioco... No, questa storia.
Alla fine dei titoli di coda, mi ritrovo per l'ennesima volta con questo vortice di emozioni: sono commosso, sono triste, sono felice, sono impaurito. Kan e il suo team sono riusciti a creare qualcosa che... mi sento di dire, è al pari di To The Moon. Il desiderio di Colin è qualcosa che mi fa commuovere solo pensandoci, il colpo di scena, anche se alcuni lo potrebbero definire prevedibile, porta con sè molta più "azione" di quello del sequel. Ho pianto. Tanto e tante volte.
La colonna sonora merita una recensione a sè, anche se non è agli standard da capolavoro del soundtrack di To The Moon, ma contiene più musiche da sottofondo di musiche memorabili, e mi ha fatto venire un sussulto quando mi sono accorto che avevano ripescato una delle musiche più belle nei giochi di Freebird Games separati dalla saga della Sigmund. Il contributo di Laura Shigihara (che ormai credo sarà una costante in questa saga) più che soddisfa le aspettative.

Commento finale: che ci fate ancora qui? Costa quanto un biglietto per il cinema ed è molto più bello di molti film nella storia della cinematografia.
