38381319.review:
A highly anticipated game.
More of a moving around to see the story kind of game with some item collecting and mini-puzzle solving mechanics.

Coming into this having an expectation of a tear-jearking story, it didn't disappoint.
Comparing to its predecessor, To The Moon, it draws on the same plot of resolving a dying man's last wish and follows on an emotional filled journey with a twist.
However, it falls a little below the standard set by the plot of To The Moon.

HOWEVER, it is by no means a lousy story.
The plot flows well and the simple twist is fits well and doesn't seem forced upon. The whole premise of the plot hinted and revolves around the twist, and eventually resolves it in a sad, touching and emotional way.

Definitely an emotional ride worthy of being a successor to To The Moon.

Experience: 10/10
Tear-jerking 8/10 (Still relatively good, but not quite To The Moon standard) 
Gameplay Mechanics: 6/10 (It's RPG Maker)

OVERALL: 10/10 (When a story is worth it, and the gameplay doesn't deter me, it is a straight 10.. or close. Haha)

38381310.review:
《Finding Paradise》和《to the moon》一样，都是让人笑中带泪的作品，字幕组potato和tudou的梗真是66666，还有换战衣的梗。一个解密游戏中夹杂着回合制rpg、射击类游戏、还有街机游戏真是让人眼前一亮，不过这次穿越时候的解密小游戏没有《to the moon》那个拼图有趣了。
撇开这次主线不谈，制作组真的挖了很大的坑，Dr. Rosalene和Dr. Watts的情感线真的令人在意呢！！！结合之前《to the moon》的dlc，我觉得又是一个情感大戏。这里提供下猜测。《Finding Paradise》里暴露出Dr. Watts身体不好的事实，之前的dlc最后eva又带个头盔在帮Dr. Watts，之后可能Dr. Watts要先走一步了，而且《to the moon》的dlc电源又被Dr. Watts操作过两次，莫名其妙的脚印，可能Dr. Watts也有一个像faye（法爷hhh）的人格存在，一个喜欢单独待着的孤僻性格，一个喜欢凑热闹在圣诞跟公司里人玩的很high的人格。看《Finding Paradise》里面Dr. Rosalene和Dr. Watts也是青梅竹马，觉得越来越期待这部虐心大剧了。
9/10

38380886.review: 第一时间入手了《寻找天堂》，甚至都赶上了原价36块囧rz。不算第一时间玩完吧，断断续续又寻寻觅觅的，甚至连结局第一次都没亲手玩到，是在女流的直播里收看的。当然之后还是自己完整地玩完了这部作品，感触良多。音乐实在是太棒了，好几次都停留在Colin的某个记忆片段里舍不得继续，人物的刻画，主要是我们的老朋友Eva和Neil，更加细致了，好多彩蛋也让人会心一笑。至于剧情，剧情是不能说的东西，我不敢保证你是否会期待下一部，但我觉得你也许会去寻找上几部，总而言之，这一切都值得。

38380760.review:
I'm now faced with one of the biggest dillemas of my life: I thought nothing could take To The Moon's spot as my favorite game, but... this.

This was stunning. For fans of the series (which you all should be), it had all the twists and layered stories you'd come to grow suspicious of and anticipated. If you haven't played the Christmas Minisodes, do it. A Bird Story too. This game stood on its own yet made enough references to the previous games to have me wildly grinning throughout... all of it, pretty much. 

I came into this trying desperately to lower my expecatations so as to not 'overhype' and be let down. I failed miserably on the 'lowering' front, but as I'm writing this review literally moments after finishing, I can definitely say that I surpassed even my loftiest expectations (To the Moon has an incredibly special place in my heart). Worth the 6 years. Kan Gao, you are an artist, and inspired me in more ways than you could imagine. I'm now a highly focused and years-in-practice Indie Dev with a focus on story, and I can definitely say this series was my main inspiration. Thank you.

[spoiler] Also, flat out, I thought I cried at To the Moon and 'teared up' at Undertale's True Pacifist ending, but the game's been over for a few minutes now and I'm still just openly weeping at midnight. I don't even know what more to say at this point. [/spoiler]

I thought Pixar overdid themselves by mking me tears up over Bing Bong, but nope, this freaking game managed to make me legit bawl and cry like a newborn baby who was just slapped in the butt and has no clue on what is happening. Anyway, super recomend it, 10/10, would play again

38380225.review:
这是一款让你知道并相信游戏是第九艺术的作品，换做其他任何一种艺术表现形式都无法呈现给玩家如此细腻的情感体验。

这是一款能让你记住的游戏，应该说Kan Gao的三部曲是能让你记住的一个游戏系列。

这是一款由强大的剧情和音乐撑起的游戏，能让你找到很多情感共鸣的游戏，一款只有短短几个小时流程的游戏，却能让你内心获得巨大的满足和充实，个人认为更适合比较感性的童鞋尝试一下。

去月球和寻找天堂能看到自己以前太多的影子，当初玩去月球的时候让我很感动，但玩了这么多年游戏，只有Finding Paradise让我哭成狗，这两年变得越来越感性，泪点越来越低了；短短几个小时作为一个旁观者去体验一遍别人的人生，那种感觉很棒，真的很棒，就像是在看以前和未来的自己；如果我以后老了，童年阶段的仙剑98是可以让我记住一辈的游戏，那么Kan Gao的三部曲是我青年阶段让我能记住一辈子的游戏之一。这种感觉可以让你在未来人生的任何阶段，打开游戏都能体验到最初的感动。

不管是剧情，音乐还是游戏性，带给玩家丰富的情感体验才是最重要的。

游戏解锁当天就立马打通了，第二幕的剧情有些拖沓，不太连贯，没有去月球的叙事那样一气喝成，却不失为一款好游戏，虽然它并不好玩。（A Bird Story是Finding Paradise的前传，配合食用更佳）

38380044.review:
自打你记事起，你总会觉得孤独。虽然有父母的陪伴，你还是觉得孤独。

父母并非不爱你，他们给了你所有你想要的东西，唯独给不了的是心灵上对于孤独的慰藉。物质上的关爱并不能走进你的心，你总是觉得没有人真的理解你，虽然你理解你的父母。

有时候你会羡慕那些有很多“好朋友”的家伙，因为在他们遇到困难的时候，心情低落的时候，总会有人来陪伴他们。而你，除了父母什么都没有。

俗话说人长时间处于一种情况下就会变得习惯，久而久之在成长的历程中，你已经渐渐习惯了这种孤独。既然没有朋友，没有人关心自己，理解自己，没有人真正的和自己说心里话，那就自己跟自己说吧。

遇到了困难，自己给自己打气。
心情失落时，自己为自己排解。
想哭的时候，自己找途径发泄。

只有自己最了解自己，尽管如此你也渐渐的适应了过来。

长时间自己跟自己的对话，时常让你有所幻想：“如果我也有那么一个知心朋友就好了啊。“

如果有一个知心朋友就好了，最好是个女孩，“她”长得好看，可爱，很酷的那种，最好是邻家少女，青梅竹马，开朗，爱笑，善解人意，愿意主动找不善言谈的你说话，愿意推动话题前进，不会给你太多尴尬，你们的对话总是会充满着阳光。

在你遇事不决的时候，“她”会给你出主意；在你失落的时候，“她”会鼓励你；在你迷茫的时候，“她”会一语惊醒梦中的你。

然而这么一个“她”并不存在，尽管如此孤独的你还是会想，如果有“她”就好了。

如果有“她”就好了……在你某次“自我对话”的时候，你渐渐在心中塑造出了“她”的影子。

“她”开始变得越来越真实，孤独的你开始幻想出自己真的有那么一个知心朋友，那就是“她”。

自己不再需要给自己打气，因为有“她”。
自己不再需要为自己排解，因为有“她”。
自己不再需要憋闷气在心，因为有“她”。

尽管没有人知道“她”的存在，但是你知道，“她”是你最好的朋友，“她”知道你的一切，像是镜子里的另一个你，你们亲密无间。

在你于是不决的时候，你总会想起“她”，你会去征求“她”的意见，而“她”也总是会给你很多有益的建议。

你总觉得“她”改变了你的人生，“她”为你指点了一条美好的人生道路，而你照着这条道路走了下去。你对“她”有着那么一丝感激。

而在这时的某一天，“她”不见了，而你也明白，“她”是你创造出来的，从今往后自己需要独挡一面，而“她”也不再被需要了。

渐渐的你结婚，生子，度过了幸福的一生，在你人生的最后，你时常会想起一个问题：“我这辈子还有什么可后悔的呢？”

仔细想想后悔的地方还是挺多的，如果当初你选择了不同的专业，如果当初你没有错过某个漂亮的姑娘，如果当初你买彩票换一个数字，如果当初某次决定性考试你多检查一遍……或许一切就会有很多不一样的结果。

但是有时候看看现在的生活，想了一下自己的一辈子，过的似乎也不算坏。你不确定如果当初自己的人生轨迹改变了，是比现在更好，还是更糟。但是无论怎么想，都觉得自己这辈子不算完美，每个人心中都有一个“理想的生活”，可以称之为终极目标或“乐园”，而自己现在的日子虽然不差吧，但总是有那么点残缺。

所以你有点矛盾，你又想起了“她”，自己当初的是听了“她”的话才走上了现在的道路，自己似乎没有主动做出过什么真正属于自己的决定。

最终“她”还是出现了，在你的面前，对你说出了“她”自己的想法：

“其实所有的决定都是你自己做的。“
”你知道自己需要怎么做，你知道自己的人生应该如何，你知道自己缺乏什么，你知道自己应该做什么选择。“
”你只是需要一个像我这样的人，陪着你，为你提出建议，所以你创造出了我。“
”我是你创造出来的幻想，我给你的建议，其实还是你自己的想法。“
”我离开你是因为需要你分清楚现实与虚幻，你不需要沉溺于虚幻的我，因为现实中还有更多你需要去享受的东西。“

你想了想还是笑了，也渐渐的明白了，也开始释怀了。

在你生命的终点，“她”再次来到你的面前。

”你的人生，还有什么可后悔的吗？“
”啊，后悔的地方挺多的，我这辈子很多事儿都没尝试过呢～“你笑着说，“但是呢……这样也不坏。”
“如果我选择了不同的道路，也就不会有现在的自己，以及自己拥有的一切了，每个人心中都有一个完美的乐园，但是盲目的追求完美或许会让人总是充满遗憾，人生不能活在后悔里，至少我度过了幸福的一生。”

生命画上了句点，幸福的一生就此结束，寻找了一辈子的完美的乐园，也许也仅仅是抱有不完美的心态才能得到吧。

-------------------------------

Finding Paradise 作为 To the Moon 的续篇，和前作风格基本一致。

只不过这一作在中段展开有点“日系 Gal”的风格，我就说白了吧特别像 Chaos Head 和 Chaos Child，整体不是一个感人故事，而是一个让你反思人生的故事，如果是独生子女的话或许更容易理解。

而且比起一般的 AVG，本作加了很多有趣的系统，包括战斗部分，非常有新意。

音乐一如既往的高标准，明明是 RPG Maker 做出来的游戏，却在演出效果上打爆很多“大制作的 AVG”，我第一次见到 RPG Maker 里的小人儿动作这么丰富。

支持 Linux / OSX / Windows 三平台还自带中文翻译，可谓非常良心了。

如果说缺点的话有两个，一个是这游戏默认速度被刻意放慢，会让人觉得“特别卡”，体验不好。另一个就是汉化的感觉不是特别好，玩了 10 分钟汉化版回去玩英文版了，个人建议还是有条件玩英文版吧，冷幽默段子也是很有趣的。

38378157.review:
What can I say about such a beautiful game? 

On top of it's brilliant narrative and captivating emotional music, Kan Gao is a talented creator who knows how to utilise a given platform to its fullest and allowing its audience to perceive and experience storytelling in a completely unique way. 

Having played To The Moon before, I (naturally) had high expectations of its sequel, Finding Paradise, and am delighted to say that this game has surpassed my expectations. A usual wary and cynic of "sequels" of any kind, I can confidently state that Kan Gao brought twists and humourous additions to the rather linear storyline we have seen back in To The Moon. This combination of humour, action, music, and some mystery (what is UP with Neil?) fills the table with a plethora of emotion for the player to experience as they go through the game. 

Utterly magical. Thank you.

38378095.review:
徐徐经过了COLIN的一生，最后到结局时，看着窗户对面的F说我其实一直陪着你，很多细节都浮现在眼前，眼泪也控制不住的爆发。
       整个游戏叙事过程就有本事是如此平铺直叙，缓缓道来，最后却层层叠加在一起，化为汹涌的感情。可见游戏制作的细节多么有功力。
       F为了Colin选择了消失令我感动（这却又是因为现实改变的发生的映射），可是Colin知道这一切但正是因为没有F，他才难以真正幸福。虽然这只是C自己脑子中的事情，但其中的情感如此令人动容，为之泪下。
      最后我也明白了Colin那句就让一切原样发生吧的意思，当博士让他的记忆回到之前时 ，他的愿望就达到了，那就是再次见到F
       你们感受到了吗？Colin那句没有说出口的话，虽然，你教导我要面对现实，但是我真的好想你。
      这个游戏让我想起《美丽心灵》，同样是描述精神分裂症患者，这个游戏主要表达的是爱的成分，感谢作者

38378009.review: Much like To the Moon, Finding Paradise is an unique experience. Giving you both laugh and moments of crying, it is masterpiece in it's full form: humour, story, music, even graphic. I don't know if there is much to say about this gem more, without going into spoilers, because well, let's be real, it is more of a interactive film than game, you do not actually "play it" but you "experience it". One thing that worries me so much is that there was 6 year break between To the Moon and Finding Paradise (with two minisodes and A Bird Story between them, but those were short ones), and with tension built towards ending of trilogy perhaps, I'm sad to wait another 6 years. But neverthless, I was happy to experience To the Moon when I was 16, I am now happy that I have experienced Finding Paradise at the age of 19, I will be more then happy to experience Episode 3 even aged 30. A big "thank you" to Kan, Laura and whole Freebirds crew, those were money well spend and I enjoyed every bit of it. If you liked To the Moon, or if you like story driven games, and graphic is not neccesarily a big factor for you, buy this game, play it. It is short, but emotions it gives are worth 10x more than that. Again, thank you.

38377107.review:
[i]И ведь не подобрать варианта лучше для первого отзыва.[/i] 

За новостями о сиквеле я следила примерно с того же момента, как, собственно, и познакомилась с оригинальной игрой [b]To the Moon[/b] (то было, насколько помню, в далёком 2014 году), однако совсем недавний релиз продолжения под названием [b]Finding Paradise[/b] всё равно как-то умудрился выбить из рутинной колеи, оказавшись для меня не просто огромным, но и по-настоящему радостным, приятным сюрпризом. Я не питала никаких больших ожиданий, ровно как и не настраивалась заранее на худшее, просто знала — игра меня ни в коей степени не разочарует. Стоит ли говорить, что так оно и вышло?

Первое и самое важное, о чём хочется сказать, это, конечно же, сюжетная составляющая. Пускаться в дословный пересказ официального синопсиса бессмысленно, копать глубже, вытаскивая на поверхность всё-всё, что лучше хотя бы единожды испытать самому, нежели услышать много раз от кого-то постороннего, также незачем, поэтому, если вкратце и без спойлеров: планка, заданная предшествующей частью, выдержана на все сто процентов. История, обернувшаяся для знакомых нам д-ра Розалин и д-ра Уоттса очередным непростым дельцем, по-прежнему сильная, трогательная, искренняя; она увлекает, она затягивает, она так или иначе цепляет. В ней найдётся место и для смеха (уж чего-чего, а искромётных шуточек в Finding Paradise — хоть отбавляй), и для крокодильих — без каких-либо преувеличений — слёз. Одно разбавляет другое, второе создаёт яркий, насыщенный контраст с первым, и всё это выполнено настолько грамотно, на таком головокружительно высоком уровне, что не заворожиться происходящим на экране действительно сложно. Дополняют повествование и живые, интересные персонажи, и простые, но душевные, непринуждённые, [i]правильные[/i] диалоги, и отличнейший саундтрек, который — нет никаких сомнений — запомнится ещё надолго (к слову, приятно было услышать мелодии, "перекочевавшие" в Finding Paradise из всеми любимого первого эпизода, а также главную тему [b]The Mirror Lied[/b], ничего не скажешь — вписались более, чем органично), и визуально красивая, аккуратная картинка с прекраснейшей анимацией. Много отсылок на To the Moon — где забавных, где, чего уж там греха таить, пробивающих на слезу, в любом случае, это не может не вызвать ностальгической улыбки, за что и хочется сказать отдельное спасибо. Как и в оригинальной игре, своя доля абсурда и нечто жутковатого, пугающего также присутствует, и всё это в совокупности выглядит довольно-таки уместно, не отвлекая от самой истории. Геймплей, в свою очередь, не претерпел каких-либо кардинальных изменений, что могли бы преобразить его до неузнаваемости, но всё же в той или иной степени разнообразился: например, головоломки со сбором мементо приняли несколько иной вид, хоть и не превратились в серьёзные паззлы, над которыми наверняка бы пришлось ломать голову долгое, долгое время, также игровой процесс дополнили всевозможными мини-играми, и... Правда, это было глотком свежего воздуха, пусть Finding Paradise и не потеряла бы ровным счётом ничего без таких вот мелких, но приятных нововведений. По атмосфере сиквел максимально приближён к To the Moon, но что самое главное — игра всё равно не заставит вас скучать. У вас не возникнет мысли: "О, где-то я уже видел подобное!". Проходится на одном дыхании; её интересно изучать, несмотря ни на что.

В целом, история Колина тронула меня гораздо сильнее истории Джонни и Ривер, чего стоит одна лишь концовка... С другой же стороны, как по мне, Finding Paradise ни хуже, ни лучше оригинальной To the Moon — она абсолютно такая же, только немного в другой обёртке. Да и, как говорится, каждому своё. Но что вводит в ещё больший восторг, так это то, как сплелись воедино сюжетные линии двух основных частей игры, а также рождественских мини-эпизодов, с огромным намёком на продолжение. Финал не поставил жирную точку  — только интригующее многоточие. Буквально. 

Что ж, с нетерпением будем ждать возвращения Евы и Нила, а пока...

Спасибо за то чудесное время, что я провела в игре.

Определённо перепройду с выходом русификатора. И не раз.

38374594.review:
Oh my.

TL;DR: THIS GAME IS AMAZING, GO PLAY IT NOW! GOTY 2017!!!

When I played To The Moon all those years ago, I teared up. The story, the simple yet beautiful retro graphics, THE MUSIC. I knew that it was a very special game that could not be duplicated. I didn't think that FreeBird themselves could make anything of that calibre again. Even to this day, It's a personal favourite. 

A Bird Story proved me utterly, utterly wrong. Using the same graphics and amazing music, It made an amazing and thought-provoking story with no words. And I too, had NO WORDS when playing it. 

And now this, the gem in the crown. Where do I start? 

The graphics? They're just the same as always, they look retro, yet add themselves very well to the game. They are simplistic, but they take the best of To The Moon and A Bird Story and consolidate them into something that is visually stunning without trying hard. The visual effects look amazing, and they really mold well with the retro aesthetic. I honestly don't know how they could be made better.

The Music?
It is, once again, outstanding. Kan uses the same classical theme that worked so amazingly with the two previous games, but it is somehow better this time around. It conveys the same emotion without appearing out of place. Anyone that has played To The Moon or A Bird Story will notice that some of the tracks are remixes from those games, giving the game a nice, familiar feel in some of the segments. I can't wait for the OST to be released. 

But how could I forget, the story!
What am I meant to say? It's made by Freebird, so it is good of it's own admission. I think that this is one of the only 'Indie' games of this year to succeed in creating a story that is both captivating and worthy of tears. 
The game might only be around 5 hours long, but in those 5 hours there is so much amazing story that it ends up being better than RPGs that are twice, or even 4 times as long. The story is a masterpiece, laced with just the right amount of humour (Which I really was looking forward to), emotion and thought-provokingness. It manages to stay within the world that the previous games had created, making little references to them and building on what has already been established. But it avoids the 'Electric Boogaloo' trap, making sure that it doesn't hang in the dogma of the previous games, but is equal or surpasses them. And believe me, this is one story that you really, REALLY don't want to not see. I cried unbelievably hard, I laughed my head off, and left the game feeling better and stronger than before I pressed play.
Go in blind without any expectations, and this game will not disappoint.

Just as with the earlier games, my only complaint is that you can only really 'Play' a Freebird game once before the initial amazingness is lost. It's one of those RPGs that are so good, you can't really replay with the same effect, but personally I think that's quite beautiful in a way. 
If Sigmund really do exist, I hope they can just erase my memory of playing the game so I'm able to play it over and over again as if it was new. But, don't be sad that the game is finished, be happy because you were there to experience it. When the credits are rolling, you'll have found Paradise.

So, I can say without a doubt that Finding Paradise is my game of the year for 2017, or possibly for longer than that. Have a merry christmas Freebird, and we'll see what you have in store in the coming years!

如果前一作是讲述了爱情，那么这作大概讲述了一个男孩子的成长吧。
小时候我也是个沉默寡言的人，所以一开始看到主角童年时的记忆，就隐隐约约猜到了FAYE可能是主角的幻想伙伴——游戏里也许有夸大的成分，但是对我们每一个人来说，FAYE可能正是我们心里那一块小世界，人的情绪会保护自己，不断自我鼓励，不断向前，然而人总是要长大，主角会遇到他人生中的另一半，总有一天他得从自己的小世界走出去，迎向新的人生，到那个时候，FAYE的存在也就没有必要了。
走出第一步是痛苦的，成长毕竟是要有代价的。
长大的主角有了更美好的牵挂，但心里也缺了那一块，空空落落的，好像忘记了什么，就像是那些琐碎的遗憾一样，藏进了记忆深处。
随着年纪的增长，遗憾越来越深，就想Sofia所说的那样，我们的一生很短暂，总会选择那么一条让自己满意的路，然后继续走下去。主角也许是走到了终点，也许是回头时那样一瞥，想起了FAYE那时跟自己说的话，一生那么漫长，他有那么多话想和FAYE说，可是却怎么也找不到了。不是说好了吗，那个时候说，要在最后把自己的人生慢慢讲给你听的。
最后，主角来到了男女主的公司。
也许，他正是希望能借助男女主之手，重新找回曾经的自己，找到那种失落的感觉吧。
索性游戏把最后的画面放出来了，不然如果男女主从机器里出来故事就结束了，可能我心里也会空空落落的，成为一个永远的遗憾。
然而，好的游戏总是伴随着意外——
因为自己愚蠢地低了一下头，错失了最后的主角亲吻sofia和Sofia亲吻主角的画面！！！
啊啊啊啊！
感觉受到了百万吨伤害！
我觉得我需要玩个巴西烤肉王去找人质谈谈人生。

38371921.review:
Spoiler-free.

This is a difficult review to write because I feel rather conflicted about the game at the moment. Ultimately it comes down to the question, "Do I recommend Finding Paradise?"

...................Yes. Very reluctantly, yes.

First and foremost, Finding Paradise is every bit a sequel to To The Moon. While the game stands on its own, it is a continuing story and you will be doing yourself a disservice by jumping into the series anywhere but the beginning. 

The game is very much like its predecessor in formula and presentation. Having played the first one recently, it feels like I've barely even left and have started up on the next chapter. If you want more of the same, that is exactly what you can expect.

........with one exception, unfortunately. Unlike the first game, the core subject matter of this one is, in a word, silly. It is very difficult to relate to the plight of the central character, and while it is presented with every bit as much sentimentality and poignancy as the first game, the lack of relatability and gravity makes it fall emotionally flat. It almost feels as if the author wanted a huge plot twist more than he wanted a relatable story, and that's just what we're left with.

The writing still has quite a lot of wit, charm and touches of humor, and combined with the excellent soundtrack, made this an overall enjoyable experience. 

I do very much look forward to the continuation of this series.

文字是苍白的，不管你是谁，我把这款游戏推荐给你，不为赚取你的几滴清泪，只为引发你对人生的思考。

38371727.review:
Если сравнивать Finding Paradise, то в итоге имеем:
[list]
    [*]Музыкальное сопровождение — всё также на уровне. Хотя, лично меня, треки из To The Moon зацепили больше при первом прохождении, возможно, потому что некоторая часть саундтреков из Finding Paradise взяты из To The Moon и уже немного приелись. Да и главная тема To The Moon "For River" мне больше понравилась.
    [*]Юмор — всё также хорош.
    [*]Паззлы — всё такие же дурацкие и скорее для разбавки сюжета, нежели как полноценный элемент геймплея.
    [*]Слезливых моментов стало поменьше, наверное, из-за специфики сюжета.
    [*]Сам сюжет — ну, начало, лично мне, показалось довольно скучноватым. Но где-то через минут 30 геймплея уже становится интересно. И в целом, концовка мне пришлась больше по душе, чем в To The Moon.
[/list]

В общем, рекомендую игру к прохождению, однако лучше всё же дождаться выхода русского перевода, иначе придётся часто лезть в переводчики, да и некоторые моменты даже с ними могут быть не совсем понятны.

I can say with confidence - I LOVE THIS GAME WITH ALL HEART. She is 100% perfect. Please buy it. You will not regret, i swear.

38370336.review:
I replayed TTM roughly 3 times, and watched several Youtuber's playthrough on it. So the hype when I learned Finding Paradise is going to be released is huge.
To be honest, like a lot of people I was more or less expecting similar experience as TTM. And if you are expecting another TTM, you might not end up liking this game.

Because this game isn't TTM. This game if Finding Paradise. And I don't think it's fair to compare this game to its predecessor.

Things I like about this game:
[list]
[*] Soundtrack is beautiful as usual <3 Can't wait for it to be for sale
[*] More cutscenes and CG!
[*] The humors dropped in throughout the game, whether it be doctors' banters or the [spoiler]overactive imagination to the situation.[/spoiler] [spoiler]I laughed so hard at the Godfather reference even though I knew it was coming [/spoiler] 
[*] This game is like the love child of [spoiler]Inception[/spoiler] and [spoiler]Fight Club[/spoiler], which are some of my all-time favourite movies
[*] It's really fun to try to solve what's really going on with Colin before the big reveal
[*] This game and Bird Story completes each other, which I think is really cool, especially when [spoiler]I see the green notebook and other items of importance[/spoiler]
[*] I like that this story takes a different approach than TTM in its theme. To me, [spoiler]the punch is spread throughout the story instead of concentrating on the last 10% of the story. I like it. I like it a lot.[/spoiler]
[*] The puzzles are changed up as well, which is another pretty cool thing. It keeps that same element of user interaction and braintease while keeping things fresh and interesting. It's super easy too, which doesn't take away too much time and attention from the story itself
[*] [spoiler]Loved the ending which showed what's happening in Colin's head and the real world at the same time[/spoiler]
[/list]
Things I'm unsure about this game:
[list]
[*] A lot about Act 3 makes me feel like I'm tripping. A lot of the time I'm just like "lol wut" in a confused way
[*] [spoiler]I'm not sure why Colin employed the Sigmund's service. The most reasonable motivation I can come up with right now is because he wants to see Faye again. I think this could be expanded a bit more towards the end... or maybe I should play Bird Story again, because I'm convinced Faye is the bird[/spoiler]
[*] [spoiler]Why do people keep getting married over a cliff xD[/spoiler]
[*] [spoiler]Nooooo don't kick soccer balls near a car[/spoiler]
[/list]

[spoiler]Wait so who's that woman riding away on the bike?[/spoiler]

Anyway, just want to add my own compliments on this already huge pile of praises. Great work! Now to wait for another five years before the next release T_T

[b]Now when can I buy the soundtrack?![/b]

38370223.review: 高瞰能不能解释下为什么原声带要2025年才解锁？

38370094.review:
[h1][i]Finding Paradise[/i][/h1]

[h1]This Review is [i][b][u]Spoiler Free[/u][/b][/i][/h1]

[b]This game is worth more than they're charging for[/b]

Finally. Freakin' [i]Finally[/i].
I have been waiting for [i]years[/i] for [i]Finding Paradise[/i] to release, and it's finally here.
[i]Finding Paradise[/i] is the direct sequel to Freebird Games' smash hit [i]To The Moon[/i], and is just as good. Still just as short, still just as bitter-sweet, [i]Finding Paradise[/i] has the same qualities that made [i]To The Moon[/i] great. 

like I said, I've been waiting for this game for years, and I'm not afraid to admit that I've been known to fanboy a bit, but this game is great. I played it all the way through the night it came out, and have spent the subsequent days obsessively refreshing Freebird Games' Bandcamp page because I want that soundtrack to play at my birthday, my funeral, hell even my wedding. I daresay that I even enjoyed [i]Finding Paradise's[/i] soundtrack more than to [i]To The Moon's[/i].

Once more, Shall we get into the nitty gritty?

[b][u]The Story[/u][/b]
As with [i]To The Moon[/i], [i]Finding Paradise[/i] doesn't just [i]have[/i] a story. It [i]is[/i] a story. It's the same length as [i]To The Moon[/i] (which honestly I find it baffling that they can fit so much emotion into so little time), so it'll net you about four hours. [i]Finding Paradise[/i]'s story conveys a message about being true to yourself, much like [i]To The Moon[/i]'s, and it does so wonderfully.

[i]Finding Paradise[/i] sees the return of our favorite protagonists, Neil Watts and Eva Rosalene along with a couple more familiar faces, helping a new patient fulfill his last wish. This time 'round we're tasked with helping a man named Colin find happiness. Now, that's all I'm going to tell you, becasue telling you much more would just mess with the masterfully crafted flow of the story.

[i]Finding Paradise[/i] is sad, which is good, I like sad, and don't get me wrong, the story is still leagues ahead of what most other games do nowadays, but it wasn't as compelling as [i]To The Moon[/i]'s. I'm gonna repeat myself here: This game's story is [i]great[/i]. On my list  of games an stories that I wish I could both forget to play again, and also never forget ever, this one ranks right behind [i]To The Moon[/i]. I'm saying this to make one thing clear: I'm about to criticize this, but be warned that I'm comparing this to what is, quite possibly, my favorite game, story, whaterver-the-hell-you-want-to-call-it of all time. You have been warned.

[i]Finding paradise[/i]'s story has one big thing that made it fall short of [i]To The Moon[/i]'s, and that's just that it requires a little bit more suspension of disbelief. In a game where you've got a giant megacorp visiting senior citizens to change their memories, it's not gonna be hard to set aside a little bit of logic to enjoy such a wonderful story. This is really the only thing stopping [i]Finding Paradise[/i] from being better than [i]To The Moon[/i], which is saying something.

[b][u]The Gameplay[/u][/b]
Exactly the same as [i]To The Moon[/i]'s, if you're looking for compelling gameplay, you're in the wrong place.


[b][u]The Music[/u][/b]
Don't tell my buddy Tom I said this, but I may just think that [i]Finding Paradise[/i] has better music than [i]To The Moon[/i]. I mean it. [i]Finding Paradise[/i]'s soundtrack adds another layer to [i]To The Moon[/i]'s, and that's for good reason. Where [i]To The Moon[/i] focused on Johnny, who plays piano, [i]Finding Paradise[/i] features [i]two whole new instruments[/i]: Guitar and Cello, becasue there are two characters who play the guitar and cello. Huh, fancy that. 

On top of everything else, Laura Shigihara is back, and better than ever in [i]Finding Paradise[/i], with a lyrical number that rivals [i]Everything's Alright[/i] both musically and emotionally.

If you want to listen to it, you can find it on Bandcamp [url=https://freebirdgames.bandcamp.com/album/finding-paradise-ost-coming-tomorrow]here[/url] or on steam [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/770780/Finding_Paradise_Soundtrack/]here.[/url]


Now, for everybody's favorite section!...

[b][u]Rant[/u][/b]
Jesus H. Christ I swear I screamed like a little girl when I got the email that this game released. I have been waiting for [i]so long[/i] for this, that I bought this the instant I got home, and actually got it [i]before it went on sale[/i]. 

Like I said in the Story section, this game falls a nanometer short of [i]To The Moon[/i], and that is only, [i]only[/i] because it seemingly adds just a [i]tad[/i] more fantasy. And hey, for all I know it could actually happen in real life, so there's that.

/rant

If you're somehow here without having played [i]To The Moon[/i], you can pick it up here:
http://store.steampowered.com/app/206440/
and read my review on it [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/FP42/recommended/206440/]here[/url].

There's a little note in this game to Freebird Games' intermediary game [i]A Bird Story[/i], which you can find here: 
http://store.steampowered.com/app/327410/?snr=1_5_9__412
Keep in mind that you don't have to play this first, though I highly recommend it.




If you enjoy [i]To The Moon[/i] and Laura Shigihara's music, you should also check out her game [i]Rakuen[/i]. It's a lovely game that I thoroughly enjoyed, and you can get it on steam, here:
http://store.steampowered.com/app/559210/
and if you're not sure whether or not it's for you, check out my review on it [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/FP42/recommended/559210/]here.[/url]

38368939.review:
Cette suite de To The Moon est encore une vraie réussite.

Le concept du voyage dans la mémoire d'autrui est toujours, bien sur, au centre de l'intrigue mais le scénario explore à fond ce thème et donnera à réfléchir plusieurs jours après avoir terminé le jeu.
Toujours très fort émotionnellement, le jeu se veut aussi très drôle et, même s'il apporte son lot de larmes, il a quelque chose de magnifique, de tout simplement beau, dans l'histoire qu'il nous narre.

Les graphismes issus de RPG-Maker sont toujours aussi simples, bien que très bien réalisés.
Petit bémol, l'intéraction du joueur avec l'univers sont encore moins présents que dans To The Moon, rendant le jeu encore plus narratif qu'avant (non pas que ça me dérange personnellement).

Bref, si vous avez aimé To The Moon, jetez-vous sur Finding Paradise !

38368922.review:
I don't do these reviews ever. But my god did this game move me to tears even more than To The Moon did. 


DISCLAIMER: Only play if you aren't looking for a full on video game. This is more of an experience than a video game.


Also prepare to cry. If you don't feel anything from this you don't have a soul. 




For those who have never heard of freebird, start with To The Moon. You'll know what you're getting into for cheaper and this is pretty much a sequel though not connected super hard to the first. For those who have played To The Moon and liked it, this is a must buy and it's not close. 

The gameplay is pretty much the same, but the puzzles are improved so you don't get stuck sometimes like I did in To The Moon and just couldn't solve the puzzles without reloading or cheating (cause I'm stupid I know but still). The humor is spot on, and one of the best things about the series overall. For how absolutely heartbreaking the stories are, the humor is always unexpected but is a welcoming sight to keep you going and not just take sob breaks. There are even easter eggs in this one, which I did not expect but did not disappoint. Even the small annoyances that you find in the game that you have to put up with they make jokes out of. 

The delivery is perfect. Not a single thing to hate. Game finishes in roughly 3-4 hours, perfect length so you don't feel like you're wasting time. Plot twists literally everywhere. 


10/10 please have minisodes and sequels.

38368849.review:
2011年去月球发布，一款RPG Maker引擎制作的游戏，像素画，毫无游戏性，却凭出众的剧本，展现了一感人却稍显遗憾的故事。时隔6年，制作人高瞰推出了这部正统续作，寻找天堂；相比前作，寻找天堂绘制了更多的场景、音乐，也融入了更多搞笑元素。
  如果去掉上一部作品，单独看寻找天堂，这是一部优秀的短篇剧情游戏，但是，如果对比上一部去月球，去月球在10分，寻找天堂只能拿5分。
  新作把更多描述放在EVA和Neil两人身上，过于用力玩梗，经常会导致游玩中感情脱节，明明是像素画级作品，却硬是增加多余特效和环节，音乐整体水平与上一作同步，延用了一部分上作的BGM，但新曲很多，缺少For River这样让人印象深刻的曲子，最重要的问题在于剧情，去月球像是一部悬疑小说，一步步铺垫，结尾反转到达剧情高潮，让人控制不住自己的情感，那寻找天堂就像剧中Colin的日记一样，平淡无奇，前中段剧情十分平滑，却在最关键的点上落入俗套，后期展开毫无张力，只能靠加特效找回主线。 盗版通关一次去月球，正版通关一次，次次落泪，反过来通关寻找天堂，只让我感到一脸迷茫，分割的剧情线，毫无关联的两个女主，俗套的反转，多到数不过来的下一部作品的伏笔。
  这是条其实是差评的好评，好评，只是因为我很自律；寻找天堂是一部优秀的作品，一个平平淡淡的故事，但不是我想要那个，去月球2.0，它缺少一个完美却又遗憾的内核。

38368511.review:
First of all: Buy this game.

Second of all: If you haven't played To the Moon, buy both and then play To The Moon as this is the second major chunk in that story.

This, like To The Moon, is a game that hit me on an emotional, relational, intellectual, and even spiritual level. The emotions evoked range from curiosity to dread to joy to amusement to sadness to wonder. This is also one of two or possibly three games that has made me tear up while playing it, with the set also including To The Moon.

While the ending of this story isn't as potentially heart-tugging as the finale of To The Moon, nor does it have as sudden of a twist as its predecessor, this is still a profoundly impactful and well-done title, taking full advantage of the wonderfully done music, beautiful artwork, and finely nuanced scripting.

It's not a perfect form, and it's hard to fully consider this a "game" as much as it is a user-advanced movie set in the RPG Maker engine. You still have the oddities such as identifying random memory objects in a scene or unlocking the next scene via a small mini-game (as well as a few larger minigames near the end that were impressive in implementation, but somewhat annoying).

Still, this form of storytelling works quite well and rewards you immensely if you invest yourself in it and think about it as you experience it, and removing some of the annoyances might make for a less whole experience, so I appreciate the author experimenting with the medium.

While most people will probably point to To The Moon as the superior product of the two major games, I found this title to be perhaps more relatable and, ultimately, potentially more powerful because of that.

Just buy the game and give it your attention. It's about the length of a pair of movies at a fraction of the cost, and it's quite worth the investment of time and attention.

We need more designers like this. We need more games like this.

『To The Moon』の続編で、『A Bird Story』の主人公であったColinが今回の患者となります。
『To The Moon』をプレイしていなくとも、『A Bird Story』はプレイしておいた方がいいと思います。プレイしておいた方が感動の度合いが違います。マジで。1時間くらいで終わるのでおすすめ。
　患者Colinの願いとは、いったいなんなのか。それはプレイしてみて確かめてほしいです。Colinの記憶の中にはFayeという女の子が妻であるSofiaより多く登場します。どちらも可愛いですが私はFayeちゃん推しです。
私が一番楽しみにしていたのは音楽です。前作の『For River』が良すぎたため不安だったのですが今作も素晴らしい出来になっています。キャラクター達がピアノやチェロ、ギターを使って演奏をする非常に素晴らしいものになっています。またLaura　Shigiharaさんも素晴らしい歌声を響かせてくれています。
前作で一瞬だけ出たRPG要素ですが、今作で大幅にパワーアップしていてプレイする人を大いに笑わせてくれます。

38367657.review:
The simplest way I can express my opinion having finished Finding Paradise is to say that I consider this game to be better than its predecessor To the Moon.

The story isn't as tragic, there aren't as many twists, and it isn't as tightly woven. Yet somehow its every damn bit as good.

While To the Moon kept me thinking about Johnny and River's story long after I was finished, Finding Paradise will keep me thinking about my [i]own[/i] story for days to come.  And I can't think of any way to give a story higher praise than that.

Thank you Kan Gao and everyone else who helped make this game a reality.

38367092.review:
自从玩了《to the moon》之后就很喜欢这个系列的作品，虽然《a bird story》过于艺术化，非常抽象，但是我也很喜欢这样的叙事风格，整个故事需要慢慢体会。玩游戏的我仿佛在体验一部系列电影（故事），强烈推荐还没入手的各位从《to the moon》开始，一步步体验这个故事。


之后是剧透，慎入……





“遗憾吗……是啊，我有很多遗憾。但是……已经没关系了。那些我错过的机会，那些小意外和我所有未竟的愿望……是的，它们还是我的遗憾……可它们让我拥有了现在的一切。而我所拥有的一切，无论什么都换不走。”

Faye笑着“……这正是我希望听到的。”

没错，人生多多少少总会有遗憾，但是这些遗憾难道不也是人生里值得珍惜的东西吗？
伴随着音乐，看到这些话，眼眶湿润了。

非常期待之后的作品，感觉背后的主线渐渐浮出水面了。

Kan Gao and Freebird Games have done it again. It's not about features, it's not about graphics, it's not about game modes. It's about giving someone a meaningful experience. It's about coming away from that experience with just a little more wisdom and caring then you had before. These games, the stories they tell, and the music that accompanies them, speak to me in a way that so very few games truly have in my decades of experience with the medium. 

Finding Paradise is everything I could have asked for in a sequel to one of the most profound experiences I've ever had. 

Buy this game.

38366235.review:
Six years. Six years it took me to play To the Moon. Six years it took me to discover Freebird Games.

I will get to the game, but I want to make a personal point first. 

2017 has been a rough year for a consumer of games. Let's be honest with ourselves. The trend for gaming has been to assault our wallet. Whether it be DLC, Season Passes, or loot boxes/crates. The sectioning off of content for those willing to pay extra is quite frankly sad. I feel ashamed that I have accepted that is “just the way things are.” 

I never heard of Freebird Games or To the Moon until early-2017. To the Moon was one of the best games I ever played in my life (#19 on my overall list from over the last 26 years). I was unaware that a sequel was going to be released until about a week ago. When I found this out I was absolutely pumped. I was pumped not because I expected this to be an equal or better story/game than To the Moon. I paid $2 for To the Moon and I felt that I literally stole from this developer. I was pumped that I was going to be a day 1 commit for their new game and pay almost full price to support what gaming should be about. This is it here folks. This is the real deal. Go look at To the Moon, yeah they released DLC episodes after the game released. Is Freebird Games like EA or Bungie and over-pricing that DLC? No they are giving it for free. Not only does this series deserve an Overwhelmingly Positive rating, this developer does as well. 

I digress and will provide my review for Finding Paradise:

Positives:
-Much improved puzzle system- I stated in my To the Moon review that the puzzle system felt slightly like filler. This did not and made sense depending on the memory. The puzzles were not terribly difficult, but kept things interesting.

-Music- Omg! This soundtrack was incredible. If you release it for purchase, I will buy it off steam. I am not going to spoil anything, but there was a scene towards the middle where both a piano and cello were being played. Instead of moving on to the next scene, I stopped for 3 minutes and just listened. I have never done that before. That song was one of the most emotional things I have ever heard in my life. I almost cried.

-Story- A very well written story that was unpredictable and wrapped up well at the end. Do not really want to go too deep here for spoilers.

Negatives:
-I wasn’t a huge fan of the different battle system change ups towards the end, but I guess it was a nice change of pace. These scenes were very short lived and hardly hurt my opinion of the game.

Final Recap:
People are probably going to want to know if this game was as good as To the Moon. That would be a more complicated question to answer than one would think. I felt that this game had better music, more polish, and better puzzles than To the Moon. I did feel that To the Moon was slightly more emotional and had a slightly better story. In my review for To the Moon, I gave it a 9.75. I would give this game a 9.5. Well worth $9. Heck, I would pay double that easily. 

Last comment: Thank you Freebird Games! You have a customer for life.

38365638.review:
[h1]If you want the best experience, start by first playing To the Moon and A Bird Story[/h1]

What a great game, please note that I'm inevitably going to make lots of comparisons to To the Moon (TtM) in this review.
The game has been long underway but sometimes that's what it takes for polish and care to shine through a game.

First of all I want to say that TtM remains my favourite and that's not due to nostalgia, the story was simply just a tad better in that. That being said both "games" (or visual novels if you will) are masterpieces and beautiful pieces of art. 
I went in, with high expectations knowing that To the Moon would be hard to outshine and even though the game in my opinion was worse it did NOT disappoint.

The story is as great as you'd expect from Kan Gao, it takes a complete different turn than TtM and still manages to captivate and surprise you, I lost track of time while playing this, which is evident of great writing. The humour is spot-on and probably even better than TtM's, not much else can be said about the story without spoiling anything but know that you're in for a treat. The mini-games are also very much improved upon.

The soundtrack is great and I'm definitely going to listen to it in the time to come, it still surprises me how well the soundtrack is composed with a limited set of instruments, most of the songs are just with the piano just as it was with TtM.
I think it helps to set the right setting and atmosphere in these types of games and the songs are just as good as TtM's.
  
I know this may not be everyone's cup of tea, players who are only interested in gameplay might want to pass on this one but personally I can't recommend this enough.

After all this praise you may ask why isn't this game better than TtM? I think there are just certain elements that resonated with me better in TtM than in this but remember that this is just my opinion.

I can't wait for the next game cause this has been a near-perfect story-driven game.
10 / 10

38365404.review:
[h1]And so... the wait for the next episode starts...[/h1]

You know what, if you haven't played To the Moon, your loss. But if you have, and you are wondering if this one will live up to expectations after many years, all I can tell you is this:
Do you expect to see just a repitition of all the things we loved there? Or you want to go through an amazing story which you would love and remember even if you didn't know about To the Moon before?
If you honestly answer that and if you give the correct answer(!). Yeah, this was a worthy sequel to that game. Anything else I say is a spoiler.

Q. Is playing to the moon necessary before this?
A. Not really. But god you have no idea how much you're missing.

Q. I have played To the Moon. Do I need to play mini-episodes before this?
A. Need? No. But why on earth you would want to miss out on all the references, I don't know.

Q. How about A Bird Story? Do I need to play that?
A. I wish the answer was a strong yes, but it isn't. There are strong references again. But till the last second of this game I was still wishing for more. [spoiler]May be developers still have things in mind we don't know about regarding that. (Going throug logs of Colin's last seconds still to be done and all!)[/spoiler]

One note to Reives and others if they ever read these...
You depending on the engine you are using sure does keep the style consistent. But I believe by now you have realized how many limitations using that format can cause. I didn't run this on a potato. It is a state of the art machine but it had hiccups of performance for certain "effects". I sure don't mind the pixel art (Though a high resolution art style would also be appreciated). But your work is popular now and people patiently wait years for you to finish your games. May be start on a more flexible platform next time?

Ok, gotta head off now. Need to open up my calendar for the next 6 years for the 3rd episopde. And start saving for some tissue paper.

38365209.review:
I had high expectations to this game, being a huge fan of To The Moon, A Bird Story, and even a fan of Do You Remember my Lullaby(which doesn't have anything to do with the To The Moon series, it's just created by Freebird games as well). 

I loaded up the game, and found myself feeling nostalgia from the earlier games, and I was so ready for another emtional journey with the two Doctors from Sigmund. At first I was let down, I didn't feel as attatched to the characters as quickly as I would've like, and found myself feeling rather distant to the story even after playing a Bird Story. Though when I reached one of the major plot points in the story, All the emotions hit me, and I had to pause the game to collect myself to even pay proper attention. 

The story was very relatable to me, as I had been in the same spot as the main character, and it was very emotional seeing someone else feel the same. I understand how someone who's never been in the same spot, might find this game being a let down if they had as high expectations as me. But personally, The game was so much better than I had expected, and I might sit down to replay it another night with the knowledge I have now. 

I truly think this game is a solid 10/10 and if you enjoyed To The Moon or A Bird Story, you should give this game a shot.

A fast add on, I think the reason that people find To The Moon much sader than Finding Paradise is because that To The Moon's topic is way easier to imagine yourself in, while Finding Paradise can be hard to relate to on some points if you haven't been there yourself.

[h1]Изумительная история[/h1]

Ждал эту игру три года. Ждал так сильно, что успел купить её в первые минуты после выхода, когда Кан ещё не добавил скидку. Ожидание стоило того. Изумительная история!

Здесь есть всё: великолепный сюжет, потрясающая музыка, полюбившиеся персонажи. Из движка выжаты все соки, и картинка получилась красивой [i](графонолюбы этот обзор всё равно не увидят)[/i].
По сравнению с To the Moon здесь больше фирменного юмора. Особенно много игры слов, которую будет крайне трудно сохранить при переводе. Кроме того, здесь немного больше именно [i]игры[/i], но ничего сложного выполнять не придётся, это по-прежнему скорее визуальная новелла, чем игра.

Итог: 10 [i]dagnabbit![/i] из 10. Обязательна к покупке всем, кому понравилась To the Moon. Остальным желаю пройти To the Moon и вернуться сюда.
Жду следующего эпизода, который выйдет, наверное, лет через шесть. :-(

38362598.review:
Finding Paradise is an amazing game. It feels like a familiar old friend, but then does something completely different with its narrative structure. Freebird has succeeded in creating something very meaningful and relatable by telling another wonderful story about growing up and looking back.

Now this is an RPG Maker game, and that will turn a few people off of playing it. However, despite the limitations of the engine, the game is able to tell a wonderful story not just through text but through the action of its character, as well as its camera movements. You have to give major props to the developer that they were able to craft a very well put-together audiovisual experience through just sprites.

Speaking of audiovisual, the score and soundtrack is top notch again. The audio is mixed very well with the movement of the game, and the song hits at the perfect spot at the climax to really drive home the narrative.

I would say though that there might be a few too many mini-games that take you out of the narrative, or that there are a few jokes there that is probably out of place within the context of the current scene, but really it just adds to Neil Watts' personality.

Even though the story stands on its own, I really wouldn't recommend playing this before To the Moon. This game pretty much assumes that you are aware of the universe and how it works, and really, this story works better if you already have an expectation on how the operation should go.

Finally and the most importantly, this game is for you if you enjoyed To the Moon or any other bittersweet or tear-jerking stories. Nothing feels like padding. It's all meat here that will make your eyes water as soon by the first bite because it's the best steak you've ever tasted.

Kan, I love you bro. You too, Laura.

What I played: The full game in just over 5 hours
Like: The universe, the story, the soundtrack, the cinematography
Dislike: A few pacing and tone design decisions.
Rating: 5 out of 5

Let me start by saying, I don't write reviews. Been on Steam for 8 years and the only reviews I've ever written have been jokes at best. The fact that I'm even sitting here right now, writing this review, is a testament to the this game.

I'm going to keep this short, as to not spoil anything: If you liked, "To The Moon," you owe it to yourself to continue the story. There is a such a rich world in these games, in the memories and out of them. There is mythos and mystery, as well as deep thoughful moments, and some truly heartwarming sequences. It's a bit of a meme when talking about, "To The Moon," to mention how it made you cry, but this game has some very heartwrenching moments that got a very similar reaction out of me.

The game doesn't overstay it's welcome and by the end of it, you can't wait for the next one. The only thing negative about my experience with this game is that I've gotta wait quite a few more years for the next one. Here's hoping for some minisodes.

Thank you Kan Gao. You've made something really special... AGAIN.

Set aside 4-5 hours and play through the game in one sitting. I promise you won't regret it.

I'm shivering a little, having played through the game. Was looking forward to it, and for good reasons. It is living up to its predecessor, which is more than hard.
The focus has shifted a little. While the first game put the patient and his loved one completely into focus, this time the surroundings leave a mark as well, and after the miniepisodes already touched the subject, some further implications of the treatment are adressed in this game.
The biggest strength is once again the depth of the presented characters. Colin, Sofia and Faye may not feel as relatable to me as Johnny and River, but that's more of a personal thing. Still they are drawn as living characters, who feel natural in every way (well, almost).
Another upside, this time even more than in the last game, is the music. Great soundtrack, fits the mood.

I should mention, that it is advised to play the rest of the series, before starting this one, so To the Moon, the two miniepisodes included, and A Birds Story. Makes it easier to understand the facets of the game.

All in all, strongly advised for all players, who value story over (the as usual meager) gameplay.

38361851.review:
I didn't have high hopes for this game. How could it [i] possibly [/i] live up to [i] To the Moon [/i]?

Then I played it.

And I applauded at the end.

See, this game can't really be compared to [i] To the Moon [/i] because, while it has the same main characters, premise, and...gameplay, the experience you'll get is a completely different one. 

The story (while not as tear-jerking) is really more creative and intriguing than [i] To the Moon [/i], even if the plot has some issues. I'm not going to spoil anything, but when a certain something is revealed...it's really poorly-executed. There are some moments that feel like they should belong to a completely different game, but I'm glad that the developer tried to make something new. One of my major fears was that this would just be a second [i] To the Moon [/i], but it isn't. It's exactly what a sequel should be: Taking the original concept and leaping off from there.

Even though you won't get as attached to these new characters as you did with River and Johnny, the story and (some) added gameplay elements more than make up for it. My only criticism regarding the story is that it should have been longer, but that is a good criticism to have. I wanted to spend more time playing this and learning about the characters, and while I didn't get that, it says a lot about the game that it made me feel that way.

In short: If you liked [i] To the Moon [/i]...or heck, even if you [i] didn't [/i] like it, then this game is absolutely worth your money. No, it's not adrenaline-pumping or even that innovative when it comes to actual gameplay. But who cares? It's an incredible experience that'll leave you thinking about your life for days after playing it.

38360912.review:
Phew. What a ride.

I just finished this game maybe... 20 minutes ago, as of writing this review. So there's a lot that I still haven't processed yet. Heck, with To The Moon, I spent at least a couple weeks letting everything sink in. Both of these games have a lot of depth to them, but not so much that you can't follow the narrative or the characters' journeys. It's just that with a game many years in the making from a team that actually cares, a lot of love and a lot of thought goes into it. And so, naturally, I don't think you can appreciate EVERYTHING all at once. It takes a little time. That's been my experience, at least. And I'm certainly not complaining; it's hard to find games that dive this deep into our common shared emotions, worries, desires, and basic humanity - without being pretentious or convoluted.

How effortlessly the story is told, how seamlessly you can jump from heartbreak to hilarity in the blink of an eye, and how subtley this game tugs at your heartstrings... it's amazing. I only cried at the end, and I was almost confused while I was crying. "Why am I crying? But this game hasn't hit me hard enough to make me cry. Oh... wait. Actually, it has. Dang." That was basically my thought process while I was crying. Seriously. I've never had an experience like that in any medium of entertainment or art.

So... if you've actually read this far down, then is this game worth buying? Ummm...

YES.

A thousand times yes. This game had it all: heartbreak, mystery, suspense, laughs, tears, characters worth rooting for, a story worth telling, AMAZING music, and even some out-of-nowhere gameplay mixed in with the narrative. (Nicely done, Kan.) I can't think of a single reason NOT to buy this game.

Please: support everyone who worked on this game and just do it!!!

38360472.review:
Прошло около шести лет с того момента как творцы из Freebird Games показали широкой публике игру To The Moon и словили огромное количество благодарностей в свой адрес за создание столь глубокой и проработанной игры, которая то и дело, что любит играть на ваших чувствах.

И вот, наконец-то дождавшись релиза Finding Paradise, купив игру и начав в неё играть, меня останавливало только одно: чертов языковой барьер. В Английский я могу с трудом, но важную информацию воспринимать кое-как могу и, если честно, где-то к середине игры я толком и забыл про то, что игра то была на самом распространённом языке в мире и продолжал играть как ни в чём не бывало, лишь наслаждаясь процессом, полностью понимая, что происходит.

Первый минус, который бросается в глаза, но вообще никак не портит впечатление от игры, так это то, что игру не перенесли на более улучшенный движок RPG Maker MV, из-за чего первое время, скорее всего, будет недоступен стимовский оверлей, да и разрешение скудное. Но впоследствии это всё откидывается на второй план, ведь мы сюда за сюжетищем то пришли!

Завязка вполне себе обычная: полюбившиеся нам Д-р Розалин и Д-р Ватс прибывают к новому пациенту по причине того, что другие их коллеги не смогли заняться им самостоятельно по некоторым причинам, вот и надо выполнить последнее желание умирающего старца на кровати, у которого есть жена и достаточно взрослый сын. Всё идет сначала хорошо, но вот так беда: желание, какое надо выполнить, узнаётся отнюдь не сразу, да и скачки по воспоминаниям теперь не идут от конца жизни до начала, а идут поочередно по эпизоду из детства и старости, с обоих сторон приближаясь к основной точке – середины его жизни.

Атмосфера игры – одна из самых лучших её качеств, так как комплект и прекрасно-сделанного интерьера, проработанных, живущих своей жизнью персонажей и под закрывающий всё это тёплым одеялом невероятным саундтреком заставляет окунаться в игру всё глубже и глубже, а покинуть игру, сохраниться и уйти становится всё сложнее и сложнее. Тем не менее, авторам удаётся выделить тот самый мелкий промежуток, чтобы каждое атмосферное направление игры не надоедало. Грустноты не слишком много, яркие моменты тоже не преобладают, а всё это порой разбавляется то приятным, то и просто абсурдным юмором, который для подобного проекта подходит просто великолепно. Хочется выделить пациента и его подругу детства, которые прилично заинтересовали и в конце одна сцена между ними заставила сползли по моей щеке смуглую, горькую мужскую слезу. Немного неожиданных поворотов в конце, которые сменяются слёзовыжимающими диалогами и знаменитым по To The Moon видео вставке с полной жизнью пациента под музыку Лауры Шигихары, вполне достаточно, чтобы после прохождения остались очень приятные и яркие впечатления от самой игры. Последний акт – самый сок.

Единственный минус игры виднеется только для русского сообщества, который не умеет говорить на английском, правда, некоторые энтузиасты уже с самого релиза работают над переводом и его не стоит ждать долго.
В итоге с момента первого тизера «The Finding Paradise» под названием «A Bird Story» минуло 3 года (и я до сих пор интересуюсь, чего так разработка долго ведется) я ждал релиза игры долгое время и наконец-то дождался и, скажу честно, они прыгнули выше головы и создаётся впечатление, будто игра не позволяет вам отойти от неё и пойти по своим 
делам.

 «Нет! Ты должен меня пройти, должен!».

Я рад, ровно, как и многие поклонники данной студии и игры «To The Moon», ну и конечно, нас ждет очередное продолжение, которое выйдет вновь через 5-8 лет. Но знаете, если в таком промежутке будут выходить действительно стоящие игры, которые перепрыгивают предыдущую по качеству и делают нашу повседневную жизнь немного ярче – то я более, чем рад этому.  К прохождению и покупке настойчиво рекомендую

38359606.review:
I've never written any game review before, but I felt obliged to do it with this one. There will be no spoilers whatsoever, cause ti ruin this game for someone is really a crime.
I'll start with little problems with this game to get it out of the way. 
- There were little problems with launching, but I was able to launch the game. Maybe it was just Steam error, IDK, really
- Second, the gameplay per se is not really there, the game is more like a movie, but I knew it would be like it, so nothing to complain about here. 
- Finally, there's no "Nextgen graphics" to be found. It's not even 3D. However, it doesn't make it any worse (It probably makes it even better).

Now to talk about positive things
+ The game is connected with previous Freebird games products, and it does contain a bit of spoilers
+ The music is absolutely amazing, it'll stay with me long after I finished playing the game
+ The plot is ... breathtaking, to say the least. I enjoy trying to predict what happens next when playing story-driven games, and  don't like when my predictions come true. I couldn't have predicted the ending of this game in my lifetime. 
+ The game is messing with your emotions. There are moments when you laugh and 5 minutes later you're about to cry. Nothing compares to this.

In order not to make this a longread, Here's what I've got to say -- If you're up for a cool gameplay, puzzlesolving and drive, you probably won't like it. 

"Finding Paradise" is not a movie -- it doesn't have effects and all the heroic stuff.
"Finding Paradise" is not a cartoon -- it touches themes that are really personal - questons of life, happiness, regrets and such;
"Finding Paradise" is a touching story filled with emotions accompanied by sweet music. It's a story about growing up, about dreams and about itself.

This isn't To The Moon 2. Even though the gameplay is still a point and click adventure let's be honest here, both games are basically interactive novels. In fact, I think the game segments hurt the pacing of both games' story.

38357611.review:
First, if you didn't like the aesthetic of "To the Moon" you probably won't like this.

While the premise of this installment is the same as the predecessor (To the Moon), the story, theme, characters, message, and emotions brought forth are all very much different.  Further separating this from a re-tread (which wouldn't have been too bad of a thing) is differences in how memories are traversed in the first game and this.

The relationship between the doctors of Sigmund Corp are further developed here as are the differences between the previous 2 on how they view the mission and contract.  This is where the meta plot that started to be fleshed out in the previous installment grows, but it does end on a serious cliffhanger if that irks you.

Colin wants his life mostly unchanged, but he wants something just a bit "better".   You encounter past regrets, but some of them are so insignificant (spilled beverage on honeymoon) that one would assume those can't possibly be what was asked of the player characters.   Colin has an unusual motivation and that drives the flow of time in the story.

This was not a tear jerker and I don't think it was meant to be.  Kan Gao always said he never intends his stories to be so.  However, being a good storyteller he will leave you with a sad smile at the end at the beauty of Colin's one true wish. Overall, the story is creepier than the first and the prime plot point is easily discernable, but I do not feel that lessened the impact when the game (mostly) revealed it.  

Playtime is I would say about 50% longer than To the Moon.

38356821.review:
[b]For anyone expecting a second To the Moon, you'll probably be disappointed as this game isn't that. It is, however, well worth your time and money if you enjoyed the first game.[/b]

The story is enjoyable, though some parts of it are predictable if you are paying attention. The idea of travelling through someone's memories and seeing parts of their life through their eyes is something I love, and it is executed well. The music is quality, but I didn't find it particularly memorable. Graphics and animations do their job, and there are some fairly nice little details in there that I enjoyed. The minigame for "preparing" mementos was unobtrusive and fairly simple. In a way I would have preferred having to work more for completing the puzzles, but I also appreciate the fact that this isn't a puzzle game and more difficult puzzles could feel out of place and push people away.

While this game is a stand-alone experience, it does reference the previous installments, especially in its frame story, and this additional context might enhance your experience. As such, I would recommend playing To the Moon and the minisodes before Finding Paradise. I haven't played A Bird Story myself, but I'd assume going through it wouldn't hurt, either. Having said that, I can't help but wonder if playing Finding Paradise before playing To the Moon would make this game stand out more.

Now then, the reasons for saying this game isn't a second To the Moon are fairly simple. However, they all come down to Finding Paradise not having as much of an impact on me.
[list]
[*]At least for me, the first game came more or less out of nowhere. I had no idea what to expect, and what it delivered hit much harder because of that. Finding Paradise was in a much less favourable position having to follow up after To the Moon's success. I already knew what I could possibly expect, and thus the impact was lessened.
[*]At least in part thanks to the previous point, Finding Paradise's emotional highs were not as great as To the Moon's. The predictability of a key story point also contributed to this; the characters were shocked by a revelation a good bit after I'd figured it out. It is also really difficult to compete with what To the Moon did.
[*]There isn't a piece of music that has the same effect as what a key piece in To the Moon had. That song still evokes memories and emotions.
[/list]

Finding Paradise may not be To the Moon, but it shouldn't have to be.

What follows contains spoilers for both games, and is there simply to provide a bit more context and comparison between the two.
[spoiler] The realization of what the bunnies were about, and how River kept trying to remind her husband of what he'd forgotten is something that stuck with me. That tragedy hurt on a whole different level, as of course did the brother situation. Faye being an imaginary friend wouldn't have had nearly as big of an impact even if it weren't as predictable as it was. 

The bait and switch in Finding Paradise was a clever thing, but at the same time it prevented a situation where everything just [i]clicks[/i] as it all comes together. All the "regrets" the player kept discovering were essentially red herrings, and the fact that in the end nothing was changed (aside from Faye and Colin finally catching up again) was a bit of a letdown. It fit, and I liked it, but it definitely didn't have as much of an impact as that moment when River walks in after having been removed by Eva. Figuring out the bunnies was a moment when things just came together and clicked. [/spoiler]

38355335.review:
Ahh, no i jest. Recenzja do napisania. Taaaak....................................

Może zanim zacznę pisać moje myśli, napiszę standarowo najpierw plusy i minusy.

PLUSY:
- Po raz kolejny przepiękny soundtrack
- Powrót naszych głównych bohaterów
- Po skończeniu gry, składa do wielu przemyśleń nie tylko o życiu
- Szybko z pamięci nie znika(wierzę w to od razu zaznaczam, piszę recenzję zaraz po ukończeniu gry)
- Przygoda, którą trzeba zaliczyć
- Dla fanów RPG Makera bardzo dobra grafika ze sprite'ami
- Niemal idealnie wgrany humor w grze...

MINUSY:
- ... jednak pojawiał się w kilku momentach, w których mógł popsuć właściwe wrażenia z gry
- Historia mimo wszystko nie dorównuje tej z To The Moon
- Częste spadki klatek przy rozmowach (jak to ogarną, to usunę minusa)

Tu jest link do mojej playlisty z mojego kanału, gdzie zamieściłem wszystkie odcinki z gry Finding Paradise, jeśli chcielibyście tą przygodę przeżyć ze mną, to zapraszam:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLM7Kyfetv1LVQ-SUDZDPS1PUzAqy-6N0L


Kan Reives Gao znowu to zrobił. Co najmniej jedna łza poleciała mi po całej twarzy. Znowu sprawił, że graczowi zrobiło się smutno. Ale mimo wszystko nie ma takiej mocy emocjonalnej jak To The Moon z kilku powodów.

1. Nieważne co wymyśli Kan Gao, stworzył naprawdę niepowtarzalną historię, której już po prostu nie przebije i widać to w tej grze, aczkolwiek zawsze może próbować jak w tej grze, gdyż widać, że jeszcze nie skończył.
2. Pojawiają się elementy humoru znacznie częściej niż w samym To The Moon, często też mruga do nas smaczkami choćby z poprzedniej części. To nic jednak złego, wręcz przeciwnie, sama historia nie ma wtedy wrażenia przygnębiającej, zwłaszcza że historia Colina absolutnie taka nie była. Jednakże czasami pojawiał się humor w takich momentach, że wchodziłeś w nie ten stan ducha, w jakim moim odczuciu powinno się być, co mogło poważnie naruszyć odbiór całej gry. Trzeba mieć to pod uwagę kiedy będzie się grało samemu i pamiętać, że historia w tej grze nie jest taka sama jak w To The Moon, gdyż wątpię, żeby nawet co innego tu pasowało. Twórca zrobił grę pod swoją wizję i dopracował niemal idealnie tak, że jakakolwiek zmiana mogłaby spowodować już odczuciem, że gramy w co innego.
3. No i właśnie historia. To już co innego. Jest dalej wyciskanie łez, zwłaszcza na końcu, ale jeśli oczekujecie takiej huśtawki uczuć, jakiej doznaliście w To The Moon, to się zwyczajnie możecie rozczarować tytułem.


Więc czemu mimo wszystko polecam ją?
Bo historia pod względem intelektualnym jest lepsza niż w To The Moon. Zwyczajnie idzie innym torem, nawet styl gry jest nieco inny. Niby ci sami bohaterowie, ale nie gramy już w To The Moon, lecz w całkiem inną grę i widać to pod każdym niemal względem, poza oczywiście grafiką i bohaterami i innymi punktami w grze. Już gra nie stara się jak tylko może uronić w nas łzę, ale poniekąd skłania do przemyśleń. Nie będę pisał jakich, bo zacząłbym spojlerować, czego zwyczajnie zamierzam unikać.
Poza tym znów mamy genialny soundtrack, który trzeba jak najszybciej wrzucić na telefon i przesłuchiwać go tak długo jak tylko się da.
Kupiłem go zaraz po premierze i nie żałuję i jednej wydanej na nią złotówki. Mam nadzieję, że kiedyś ją jeszcze powtórzę sobie, gdy będę miał przede wszystkim lepszy mikrofon i ogólnie sprzęt, no i ludzi, którzy będą chcieli mnie obejrzeć grającego w Finding Paradise.

Tak czy owak, warto wejść w tą przygodę, dlatego serdecznie polecam każdemu, kto lubi takie głębokie historie, zapewniam was, że się nie zawiedziecie.

38354900.review: Finding Paradise es la segunda parte de To the Moon, que si no lo habeis jugado deberíais hacerlo, o pillarlo junto a este. Es un trabajo muy emotivo, que intenta calar hondo, navegando por la vida de Colin en sus ultimos dias. Es una historia lo que ofrece este juego, no encontrarás unos graficos next gen ni una jugabilidad divina, pero merece la pena echarse de cabeza a este juego y disfutarlo. En lo personal tengo que decir que To the Moon me emociono bastante más que este, que me dejó al borde de la lágrima, y pensaba que este me sabría a poco, que me tendría que conformar con una historieta con ansias de algo grande pero que no llegaba a lo que hizo grande a la primera parte. En cambio, he encontrado una historia elaborada, con personajes muy bien construidos en el poco espacio en el que se presentan, el simbolismo que le da a los objetos que tanto me gustó del primer titulo, y un largo etc. y pese a no ser tan bueno como To the Moon me sigue pareciendo un "Altamente recomendado" y también recomiendo seguir el trabajo de Kan Gao, que no decepciona. Actualmente (16/12/17) esta en Inglés, pero supongo que al final acabará siendo traducido a otros idiomas.

38354145.review:
首先先让我推荐一首歌：野菊花乐队的那就是我的世界，请搜原唱最近的现场版本，也许能对这部作品有帮助

这是一款优秀的游戏，节奏感满分的讲诉，依然优秀的音乐，都证实着这无疑是值得夸耀的作品

总是难免把这部作品和上一部相比，在我看来却是不相伯仲的

在高潮的处理上，这一部显然是在情感爆发上略逊一筹，但是在节奏上把握的更好，不是我一个人在去月球的后部分对重复内容感到烦躁。

至于剧情爆发力的差距，这是明显的，但是听着音乐的响起，又是必然的，两者的人生是完全不一样的。一个是一生虽然有着遗憾但是却沉稳坚韧活着的普通人，一个是有着悲痛记忆眼里常常凝望过去的守望者，宛如大提琴与钢琴一般，有着决定性的区别，但是你能说这二者有高下之分吗？是不能的，我们每个人都无法对其他人的人生说三道四，正如同Colin最后选择了自己那普通却又独属于他的人生。

其实最开始，我并不是这样认为的，尤其是Colin和Faye在山上道别的时候，我对这一部感到了遗憾，但是
在最后，在阳台上当Faye逐渐的从Colin的背后出现时，当
“嘿，老顽固，在找我么？”
“该回家了，Colin。”
我的眼泪却不争气的留了下来
我貌似懂了什么
这一部是彻底的关于人的一生，爱情，亲情都不是主线，主线就是人生本身
Colin和Faye其实就是“我”，这一段故事其实是关于“我”怎么看待“我”一生的故事
如果只是从哲学角度上来讲，这一部的高度是比上一部要高得多的
但是这也暴露出了高瞰在剧情把握上的不足，但是这并不能怪他，也许他只是想依然讲一个人生的故事

38353739.review:
Please play 'To the Moon' before picking up this game. It will give you backstory and  a good indication of whether this type of game is for you or not. Plus, To the Moon does more to draw you in early on if I recall correctly. This game ramps up more slowly, but the end was worth all the time I spent waiting for this game.

This series of games is more like an interactive visual novel than anything else. You mostly explore and observe. If you can read, you'll probably enjoy this game. If you hate reading or are otherwise the sort of person who would simply skip through the dialog, then this may not be the game for you.

38353685.review:
Finding paradise作为to the moon的续作
强烈推荐玩过to the moon和a bird story的人去玩，质量不会让人失望。
推荐玩过to the moon的人去玩，当然推荐有空可以先把a bird story玩完再来玩本作会有更好的感受。
不推荐没玩过to the moon的人直接玩，因为不管是剧情时间线还是单作质量来说都是先玩to the moon更好。
游戏时间和to the moon的长度基本类似，约5小时（至少我应该是大概玩了这么久，这游戏又不会卡关）。

如果你作为一个to the moon的粉丝，期待着高质量的音乐与故事，那么本作绝不会辜负你的期待。
但如果你期望得到和to the moon同等程度的感动，恐怕此次的故事并不能满足你。
当然，这并不是说故事不好，而是故事的方向性我认为可以说完全走了相反的路线。

在to the moon中
我们明确的知道Johnny上月球的愿望
能够看到Eva和Watt两博士为达成愿望逐渐追溯而出的记忆真相
能够看到尘封记忆中那真正促成愿望的令人感动的约定
能够看到两博士在知道愿望真相后，所作出的艰难决定
Johnny提供了一个美好的故事，而博士们努力的将它圆满的结局
Eva和Watt功不可没，尽心尽力的将故事续写结束

而在finding paradise中，故事有了完全不同的走向
临终病人Colin的愿望极其模糊不清——生活美满，内心却觉得不充实
故事本身不如to the moon那样美好而感动，而是增加了几分纠结和困惑
Eva和Watt此次与其说是面对Colin的故事，更多的是面对Colin的内心
而内心的结终究只有自己能解，无法交给别人

To the moon讲述了一个只有西格蒙德公司能完成的任务
而finding paradise则讲述了一个西格蒙德公司完全无能为力的事情
比起to the moon那种由于记忆缺失与巧合带来的感动真相与美好故事
finding paradise所面对的成长中的内心纠结则让人感觉更加的真实

同样的，finding paradise仍然是和to the moon一样，值得在玩的过程中和结束游玩后细细品味的游戏
但是带来的是与to the moon完全不同的美好体验

所以我会继续期待第三作，不知道有生之年能不能看到这个系列的完结


缺点的话，这一作的收尾感觉并不是很好，篇幅的分配有些虎头蛇尾的感觉
也许也是因为Eva和Watt在这作真的没有什么可以做的吧

38353463.review:
作为去月球的忠实粉丝，关注本作很久了，昨天早上爬起来迷迷糊糊就在床上下单购买，今天一晚上打通，说实话本人比较失望。首先首当其冲令我不满的就是本作不仅没有填补to the moon的坑，反而在此基础上将坑挖的更大了，本人不反对游戏出续作，对于后续作品我肯定是买买买。但是作为一个独立游戏，如此光明正大反复刨坑的行为我个人比较反感，一来是这个系列本身出产周期长，6年一次，按这个速度恐怕完结会变成有生之年系列。二来本作流程较短，目测只有去月球内容的一半左右。作为序列万众瞩目的第二张诚意存在问题。
下面谈本作的音乐，一部分是去月球原声BGM，一部分是去月球BGM的复刻版，新歌曲很少，个人一周目感觉不超过5首，主题曲好听，但是全程各种变奏翻来覆去放也会腻。
剧情方面(放心食用，无剧透)：代入感一半，如果说to the moon的主题是爱情和缘分，那么本作的主题是你也不知道是什么，因为本作病人的一些特殊性，导致普通玩家很难产生代入感。全程气氛把握整体良好，把一个没什么代入感的故事说的细腻动人，但是谈不上感人，更不存在to the moon的那种对人情感的撼动，反而多了一股无病呻吟的违和感。全程伏笔很多，很遗憾，基本上没有做到呼应，很多甚至是光明正大地给续作做准备，to the moon故事精彩之余结尾的伏笔会让人欣喜觉得这个游戏没有到此为止，而FP全程各种伏笔结尾戛然而止明显给人一种卧槽还有续作，卧槽这是大坑，卧槽怎么没了的感觉。
总体游玩感受：BUG比较多，甚至是恶性卡死和跳出bug，这种都不是问题，可以通过更新解决。翻译质量个人觉得可以，但是充斥了很多网络词汇，让对白俗了很多，人物刻画仍然与TTM一样很到位，个人游玩时感觉前一个半小时神作，后一个小时懵逼，最后半小时不爽。作为去月球与鸟的故事共同的续作，本作与前二者的联系约等于0，没有玩过前作的完全不影响本作，虽然降低了新玩家门槛，但是对于老玩家而言割裂感明显，也有明显吊胃口嫌疑，给予批评，总体来说本作素质中流，也是因为有了去月球的对比，大家一方面对FP有了过多的期待，但是另一方面抛开TTM不看，本作也只是一个算得上佳作的独立游戏，与杰作差的甚远。
购买建议：如果你是去月球和鸟的故事的粉丝，那么本作无疑必买，但是也不要抱有太大的期望。没有玩过TTM的但是对本作感兴趣的玩家不推荐购买，因为入坑作当然留给去月球，也轮不上FP。

38353365.review:
Maybe because I expected too much, but after completed it in one go, this is my review.
Will contain spoiler and review about To the Moon, so please don't read the spoiler part if you don't want to be spoiled.

Pros:
- Better puzzles to break memento than To the Moon.
- Good story telling, no duplicate from To the Moon. Must say it was a good improvement.
- I like how the game remind me of the missing link in a room, that did save a lots of times compare to To the moon. The path is not too long, too.

Cons:
[spoiler]- I HATE jumpscare, and really hate that jumpscare. Also I'm not the type that can play fighting or shooting game.
 So I was going through hell to go through that part.
Really, I didn't sign up for that genre. It's not funny you know.[/spoiler]

- I'm here for the feel. And this game doesn't provide me with it.

Good puzzles? Only better than To the moon say frankly. 
Good surprise? Nope, may be creative, but doesn't linked anything at all.
If I want good puzzles and good surprise, I will buy another game, not this one.

Because the thing I want from this game is the feel and a good story, but it didn't provide me those - for me, the main point of the story is just nonsense so this is clearly negative review. 

- Plot holes. In this game, Eva and Neil became dull and the technical element doesn't make sense to me anymore.

- Bugs. I had to replace my save file with one from the community to continue to play the game. If you search the community, you'll find out lots of people experienced them too.

Now is the details of those points:
[spoiler]
- IMAGINARY FRIEND??? Really? I played all those time, for a scene of him and his imaginary friend?? Really? 
How does an imaginary friend "always protect you"?

I tried to get through this point by reading lots of review, I know this is a story about Collin's growing up and his life.

But sorry, a grown up man, a father who still clinging to his imaginary friend, got affected easily by an advertisment and then even risking his beloved ones's happiness can't make sense to me.

He is an old man, not a high school or college boy. And he's a father. Sorry, can't sympathy with someone like this.

- The music became lame after I completed the game. In To the moon, the moment "Everything is alright" was playing, and the moment "For River" was renamed to "To the moon" really make me cried. But for this one, the music doesn't have any meaning or linking to anything, so it became lame after I completed it.

- Last time, Eva decided to erase River because "the reason Johny want to go to the moon, is to find River", and she hoped that by go to the moon he will meet her again anyway. But this time? They don't even know what the patient want, but still decied to "try" erase Faye. When did Eva and Neil become such a bad doctor?

- Faye got those power, maybe you will say the reason is Neil's changes to the machine, but still it became a flaw to me. Technology doesn't make sense anymore if you added too much fantasy. And I'm not here for fantasy.

And let's be clear about this. Imaginary friend IS NOT REAL and CAN'T BE REAL. Even if one person want their imaginary friend to be real how much, they are still not real, without thought or real characteristic.

- The key scene of this game gave me no feeling. Okay, maybe say goodbye to your childhood to become stronger is a point to remember. But compare to how we see the moon in to the moon - how all the rabbit and other point linked to each other, this one is poor designed and couldn't describe its meaning well.

- Just like the key scene, overal the items in this game doesn't connect to each other. Or the way they connected, is poorly written.
[/spoiler]

Overall I must say I did enjoyed it, because I thought it will be a story about family's connection, and was waiting for it to happen [spoiler]after I saw how sad Fia was because of Collin's decision to call Sigmund. I thought that maybe, just maybe, he feel incomplete, because he was always wanted to do more for his beloved one - he just doesn't realize that.[/spoiler] Then the real story broke all those enjoyment of mine.

Maybe I expected too much. I told myself it's really hard to have another to the moon, but was still expecting a good story after all. Then I got this game, I feel like I was fooled with a poorly written and still have bugs game.

This game was delayed for too long, then still have game breaking bugs. That's one of the most clearly prove of how this was a "forced to come out" production.
