38351979.review:
Finding Paradise, ou como é chamado em alguns lugares, To The Moon 2, é a sequência de A Bird's Story [b]E[/b] To The Moon. Apesar de não ser necessário ter jogado os dois jogos anteriores para entender perfeitamente o que acontece, é altamente recomendável para melhor entendimento de certas passagens. 

No papel de Eva Rosalene e Neil Watts, você tem um trabalho a fazer: Realizar o último desejo de seu paciente no leito de morte, entrando em suas memórias e alterando-as em nome desse objetivo.

[h1]Jogabilidade[/h1]

Não houveram muitas alterações entre um jogo e outro. Ainda sendo um jogo de RPGMaker, acaba sendo bem limitado. Você apenas move pelas direções e interage com objetos, tendo vez ou outra alguma leve mudança de jogabilidade para algum propósito superior na história. 

Talvez a maior mudança foi terem adicionado a opção de trocar entre os personagens quando estão separados (as vezes), embora dê uma ideia não-linear, não consegue quebrar  esse formato, mas ainda é um recurso interessante e infelizmente usado pouco em Finding Paradise.

Em determinados momentos, pequenos puzzles serão colocados para que sejam resolvidos e então você possa prosseguir pela história. São simples, onde as vezes tendo algum impedimento ou não, você tenta alinhar 3 ou mais objetos iguais (relacionado à memória em questão) e então se quebram, gerando a energia necessária para prosseguir.

[h1]História e enredo[/h1]

O ponto alto do jogo, obviamente. Aos familiarizados com To The Moon, a ideia é a mesma: Nossos doutores vão realizar o desejo de Colin, nosso querido protagonista de A Bird's Story. Como já dito, apesar de não ser necessário para entender a história de Finding Paradise, jogá-lo vai dar uma base mais firme de certas situações durante este jogo.

Eva Rosalene e Neil Watts são dois funcionários que trabalham em equipe para a Sigmund Corp, lugar que oferece um serviço único para seus clientes: Realizar seu mais profundo desejo no momento próximo do fim de sua vida. Uma tarefa complicada, até invasiva, mas é tudo para que as pessoas partam sem nenhum arrependimento.

O paciente: Colin é um ex-piloto de avião, casado e com um filho. A história conta que em seus dias de idoso, ele decidiu assinar o contrato com a Sigmund Corp, empresa que realiza seus últimos desejos. Infelizmente, sua esposa não viu a ideia com bons olhos. Diferente do jogo anterior, não temos uma noção concreta do que é o desejo de Colin.

Ambos os protagonistas possuem personalidades fortes, e o humor é tão presente quanto no seu antecessor, deixando a experiência mais relaxante, mesmo tratando de uma temática mais pesada. Ainda assim, é muito provável que você dê muitas risadas durante o jogo. Extremamente gratificante.

O enredo é envolvente de uma maneira única, que pretende o jogador quanto mais ele conhece a história, mesmo não tendo nenhum sentido total ainda. As revelações e dicas mínimas que o jogo vai largando para você, é suficiente para que em pouco tempo, você esteja já esteja emocionalmente envolvido com toda situação.

[h1]Trilha Sonora[/h1]

Rica em sentimentos. A forma que a música de Finding Paradise se expressa é algo difícil de colocar em palavras. As faixas transmistem os mais diversos sentimentos, mesmo em cenas que a mesma música toca. É um trabalho excepcional que tem como maior foco o uso do Piano, que tem forte ligação com a história do jogo.

As músicas sozinhas possuem um impacto extremamente forte, principalmente àqueles que conhecem bem o jogo anterior. Uma sensação nostálgica talvez seja a descrição inicial para a trilha sonora, que aos poucos se desenvolve em algo único, que se adapta perfeitamente ao Finding Paradise. 

Provavelmente uma das melhores trilhas sonoras, ao menos com um impacto muito maior nos jogadores, diferente na maioria dos jogos.

[h1]Visuais[/h1]

O pixel art em Finding Paradise é excelente. São muitos, mas muitos detalhes nas animações de poucos frames, mas que ainda assim trazem uma imersão absurda para as cenas. Talvez sejam os efeitos sonoros que contribuem para o impacto das pequenas ações, mas ainda mantém um padrão de qualidade visual altíssimo, mesmo sendo feito em uma engine mais limitada.

Uma novidade foi que passaram a usar recursos visuais bem interessantes em alguns momentos, como mudança de ângulos e zooms bem feitos, causando maior impacto nas cenas em questão. Até mesmo o leve movimentar da câmera foi capaz de deixar mais cinematográfico, mais profundo. Um trabalho excepcional com os limites impostos.

[h1]Conclusão[/h1]

Uma experiência única, totalmente diferente do seu antecessor, mas que ainda mantém o mesmo núcleo que prendeu o coração de muitos.

Finding Paradise é um jogo incrível, feito com muito amor e carinho. Uma história emocionalmente envolvente, com uma trilha sonora poderosa, proporcionando uma das experiências mais gratificantes que um jogo pode oferecer. Altamente recomendável para todos os tipos de jogadores.

38350161.review:
Finding Paradise was a beautiful game.

I've played To the Moon, but that was a long, long time ago. I think it was in the same month it came out, but it always stuck in my head. Like many others, I cried during To the Moon, and even more-so in Finding Paradise. But the point isn't to make you cry, but to tell a beautiful story with meaning. Kan Gao achieved that. 

I don't think the game would be the same without the music. It's beautiful. Multiple times I just stopped and listened. Each track was (usually) perfect to the mood of the current scene. I used "usually" because there were one or two times that there was some pretty heavy, bittersweet music while something comedic was happening. It didn't bother me too much, but it was noticable.

The art itself is also very fitting. The pixel art looks very good, but the graphics are improved with the lighting that was used. There were sunshafts in rooms that made some stuff look gorgeous. The backgrounds were very well made too; they were a great accent to the levels.

The story, as previously stated, was fantastic. It had more layers than To the Moon and additional sideplots that helped set up the story for the next episode (admittedly, it's been such a long time since I've played To the Moon that I might be wrong on this, but this was definitely deeper layered and more meaningful than the first to me). Dr. Rosaline and Dr. Watts are a pleasure to see again. There were less jokes than To the Moon, but this time there was a proper build-up to each of them, which made the jokes funnier. I would love to go deeper into the story, but it's something that you should really experience yourself.

I have not played A Bird Story, but it ties in with Finding Paradise. I only looked at screenshots, and I think that people who played A Bird Story previously would have a somewhat deeper understanding of the story than someone, like me, who did not. It didn't really affect me at all though. It's not necessary, just a nice addition.

All-in-all, Finding Paradise is brilliant. I hope that people keep playing this game for a very long time, and I look forward to the next episode.

38349725.review:
TL,DR: IF YOU COME HERE IN ORDER TO FIND THE SAME FEELING THAT YOU HAD WITH TO THE MOON, YOU WON'T. IF YOU ARE EXPECTING THIS WILL GIVE YOU THE SAME FEELING THAT TO THE MOON DID, WELL IT WON'T.

Not playing To the moon before only makes you feel some of the doctors' lines being cryptic and you aren't going to get the joke that they are referencing somewhere throughout the game, but not playing A bird story is a huge loss when playing Finding Paradise because Finding Paradise itself doesn't explain enough the main character's odd mind.
I'm pretty sure that 99% of the customers that bought Finding Paradise are all To the moon player fellows trying to get onto the feel train bounding for the feel villa. But this time it is a totally different story than To the moon. It's true that the producer tried to put some emotional elements to the game but honestly I cannot have any compassion with the main character in the game. Perhaps the main character is a little bit peculiar, and ordinary people cannot share the same feeling that he held.
I appreciate the tons of new elements, cutscenes, animations, soundtracks that the producer tried hard to build into the game. Compared to To the moon, Finding Paradise is much upgraded, being a lot more similar to a movie than a game. The fantasy elements, the humor, and an excellent way of story telling really suck people's mind into it. However, those are not really what To the moon player folks are expecting. The ending is short, cliche but unsatisfactory. Many reviewers "shed a tear" but I'm so sorry that I hardly felt touched. The fact of [spoiler]an imaginary friend[/spoiler] really ruined my mood for the entire opening of the game.
For those who haven't played To the moon before, this game is quite entertaining, amusing, and will suprise you at certain points in the game.
For the left, maybe FInding Paradise doesn't live up to the expectation of the hype bandwagoners, the shadow of the predecessor is just too great to be surpassed.

Excuse me for the disorganized review and my mediocre Engrish. I am looking forward to the third title and the doctors duo is now a good material for a new story to revolve around it. This sequel did not elaborate enough on all of the occurences of events in the two Minisodes. About the surprising, amusing contents, Finding Paradise did it well and neat. Hopefully, next sequel will prioritize it over the touching factor.

38349436.review: Kan Gao and Freebird Games haven't lost their touch. Storytelling is as strong as ever and gameplay is improved in a sequel that's been made with top effort and to the absolute best of its potential. Feels familiar alongside To The Moon but explores new concepts that make it feel very fresh. Those who were emotionally affected by To The Moon (everyone?) will actually be pleased to find that Kan Gao has not tried too hard to make you feel those feels again - which of course would have backfired and become sappy and manipulative. Instead, he has worked hard to tell a unique story that is beautiful and fascinating on its own (and make you feel those feels anyway). 38349413.review:
You probably already know if you want this or not based on what you thought of To The Moon. It's a very worthy successor. Stands in its own right as well. Since I found it to be a surprising improved experience, though, it's different enough that other people with their own sensibilities may find it more flawed.

They keep a similar style (visuals, music, "gameplay") but that style has been polished overall too. Visuals are a step up, pacing is smoother sometimes, it all seems more direct. Also, not that TTM necessarily had a problem with this, but there is great chemistry between characters, for the Sigmund crew *and* the people in the patient's memories. This does make the narrative a bit more lighthearted at times, especially in how the "game" medium is utilized, but that doesn't detract from its emotional depth and absolutely stellar plot structuring. If you're going to ask me whether I cried or not, I think a lot of "feels-y" (for lack of a better term) media like this risks either not fulfilling what it builds up to, or making the reader feel something just for the sake of feeling something. Finding Paradise is PERFECT in avoiding both of these. Moreso than its predecessor. The story's progression feels natural, sappy moments do something for the characters, not just the readers. And as a whole these moments touch on broader themes as well, providing substance while still giving closure. Actually, the ending (final 20min or so?) achieves something surprisingly new. How the story wraps up was surprisingly refreshing even in terms of just Kan Gao's works. A couple hints of introspection have me *really* looking forward to where this series goes, or rather whatever is next for Freebird in general.

This team seriously knows how to tell a story.

38348799.review:
Finding paradise 玩後感 (少量劇透

的確,finding paradise煽情位沒有to the moon這麼厲害, 
但是兩者不是在描述同一個主題下，真的很難說誰比誰好。但個人而言是推薦finding paradise的。

to the moon 是描述一場永遠理解不到對方的愛情，結局傷感又幸福。

而finding paradise要說的是人生中的一位"摯友"。

38347838.review:
Finding Paradise is the second game and indirect sequel to the excellent, "To the Moon".

It needn't be said that this title like its predecessor delivers when it comes to its insightful and emotional story.
Finding Paradise may not be a complete tear jerker, like "To the Moon", but makes up for this with its overwhelming good writing and story. It is nice to see that freebird games were able to jump off, "To the Moon", rather than feel obliged to make another tear jerker. (This is not to say that there arent any emotional moments in the story) 

More importantly, as a fan who has been following the games and minisodes, it is nice that these games are actually being interconnected. Not to give anything away, but i cant wait for the next game in the series.

If you havent played "To the Moon" and its minisodes, i really recommend you do so before playing "Finding Paradise".
In terms of bird story, playing it may hint at some of the more suprising twists in the story, but i still feel it to be an important part of the experience.

Overall, I am glad freebird games were able to recreate their sucess again. "Finding Paradise", will end up being a game i will remember for the years to come. If you enjoy a wonderful story at the cost of deep gameplay, "Finding Paradise" is a must play.

38345416.review:
[h1] For those who don't want to read the thing... [/h1]
TLDR: The game was great. If you enjoyed To the Moon, this is a must buy!



[h1] For the rest of you: [/h1]

First and foremost, although this game can be played as a stand alone without missing any of the story, there are many references and inside jokes scattered throughout the game linking to To the Moon (along with its minisodes), A Bird Story, and I even think I found a couple references to Rakuen for those who played that game. While you won't really miss out much, if you have the extra money and haven't played those other games (Rakuen not required but it is a great game), I highly suggest playing those games first.

[b] Gameplay [/b]
The gameplay is fairly similar to To the Moon, in the sense that it is fairly apsent from the game. That is okay though, since the main focus is really on the story. There [i] are [/i] some extra gameplay elements over the first game however, but more or less, the gameplay amounts to fairly the same. They had several extra things where you could switch between which character you controlled which was fairly neat. Inconsequential... but neat. Kan Gao also manages to stick with a similar formula to the previous game while keeping it feeling fresh.

[b] Story [/b]
As is a trend with Kan Gao's games, the story is very well done. Of course it deals with very different themes than To the Moon and while the story as a whole didn't move me [i] as [/i] emotionally as To the Moon did, I thought that it was very well done and heartfelt. We also get some expansion on [spoiler] Neil's condition along with some more mysteries that are going on apart from the main storyline. [/spoiler] The game manages to stick to the main storyline while also expanding on some side plots.

[b] Artwork [/b]
The artwork in this game just feels generally more polished than it was in To the Moon, from the animations, to details, to expressiveness of the characters. It was very well done. The pixel art was used to great effect in bringing this world to life.

[b] Music [/b]
The music was phenominal. Kan Gao delivers another great soundtrack to his game and I was so glad that Laura Shigihara came back to do another song. If you enjoyed the music in To the Moon, you will enjoy the music here. 

[b] Faults [/b]
That isn't to say that the game lacks any and all faults. Like I saw online, I will agree that the story drags on a bit in the middle of it, though it isn't too bad. Personally, I wasn't able to get attached to these characters quite as easily as in To the Moon, but that may just be me. [spoiler] I didn't really end up caring all that much for the wife and ended up caring more about his childhood friend. [/spoiler] That said, the faults are few and far between and my expectations were definitely met for this game, though I'm not quite sure about exceeded

[h1] Conclusion: [/h1]
Finding Paradise is a wonderful addition to the To the Moon series which, while it might not obtain the cult status of its predecesor, stands strong in its own right. That being said, I'm not outright saying which game is objectively better, that is fully due to subjectivity. Some may prefer Finding Paradise while others may prefer To the Moon. I think it all depends on your own experiences which is what makes these games so great! We can all relate to it a different way.

38344379.review:
If you think the concept of "Inception of Dying People's memory" in "To the Moon" is confusing.....hooo boy....this one kicks it up a notch.

Finding Paradise is....relative to "To the Moon"...abstract. This game will not resonate with everyone unlike To The Moon. You can explain the plot of "To the Moon" to someone and many will still understand why it is a beautiful tragedy but the same can't be said to this one.

Jhonny's wish is straightforward. The goal is there; we can see it. The true meaning behind it made us understand why it is such a tearjerking wish. 

On the other hand, Colin's wish....I'm not even sure how to begin explaining 'it'. 'It' is not something you can just tell everyone about. Many of us definitely wish for 'it' before. A small desire in our heart that wants someone else except yourself to see it at least once. 

I had that wish before too, but I know it will never come true no matter what. This is what Colin's wish is like....it is impractical and destructive. There is no way that it will normally work, but that's where our doctors come in. They are here to acknowledge this wish that we had but will never really come true.

38344347.review:
✦✦✦本测评含有大量剧透✦✦✦

“寻找天堂“实则“寻找完美的一生“

如果说Faya是男主为了寄托孤独而产生的在脑海里拥有具象化实体的“青梅竹马”，那么Faya的“离开”大概只是所谓的“大人不相信童话“罢了，男主找西格蒙德公司在自己临终前改变自己生前记忆弥补那些“遗憾”，或许他需要改变的真的只是所谓的那些少许的遗憾，但是那些“遗憾”并没有改变男主本来就相对完美的一生：在拥有了目标的时候开始朝着那个方向不懈努力；在青春绽放最美好的时刻与所爱的人相遇；在家庭安定的时刻诞生了爱情的结晶。虽然最后自己临终前儿子也是单身，但是细想自己的一生，何不已经是非常美满的？

用游戏最后男主和Saya“重逢”时的对话作为总结：
"那些我错过的机会,那些小意外,
和我所有未竟的愿望……
是的，它们还是我的遗憾……
可它们让我拥有了现在的一切"

38342916.review:
花了几个小时打通了这个游戏，简单的谈一下我个人的看法。
       首先是游戏音乐。当初玩去《去月球》是 因为它的音乐。这次的《寻找天堂》的音乐，听起来，没有《For River》那么惊艳，但也是非常优秀的。仔细听，似乎还能感受到《For River》的影响。
       游戏画面和操作方面，和《去月球》相比没有多大改变。有一些改变，但大部分仍然是熟悉的味道。这里就不赘述了。
       游戏剧情方面，保持了 一如既往的高水平。如果说，《去月球》给我展示了一个缠绵的爱情故事，那么，《寻找天堂》则是一个关于成长的故事。关于剧情就不展开讲了，大家可以自己游戏里探索体会。
       有一点要提一下，字幕组怕不是也有秦流感患者。
       最后说一下自己的感想。玩游戏时，我想起两部电视剧：《爱情公寓》和《东京爱情故事》。相信看过的人应该会懂。就不剧透了。无论如何，如果你喜欢《去月球》，那么《寻找天堂》也不要错过。

38342906.review:
So this review is coming from the point of view of someone who love and cried like a baby to To The Moon and bought and played it almost on day 1 and just finished it, so my opinion might be mostly biased of the emotions at the moment

I just did not really enjoy it most of the way

Objectively speaking, the game improved a lot in comparison to To The Moon, even better soundtrack, art, etc

However, most of the negatives of its previously title are still there; puzzles that really have no purpose being there besides extending game time, taking too long in order to get from point A to point B to progress through the story (no, making a joke about it and backtracking in general does not redeem the issue), and other "minigames" that appear throughout the game did not feel like they had any purpose or even felt good to control, though I appreciate that they give you the option to outright skip them, but the problem is still there

So these are all issues related to the RPGMAKER engine in general and whatnot, but the real issue is with the most important reason why most people play Freebird's games:
Writing

[spoiler]SPOILERS AHEAD PROBABLY
The story starts up pretty much like To The Moon, same premise, similar situation, etc, like probably everyone expected from its predecessor, however, pretty much the entire setting gets straight up thrown into the trash and replaced with subplots that are really never resolved in the game, such as Watt's pills which are there for no reason but to add tension or drama,  or just straight up teased as a part of future iterations, such as why the hell is Watt doing shit to Sigmund Corps machine, even though it was teased in the minisodes which I didn't really enjoy besides being an epilogue to the base game. Of course I wouldn't really be mad with this twist of "destroying" everything that has been set up on act 1, I just felt like at that moment I was not going to get what I expected from this sequel, and instead admitted that I was going to get something else, hoping that it would be good.

But it wasn't, the following 2 hours of act 2 and most of act 3 was pretty much a mediocre Man vs Computer plot with a bunch of useless exposition, pointless writing and scenes which a lot of referential humor that for me just felt flat on his face, these 2 hours just made me mad enough to just stop feeling or the need to know anything else for any of the characters, even if most of the ending of act 3 felt really nice. Just for some contrast, I was crying like a baby in the bunny's belly scene, whereas in this one I was just mad as fuck and clicking through most of it.

I don't really know what else to say, I expected it to be a emotional story with a few sci-fi and psychological elements thrown in and lightly discussed or shown, but all I got was a shitty Scooby doo cyber chase plot with some feels that didn't really do its job due to what happened previously[/spoiler]

I wrote this review on the heat of the moment so I might change it later but yeah, I do not recommend buying this one yet, it's not worth it, maybe when it goes on sale for a dollar or if you are really a hardcore fan of other freebird games. But if you want to get into Kao Gao games, this is not the one

38342798.review:
剧情故意绕圈子，埋了很多包袱却没给解释，只能扣分。比如摩托车，比如N和R不同步穿越的原因，比如R对水母突如其来的好奇，比如记忆螺旋追溯的原因。类似的包袱在To The Moon里只多不少，但To The Moon统统给了合理的解释。
抛开剧情，单论音乐，在情绪的推动上明显不如To The Moon，几乎从头到尾一直煽，用力过猛了。
还有，汉化水平太差，很多话没能翻译出原意，而且网络用语过多（神他妈、毛、惊了）。最无法原谅的是，在中后部份（大概4小时游戏时间左右）有一个错别字：“着"被打成了”者“，瞬间产生一种粗制滥造感。不奢求信达雅，但难道连错别字校对都没人做吗？看着片尾长长的汉化组名单我不禁感慨。

38342786.review:
“对我而言，只要活得充实，选择了什么样的道路并不重要。

人的一生如此短暂……我们不可能完成每一件想做的事。

无论我们做了什么，总有其他东西值得一试，总有另一条路值得一走。

所以到最后……我还是必须满足于我所选择的路。

我好像又在说个不停了……Colin，说说你的事吧。你当初为什么想当飞行员？“

“为了飞到世界各地。”

“……就是这样？”

“…………

很久之前，有一个朋友离开了，去了很远的地方。”

[h1]“我猜，我可能是梦想着能和她重聚。”[/h1]

——————————————————————————————————————————

FP之前从没接触过该系列里的其他作品，之所以非常想玩这一作，不是因为《去月球》或者Freebird的名气，仅仅是被内容简介吸睛了而已。“医生”，“弥留”，“最后愿望”，我还以为这款4399会是关于[b]临终关怀和姑息治疗[/b]这类的医疗话题。

虽然，玩完发现实际内容和个人预想风牛马不相及，总体来说还是瑕不掩瑜的小品。说是说“瑕疵”，但是大大小小的问题真是不少；并且，先不提设计方面的问题，我自己在游玩时已经见过四五处BUG，其中两处会让游戏直接崩溃。
故事在中期转折点后的恐怖与搞笑元素演出效果不足，并没有起到调节气氛的作用。在临近结局时节奏略显拖沓，其中一些桥段反复使用，颇有些为了煽情而煽情。游戏的所有道具都排不上用场，只有收集用途而无使用价值。触发回忆的叙事方式互动性非常低，基本上就是按个键然后开始播片儿。碰撞体体积设置地有点奇怪，很多地方走不通，走得通的地方也让人走得不舒服。可调查物品并不丰富，且没有被标记出来，而要命的是这游戏就是靠调查物品来推动剧情。

无论是剧情、叙事、演出还是实际游玩，本游戏没有一点能称得上是完璧。但是各有缺陷的元素被巧妙地搭配，让这些瑕疵不至于分散玩家注意力，从而将本作最大的魅力点，这一整个好故事，尽可能地好好展现给了别人。

——————————————————————————————————————————

一点多开始玩的，本来只想玩个开头体验下，然而剧情过于紧凑，直接玩到第二天早上
玩完按照惯例给个评价，然而已经是意识模糊胡言乱语了，睡觉去，rua

38342032.review: Unlike To The Moon, this game didn't rip my heart out and make me sob for six hours.  Instead, it made me cry with laughter, and with the shockingly relatable plot that sometimes, we must create our own happiness in order to make it through.  The story of this game struck home for me, and Eva and Neil are just as lovely and engaging as ever.  There are loose ends, from To The Moon and the DLC -- but the open ends make me think there's more to come, and I'm willing to wait for it.  It's a worthy sequel, well worth the money, and I genuinely loved every second of playing it.  Support this artist!

38342002.review: 还记得以前看过爱情公寓2里面有一集，讲的是关谷有一个马里奥。唐悠悠却看不见，但是马里奥懂关谷的一切，就算马里奥只是关谷的想象。foye也只是colin的想象，支持他完成他的梦想。记得小时候家里养了只狗，遇到事情都会跟他说，他总是会倾听，我也总是想象他给我回应告诉我，我能克服那些困难。但是我们终归是要长大的，我们的马里奥都会离去，幻想终究是幻想，我们还是要去爱我们的生活。就像游戏里所说的，foye的离去是一个遗憾，Cloin失去了精神支柱。foye的离去也不是遗憾，这让colin拥有了生命的一切。非常非常推荐大家玩这款游戏，用心去回想属于我们每个人的foye。

首先声明这款游戏偏慢热，相当不错，值得入手，强烈推荐！
最吸引我的亮点有3个：
1.剧情：讲述的是两位医生帮助colin解开心解，让他最后与自己和解的故事。 情节由一个个小故事递进推动，新颖之处在于回溯colin的时间并非线性的。为了不破坏游戏体验就不剧透啦，但可以说这些故事到后期会给人满满的感动，关于爱、亲情、梦想等等。
2.音乐：体现制作组满满的诚意啊！绝对是不亚于剧情的另一亮点。 做到了为每个场景量身定制音乐，玩起来很有氛围，耳机党福利！（音乐挺偏向日式风格））
3.角色：我个人非常喜欢两位医生、colin梦中的那个女孩。傲娇、吐槽技能怕不是点满了吧！每次看到一些对话都莫名戳中笑点啊= =可以说，在强大的剧情下人物也显得很丰满~
4.小关卡：不同于一般剧情向的游戏，此作中一些别出心裁的小关卡也大大提升了游戏性！希望购买了的朋友能玩到后面~


再说说缺点吧，我觉得每次过关的那个“消消乐”玩多了还是会有些乏味的，不过瑕不掩瑜嘛，为了剧情肯定要玩下去的。

To this day, To The Moon ranks among my top 3 favorite stories of all time. Finding Paradise tops To The Moon.
The story really drew me in; the unique way of revealing Colin's life kept me guessing right up til the reveal as to just what was going on. And even though I kinda figured [spoiler] Colin would die at the end,[/spoiler] that didn't stop me from trying to will a different outcome.
It made me laugh. It made me cry. Finding Paradise gave me a much needed breath of fresh air and has me waiting with bated breath for any future SigCorp Minisodes and the next episode.

更新：2017.12.21
汉化组态度很不错，目前的汉化版本还在修正中，等待进一步更新。方言表达和网络模因表达不可避免，但是可以尽量去除影响。现在这个影响已经去掉了大部分，应该不会让敏感的人感到不快了。


原测评的”啥鬼“似乎是漏洞，但自己游戏的时候在第一章就遇到了这种翻译，实在影响体验，在新的文本出来之前，暂时不更改测评。

以下为原测评：
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[h1] 不推荐的原因是官中，无关剧情以及其他。[/h1]

游戏只玩到第一幕开头，简中汉化已经让我对这游戏绝望了，很违和的“啥”和“咋”，我玩到的部分没有见过词语“怎么”和“什么”，全部是前两个字代替了。然后汉化还充满了网络流行语。
我就举一个例子：
这两个的结合体，就是在房间二楼的储物室，医生看到绿色的书以后，发出惊叹  [i]“啥鬼？”[/i]
啥鬼！！！！！！！
我玩的游戏少，这是我今年看过的最佳翻译，简直造化钟神秀。

汉化组你咋不上天？？？
官中是在发售前不到24小时添加的，虽然非常感激汉化组辛勤劳动，以及开发商的一番诚意，但是这个官中极其破坏游戏体验。
我去设置改游戏语言玩游戏了，等通关在来改测评

38341561.review:
TL:DR- You may cry, you may not. You may just tear up, and that's ok. That happened to me. If you want a well crafted story in your games, I must recommend this and To the Moon. They are like bread and butter to each other.

I must say something. This game, is not a game. This game, couldn't even comprehencibly be described as a game. It's not even art at this point.

It's a f*cking masterpiece.

For all its faults from its game engine to certain hiccups here and there-all things that I completely don't mind personally-this is the most cleverly made game I have played. 

Also I exagerated at the game part. Which leads me to its improvements. Because it is very much improved since the last 2 games. 

To the Moon was the Stanley Parable before the Stanley Parable. Arguably, To the Moon was the Undertale before Undertale (in that it partially exemplified its trope and genre. Play the original if you really want to know). 

Finding Paradise blows To the Moon out of the water. It is very much an improvement with better gameplay, better pacing (not that the pacing in TTM was not that great), and to me a definite, and I MEAN DEFINITE, step up to TTM's story. I will not spoil anything for you in this review, but if you thought To the Moon's story was wild, wait till you experience this one. 

Critics of the old game said that To the Moon's gameplay was severely lacking. And that was alright, because games weren't like art forms back when TTM was released. And now that people have credited TTM as inspiring the "games as art" form, people enjoyed it so much more. Now, critics of the new game say not much has changed. But SO MUCH HAS CHANGED. 

I must end by giving my compliments to the chef. Kan has done soo much to make sure the game completely covered all the critisisms and faults the original game had. And while there are still holes, by god is it a tremendous effort for him and Freebird, and he deserves to be honored for it. As a writer, I am forever inspired by Kan's work, and I hope to see what he has in store for the Sigmund Corp universe.

38341515.review: 一口气通关了《Finding Paradise》。如果说《To The Moon》是Rosalene和Watts博士为即将死去的Johnny Wyles实现了去月球的“愿望“；《Finding Paradise》则是Colin在临死前告诉博士一个道理：“遗憾“同样可以成就人生。“愿望”与“遗憾”看似对立，但都是一生中不可或缺的部分，从本质上讲其实是统一的，甚至从更高层面来理解，愿望即遗憾、遗憾即愿望。经历了这一次，可能博士对自己的工作也有了新的理解吧。游戏的画风和BGM依旧有非常高的水准，很用心，情感渲染也恰到好处；不过可能是我对这类游戏比较严格，《FP》在节奏方面的把控感觉不如前作，尤其是中间突然加入的RPG打斗，情感转换过于突兀，另外几处致命穿图BUG也比较影响游戏体验，总体来说是一款不可多得的好游戏，值得推荐。

38340555.review:
To the Moon Again? Not this time. This story is a little closer to Earth. Or is it?

"Finding Paradise," the next installment of Kan Gao's fantastic series, is everything I hoped it would be and more. With a delightful mixture of old and new characters, this game will expand the horizons of your mind in ways that you could never have imagined. Where the prequel, "To the Moon," explored the mystery of love, "Finding Paradise" instead unravels the mystery of life. 

Is it wrong to have regrets? To feel alone? Are the memories we hold closest to us real, or imagined? These are things that every human being wrestles with during their lifetime, and Kan Gao's newest story meets them with the carefulness and wit that his fans have come to expect. Add to that a fanstastic new soundtrack, and "Finding Paradise" is sure to become one of your favorites.

You might cry; you'll probably laugh. But you'll certainly be left with a sad smile and a wellspring of thoughts and emotions that only the best kinds of stories can elicit.

Finding Paradise absolutely lives up to the legacy of To the Moon. The writing is top-notch, the soundtrack (and the global sound design !) is a blast, and the pixel art is gorgeous and expressive. 

If you loved Freebird's previous hit, this one is an absolute no-brainer. If you didn't, you would be well inspired to give another shot at this much more nuanced entry. And if you haven't played any of these titles and would like to treat yourself with one of the best narrative games available out there, leave this page and throw your wallet at To the Moon. It costs as much as an AAA lootbox, draws you the same amount of tears, but with awesome memories included in the package.

NB : A Bird Story might be a bit of an oddball, but I highly recommend to play it before beginning Finding Paradise.

10/10

38340269.review:
12月15日凌晨，《去月球》的续作《寻找天堂》准时解锁了，我也在第一时间购买并下载，在八个小时之后，终于完成了整个体验。

和《去月球》一样的是，《寻找天堂》仍然是一个关于男孩、“女孩”和爱的故事，我喜欢关于男孩、女孩和爱的故事。但是在《寻找天堂》里面，尽管故事的结构初看与前作十分类似，但是《寻找天堂》的叙述更加有“弹性”，也更加耐人寻味。


1
游戏的整体系统上面基本继承了前作，许多用以交互的音效都十分熟悉。在整体的音乐表现方面依然十分的稳健，主要还是制作者高瞰本人的风格，毕竟用他自己的话来说，前作就是一个“音乐还不错的游戏”。除了基础的钢琴配乐外，本作在风格没有大变的前提下更多的引入了其他的乐器，例如男主的大提琴、Paye 的吉他、某些时候背景里面的管弦乐团。

每个场景的流程仍然和前作一样，寻找足够的物品作为记忆碎片，使用记忆碎片激活关键物。区别依然存在，例如感觉平均下来每一个场景所需要的碎片明显减少，寻找碎片的难度也减少了。碎片和关键物品都会加上闪烁或者亮边，有一个场景中甚至两个鸭子也给了两个记忆碎片（当然主角也对此进行了吐槽）。关卡最后的图形解密部分也远比《去月球》要细致多变，通过引入了多种图形机制，在通过不同机制的组合，来达到增加难度、提高成就感的目的。但是由于不同的机制互相之间的结合较弱、趣味性不足，增加难度的目的是达到了，但是还是非常简单的谜团，并且解开之后也不觉得精彩。

还有个不同的地方是，本作的许多场景里面的一些地方是不能随意进入的，是要求收集到一定碎片才能进入，这是我不喜欢的改动。我自然知道作者想通过限制碎片数量才能解锁区域的方法来保证体验到的剧情的连续性和完整性，可是我更喜欢原本的在一小段时间内不求前后逻辑、不求时间顺序的讲故事的方式。更何况，作者想要进行互动体验顺序上的引导的话，可以在对白、机制、地形设计上下功夫，而不是简单的封死这条路。既然说到了地形设计，就顺带提几句。作为一个以 RPG Maker 为基础制作的游戏，本作也没有太多可以指责的地方，对于两部前作《去月球》和《鸟的故事》的地图的复用也是在情理之中的。但是少数地形被设计成转折极多的山路，这个时候在事实上给我带来了操作上的不便，不论是用方向键还是点击鼠标，主角极慢的走路速度总是能让我难受。

首发就有中文自然是好事，这一次本地化如此迅速也离不开作者和爱好者的努力。整体上来说，翻译是优秀高质量的。并且尽可能的去揣摩高瞰在使用英文时想表达的细腻的的感情，同时又要做到接地气，这是极为不容易的。但是也有让我不满意的点，例如“大秦话”稍有滥用的趋势，例如有些地方的表达为了接地气而显得没有了英文原文的腔调。名字的翻译此次选择了全部保留英文，自然对我来说没有什么问题，但是对于大多数玩家来说，这会不会造成游玩时的困扰，这也是汉化组值得考虑的。

前作的“战斗系统”只在开头出现了一会儿，而且是为了幽默的剧情桥段服务的。而本作终于在后期出现了三种正儿八经的战斗系统，“横版打飞机”、横版格斗和回合制战斗。飞行射击的部分还是有一定难度的，需要稍稍会背板，多试几次就能过了；格斗部分的话，没有任何难度，我只用攻击键就通关了；回合制部分倒是小有深度，不用特定的方法的话没法取得胜利，所以也需要多做尝试、多开脑洞。

本作的UI交互界面还是一如既往地简陋，分辨率支持不齐全，游玩的时候屏幕还是上下大黑边。但是整体来说，在像素风的 RPG 游戏里面，《寻找天堂》的演出说得上是费过一番心思。有时候在看过场动画的时候也会感叹，“这也能用像素画面表现出来！”，不得不说，高瞰在这方面的能力是足够的。


2
前面也说到，这次的故事结构看起来十分地类似于《去月球》，但是更加有“弹性”。换种说法，《寻找天堂》的故事看起来处处与《去月球》相同，实则处处不同。

最容易发现的便是整体的叙事结构上面的区别，前作的主体的叙事结构结合了游戏的机制，呈现出倒叙的状态。但是在本作，高瞰选择了一种非常让人意外的处理方法，用游戏内的话来说就是“螺旋状”叙事。由于记忆机器的“出错”，两位博士在男主角的记忆中跳跃时，一会落在老年，一会处在童年，两种不同的年龄状态相继出现，最终汇聚在了记忆中的某个点，也就是“漩涡的中心”。所以习惯上一作的玩家一上来确实会有点不适感出现，因为两次连续的事件在时间间隔上面太久远了，不光不利于记忆，不仔细找寻的话，也看不出有什么联系。

在尽可能不剧透的情况下，我只能去聊一聊一些表现上面的东西。（大概会再去写一篇包含大量剧透的文字吧）本作在情感表达方面相比前作要远远来得克制，并且在表面上也显得更加的平淡。最简单的例子就是，在第一次通关《去月球》的过程中，我整一个下午都在流泪；更糟糕的是，第二次为了写东西再去玩《去月球》的时候，我从剧情一开始就不知道被什么触动到，开始情绪失控，哭着通过的前半段。在《寻找天堂》的整体流程中，只有在 Faye 消失的剧情开始，到她再次回到 Colin 的身边的过程，落了几次泪，眼睛也只是微肿。但是在感情表达上面的淡化处理，绝不意味着情感的深度也被淡化，这次的情感远比前作要深层次，也远比前作要难以体味。在 Faye 最终出现的那一段演出，我除了感动和欣喜外，还有莫大的解脱。

感情上面的“深”，也有部分原因来自于这次的几个选题。从《去月球》到《鸟的故事》再到《寻找天堂》，高瞰一直没有放弃对于“自闭症”这个话题的探讨。《去月球》里面的 River ，《鸟的故事》和本作的男主 Colin ，都有不同程度，不同表现形式的病症，这当然和高瞰曾经或者现在仍被自闭症困扰的经验有关。不同的是，本作更加重了对于“我”的探索，为此高瞰在男主的设定中还加入了幻视、妄想症和一些精神分裂的要素。虽然个人不是很喜欢心理学意义上的对于“我”的探讨，也不是很认同现在对于心理学上的“我”的认知，但是不可否认的是，高瞰基于现在的认知，在这个方面做得还是非常的“有趣”。其实我前面有个地方说错了，这不是一个关于男孩、“女孩”和爱的故事，这是一个关于我、“我”和爱的故事。

本作依然还是和前作一样爱埋伏笔，不过还好的就是，高瞰并不是那种管埋不管理的制作者，大部分的伏笔在本作就得到了解决，少部分的奇怪的点也能和几个前作的部分合起来。不过要彻底弄明白这一系列中的关于两位博士的问题，可能还得等下一作甚至是再下一作了，结尾处按顺序显示的过往作品名单也能够说明这一点。让我感到悲观的是，以高瞰本人的制作速度，绝对算得上又一个“有生之年”系列了。


3
如果要我推荐给别人一款高瞰的游戏的话，《去月球》毋庸置疑还是首选，因为其更“大”。但是我私心更偏爱《寻找天堂》，它不似前作那样的“大”，却在“小”的方面做到了更佳。



彩蛋呈现
本作中含有大量的致敬和 neta 元素，不光是对于前作的，也有对于现实世界中的某些元素。这里把我见到后觉得印象深刻的彩蛋列下来。

某一个配角对博士说“你从来没有等电梯的烦恼不是吗”，确实在大多数游戏中，可操作角色都不需要等电梯，直接进去就行。

两位博士在经过两只鸭子时获得了两个记忆碎片，吐槽自己说“什么？这样也有两个记忆碎片？”，大概是对于前作的“记忆碎片获取太简单”的吐槽。

某段回忆里，小时候的男主跌在地上竟然睡着了，某位博士吐槽“他是死了吗？这应该是他的另一个双胞胎兄弟对吧？”，明显是在指代《去月球》的 Jonny 两兄弟。

男主说自己见过獾，出自《鸟的故事》。

某位博士在激活关键物品的时候变成了赛亚人的模样，并且喊出了“龟派气功波动拳”这样的台词，出自《龙珠》和《街头霸王》。

男主年轻的时候，工作的机场的老板完全是一副《教父》打扮的模样，坐在黑暗的房间里面喝冰镇柠檬汁（不加苦杏仁酒的意大利酸味苦杏仁酒）。这里同时黑了《教父》和意大利男人。

住在男主隔壁的邻居是一个特别特别有趣的人，游玩的时候试着操纵两位博士去敲门。

男主 Colin 在小学时代，和前作的主角 John 、River 是同一所学校的学生，并且应该和 River 是同桌。我也很奇怪他们的老师是怎么把两个有自闭症的孩子分到一起的，不过想到这应该是高瞰为了偷懒复用素材而写的剧情就释然了（大误）。

38340108.review:
Another amazing chapter in this emotional set of stories. When compared to "To the Moon" I think this game by far has better "gameplay"- but the "gameplay" still earns the "'s because you are still not here for that. The story is king, and what we have here is another masterpiece. The music is up to the same standard as To the Moon, the gameplay pacing seems better... The only part which I still think To the Moon wins on is the story, however, that is likely subjective as I simply connected more with To the Moon. Either way, a phenominal story and worth enjoying.

While it isn't required for you to play A Bird Story- I suggest you still do. As for To the Moon and minisodes? I'd suggest playing them in their own right, but the game does give you an option to get a little bit of backstory on the core concepts at the start if you don't wish to. This game isn't technologically any different than the first however, so if you are willing to play this game in its current state than you should more than be able to enjoy To the Moon. 

One final thought, be careful with what you read in these reviews. Some have spoiler tags which you may be tempted to mouse over but- don't. Let yourself live this 4 hour story like you did the last one. 

Overal, if you couldn't already tell, I highly recommend this game even at full price.

Ken Gao proves his excellent storytelling once again in this latest visual novel.  If you played To the Moon beforehand you will not be disappointed by this game: it's just as good as its predecessor.  There's slightly more gameplay involved in this one, but it's nothing a little patience won't solve, and a couple issues I had with control and interfacing with the player have been fixed.

If you didn't play To the Moon, but still love a good story and gripping emotional music, I highly suggest this game. The music is a must for this too: I sat at the title screen for two full loops, eyes shut as I just listened, before I could even start the game.  It only improved from there.

38339667.review:
I've been waiting a really, really long time for this and it's been most certainly worth the wait.

Much like To The Moon, Finding Paradise still shows that the director, Kan Gao, can take you on a even greater adventure than his last. The soundtrack is still as beautiful as I expected, and the story-rich gameplay is honestly timeless for the To The Moon 'saga'. I loved how the mementos were given a little more 'gameplay' and slight challenge, and I honestly think I loved this adventure more so than the last. I played it with my spouse and of course, it hit us like a truck in the emotional, yet happy sense and it only makes me much more excited for the future.

Don't pass these games up, To the Moon + it's minisodes, A Bird Story, and Finding Paradise will hook you, and hook you passionately with their beautiful love letters of story telling.

38339233.review:
[quote=寻找天堂] 由于其带来的严重后果，新的人工记忆将取代真实记忆成为病人临终前记住的事， 所以通过修改记忆去满足人们最后愿望的这种技术只能对临死的人实施。 [/quote]

本作主要试图探讨这一概念——即虚构的记忆与真实的记忆到底有何不同，哪一个更真实，哪一个对人更有价值。相比前作的浪漫，本作的科幻味变得很浓。

由于《去月球》中约翰尼的家庭中只有他一个人，所以我们并不知道一般大众对西格蒙德公司提供的服务的看法。而在dlc和本作中，我们可以了解到，是有相当一部分大众反对这种做法的，尤其是死者的家属，可能很难接受死者想要过上另一种人生的想法。尽管这只发生在死者的头脑中，但现实也不过是存在于各个人头脑中的记忆而已，修改了记忆与修改了现实又有什么区别呢？

对整个社会背景的描述丰富了这个系列的内涵和真实性，也为本作的故事埋下了伏笔。

就我个人来说，本作的谜底揭晓时给我带来的震惊远不如《去月球》，实际上，在整个故事开始没多久我就预料到了这种展开，这很有可能是因为我之前玩过了《鸟的故事》，所以对科林的性格有了一些预判。总的来说，故事里没有设计太多悬念，也没有《去月球》的那种命运式的悲剧，有的只是一些关于记忆，生活，真实，勇气的思考。[spoiler] 有些人（可能高瞰本人就是这样）在他的一生中都无法精确分离现实与幻想，就像那些不合时宜的生长的木槿。但那又如何，所有东西自有它存在的理由，它们在你人生的不同时刻陪伴着你，你只需要心怀感激。[/spoiler]

[spoiler]最终的解决方案很有趣，实际上，西格蒙德公司这种混淆记忆与现实的边界的做法才是导致科林开始产生遗憾的原因，让他无法正视自己的幻想与现实。而通过抹消科林记忆中西格蒙德公司的存在，才是让他感到满足并真正与自己的幻想和解的方法。[/spoiler]


西格蒙德是否做错了，科学家们是否将为他们肆意更改记忆的行为付出代价？又或者，他们已经付出了代价？我们都不得而知，期待高瞰的下一部作品!

38339190.review:
I could say this game is inferior to To The Moon, but I wouldn't really be saying much since that's a hard one to top.
(It's still up there though, when it comes to this little peculiar genre)

I'll instead say that it's a very good continuation of an interesting overarching story and world that also offers an "episode" (the patient/client treated/served) with a more than decent story.

The structure of the game itself isn't much different from the overwhelmingly successful previous chapter, which means you'll  likely laugh and cry with the same frequency as you did with the previous one. You have new jokes, inside jokes and callbacks, as well as new iterations of long running jokes; there's also plenty of lines and situations that might cut deep depending on your current emotional state and where you feel you are in life right now.
The two main character maintain their charm but seem to evolve much less compared to the episode where they were introduced, To The Moon. There seems to be less focus on them and more on moving things forward, both inside the patient's mind and outside. Whether this is a problem of characters, scriptwriting or direction is hard to say. Probably a bit of all.

Still.

One one hand, working with a well-tested formula allows you you as the author to play it safe and satisfy your audience. On the other hand, treading familiar territory also means that you as the audience have certain degree of prescience (which can vary depending on your innate intuition) that might impair the overall effectiveness of the work.
The game, in my opinion, plays it excessively safe, resorting to a few tricks (I'm not using more appropriate words for fear of being too specific and spoiling the game for you) that hide truths you may have seen coming way ahead of time. Trick me once, yatta yatta.

It's by no means a bad game, on the contrary.
Just don't expect the same level of impact and emotional rush.
It's unlikely to happen because you're already acclimated to Freebird Games' style.

38339138.review:
While it didn't make me cry quite as much, "Finding Paradise" is as much a beautiful, heart-wrenching story as its predecessor. With gorgeous music, a beautiful world, an enthralling story and intriguing characters (including a pair of familar faces who haven't changed a bit), "Finding Paradise" is everything I could have hoped for in a sequel.

If you enjoyed "To The Moon", you will definitely want to play "Finding Paradise". And if you haven't, play "A Bird Story" before this one. Revolving around the central character, the short ties up some stray memories quite nicely. 

All in all, "Finding Paradise" is an excellent game, one I am glad to have experienced. I cannot wait for Episode 3.

38338960.review:
With pixels and music, this game manages to convey more emotion and heart than most stories. It doesn't overburden you with melodrama or pretentiousness; nor does it ever try to wrangle feelings out of you. It simply plays its course, tells its story, and leaves you speechless by the end. Naturally, the waterworks came on for me but they might not do for everyone. I just think it's worth stating, and I do so without shame, that I choked up towards the end of the game.  


In one word, this game is special. 



As a huge fan of To The Moon -- which no doubt alot of the people purchasing this game are -- I came in somewhat sceptical over wherther or not this game would be able to replicate the magic of it's predecessor. I can safely say that it has met expectations and, in some ways, surpassed them. Even if you haven't played To The Moon, this is an episodic experience and, as such, can be played seperately. That said, I'd still highly recommend you buy To The Moon first and play through it to get that proper sense of continuity and some of the 'in-jokes'. 



I don't really think I need to say much more -- this game is worth it. No doubt about it.

38338473.review:
[h1]前言：[/h1]
漫长的等待是值得的，KAN GAO再一次告诉我们：像素风是不输给3D高科技的、RPG MAKER的正确使用方法、只要剧情和BGM出色就能做出极佳的作品。

操控极少，完全就是看电影的<去月球>为什么被评为佳作？这可能是很多人无法理解的事情，其实这样的游戏只适合感情细腻的人去玩，只有感情细腻的人玩过之后才能明白这样的游戏为什么能够封神，里面的感情因素、细致的人物刻画和出色的BGM都是水平极高的，更重要的是这样的作品仅仅是使用RPG MAKER做的，在很多人都在用RPG MAKER粗制滥造和卖国产情怀或者小黄油的时候，KAN GAO告诉我们什么才是真正的RPG MAKER，什么才是真的用心到位和一丝不苟的作品，什么才是对玩家负责、对自己负责。


[h1]开篇：[/h1]
舒缓的音乐慢慢的响起，大提琴+钢琴的BGM一下子充满了我的内心，故事也缓缓的拉开了帷幕，开篇后我们见到了熟悉的松鼠和经典的BGM，这一次W和R两位博士又将进入一个迟暮之人的回忆去完成他未完成的梦想和遗憾。开篇不但具有轻松和温情的格调，还埋下了不少的伏笔。

这一次的剧情主角是柯林，和上次去月球的强尼不同，他并没有什么特定的临终愿望，而是提出了一个奇怪的请求，而进行记忆穿梭的时候也是这样的，和月球一作完全的不同，这里不方便剧透，希望你能自己去玩。

在穿越回忆后，本次的剧情依旧和去月球一样平淡而真诚，故事缓慢，BGM温柔而舒缓，在经过一些反反复复而平淡的日常后我发觉主角的人生其实是完美的，除了一些所谓的“遗憾”以外根本没有什么不足之处。童年有邻家可爱青梅竹马的陪伴，青年有漂亮美丽的女朋友相随，中年有儿子，老年夫妻相濡以沫，以此为基准简直就是完美的人生，完全找不出他需要改变和进步的地方，


[h1]转折：[/h1]
在剧情进行到一半的时候，两位博士产生了疑惑，那就是青梅竹马这个人仅存在于男主年轻的记忆中，在老年的记忆中完全是不存在的。这也给剧情带来了不小的疑点，而开篇中的一些伏笔也让人觉得和剧情有什么关系，在你逐渐玩下去后，你会有一种违和感，觉得剧情并不是这么的简单而平淡，肯定会有什么重大突破。

玩到第三章的时候，剧情迎来了意想不到的事情，节奏内容越来越快而波动，就像钢琴曲进入高潮区一样的激进而具有魄力，让作为玩家的我内心有了一种莫名的酸楚，我在此刻猜想了无数的剧情的可能性以及后续发展......
但事实上我猜错了，我没有想到剧情并没有按照我想的去发展......


[h1]结局：[/h1]
剧情进入尾声，男主的孤独和<鸟的故事>的关联以及剧情都已经进入了最后的结尾，我们也已经完全明白故事在说什么。

其实我的童年也和男主是一样的，每天父母上班早出晚归，只有我自己上学、放学。暑假寒假也只有我自己在家看电视或者自娱自乐，所以我能理解他的那份孤独和苦涩。而男主是幸运的，他有一位“青梅竹马”的陪伴才填补了他孤独的童年，虽然这个青梅竹马是那样的人，但他对她的友情并不是虚假的。我是能够感受他那份感情的流露的。

如果你玩过<鸟的故事>你就会很快开始对剧情脉络有了新的认识和理解，这也是对本次故事最好的补充。
正因为有着这样的回忆才会让青梅竹马的存在变的合理，这样的回忆既温馨又苦涩。如果你能和我一样玩到这里，你会明白我在说什么。


[h1]评测：[/h1]
我不想把《寻找天堂》和《去月球》这两部作品做比较，因为我认为他们处在同一高度，都是水平极高的优质作品，并不存在谁高谁低。

我能够在这样的作品中找到共鸣，因为我也是一名孤独的玩家，我和KAN GAO所描述的那些主角一样有着孤独的童年，我能够理解他所表达的孤独是什么，他的BGM在诉说怎样的故事，他的动画告诉我什么样的东西。所有他作品中的东西都能带给我小小的感动和细腻的心酸，玩他的游戏不需要看到画面，只需要听到那几首BGM就能感动的要哭。这就是KAN GAO作品带给我的感受，无论别人怎么说，我就认为他的作品是2D中的佼佼者，也是RPG MAKER界的标杆作品。

这样的作品很难用评测去鉴定，只能用感言去描述。而我的感言是：

“人生难免有遗憾和不如意的地方，但是正是因为这些琐碎的不如意才造就了我们精彩的人生；如果一个人的人生过于完美，那么ta还有什么快乐和性福可言，只有体会真正的酸甜苦辣，才能算是完美而又无遗憾的人生。”

谢谢你给我带来的精彩回忆，故事很好；谢谢，柯林
谢谢你给我带来的精彩音乐，用那些描述故事真的太棒了；谢谢，GAO KAN
谢谢你给我带来的一切一切，小小的感动和细腻的感情已经传达到了；谢谢你，FAYE

我不会忘记你们的，这样的游戏我会珍重的保存起来放在特别的STEAM分类里的，OST数字专辑也要快点出啊，还有伏笔DLC也要做哟，加油吧！寻找天堂。

最后；再见，柯林。

38338230.review:
A very well told touching story.  I thoroughly enjoyed the whole game and, much like with the original game, felt a strong connection to the characters by the climax of the game.  It is, very similar to the first game.  Freebird Studios have clearly found a formula for their games which works and is effective to tell the story that they wish to tell, and I am delighted to see that they stayed true to that.

A few points need to be stressed if you are considering buying this game, however.  The main one being that if you’re looking for a game with breath-taking graphics, visuals or interactivity/impact on the story, this game is the very antithesis of what you are looking for, and you should pass it by.  It is, a story told almost completely in 16 bit graphics, wherein you are constantly given the chance to explore and are expected to find what needs to be found in order to progress, and while the odd choice is given to you in this game, ultimately, the choices have hardly any impact, and what little impact they do have is made irrelevant after a few minutes.

I cannot stress this enough, this a game designed solely to tell a single linear story, and it does that very well.  So, if you’re looking for a story driven game and want it to be a tearjerker, this is the game for you (along with the prequel To The Moon).  The game sets out with that one clear goal in mind and does a fantastic job filling the large boots left by the first game.

Overall, I am very happy with this game, and look forward to the next episode in this series.

38336447.review:
Che dire..Apprezzatissimo.
Dopo sei maledettissimi anni di attesa, finalmente il sequel! Ritengo che ne sia valsa la pena. 
La storia inizia in maniera piuttosto leggera e "lineare" (per modo di dire...), ma a partire dagli atti II e III prende una piega molto più profonda e interessante, similarmente al primo gioco. Se vi piacciono le storie pensate e che fanno riflettere, questo gioco è perfetto.



La struttura cita evidentemente quella di TTM, ma viene riproposta con alcune variazioni che riescono a non renderla monotona anche per chi ha già giocato il primo gioco. Inoltre, rispetto al primo titolo della serie ho evidenziato un forte miglioramento tecnico - non solo come qualità (e quantità!) degli sprite usati, ma anche come giocabilità: i piccoli minigiochi fra un ricordo e l'altro sono cambiati e meno monotoni, e anche l'atto di raccogliere i singoli momenti (i "pallini", per chi mi intende) mi è sembrato più scorrevole e naturale rispetto al primo titolo. 

E' all'altezza di To The Moon? 
Beh, il titolo è uno standalone, quindi bisogna ricordare che è autonomo rispetto al primo, e ritengo che l'intento sia diverso. L'aspetto emotivo - sebbene presente - non riesce a catturare l'animo del giocatore come il primo gioco ha fatto. Ma lo ammetto, TTM è l'unico gioco in assoluto che è riuscito a farmi quasi piangere - quindi compiere l'impresa una seconda volta sarebbe stato probabilmente impossibile. Detto ciò, Finding Paradise è e resta un esempio di narrativa perfettamente eseguita e che cattura il giocatore (nel mio caso, ho giocato in due sole sessioni, 2+4 ore in meno di una giornata) prima con la simpatia dei personaggi e poi con la storia - sia quella dell'episodio che l'interessantissimo filone conduttore della serie.


Come da descrizione, il gioco è uno standalone a tutti gli effetti, con una sua storia autoconclusiva. Nonostante questo, consiglierei vivamente a tutti gli interessati di dare prima a un'occhiata agli altri titoli della serie, in quanto senza di essi ci si limita a seguire il singolo caso narrato ma si perdono gli sviluppi della trama generale, a mio parere geniale. Penso sia quindi necessario approcciarsi prima a To The Moon, che introduce il filo conduttore (ed è un capolavoro!), ma anche ai due miniepisodi natalizi e a A Bird Story; i primi perché necessari a comprendere la trama che unisce gli episodi, e il secondo in quanto di fatto è la spiegazione di una parte importante della vicenda. (e non mi dilungo per spoiler ;) )

38334462.review:
Finding Paradise is a part adventure, part visual novel videogame developed by Freebird Games. It's the sequel to their previous effort, To the Moon, and the second game in a supposed series. Once again the player takes control of two scientists, dr. Eva Rosalene and dr. Neil Watts, employees of a fictional Sigmund Corporation, as they use the technology at their disposal to help a dying man, Colin, achieve happiness by exploring his memories and change them as needed.

Since the game could be considered a direct follow-up to To the Moon, Finding Paradise offers the player the same gameplay as its predecessor. You are basically tasked to visit different memory locations, find all the points of interest and then solve a rather simple, grid-based puzzle mini-game: so once again the core gameplay should be considered just a vehicle for its story, which is arguably the game's main attraction.

Once again the developers have made a super use of the RPG Maker assets: the environments look absolutely stunning and detailed for this kind of game, the sprites' animations are most of the time incredibly convincing and every once in a while the gameplay will suddendly change, often in humorous and surprising ways which are totally unexpected (in a good way).

When it comes to story, Finding Paradise the same quality featured in the original game, and maybe it even surpasses it. The whole game is really a very touching tale about the true meaning of happiness and the role of regrets and mistakes in our live: heavy subjects that the developers managed to take on in a very tasteful manner.

Given the very low price of the game and the kind of experience you are going to get for yourself I can't see any reason not to reccomend Finding Paradise to anyone

38334291.review: Я люблю игры на RPG Maker, в них есть какая-то изюминка, можно сказать, душа. Но игры от Freebird Games всегда выделялись на фоне всех инди-проектов на RPG Maker, это просто нечто особенное, уникальное и неповторимое. Думаю, это и случается, когда действительно талантливые люди воплощают в жизнь отличную идею в той области,  которую любят всей душой. Finding Paradise  - достойное продолжение истории, приквелом которой являлась A Bird Story, и новая часть нисколько не уступает старой, а во многом - даже превосходит. Стало больше уместного искромётного юмора, игра умеет иронизировать над самой собой, персонажи всё так же харизматичны, история пациента как всегда трогательная и не лишена неожиданностей. Музыка волшебна, о ней невозможно написать, её надо услышать. Идея с мини-играми в этой части доведена до ума и отлично реализована. Для меня до сих пор остаётся загадкой, как разработчикам удаётся создавать такие душевные истории, это действительно нечто невероятное. Ну и, конечно, нас не оставили без кусочков головоломки, которая отчаянно терзает любопытство всех поклонников вселенной To the Moon, корпорации Зигмунд и её работников, правда, эти кусочки вызывают больше вопросов, чем дают ответы. Хочется думать, что Кан Гао готовит нечто грандиозное для развязки, и, зная разработчиков, я в этом даже не сомневаюсь. Freebird Games задали высочайшую планку качества своими играми, и Finding Paradise лишь доказывает, что они не собираются её опускать.

개인적으로 정말 기대했고 기다린 게임입니다. 발매하자마자 구매했고 플레이 했습니다. 일단 스토리에 대한 평가는 개인적으로( 다른분들은 생각이 다르실 수 있습니다) 이 스토리가 전작인 투더문보다 좋았습니다. 정말 심금을 울리더군요. 게다가 어 버드 스토리부터 예상했던 거지만 게임성이 전작보다 신경쓴 부분이 많이 보입니다. 정말 좋은 발전이라고 생각합니다. 게임 몰입도도 많이 높아졌고, 게임 중 간간히 나오는 유머러스한 부분들이 많아서, 긴 시간을 플레이 하면서도 전혀 지루하지 않았습니다. 스토리에 대해선 일절 스포일러를 언급하지 않을것이고, 궁금하신 분들은 직접 구매하셔서 플레이해 보시길 바랍니다. 10퍼센트 세일중이니 고민해 보세요. 근데 언어적인 부분이 어려운 단어가 꽤 많아서, 비영어권 국가 분들은 맞는 언어 패치가 나올때까지 기다려야 할 것도 같습니다. 아니면 저처럼 사전을 찾아가면서 하셔도 되고요. 


여유가 있으신 분들은 꼭 구매하셔서 해보세요. 정말 돈이 아깝지 않을 겁니다.

아 저는 이제 와츠박사 떡밥이 또 나올때까지 다음 에피소드를 또 기다려야겠어요. 

플레이 하면서 정말 좋았습니다. 제 인생작품이 될 것 같네요. 장장 3년을 출시 연기 된걸 기다린게 전혀 아깝지 않을 퀄리티였습니다.

38334139.review:
I cried. Something I haven't done since I played To the moon. While I was a little bit uncertain in the beginning if it could live up to 5 years of buildup, after finishing it I can wholeheartedly say that yes, it really does. It has enough twists to keep it fresh, while still keeping the quality that To the moon had.

If you liked To the moon, then I would fully advise buying this game.
If you haven't played To the moon, I would advise buying and playing that first.
In case you didn't like to the moon, this isn't the game for you though. The game improved a lot on some of the minor flaws To the moon had, but has still the same style and atmosphere.

TL;DR
Great game. Enjoyed it a lot and couldn't hold back my tears (again).
Would advise to buy to anyone that loves the first game in the series.

38334002.review: Absolutely beautiful and emotional and heart-wrenching and absolutely worth every minute spent playing it. It's hard to compare whether Finding Paradise or To the Moon was 'better' because I think they succeed in different ways. To the Moon had a beautiful and original story to tell. But the themes and implications of Finding Paradise go beyond what was accomplished in To the Moon, at least for me. The stories in both games made me cry. But in Finding Paradise, I think I was crying more so because what the game was trying to communicate hit home. Really hard. For my life and the lives of those I love. For everyone who worked on this game, bravo. What you accomplished is truly beautiful.

38334000.review:
"To the Moon" war in meinen Augen ein Meisterwerk der Geschichtenerzählung. Natürlich habe hatte ich hohe erwartungen an den Nachfolger, als dieser unter dem Titel "Finding Paradise" angekündigt wurde. Zwischenzeitlich fragte ich mich, ob meine Erwartungen vielleicht zu hoch sein könnten, und zu einer Enttäuschung führen würden, wenn es nach der langen Wartezeit endlich erscheint.
Mitnichten.
Finding Paradise überrascht auf vielerlei Art. Wer glaubt, im ersten Teil bereits verstanden zu haben, welchem Muster alle Geschichten der Reihe folgen werden, wird hier bereits recht früh von einer unerwarteten Wendung eines Besseren belehrt. Die Story, der Humor und die Spannung sind perfekt aufeinander abgestimmt, um ein weiteres unvergessliches Erlebnis zu zaubern. Es regt an, darüber nachzudenken, welche Bedeutung das Leben hat.
Ich bitte um Entschuldigung, wenn der Stil dieses Reviews zu überheblich oder poetisch wirkt. Ich habe das Spiel vor wenigen Minuten beendet und spüre noch die Rückstände der Tränen auf meinem Gesicht.

38333960.review:
When this game came out, I bought it as soon as I could and played. I've been anticipating it since I bought every single other product from this publisher out of love for To The Moon. And [i]wow[/i]... So here are my stats:
[list]
    [*]Time in game (as of writing this review): 6.1 hours
    [*]KDR: 0/1 :(
    [*]Times laughed during gameplay: At least 6
    [*]Times cried during gameplay: 4.5
    [*]Times cried after completion by thinking/talking about the game: 3 (so far, it's only been a day)
    [*]Times I've looked for the OST: 2 (It's being released tomorrow, 12/16)
    [*]Tissues used: 0*
    [*]Finals failed because I should have been studying instead of playing this game: (pending)
[/list]

99/6 for all them feels, 1698/4 would recommend

This is a beautiful and moving story, and somehow made me cry more than To The Moon did. My only complaint is that a couple of the mementos were hard to find,[spoiler]both times it was the flowers, so it could have been my stupidity or colorblindness,[/spoiler]but that's it. So go buy it, buy it all. Give them your money, they deserve it. Play the game, you (probably) deserve it.

My only question is are we gonna have to wait 7 years for episode 3...

[i]*I didn't use any tissues so the tearstains that are all over everything can remind me of the feels, thus reevoking the feels, thus causing more tears that will stain even more things. Eventually, the tissues will probably get wet too, if only because they are the only thing not already tearstained. So yeah, this game got feels.[/i]

38332876.review:
This is just quality work. 

They avouided the one thing I was afraid of in the story, redundancy. And they did it masterfully. Yes, they have a fancy machine to dive in memories of people, but unlike some AAA companies,  they are not milking this idea. *nudge nudge wink wink* Each time I play a Freebird Games title, I see something new. Something.. human. I can see people from a different perspective. It's so organic, so relatable. The story so good, it's not even trying to hide behind anything like realism or fancy gameplay mechanics. 

This is, in my opinion, the sole reason why no one is even considered graphics before buying this game. Not saying they are bad. I'm just saying we gamers have a general conception of "more realistic the graphics, better the game" these days. We are automatically pushing the other mechanics like gameplay or story to the side. This is preventing us from even trying out something indie, like To The Moon. 

Even so, just look at the numbers of dedicated Freebird fans. I don't think they heard the game from advertisements.  Ask all of them. I bet at least half of the player base comes from a friend advice. This kind of advertisement is the healtiest and the strongest one. Cus it means how good these games are.

So...






No, screw it. I played this game through in one setting. I can´t even think straight right now. I never thought they could top To The Moon, and yet, there it is. Finding Paradise, the... Sequel... to this series of RPGMaker games made by Freebird, is everything that To The Moon was, cranked up to eleven. I had high hopes for this game, and it blew them straight out the water. [spoiler] Even the god damn ending song was better then To The Moon´s "Everything´s alright", and that´s saying something [/spoiler]. If you liked TTM, go grab it while it´s still on discount, and even if you do get it for the full price, rest assured that it will be worth every single cent you spend on it. I love games that try something new, be it gameplay-wise or in how they handle storytelling. Just like DDLC absolutely impressed me by screwing with me in ways I never thought would get to me so much, TTM and this game completely flashed me with the way the story is told. If you are looking for a good game to cry to, look no further than this.

10/10 would cry again

38332024.review:
写这段字的时候，现在是12月16日凌晨三点，大脑有些缺氧，可能是哭的太用力。

上一次嚎啕大哭还是在半年以前。我以为自己不会再那样丑陋，可是真的忍不住了，十点半下好游戏，稍微收拾了资料就直接一头扎了进去。第一次阳台的时候就哭了出来，到最后完成任务时，整个人都在发抖。

Finding paradise 寻找天堂
剧本9.5/10
音乐10/10
汉化组12/10
总评我给9.5

额外表扬一下汉化组，非常靠谱的翻译，同时也有大量即时梗，翻译组里肯定有秦先生的粉丝，画风很熟悉。

时而笑得像个疯子，时而哭的像个傻子。有的剧情会让我深陷其中，有的故事则让我脱离其外，忍不住思考这样一个问题：

我能不能写出这么好的故事。

另外就是故事外的故事，如果说《去月球》是开始的话，两个dlc和鸟的故事则是补充完善，《寻找天堂》是继承，未来的第三个故事又会将整个系列推到什么高度呢？

睡觉吧睡觉吧，缺氧真的难受，这几行字写了这么久，丢人。

38331833.review:
You're probably here looking answers to the question: "Did it make you cry?"

I can only speak for myself, but the answer is yes, although not as much as To the Moon did. Keep in mind, however, that I appreciate these games not just for being emotional, but because they give insight into people's inner selves and desires, what makes us what we are, and how complicated the sum of what makes us, 'us', is.
And approaching Finding Paradise from this direction, I can say it's a great success like its predecessor was.

Everything about Finding Paradise is amplified and refined compared to To the Moon. Its visuals are prettier and more detailed, with more expressive and animated character sprites that really bring the world to life. Soundtrack is amazing, and rearranged leitmotifs from To the Moon makes me feel at home, being in the company of the doctors.
Storyline is also expanded: intrique is built up very well, and there's more story happening outside the actual job this time around. The story beats feel familiar, while also building up its mystery in a less straightforward, more ambiguous manner. It isn't totally unpredictable, but Kan Gao has certainly improved in making things have more than meets the eye.

While the good parts of To the Moon are amplified, the same applies to the flip side. There are still some tonal inconsistencies, accompanied by Watts' signature video game riffing. At one point it goes to new heights in a very jarring way that feels completely redundant. The puzzle-solving gameplay is still just kind of there, but it doesn't get in the way of the narrative, so I digress. There's also some missed potential with the game's themes, but I won't go in-depth with it. Most of my issues with the narrative cluster in the final act of the game, so they're not persistent problems, but they keep me from singing very high praises of the game.

In the end I still think Finding Paradise stands tall next to To the Moon, even if it might not gain the same cult status. If you have any love for To the Moon or an appreciation for video game narratives, don't miss out.
It's definitely a worthy experience and a legitimate expansion of the original's worldbuilding and ethical musings.

38331774.review:
Finding Paradise tells a story that can be relevant to many, but it is one that goes untold in our society due to the nature of the topic. None of it was what I was expecting, and the game was more personal for me than To the Moon.

Similar to To the Moon, you will have a type of puzzle to solve as you go along, and you will find mementos to unlock memories. Don't expect the puzzle to be the same as To the Moon though. There is new music heard throughout the game, and there are also new renditions of music from To the Moon. Occasionally, there are corny scenes, and one felt a bit longer than I'd like (thanks a lot Neil). I would say that A Bird Story is an important part of understanding the patient. It hints at the patient's secret more than one might think.

Although the game is slightly shorter than To the Moon, it is just as meaningful, or more meaningful for those who can relate to Finding Paradise. I enjoyed it all the way through, despite one of Neil's scene and the cliffhanger.

38330703.review:
【前言】
此篇测评包含剧透和个人主观猜想成分，请未通关的小伙伴把重点集中在「推荐」上呐~^_^ 15号的凌晨2点左右准时蹲在商店入了库，在双休日之前迫切地通关写下这篇或许肤浅的见解。（Freebird Games收割了俺唯二的测评…orz）
<Attention>RMXP的优化性不可避免，请务必耐心，这部作品游玩重要的要素之一就是耐心啦。

【总体评价】
老伙计（Freebird Games）依旧是厚积薄发的套路啦（拍肩）。另外，此部作品似乎更有小说化的倾向，并不知道是不是我的错觉…总之大体上，除了昭示/揭露Colin内心的「愿望」真相那一部分之外，感觉像是读一部具有丰富交互性的视觉小说，倒不如说，R剧本身似乎可以纳入“视觉小说”的范畴。特别是最后Neil与另外两人的对话，赤裸裸的就是Episode-3的伏笔嘛。此部相比前作哲学性强，好玩的地方更多了。（同时这里感谢汉化组，笑话翻译得也很棒hhh  eg：谎话谎话，裤衩焚化）

【与前作的联系】
在开玩前在思考是否和前作有着什么藕断丝连的关系呢？当然结果是和自然地呈现——
<1>Eva在踌躇于本次客户愿望复杂性的时候，Neil调侃道先前更为棘手的，我想有包含上次帮助John登月的经历。
<2>在第一次跳转至Colin童年时期的记忆时，父母出差留他一人看家，其中一幕是Colin突然从卧室冲出来然后摔倒在地板上良久没有动静，Neil好奇是不是已经死了，Eva则指道那否则就没有未来的Colin了，于是Neil又补充Colin会不会有亲生兄弟…（John & Joey）
<3>两人在准备顺着Faye顺藤摸瓜，清除相关记忆时，Neil提议这份工作交给Eva办比较好（Eva为了阻隔John成为宇航员阻力源之一——River，某种程度上清除了相关记忆）
<4> etc（一周目没太仔细= =，一定有我遗漏的地方）

【人物个人向评价】
「Neil & Eva」
可能相比上一作，人物刻画可能减弱了不少。（在《To the Moon》中，个人觉得非常具有戏剧性，尖锐的矛盾/冲突就是对于River存在的处理方式，Eva一方面可能为了工作目的或者是出于自身理性的判断认为River在中学时期的消失更有利于John愿望的实现；而Neil当时则极力想阻止Eva，对于John来说，记忆本身可有可无的界限更加模糊，但在客观人性角度又太残忍。两人间的对比算是鲜明描写人物的有力途径之一吧…）本作中戏份多（或是比较引人注意的）或许还是Neil吧，接前作结局某种疑似突发性病症的神秘线索，本次算是确定了这一事实。以及Neil本作的滑稽演出更加出色了哈哈哈，不一一细数，在还未挖掘Neil的性格和身份的同时，看似逻辑严密，幽默感十足的专家其实感性十足，本作再次圈粉啊…和Faye最后的对话…对于Neil在西格蒙德隐蔽的动作同样很有悬念。//Eva没有留下太深的印象，只是最后的对比，本作有Eva如约参加葬礼的镜头，而上一作则是Neil一个人去给John的墓碑献花，Neil也提到，他想做的是普通地造访而不是参加葬礼。但是Eva小姐姐也很有趣，比如长颈鹿图案的袜子。（）

「Colin（Faye）& Sophia」
这里大胆地把现实的Colin和Feya统一归纳成内心的两大人格（例证：Faye最后在云端和Neil说道他们俩是罕见的，能够理解“他们”世界的存在，人称代词）（不负责任用MBTI划分，Colin可能是INFJ-T）。在养老院和妻子度过生命的最后一段时光，一边回想以往的记忆一边慢慢让自己接受终将死亡的事实大概算是已经是个很不错的时光，但是Colin对于自己在外界定义的「幸福」中有些迟钝，虽然说着“我很幸福，不是你想的那样”。但是对从记忆的清晰度来说（虽然也要考虑现实老龄阶段记忆力衰退的事实），显然在Feya频繁出现的那段时期（截止于曾学习的家族系小型飞机场关闭），Colin要活跃的多。再回到和西格蒙德以及和妻子在送走来看望自己（送了纯棉帽，风大以免生病）的儿子之后，在长凳上的交流。提及自己有许许多多的小遗憾，在签订合同的时候Colin似乎还没有完成生命中最后一次也是应如往常的仪式——自我认知。所以调侃着“许能实现很多愿望的愿望”，以及和自己的真实模棱两可的“想要变得充实一些”的想法。在Sophia一开始看来，这似乎是不可理喻，早在水族馆提及自己的想法「人生本来便有很多遗憾…」在践行她自己的价值观的同时，在自己眼里，Colin应该是很幸福的，所以开始的争执可能也是误以为Colin只是拘泥于一大堆的小遗憾，虽然在长椅上的对话看起来似乎和解了，表达自己想法后会释然很多「希望你在有了一段崭新的人生后不要抛弃家人。」兴许是并未理解，所以才有Drs初到家中时的态度。在Neil离开记忆地图回到现实签署公关文件时候，看到阁楼上Sophia在翻阅着Colin全是“空白”内页，还有褶皱的绿皮日记，这个时候渐渐地放下了某种尊严：Colin将死之至，已经没有必要纠结这些东西了，作为妻子还是希望让他安详地完成意义上的救赎——到无所谓态度的转变，太太也是个很温柔的人啊。Colin的精神需求在和Faye分离之后也许就很少被满足了，这或许也是导致在弥留之际，觉得整个人生似乎还有一大段未被填满的空虚，人们大概对自我状态的评价很大程度上取决于临近的时期，和Faye“相处”的那段时期太遥远了（参照结尾在记忆回溯第一段，Colin经过熟睡的妻子走向阳台，在背向栏杆时和Feya的最后一段对话。“已经很长一段时间没见了吧。”）。对于Feya的角色定位，个人理解是从Colin本身人格的抽离后再塑造，只不过这种形式的自我对话有那么一点儿神奇，从头至尾，我一直坚信着Faye是确实存在的。而对于动机缘由，陪伴诸如此类，或许还解释不太清。比如如何在拟定的情境下给自己灌输，「做个飞行员」这种想法，浪漫而不可思议，只是觉得，如果在Faye的身份揭露后，如果再加长篇幅，丰满其形象或许游戏的内涵可能会更上一个层次。总之，这两位的角色塑造我觉得很棒。

【哲学相关】
篇幅中，开头Colin的言行举止以及真相揭露后到葬礼之前，都值得去哲理性探讨。人生意义的讨论应该是无止境，也是不该妄加指责的。不及每个人的追求方式，不论有无意识，大概也可归纳为独一无二的一种。哲学家们也在研究着这个深奥的课题。看着顶端的时间尺，思考着一个人一生的时间就这么被归纳成大约640 pixel的横条，好像还带着那么一点儿不甘心。故事中Colin与Sophia相遇的那一时候开始，就好像走上了标准化的模板。如此安稳地履行自己的义务，来得困难又容易。回到更加复杂的现实社会，在马斯洛需求理论的金字塔中，从最为基本的生理需求到自我实现实在是无法详细阐述的过程，但更加现实的是，其实大部分人，都还在为基本的生计操劳奔波。所以看到Colin，似乎也代表着理想主义的典型。不说中国古代的天下大同或是西方的乌托邦，物质的追求无止境，精神更加深不见底。交叠繁复的元素，大概只会越陷越深。甚者，在还未像Colin想清醒认识自己的精神需求之前，便罹患谵妄或是阿尔兹海默综合征。唔，还是不继续表达自己可能有些狂妄的见解了。但这个系列能留下可以探讨的空间很大，这点很喜欢。

【喜欢的几个场景】
<1>（太滑稽了忍不住写下来）Neil把欺负人的熊孩子的玩偶扔进水里，于是被欺负的那个魔性地扭动起来…= =
<2>某日清晨，Colin回到卧室，在阳台和Feya告别后回到床边亲吻了Sophia。与此呼应地是，在生命体征监护仪不再波动地那一刻，Sophia抱着与世长眠的Colin。
<3>Neil在记忆看似毫无章节可循地虚无空间里游荡以及在云端和Faye最后的对话。

【结尾】
通篇总结下来，深知自己还未察觉到许多细节，同时多了几分喜欢。很自豪，很骄傲，对于仍然用RPG Maker XP的都是有爱的人呐。顺便，Freebird Games招人吗？画地图还是有一手…（> <）

[待编辑]

38330513.review:
[b] FINDING PARADISE [/b]

Bem, como começar...digamos que é dificil explicar como fiquei exatamento depois de zerar esse tão esperado jogo desde seu anúncio. Tudo que foi mostrado conseguiu me entreter tanto quanto o seu antecessor, então aqui vai meus pontos:


[b] ENREDO - 10/10 [/b]

Diferente de To the Moon, o impacto emocional aqui é menor, talvez por trocar o tema amor por amizade e arrependimento. Não me fez chorar, mas me fez refletir e muito. Um enredo muito mais crítico mas que não deixa de ter seu apego emocional também.

[b] SOM - 10/10 [/b]

Kan Gao como sempre é brilhante em suas composições e aqui ele não deixa nada a dever. Uma trilha sonora apaixonante, inclusive com algumas musicas renovadas de seu antecessor, com uma pegada um pouco diferente mas que com certeza quem jogou vai se identificar.

[b] GRÁFICOS - 8/10 [/b]

Cenários lindos apesar de alguns terem sido retirados do próprio To the Moon. Se foi um apelo nostálgico ou não, não da pra considerar bem um defeito, porque nada nesse jogo deixou de fazer sentido.

[b] GAMEPLAY - 7/10 [/b]

Puzzles novos foram adicionados, mas ainda assim sem desafio algum. o gameplay continua mínimo e não é o ponto forte do jogo, até mesmo pela engine datada do RPG Maker


Se voce se emocionou com To the Moon, vale muito a pena se aventurar por aqui e vale mais ainda se deu uma jogada em A Bird Story também. Kan Gao já soube te emocionar e aqui ele vai saber te surpreender, com um enredo ainda mais diferente do esperado.

38329855.review:
Finding Paradise is a beautiful story. 

It's calmer and more subdued than To The Moon, which on a personal level was exactly what I needed in my life right now. 
I think most people who played To The Moon had their lives changed in some way by it. Whatever that change was, it somehow makes this game feel... right? It's hard to explain. 

Sure, nothing will ever be To The Moon. But nothing else needs to be To The Moon.  We've experienced it and grown from it. It's done its job. 
This game is the natural progression from that. While in some ways To The Moon taught us about love and finding strength in someone else, Finding Paradise shows us the importance of loving yourself and finding strength within, along with other lessons about life, regrets, and what-ifs.

Of course I could just be taking out of my ass here, but that's what I get from it. Maybe you'll get something completely different.

Wherever you are in your life, these games speak to you in ways that other games can't.
Whenever someone says, "yeah but these are barely even games", tell them they're wrong. These stories are MORE than just games. 
So much more.

10/10

38329757.review:
[h1]Finding Paradise em uma palavra eu poderia dizer que é Sensacional.[/h1]

Arrisco dizer que é até melhor que o To The Moon

O jogo acaba abordando dois temas muito significantes hoje em dia, não vou comentar sobre pois acaba sendo spoilers da maneira que é tratada, mas que são mais pesadas e comuns no dia a dia e muitos não percebem.

Da metade do jogo para o final não parava de chorar pois começou a ligar a história e vi muito de mim no Collin, e os problemas que ele passou diante das memória com dois familiares próximos a mim que seriam meu tio e minha mãe, infelizmente meu tio com a condição que tinha do problema agravado faleceu faz 2 meses (por conta desse mesmo problema)

Sem duvidas vale o preço cheio (mesmo se tivesse em promoção eu pegaria pelo preço full, como eu fiz, peguei antes da promoção de 10%)

Kan "Reives" Gao, lançou um video um dia antes sobre as expectativas do jogo, e um desenvolvedor nunca esteve tão errado quanto ao que ele disse sobre a trilha sonora (claro que pode ter sido marketing, o que eu não duvido), fora algumas osts "remaster" como a Having Lived, muitas musicas do A Bird Story estão presentes tocadas de outras maneiras, é simplesmente lindo as musicas, até a Best Detectives in the World que eu não curtia tanto ficou muito boa neste jogo

No quesito dos gráficos, não tem o que discutir é aquilo mesmo mas melhorados, as animações mais trabalhadas e com umas expressões faciais fofas demais xD

Podem comprar sem medo pelo preço full ou promoção, mas pelo amor de deus ajudem o Kan Gao para ver se ele faz um capitulo final, pois para quem não sabe tem uma história paralela com o Dr. Neil Watts.

[h1]Notas[/h1]

[*]Graficos 10/10 (é por RPG Maker e vindo do TtM/ABS teve uma evolução nos personagens

[*]Trilha Sonora 10/10 (Começava a tocar a Faye's Theme/Paradise/The Scale Song e uma que toca no inicio eu já chorava)
 
[*]História 11/10 (Os temas abordados são mais pesados que o To the Moon)


[h1] Um dos melhores jogos que eu joguei atualmente, não precisa de gráficos para ser algo lindo, e eu espero um filme de ambos os jogos[/h1]

NP(Nota Pessoal): Não vejo a hora de lançarem a trilha sonora do jogo para comprar na Steam, e até mesmo já fiz a minha primeira insignia do Finding Paradise e dependendo pego até a Foil.

38328986.review:
tl;dr: More of what you love. Cannot go wrong with that (y)



Edit: No matter what I write, I know I cannot do this game justice just by my own words, because it's just that great. But still, I really feel like I should at least give an analysis/comparison of this, especially for the sake of people who have previously played To The Moon. Keep in mind that this will contain no spoilers.



[b]1)[/b] In To The Moon, the feeling of sadness is more distributed throughout the whole series kind of equally, by that I mean the parts where you travel from memory to memory, each memory had it's own "aww" moment that makes you feel sad, if that makes any sense to you. 
In Finding Paradise, the sad parts are more isolated from the happier ones. 

[b]2)[/b] To The Moon had a great sense of humor, but in Finding Paradise you'll probably see yourself laughing even more often. Yeah, I guess this game has more parts that are funny than parts that are tragic compared to To The Moon. But still reminding you, both are pretty sappy stories.

[b]3)[/b] A finale with a great tearjerker potential -> checked. Exists in both games.

[b]4)[/b] Both games have this mystery surrounding the patients at the start of the game. While playing Finding Paradise, even though you'll find yourself scratching your head and trying to come up with many different possibilities and scenarios in your head early on, but soon you'll probably guess what is going on before the game tells straight to your face. To the Moon nailed the mystery part much better and was much harder to predict, at least that's my opinion of it.

[b]5)[/b] I know very few people didn't enjoy To The Moon as much for it being "too pretentious". While I don't share their sentiments (I liked To The Moon very much), I still can see where they are coming from. I mean, 8 year old children philosophizing about the meaning of stars and the loneliness and stuff, and a main character whose emotions and actions are incredibly hard to understand (River).
Finding Paradise keeps it less pretentious in that aspect, while not losing any depth. For most of the time, you will understand the actions and motivations of all characters involved, and it will make sense. 

[b]6)[/b] The patient in Finding Paradise has a much more interesting character and a great sense of humor compared to Johnny from To The Moon (at least in my opinion :P )

[b]7)[/b] Finding Paradise has more "gameplay" moments, though I personally found that a little bit too distracting from the main story, even though they were generally comedic moments more than anything, take this as however you will.

[b]8)[/b] How could I forget this? This should go without saying anyways. Both have equally amazing, hauntingly beautiful soundtrack. 


All in all, there's no reason you wouldn't love this if you loved To The Moon. Both are very great, and a must play if you are into story driven indie games.

38327964.review:
I feel as though it's safe to say that [i]Finding Paradise[/i] has been highly anticipated for a number of years. For me, I've waited 3 years and I can honestly say it did [b]not[/b] leave me disappointed.

[i]Finding Paradise[/i] may be the second episode of the [i]To the Moon[/i]... series...? but it's able to function as a standalone title. There are a handful of jokes that might go over your head if you haven't played the first installment (I'm looking at you, squirrel), but nothing that takes away from the enjoyment of the game. In fact, you have the choice of skipping through the dialogue of how the Sigmund Corp. works if you don't want or don't need it. If you have played it before, you'll definitely get a few extra laughs out of the dialogue and one or two familiar locations.

I initially thought the story was going to be predictable, but boy was I wrong. About halfway through the game, I sat there proudly thinking I'd solved the problem and was just waiting for Neil and Eva to confirm everything for me. Needless to say, they did not. In fact, the only thing I was able to guess correctly was the significance of the green book. I truly appreciated the game's ability to keep me guessing; I kept flipflopping between what I thought was actually going on with the technology, and with Colin's memories.

I also found the story narrative to be believable. It was able to maintain its futuristic elements while still somehow being grounded firmly in reality, especially the emotional aspects of the game. I recall a lot of negative criticism on Neil's poor comedic timing in the first installment, and I think that's been addressed here. The humor is appropriate and we're able to appreciate the more somber scenes without interruption from jokes or puns. Moreover, the dialogue itself feels a more natural and not quite as stilted as it sometimes came off in the first installment.

Even though I loved [i]To the Moon[/i], I was worried that a similar gameplay idea would make the game stale or boring, but thankfully that's not the case. You still have to find mementos, but breaking the barrier is a bit easier (and more challenging, depending). The patient is a unique individual, which also helps the games from being too similar.

One more gameplay aspect is the idea of choice. While the opportunities to make decisions are few in number, they are, for the most part, pretty meaningful. They allow the player to see the morality of Neil and Eva, especially Neil who has opportunities to break protocol and handles such times in a unique manner.

As expected, the music was phenomenal. I enjoyed the remixes of familiar songs from [i]To the Moon[/i], but the new songs were just as amazing. They all fit the mood and the settings, and for those who have played the first game the music will definitely be nostalgic. As I expected, Laura Shigihara made a return to sing another beautiful piece.

Overall, I feel this game is an absolute gem. It's reasonably priced for a game that's a little over 5 hours long with decent replayability, and if you enjoyed  [i]To the Moon[/i] you'll probably enjoy  [i]Finding Paradise[/i]. While I'm glad my 3 year wait didn't end in disappointment, I'm definitely not looking forward to a years long wait for the next installment.

Thank you Kan Gao, and the rest of the developers, for making such a beautiful game.

38327103.review:
Finding Paradise is an excellent game with a deep story and valuable life lessons on loneliness, growth into adulthood, death, regrets, and what it means to be human.

Death is something that every one of us will have to face one day. In most video games, we are supposed to avoid death to win. In Finding Paradise and To the Moon, we explore this issue of death instead, as well as the struggles that a dying person may have when they realize their life is almost over. Both games have meaningful messages, that have made me a better person.

While To the Moon gave huge emotional impact to most people who played it, I think Finding Paradise will have bigger emotional impact on lonely people,[spoiler]especially those who had an imaginary friend when they were growing up[/spoiler]. To me, the last few scenes really hit home, and I couldn't help but got very emotional and broke down in tears. Such a beautiful and inspiring story! Definitely worth the price, even more. Every minute spent in the game was meaningful. And I definitely will replay this game when I need to be reminded that life is beautiful and our struggles in life are worth fighting.

To Kan Gao and Freebird Games: well done, and thank you for this masterpiece.

38326631.review:
ACHTUNG: DIESE REVIEW KÖNNTE SPOILER UND VERMUTUNGEN ENTHALTEN: WENN IHR FINDING PARADISE NOCH SPIELEN WOLLT, DANN BITTE DIESE REVIEW NICHT LESEN:

Finding Paradise, der direkte Nachfolger von To The Moon ist das 2 große Spiel der Abenteuers von Dr. Eva Rosalene und Dr. Neil Watts, welche in Auftrag von der Sigmund Corp ihren Patienten versuchen vor deren Tod ein neues Leben zu ermöglichen.
In diesen Fall sollen sie Colin Reeds zu einen neuen Leben verhelfen, aber ist das überhaupt erwünscht....?

Finding Paradise ist ein ausgereiftes und wunderschönes Spiel, welches vom Entwicklerstudio Freebird Studio veröffentlich wurde. Die musikalische Begleitung des Spiel ist einzigartig sowie der Witz, dass mehrere kleine aber feine Minigame mit einprogramiert worden sind macht Finding Paradise zu einen sehr guten 5. Spiel der Sigmund Corps. Reihe, wobei die letzte Szene mich persönlcih aufregt, da uns wieder etwas der geheimen Geschichte hinter den Spielen angeteasert wird, was wir aber erst in den nächsten Teilen der Hauptreihe oder der Minigeschichten erzählt bekommen.

Trotzallen empfehle ich jeden dieses Spiel!

38326623.review:
新作在故事叙述上明显比to the moon上了一个档次，并不是说to the moon的故事不好，但是作为一款慢节奏的游戏，to the moon倒叙的方式会让玩家难以投入，前期完全不知道to the moon在说什么的肯定不止我一个。同样是一路设悬念，新作对于节奏的掌控明显比to the moon好很多。新作在这方面显然做了很多的努力，一是改变了之前完全线性的叙事方式，另外在故事开头就交待了游戏的设定，二是加了很多的梗和吐槽。
虽然游戏介绍说没玩过前作也可以玩，但是还是推荐把a bird story，to the moon和2个dlc全部补完再去玩，之后你会发现这个游戏的很多有趣的地方的。
给该作的汉化组打call，汉化质量可以说是我见过的游戏中最好的了。
为了避免剧透而且个人文笔不好就不说关于剧情的评价了

音乐：10/10 听着Wish My Life Away写完的这篇评测
游戏性：7/10 一个剧情向游戏就别对游戏性要求太高了，已经比to the moon好很多了
画面： 9/10  一个像素游戏依旧能表现出人物细腻的神态和动作，Faye卷头发动作好撩人啊
剧情：8/10 其实很想打10分，但是貌似感觉没有to the moon那种催泪的感觉了，可能是老了吧。

综合评价：还看个锤子的评价，买买买啊，ost预定。
有生之年能不能玩到下一部呢
