I bought the game and played it in a row. 

This game is exactly like To the Moon (in the most positive way possible). It is a hard to explain combination of humor, joy and sadness. The gameplay is still minimal, the riddles are better than the ones in To the Moon. The graphic art and music are wonderfull. The story is very well done and perfectly executed. If you pay attention you will get the main plot twist before it is revealed but thats not a bad thing at all. 

There are some more signals about the greater story of all parts but the cliffhanger at the end of To the Moon is still unresolved. It looks like there will be a episode 3 sometimes. 

I would pay a lot more for this game! It, together with To the Moon has one of the best stories I have ever expirienced.

Story 11/10

Overall 10/10, would cry again

38325646.review:
玩到一半的时候以为是红玫瑰和白月光的故事
没想到后期一路反转，最后一幕colin亲吻熟睡的Sofia和sofia亲吻临终的colin的画面重叠在一起,colin终于放下了执念，重回现实的温存。
看到这里的我终于止不住眼泪了。
可以说我能理解colin那种心情。我小的时候家里出了重大变故，在亲戚家寄住一段时间之后又度过了很长的一阵孤独压抑的生活，见不到家人，也没有同龄人可以倾诉，于是慢慢地就学会了在脑内构筑一个美好的虚幻的世界。那里比现实温情多了，有时候我甚至会觉得只有那个世界是完全属于我的，而我只是独自在现实中受苦。我开始逃避，讨厌一切使我不安的东西，拒绝和旁人有所接触，只活在自己期许的想象中，总觉得生活不应该是这样的，它应该更友善，也更可爱，所以我不能接受这样的它。
所以看到那句“对于曾经连放弃幻想、拥抱现实也需要心理斗争的人来说……”时，我真的被戳的体无完肤。我一直活在过去，自怨自艾，总怀揣着“如果当时没有发生那些事情”的想法浑浑噩噩度日。已经发生的事情我无力改变，总是在臆想中的未来到来时去悔恨过去，这样的我实在令人生厌。而存在于另一个世界中的我大胆果决，乐观健谈，是我成为不了的样子。
感谢作者带来这么棒的作品，finding paradise比起前作已经上升到对人生的反思了。我想我也是时候和我脑中的世界告别，去迎接现实了。或许现实不尽美好，但也正是因为各种遗憾才得以称之为人生，一味地抵触未知的前路只是自欺欺人罢了，既然已经走到这里了，那就再试试还能走多远吧。
希望百年之后，我也能在回味这一生的时候见到那个我想象中的人，将这世间冷暖慢慢说给他听。

Just like the first game "To The Moon" this is a great and emotional story-driven game that in my opinion only hase one big issue: The game engine. That being said, the limitations it brings only really bother me on two fronts: Resolution and diagonal movement. Being forced into a 1999-level resolution doesn't do it many favors since it pretty much leaves you with a weird resolution change or has you play in a small window which is why they'll do the switch to something more appropriate for any potential further games. 

The gameplay mechanics themselves are appropriate for a game with that much focus on narrative. It doesn't hit nearly as hard as To The Moon did, but that isn't a bad thing in itself.

If you've liked To The Moon, you'll like this one as well. If you haven't played it I'd suggest playing it first.

38325183.review:
Были очень завышенные ожидания, которые еще бы чуть-чуть и не оправдались, но [spoiler] последние минут 10 сюжета, всё же смогли заставить мои глаза моргать немного чаще,  сама игра намного меньше давит на жалость [/spoiler] . Не могу не сравнивать сиквел с To the moon, сюжет здесь намного глубже, хотя исполнение иногда подкачивало, музыка стала немного менее нависающей, что объясняется спойлером. Геймплей слегка топорный, это лишь половина беды, ради разнообразия [spoiler] в некоторых местах были написаны окна диалогов, которые либо не влияют на развитие сюжета, либо просто говорят тебе: "Эй, друже, ты тут забыл кое-что, вернись!" [/spoiler] . Мини игры порадовали, хотя и ходьбы стало больше, но это всё чушь на блюде в игре, где основной фокус на сюжет. Не без удовольствия потратил 5 с половиной часов.
И еще небольшое напоминание русскоговорящему покупателю лично от меня: я смотрю в оригинале либо с английскими субтитрами достаточное количество контента, но здесь мне порой было довольно сложно не пользоваться переводчиками. 

7,5/10

38325099.review:
一个在7102年看来糟透了的游戏引擎.

一段有关死亡和人生遗憾的故事.

几首扣人心弦的曲子.

出色到应该去拍片而不是制作游戏的叙事水准.

一个少用点梗或许会更好的中文本地化团队.

一段足以拿来当噱头的足够漫长的制作过程.

还是一样的配方, 还是一样的味道.

故事讲透, 伏线回收, 章节合拢.

每次都只差一点, 只差一点或许就可以把故事讲得更有诗意, 不会让人觉得那是靠BGM渲染出来的短暂感动.

每次都只差一点, 只差一点或许就可以让最后的演出像Undertale一样触动人心, 不会留下令人遗憾的张力不够的结局.

每次都只差一点, 只差一点或许就可以把作品的立意拔高, 让它不再像是个只满足偷窥嗜好的过家家级侦探游戏.

也许这个系列就是这样, 不会在音乐以外的事物上追求完美, 期待着新作能够自我挑战突破极限, 却每每落空.

是啊, 毕竟最后我们还是会被高瞰的音乐所折服, 也许这样就足够了.

38324896.review:
[quote=]
 “我想让你们帮我度过美满的一生……但不能改变我已经经历过的那些。”
[/quote]
[spoiler]
“我喜欢你啊，笨蛋！你真的蠢得真的很恰到好处。”
“只要能正确的伴奏，什么都能变成好旋律”
 “我只是来说再见的”
希望每个人都能找到自己的Faye，哪怕她终将一去不复返
[/spoiler]
《To the moon》的续作，还是熟悉的味道
剧情上并不像前作那么催泪，引人共鸣，但是本作主题在成长意义上却是格外深刻。
总有些事物陪伴着我们成长，却又不能陪我们到最后。
直到有一天，你会回首往昔，惊觉这段宝贵人生是如此转瞬即逝。
所谓成长之痛大抵如此。
[spoiler]
Colin：“今天天空很美。”
Faye：“一直都是啊”
Colin：“……你不用再离开了”
“我现在会飞了”
“不论你去哪儿……我都可以和你一起走”
Faye：“……你可真顽固，不是吗?”
“你不觉得现在你已经长大了，不用我再留在这了吗？”
“如果别人知道了，他们一定会嘲笑你的”
Colin：“他们爱怎么笑就怎么笑吧，我不在乎。”
“……你才是造就了我的人”
“因为你，我学会了飞行……也是因为你，我一直练习着大提琴。”
“……你教会了我怎么练习那些音阶”
Faye：“不，Colin……”
“那些你不知道的事，我教不了你，那些你不愿做的事，我也帮不了你。”
“……也许你想的，只是有谁陪着你。”
[/spoiler]
[spoiler]
Colin：“我只是……不想孤单一人了。”
Faye：“当然了……如果我走了，就算你不想独处，那些孤单的时刻还是会来。”
“可这就是成长的一部分，这也是人生的一部分。”
“他让我们与我们所爱的人相处的每个瞬间都无比珍贵，让我们的回忆价值千金。”
“.……它还驱使你去寻找那些你在我身边找不到的东西。”
“外面有一个更大的世界在等着你呢，Colin。”
“我不能保证一切都会顺利，但是……”
“.……我知道，只执着于我们的篇章的话，是翻不到你所需的一切的。”
“是你把我带到了这个世界，我不会忘记的。”
“有些事物注定会伴随着你……但有些事物只能陪伴你到这。”
“用我的方式……你知道我会一直在你身边保护你。”
“无论什么事情，只要它是我做得到的……那么你也一定可以做得到。”
[/spoiler]
[spoiler] 
弥留之际，Colin也终于给出了他的答案
Faye：“……老顽固，你在找我吗？”
“没事的……我一直都在呢。”
“我只是来说再见的。”
“只不过……告诉我一件事就好。”
“.…..你现在还有什么遗憾的吗？”
Colin：“遗憾吗……”
“.……是啊，我有很多遗憾。”
“但是……已经没关系了。”
“那些我错过的机会，那些小意外，和我所有未竟的愿望……”
“是的，它们还是我的遗憾……可它让我拥有了现在的一切。”
“而我所拥有的一切……无论什么都换不走。”
[/spoiler]
音乐方面，比前作更为惊艳，主题曲Wish My Life Away响起的时候，眼眶还是有点湿润了（OST出了后一定要入手）
还有一些小彩蛋，比如本作男主和前作男主竟然在同一所学校，男主结婚的地方就是前作中灯塔的地方吧hhh
综上，没什么事的话，不妨试试这款游戏，绝对不会后悔的
最后有什么想说的么？
“……谢谢你，哪怕是谁也不在身边的时候，也有你一直陪伴着我。”

有时，通往回忆的路途窒碍难行  有些空白让你想起，有些让你忘却  有些记忆轨迹引导着我们的记忆  
我们不管做什么事情都要面对人生，逃避不一定躲的过，面对不一定最难受，孤单不一定不快乐，得到不一定会长久，失去不一定不再有，转身不一定最软弱。Colin是千千万万渺小的我们，当我们渐渐走向独立走向成熟的时候又何尝不曾害怕，何尝不曾孤独过，何尝不被这世界冷漠相待。我们总在伤害中学着更加坚强，再离别中学着更加独立。每个人总会告别自己心中的那个Faye，告别自己心中的那份恐惧和不安。
[b]“在真的到来之前。我们永远都没有准备好” 	[/b]
那些你不知道的事，我教不了你，那些你不愿做的事，我也帮不了你  ......或许你想的，只是有谁陪着你  但你已经花了太多时间在我身上，想象着那些不可能的事物......   它让我们与我们所爱的人相处的每个瞬间都无比珍贵，让我们的回忆价值千金  它还驱使你去寻找那些你在我身边找不到的东西。
我们用一生的时间做着两件事：行走与选择行走的路。但无论如何，人总是会后悔，会有遗憾，人总是在想如果有更好的选择.....如果那时我做了什么事......
[b]“外面有一个更大的世界在等着你呢，准备好了吗？” 	[/b]
那些我错过的机会，那些小意外，和我所有未竟的愿望......  是的，它们还是我的遗憾.....可它们让我拥有了现在的一切  而我所拥有的一起，无论什么也换不走。
或许是不知梦的缘故，流离之人总追逐幻影。[/spoiler] 
[b] “是时候回家了”	[/b]

38324534.review: Как и свой предшественник To the Moon, вышедший 6 лет назад, Finding Paradise убедительно доказывает, что хорошей игре не нужен огромный бюджет, целый штат разработчиков и именитый издатель за спиной. Хорошей игре не нужна современная графика, продвинутый геймплей, даже мультиплеер. Хорошая игра не пытается выжать из игроков как можно больше лутбоксами и прочими микротранзакциями. Всё, что действительно нужно, так это интересная идея, захватывающий сюжет, чарующая музыка и неповторимая атмосфера, и этими качествами игра обладает. Игры такого рода сейчас редки, но именно их игроки будут помнить всю жизнь и называть шедеврами.

也好，期待续作。

38324443.review:
Holy Cow!

To the moon was a beautifully crafted masterpiece that hit me right in the feels. Honestly i never expected "Finding Paradise" to be even remotely as good as its predecessor because Kan Gao just set the bar sooo high.
But what should i tell you? This game is just as good and emotional as the first one, if not better. Kan Gao just has an incredible talent for writing these kind of stories. I cried just as much as by playing "To the moon".
The music is also amazing and so fitting. Great work here also from Laura Shigihara.
If you loved the story of Johnny and River then BUY THIS GAME ASAP! You will love it! I promise! For real! You get a lot of references to the first game and i also love the fact, that the backstory about Neil and Eva is continued.
I already can´t wait for the next game in this series.

38324040.review:
比起前作《TO THE MOON》少了一份感动，多了一份回味。
分别，这个词是我们总会遇到的，亲人的逝去，好友的诀别，每一次都是那么刻苦铭心。
本作中包含的分别，每一种都是无奈的选择，而每一次分别，都牵引了故事线。
主人公父母的离开，造就了他孤僻的性格，一头驯鹿狗成了他唯一的伙伴。
Faye的出现打破了这份孤寂，他开始了自己的人生。
直到妻子的出现，他知道，Faye只是一个投影，而自己终究还是要迈出那一步。
但他也做出了约定，他一定会过得很好，并要将自己的故事，在人生的尽头说给她听。

然而真正到了那一天，他却迷茫了，自己的人生似乎没有那么美好，充斥着瑕疵。
他觉得，没了Faye的人生，就是一团烂泥，他开始否定自己，他隐藏了美好的结局，看到了糟糕的过程。
他失去了遇见Faye的勇气。

可Faye真的需要他的每一步都完美，每一次过程都与众不同吗？
不需要！

38323868.review:
[h1]17년 최고의 인디게임[/h1]

[b]본 리뷰에 스포일러는 포함되어 있지 않습니다.[/b]

Finding Paradise 는 To The Moon 의 정식 후속작으로써 기억을 조작해주는 회사 지그문트의 직원들이자 주인공들인 닐 와츠, 에바 로잘린 박사가 A Bird Story 의 주인공이었던 콜린의 기억을 조작해준다는 내용입니다.

스토리에 대해서는 '완벽하다' 라는 말만 하겠습니다.
이 평가를 봐서 게임의 재미를 반감시키고 싶진 않습니다.

우선 투더문보다 좀더 발전한 연출들과 게임성이 눈에 띄는 장점입니다.

투더문의 연출은 모두 컷신에 의존하여 쯔꾸르 게임을 플레이하다 일러스트 작화를 보다가 하는등 좀 아쉬웠지만 Finding Paradise는 조금 유치하고 촌스럽더라도 게임으로 직접 컷신을 만들어낸 부분이 굉장히 인상적입니다.
물론 일러스트들도 나오지만 비중이 확 줄어들었습니다.
게임내에서 등장하는 모션들도 상당히 발전했습니다.

또한 조악하지만 슈팅게임, 격투게임, 턴제 RPG라는 플레이 방식을 자연스럽게 녹여내서 웃음도 유발하고 은근히 도전정신도 불러 일으킵니다.

당연히 좋은 BGM들도 게임의 재미를 배로 늘려줍니다.
투더문과 비교해서도 손색없고 게임의 분위기와 아주 잘 어울립니다.

퍼즐들도 발전해서 단 한가지 패턴밖에 없었던 투더문에 퍼즐에 비해 굉장히 난이도 높고 머리쓰게하는 퍼즐입니다.
물론 그냥 막 누르다보면 되는 퍼즐인건 마찬가지 이긴 합니다... ㅋ

맵디자인도 굉장히 좋게 바뀌어서 쓸데없이 돌아다니거나 메멘토 주으려고 돌아다니는 동선을 최소화 했으며 뜬금없는 메멘토 획득포인트도 최대한 줄여 게임 몰입에 큰 도움을 줍니다.


그러나 아직도 우려먹는 RPG메이커... 덕분에 거지같은 조작감과 다중입력 미지원 등으로 인해 상당히 거슬립니다.
다음작품에서는 꼭 비슷한 느낌을 내더라도 다른 엔진으로 변경하였으면 하네요.

또한 비영어권 국가들의 유저들에겐 쥐약같은 단점이 하나 있습니다.
게임이 한국어를 지원하지 않는데 게임내에서 등장하는 대사들은 하나같이 다 어렵습니다.
주요 스토리를 보는데에는 크게 어려움은 없지만 게임에 소소한 재미가 되는 대화부분이 너무 해석하기 어려워 플레이에 방해가 될 정도입니다.

적어도 해외 레딧에 올라온 게시글들을 사전없이 90%는 독해할 실력은 되야 그럭저럭 플레이 가능하다고 봅니다.
아무리 EBS 수능특강 독해를 잘해도 전부 구어체기 때문에... 현지 영어와 친하지 않으면 플레이가 힘듭니다.
(언제가 될지는 모르지만 한국어를 공식 지원할거라고 합니다.)


만약 충분한 영어실력과 인내심을 가진 플레이어라면 꼭 사서 플레이해보시길 바랍니다.
투더문을 뛰어넘는 스토리와 반전, 엔딩을 보장합니다.


솔직히 말해서 14년 A Bird Story에서 '곧' 출시될거라 했던게임이 3년이 지난 후에야 출시가 된거라 기대반 불신반으로 플레이 했으나 정말 완벽 그자체인 게임을 보고선 3년을 기다린 보람이 있다고 느꼈습니다.

한가지 걱정되는점은 후속작이 나오는 주기를 보자면 제가 30살 먹었을때가 되서야 지그문트 시리즈의 최종장을 볼수 있을것 같네요....

38323480.review:
Long story short, if you liked To The Moon, you'll like this one. Everything great about the previous game was polished to a mirror shine: the main duo is as eccentric as ever, the overarching plot and mystery are more interesting, and the soundtrack is, again, amazing.

While TTM took a fairly straightforward, heartwrenching story but told it backwards, Finding Paradise has a more complicated structure, and deals with more themes and ideas than TTM. The focus, I feel, isn't about making you cry as much as it is about making you think about life (as well as other specifics I won't spoil).

That being said, the gameplay loop is much of the same. You'll still be pointing and clicking your way through environments, trying to find that last damn memory orb. You'll play arbitrary match-3 games and do lots and lots of reading. It all still works, but it started to grate on me by the end. There are some jokes and plot points that just didn't work for me, especially in the last part, but the game redeems itself by the end.

It's good, it's emotional, it's surprisingly philosophical, go get it.

38322916.review:
Finding Paradise is a direct sequel to To the Moon. It is not necessary to play To the Moon to understand what's going on, but I [b]extremely recommend[/b] you play To the Moon first if you haven't already. Finding Paradise's story hit me just as hard as it did with To the Moon [b]because[/b] I played To the Moon first, and I wasn't expecting what happened; To the Moon is a narrative set up to make you cry, whereas Finding Paradise's narrative makes you think about life and what really matters to you. Having said that, although the fundamental premise of both games are the same, you're going to get a different experience with Finding Paradise than you would in To the Moon, so don't think it's just "the same game twice" because I can safely say it's not.

Like To the Moon, the story is about 4 hours long, and I played it all in one sitting to get the entire experience without any immersion breaks. Finding Paradise really made me re-think about life in a different light (something I thought I'd be used to having clinical depression problems) and I think it's a very powerful sequel to an already powerful title.

38322053.review:
A fitting sequel to To The Moon.
Kan Gao is a genius of a writer, director, songwriter, and game maker.
Can't wait for next project (such as Sigmund Minisode and A Bird Story)
When the OST of Finding Paradise comes out, I'll definitely get it.

A different approach and plot from To The Moon (well, at least not the tragic ways, it has its own story which can't be compared to its predecessor)

[spoiler] To The Moon's plot was mainly to fix a tragic life of a man in which he was robbed off. But Finding Paradise stands for different plot. It spins around a man (Colin Reeds) who was having a normal life, in which he doesn't have any tragic lost (like To The Moon's Johnny Wyles). But Colin, is having an imaginary friend in his youth (which was some kind of mental issue of schizophrenia). The only loss he's gotten into was he's moved on way far from his imaginary friend. And I'd like to say it's very touching. Because, Colin has the very life he's always wanted, yet he lost a part of himself he was longed for. [/spoiler]

Thanks again, Kan Gao.
Final words and rating: 10/10 for giving us the story that deliver different feels from To The Moon. But still touching our heart to an extend. [spoiler] Thank you for giving me the understanding that when you get life exactly what you wanted, you gotta sacrifice something to earn it. [/spoiler]

제작자 Kan Gao 님에게 직접 메일을 보내 문의했습니다.
결과적으로는 한국어 지원해 줄 거라는 답변을 받았습니다. 물론 정확한 날짜까지는 언급 안해주셨고요.


저는 한글패치 기다리기까지 힘들어서 일단 영어로 엔딩을 봤습니다.
중간중간 너무 생소한 단어는 사전 찾아가면서 했고요.

결과적으로는 대만족입니다. 역시나 기대를 저버리지 않네요.


단, 전작인 투더문과 같은 애틋한 사랑이야기가 주된 내용이 아닙니다.

게임 내적으로는, 시간을 거슬러 올라가는 방식에도 차이가 있습니다.
기념물 퍼즐을 푸는 방식 또한 조금 더 복잡하고 어렵게 바뀌었습니다.

그리고 마지막까지 와츠 박사에 대한 떡밥이 계속됩니다.
결국 또 다음 에피소드를 목이 빠져라 기다려야 할 것 같습니다.

38321620.review:
I planned on playing Finding Paradise over the course of a few days. I ended up shooting through the entire game in one sitting. Just goes to show you how engaging the story is.

Anyway, this is the sequel to 2011's indie hit To The Moon, though you don't need to play that one to enjoy Finding Paradise. Even so, I still think you should play To The Moon first. I'm finding the Sigmund Corps. series to work like the original Star Trek episodes: some move your heart, others make you think. This is more of a thinking piece than an emotional love story, but it is still rather emotional and I did almost cry at the end of the game. Still, I find that playing To The Moon, will help you understand the basics of this alternate future and how the technology can be used to help others. This game puts those mechanics and morals under scruntiny and asks if messing with one's memories is really nescessary to give someone a happy ending, which is why playing To The Moon first will help you appreciate the conversations more.

That's not to say this game is without humor. Our favorite scientists, Dr. Rosalene and Dr. Watts, are back to snark and make terrible puns. To The Moon made some nerdy references, but this game goes full-out on the references. The memories themselves have some fun moments too, mostly because the game's subject is quite an imaginative sort himself. But even the scientists get some great character moments and rather suspicious motives. What are you up to, Neil...?

Finally, the game's art and animation improved a lot since To The Moon. The character sprites are tiny, but you can still get a lot of emotions out of them. The puzzles and minigames were also much more engaging, though a bit trickier than To The Moon. Or maybe because I suck at video games. XD And the music in particular was really moving, mostly because the characters are musicians and have a connection to music. Some To The Moon tracks do return, but the new pieces do shine brightly. 

If there is one thing I want to nitpick, it is the search for memory links. Most of the time you can find what you'e looking for, but ther were times where something wasn't obvious until I did a mouse-clicking frenzy on the screen. Not sure if it was just me or what, just something to keep in mind.

Overall, great experience and great time. I'll be thinking about the questions the game raised for a while, and I will be buying the soundtrack when it comes out.

38321542.review:
As soon as it was available to buy, I bought it. And as soon as I got home from work (Mind you, I bought it while working) I sat on the couch and, for the following 4.8 hours only got up to pee.

I discovered To the Moon through a friend, and then I watched Markiplier, Pewdiepie and Jacksepticeye playing it. I bought it and I played it in a friend's account. I still haven't played it in my account because I'm not ready for an avalanche of feelings.

I liked this game. I'm not sure whether I prefer Finding Paradise or To the Moon. To the Moon hit me hardest, I think, but I only teared up in Finding Paradise when the half-dead person dies.

It has cool moves, new features and it gives us a hint at a third game! Which, of course, I will be buying as soon as it comes out. Hopefully, there isn't a bridge as it existed between To the Moon and Finding Paradise.

10/10 would buy and playing and tear up again.

38321064.review:
I have waited for this game since the release of 'To The Moon'. And it is not a disappointment.
For those who played or watched 'To The Moon', this game is a must-play (or watch Youtubers playing if you don't have money). 

Finding Paradise is a great sequel to the series. The premise of the story is the same as To The Moon, with Dr Watts and Rosalene on their routine job. However, this story is different from To The Moon's as the patient in this story is... not of their regular routines. 

The good points in this game is basically
> Plot. Whether your life story is relatable or not, the plot gives to all several valuable lessons
> Soundtrack. Needless to say, the music is made by Kan Gao and Laura.
> Humour. Humour deserves a separate point. It is well integrated and does not feel out of place or overwhelming. 

The room-for-improvement points. Note that these aren't bad points that will deter anyone from playing this game, but just some (extremely) minor gripes from me. 
> Plot delivery. Well I am not a master storyteller, but at some points in the game I could not tell the mood of the scene or  whether a scene is an important scene or not.
For example, the scene when the truth was revealed [spoiler] Schizophrenia [/spoiler], I couldn't tell the mood and was immediately bombarded with the feels when the dialogue hits. There are more examples but I will avoid posting more spoilers.
> Does not come with tissues... you will need it.

To conclude, once you finished (or have) To The Moon, please buy this game.

Don't expect much in the way of interactivity, save for the occasional minigame. This is about as linear as it gets. The mechanics are to service the story, not the other way around.

38320359.review:
Masterful spritework, captivating music, juicy plot. Do not come with certain expectations obtained from To The Moon, as this game attempts to establish a more broad tale through worldbuilding and foreshadowing rather than serve as a single, beautiful tearjerker. 

Noticeable performance issues (likely due to the platform this game was built on), and creative-yet-slightly-distracting mechanics which can divert attention from the intended atmosphere a little too strongly. Characters had some flat qualities, and plot was haphazard at crucial moments which replaced some mysteriousness with simple confusion.

Will definitely remain a devoted fan after another incredible game. As a writer and dreamer, I was able to connect in a very personal way to the essence of this story. I am looking forward to more planned-out, well-executed pieces in the years to come. With lower expectations of sentimentality, I will be able to more fully enjoy the next game by focusing on the story as a whole, rather than expecting a heart-rending one-liner.

Thank you, Kan Gao, as well as everyone else who has worked in or collaborated with Freebird Games, for putting so much passion and love in an RPG Maker game which really means something -  in a world where big video game companies are heartlessly and shamelessly scrounging for cash.

38320169.review:
I would Highly Recommend anyone who plan on playing this game to play bird story right before it.

So it finally arrived. I was literally counting date before this game was released, purchased as soon as it got onto the store, finished it just now. To start off, as always, writing review about this game is hard just like To the moon, simply because I do not want to spoil anything, and so much things are floating on my head and I am not sure if I can really write it too well about it. 

I am planning on re playing this game sooner or later simply because there are many things that I felt like I missed and some stuffs I couldnt fully understand, so I will have to give a second run for this game. 

For Music, as always I would like to give 10/10. To the moon made an awesome music pieces, very repetitive, but very addictive. Compare to To the Moon series, I would say that I liked To the moon music bit more (I started playing Piano after playing To the moon as well), but that is only in comparison to To the moon. Compare to other games of this genre, I would give 10/10 without hesitation.  Especially the main theme, "Time is a place" is such an awesome piece.

For story, story of finding paradise is very different from To the Moon. I wouldnt approach this game thinking we will have some kind of heartbreakening love story that will make you shed with tears. Rather, this is story about man, story about his life. 

How should I put it... Playing To the Moon feels as if you are watching well made drama or novel about love story. It isnt story about us. It is story about River and Johnny. It is story about them. However, Finding Paradise is bit different. It feels as if it is a story about me, story about you, and story about all of us. There is no such thing as heartbreakening love story. Rather,  it is story about our life. Our past, present, future, regrets, dreams, fulfillment, friends, lovers, children, and goes on. 

Playing to the moon made me shed a tear. After playing Finding Paradise, however, I find myself sitting on a chair at 4am, with so many thoughts about myself, my past, my present, my future, and about my life. I do not know, or I cannot say whether playing this game has any impact about my own life or not, but what I can say for sure is that playing this game has changed how I view about who I am.

Is this game better than To the Moon? I do not know, you may love To the Moon but may say meh, story of finding paradise was so-so. Simply because To the Moon makes you much more emotional, whereas finding paradise makes you feel tranquil. 

Thanks Ken Gao for creating such an awesome game. 

Just piece of advice for people who are planning on playing this game, do not rush it, just take it slow and read each lines slowly and do not miss anything out. Give yourself whole day, and just play from Bird story to Finding Paradise. If you take this slow, it will give you unforgettable moment after you finish the game.

And lastly, dont try to judge this game. Dont try to judge meh compare to To the Moon, its not that emotional, it is not as "new" as it is. Just take the story slowly and go with the flow. I think a lot of time we miss good things because we are too busy judging them.

Thank you and have fun.

38319974.review:
Well, here we are at the long-awaited sequel to To the Moon. Whats there to say about it?

For starters, it's NOT To the Moon. Yes, Eva and Neil are back, yes they are performing the same job on a new patient, yes the graphics are identical, and yes the music is still amazing. But going into this game expecting the same kind of experience would be a mistake.

That is not to say the game is inferior. It is a great and welcome addition to this game series. But it is great for reasons other than "It was so emotional it made me cry" like its predecessor.

No story spoilers here, but if you go in and just enjoy the story, you will not be disappointed.

38319298.review:
[b]No quería hacer la reseña, ya es muy noche, pero realmente he visto que la mayoria de las reviews son en inglés y se que hay gente que apenas y entiende el inglés, agarrense que esta reseña viene con spoilers, si no quieres spoilers solo salteate hasta los "pros" y "contras", no se preocupen, pondré el texto que tenga spoiler con la etiqueta "spoiler", así que no la verán a menos que pasen el raton encima [/b]

Primero empezamos con una intro como To the moon la hizo, el juego combina comedia con momentos tristes e inclusive, por loco que suene hay "acción", y en efecto, el juego es una secuela tanto de To the moon como de A bird story, realmente no importa mucho si no jugaste los anteriores, como dijo Kan Gao en un comentario hace un dia "no es necesario que juegues to the moon o a bird story, debido a que son historias diferentes", aunque, recomiendo al menos jugar "A bird story" debido a que hay algunas referencias que quiza puedas quedarte como de "¿porqué menciono eso?" o "¿sobre que cosa esta hablando él?"
 
[spoiler]
Bueno, vamos con la historia, la historia ronda alrededor de Colin, es un ex-piloto el cual llevaba piloteando desde que era un adulto, es el mismo protagonista de A bird story, pero en este caso en su lecho de muerte, el cual, se menciona que contrata a las industrias sigmund  para poder cumplir su sueño, el cual consiste en que quiere ser feliz, pero, Colin especifica muy en claro que quiere que se modifique lo menos posible de sus recuerdos, dado que no quiere olvidar nada. Feliz es una palabra muy dificil de interpretar, porque para lo que alguien es felicidad, para otro puede no serlo, esto da muchos dolores de cabeza a Eva y Neil debido a que no saben por donde empezar ya que no tienen un "punto" al cual llegar, debido a que no hay un deseo especifico, a diferencia de To the moon, en donde Neil y Eva realmente tenían un "punto" al cual llegar, que era llevar a Jonnhy a la luna, era ir desde atras hacía delante. En este caso, ellos se encuentran en una espiral, me explico, cuando visitan el recuerdo de Colin anciano, al capturar los mementos, se van inmediatamente hasta el Colin niño, lo cual, en teoria es "ilogico" porque no puedes saltarte toda una vida entera con un solo recuerdo u objeto preciado; hasta este punto sabemos que Colin esta casado y tiene un hijo, pero, al viajar a sus recuerdos cuando este era niño, nos damos cuenta de un interes "amoroso" que tenía Colin con una vecina de él, que vivia enfrente de su departamento llamada Faye. Conforme avanza la historia, Neil y Eva se percatan que las cosas no cuadran, por que conforme mas van retrocediendo (del Colin anciano al Colin "adulto") y avanzando (del Colin niño al Colin "adulto") se forma una espiral como dije, y llega a un punto intermedio que es con Colin adulto, se percatan que hay momentos "ilogicos" debido a que, en los recuerdos posteriores a Colin adulto, Faye nunca es mencionada como si nunca hubiera existido, ni su esposa la recuerda, mientras que, los momentos anteriores a Colin adulto, Faye siempre esta al lado de Colin, apoyandolo y siendo su amiga. Cuando esan apunto de llegar al "medio" de todos los recuerdos, Neil sale un momento a hacer un papeleo urgente y deja a Eva dentro de la maquina para encontrar un memento que les resultaba imposible encontrar, minutos despues, Neil recibe una llamada de Eva de manera urgente, avisandole que investigue los datos sobre Faye, debido a que, sospecha que ella es la causante del problema con Colin, solamente para percatarse que no existe ninguna "Faye" registrada, osea, nunca existió una tal Faye en el mundo; despues de eso, Neil recibe otra llamada, y al parecer, está se corta debido a un problema con la maquina, por lo que Neil entra rapidamente a la maquina, solo para percatarse que Eva se encuentra desaparecida y darse cuenta que Faye tiene conciencia propia y puede controlar todo en la mente de Colin; Faye, les pide a él y a Eva que se retiren de la mente de Colin, debido a que el problema de Colin inicialmente fue las industras sigmund; comienzan una pelea Neil y Faye para "eliminarse" uno al otro, pero, llega un punto en el que ella es derrotada por Eva, ya que, logra salir de la maquina y de alguna manera color sedantes en la mente de Colin, que era la que estaba dandole todo ese "poder" a Faye, una vez tranquilizada pueden seguir haciendo su trabajo, pero, ¡oh sorpresa!, tienen poco tiempo debido a que los sedantes no duraran mucho y el cuerpo de Colin ya no aguantará más, su muerte esta cerca; logran conseguir el ultimo memento para entrar al ultimo recuerdo de Colin (el de su "adultez"), una vez ahí, en ese recuerdo, Colin esta apunto de irse lejos, ya que esta apunto de cumplir su sueño de ser piloto de aviones (que me falto agregar, que dicho deseo fue influenciado por Faye) y no podrá ver a Faye en mucho tiempo; despues de una charla entre ellos 2, se revela la verdad, Faye NO ES alguien real, si no, es un "amigo imaginario" creado por Colin desde la niñez que lo acarreo hasta su adultez, esto debido a que, como se mostro en A bird story (y aquí se menciona en un recuerdo), Colin siempre estaba solo debido al trabajo de sus padres, por lo que, no tenia amigos, era solitario, y eso le forzo a hacerse un amigo imaginario; Faye le menciona a Colin que es tiempo de que la "olvide y crezca", que tiene todavia una vida por delante en el mundo "real", despues de un momento emotivo, Colin acepta la realidad y olvida a Faye, dejandola ir para siempre, pero esta, antes de irse le recuerda que volverá en algún momento, para que Colin le cuente todo lo que ha hecho de su vida. Al final, Eva y Neil siguen dentro de la mente de Colin, y Faye esta libre ahora debido a que los sedantes se terminaron, pero tienen que salir ya debido a que Colin esta apunto de fallecer, por lo que, en ultima instancia, Neil se da cuenta de todo, la razón por la que Colin no "podia ser feliz del todo" era por que Faye nunca regreso y al enterarse de las industrias Sigmund él quería verla de nuevo lo cual, para Faye, era malo, debido a que quería que Colin creciera y viviera plenamente; por ultima instancia, Neil le da control absoluto sobre la mente de Colin a Faye, y esta, ya en su lecho de muerte y en su vejez, aparece por ultima vez para desaparecer de sus recuerdos a las industrias sigmund y porder despedirse de él para siempre, además de disculparse por haber desaparecido y nunca regresar, y lo último que Colin le dice al morir es: "No tienes porque disculparte, muchas gracias por haber sido la única amiga que tuve" y posterior a eso, Colin muere.

Perdon si me trague acentos, comas, etc... lo escribí muy noche y tenía demasiadas lagrimas en los ojos hahaha (no es broma, si es real)
[/spoiler]

Pros:
- Gráficas mejoradas (no esperes nada realista, pero, realmente se nota mucha mejora en los diseños y animaciones)
- La música (a pesar que se reciclan una que otra tonada de To the moon, en su mayoria el soundtrack es nuevo y muy muuuuuuy emotivo)
- Buena combinación tanto en "bromas" y momentos emotivos, nunca se salen del contexto
- Duración "buena" (alrededor de 5-6 horas)

Lo meh:
- Idioma (realmente estaba considerando si ponerlo o no, el inglés que emplea el juego no es "complejo", con que sepas lo básico del inglés ya lo dominaste, aunque, se que para muchas personas, el hecho de tener una historia y no saber tanto inglés les causa muchos problemas)
- Historia enredada (esto va de la mano con lo del inglés, digamos que la historia es algo rebuscada, pero no por eso es mala, es excelente, de hecho me atrevo a decir que Kan Gao pudo superar la de To the moon)

Lo malo:
-Quizá el unico punto que le veo malo es la "resolucion" si lo escalas con "Alt + enter" te abre el modo pantalla completa, pero que pasa, esta limitado a 640 x 480, por lo que no puedes cambiar de pestaña sin hacer que tu windows se mueva en el escritorio

10/10, realmente es muy recomendable, tiene buen precio, así que, que esperas; traigan pañuelos :'u

38319144.review:
Finding Paradise è il sequel di un gioco che ho adorato nella sua semplicità, To The Moon. Pur essendo il seguito di quest'ultimo, e quindi presentando un approfondimento sul cast principale, credo vada vissuto come una cosa nuova, non come "To The Moon 2", proprio perché, se lo si vive con cuore aperto, regala emozioni molto diverse, ma molto molto intense (in alcuni passaggi anche più del predecessore).
Non credo ci sia bisogno di dire che si gioca molto poco, così come nel predecessore (ma comunque più di quest'ultimo), e che il focus è completamente sulla narrazione e sull'estetica visiva e musicale.
Ultima nota di merito: le citazioni. Ce ne sono tantissime, a tanti giochi del passato e non solo! (Doc Manhattan who?)
Fatevi un regalo natalizio e giocateci, costa appena 10€, ma vi regalerà 5 ore di assolute emozioni.

38319105.review: I've eagerly anticipated this ever since announcement, and I ... I have nothing but soaring recommendations. It's a graphic novel almost, and the theme is so relatable, with music that is its own thing, but also has a lot of callbacks to previous episodes. I love it. Thank you.

38318781.review:
Kan Gao and his team have done it again. They have managed to tell a story that is witty, warm, and in some ways educational. Without spoiling details from either To The Moon or this game, I can say that both titles work wonders in exploring the concepts of mind, memory, and mental health. They do not shy away from the rougher edges of the human condition, and in doing so tell genuine and heart-tugging tales.
In short, if you like narrative driven games, buy this and To The Moon( and, should you feel so inclined, A Bird Story, though I actually recomend this after playing the other two). They are both masterpieces in their own right.
Be aware that these games are not so much "games" as they are interactive novellas( though this one does have a few refreshing gameplay tweaks here and there) That's about all I can say if you're new to the franchise.

Now, I will talk to the home crowd, the ones that have been waiting for this for ages. I will be frank: this is not the same kind of story as To The Moon, and does not hit as universally as the romance between Johnny and River. What we get, in my opinion is no less powerful, even if it isnt as universal. I still felt endeared to all of the characters, and it was nice to see Niel and Eva developed even further. There are also tons of refrences to To The Moon if you pay attenton, and even a well crafted nod to A Bird Story( note that our patient here is the boy in A Bird Story as an adult). There's also a TON on intrigue that leads me to believe that this franchise will be around for a while longer, and I for one am quite excited for whats to come.
TL:DR
Get the game if you liked To The Moon. Gao deserves it.

38318444.review:
It's so hard not to compare Finding Paradise to To The Moon, especially in terms of the story they tell. But to do so would be a disrespect to the devs and the game itself. So I'll skip the plot and jump straight into the gameplay and technical stuff, because this is where the devs really stepped up.

The style and theme were practically the same, but for it to have taken 6 years+ to develop you can bet there's improvement. Everything just seems more meticulous somehow. I thought TTM was a bit on the crude side, but every scene in FP just looks so polished and perfectly hued and [i]right[/]. Characters have waaay more sprites, too, which really helps making characters even more real and relatable. But the best part is, no more random plants blocking the way! 

There's more ...interactivity to the world than in TTM. And, [spoiler] you can actually fight as Neil this time! [/spoiler] There's more game elements, and there're more choices to make, even though they aren't plot-important. 

Some minuses, still. The game crashed on me 2 times! Something about bitmap not generated, and I highly suspect it's the special sprites in some scenes. I was playing on something less than a potato, though, so this will probably not happen to you. And maybe for the same reason, the text and scenes were a bit slow and glitchy everytime there's a special effect like leaves falling, lighting, etc. Sometimes the map is not effectively designed against backtracking, [spoiler] even Neil said it at one point, [/spoiler] so it might take away the immersion. Some mechanics are only introduced once and never appeared again, but hopefully they will be in use more in the later episodes, because [spoiler] switching between Neil and Eva is so cool and has so much potential [/spoiler]. 

Overall, it's a good game, lads. 5/7, would buy at launch again.

38317953.review:
I find that sequels to games like To the Moon are a bit difficult to pull off. How can one not only capitalize on the humor, mystery, and comfiness of the first one, but expand upon it?

This question should be asked to Freebird Games Developer Kan Gao, because Finding Paradise is an exceptional sequel and definitely gets my recommendation. The humor is wonderful, the story is gripping, and the game has several emotional moments that really make this a must play if you enjoyed To The Moon. 

The game isn't too long, I beat it in a single playthrough of 5 hours, but it's just as long as it needs to be to tell a good story. If you're looking for that then look no further than Finding Paradise. Let's just hope they don't take as long with the next sequel!

finding paradise不像To the moon这般出色，在大众游戏中不是容易安利的游戏，但是它能给愿意懂你的人而游玩。因为他是高瞰的内心，也是某些人群的内心，也是我的

38317855.review:
3.7小时一口气通关了。如果说To The Moon的主旨是弥补遗憾，Finding Paradise的主旨更倾向于摆脱遗憾。

在人生以往的时间线上你实际做出了的选择只有一个，这些选择或完美或残缺勾勒出成就了现在的你的轨迹。所以遗憾也是你的一部分呀，珍惜这些遗憾并拥抱现实吧——虽然我知道这是面对人生一个正确的态度，然而我不愿意。想象因为无拘束且完美才热烈，才会让人类无可避免地醉心其中，才会让当年的我觉得To The Moon的剧情真的是太美丽了。

好评归好评，我是真的要更加喜欢To The Moon的。如果我能消化所有现实中的遗憾带来的苦，那我为什么还要玩游戏呢。

Finding Paradise     10/10

38317615.review:
I didn't hate it, but by the end of the game I ended up with more negative feelings than positive ones.

The Good:
-improved Visuals
-spot on humor
-decent music
-decent game length 

The Not So Good:
-story is convoluted
-bland characters
-doesn't answer many questions and raises too many new ones.

Honestly, I didn't connect with the characters in this game.  I enjoyed Eva and Neil well enough.  I could not build an emotional connection with Colin.  He really felt bland as a character.  he really didn't have any trauma or real struggles to deal with.  I feel as though the story had to get a little crazy to counter this, but as a result, Colin really was lost in the mix.  By the end of it, I forgot the story was even about him in the first place.  When you have a story driven game like this, you need more interesting and flawed characters (like River and Johnny).  The story and new characters fell flat for me, which is a major shortcoming in a story based game.


It's also a pet peeve of mine to have so many unanswered questions.  I understand you need some,  but none of the overall mysteries were answered at all.  Then on top of that, a ton of new mysteries were piled on.  I feel this game suffers from middle book syndrome, where it really just exists to set up stuff for the next entry.  I'm to the point in my life where I don't want to wait around for years just to get some (if any) answers.  I get impatient and do not want to bother waiting around. I've been burned by too many series I suppose. 

Congratulations to Freebird Games, on what seems to be a very successful entry.  But sadly, this was a miss for me.

38317352.review:
Wacky Hajinks, Soft and Enjoyable Music, Mystery, The Godfather, Dr. Neil Watts, and a beautiful story about a bird truly brought to an end.

This game was truly worth the 5 year wait (not counting the Minisodes and A Bird's Story) and you bet your ass I am ready to wait another 5 years for episode 3.

38317336.review:
There's something very nostalgic about Finding Paradise. Of course, that could be the entire year it has been since I finished To the Moon and shed an unashamed amount of tears over, but still Finding Paradise seems to exude nostalgia. The narrative in this episode is one of coming to age and lonliness, learning to accept that as we grow older, we have to let things go. Yet when we let things go, sometimes, we are rewarded with something tuly great. Finding Paradise is a story of learning to live with regrets and accepting that they are a part of life, no matter the circumstances. 
In the end, Finding Paradise is not To the Moon. It never could be. Finding Paradise is a whole different rollercoaster ride, but it is still another beautiful piece of storytelling from Freebird. I've been a fan since I played To the Moon and I am eagerly awaiting their continuation of this story. 10/10

38316849.review:
ภาษาไทยด้านล่างจ่ะ

Great Story to be told.
This game is a sequal to To the moon, TTM minisode. A Bird Story, Sigmund minisode
You must have to play all the game above to enjoy the Full story and meaning of this game.

While if you don't it's still a great story
But in the feeling that make my tear come up. To The Moon is more impact. But Finding Paradise is a wonderful story though. 

This game have a sweet bgm and deep story. I want to told you more but i don't want to spoiled the story.

And yes... This is not the end of this series... I'm waiting for the next sequal ...

" WHAT's HER " that he said anyway... and ... that pills again... what happen to him....

-----------

TLDR

Finding Paradise และ To the moon Story รีวิวและสปอยล์ + สรุปรวม

เกมภาคต่อของ To The Moon ซึ่งถ้าคุณอยากจะเล่นเกมนี้อย่างได้อารมณ์เต็มๆ คุณควรจะเล่น To The Moon , Sigmund Minisode 1, A Bird Story, Sigmund minisode 2 มาก่อน

แต่ถึงจะไม่เคยเลย เกมนี้ก็ยังให้เนื้อเรื่องกับคุณได้อย่างเต็มอิ่ม

เรื่องราวของเกม เล่าถึงงานของ Dr. Neil Watt และ Dr. Eva Rosaline สองเจ้าหน้าที่หัวกระทิ จากบริษัท Sigmund Corp. ที่เป็นบริษัทที่ " สามารถส่งเสริมและทำให้ความฝันของทุกคนเป็นจริงได้อย่างแน่นอน ไม่ว่าคุณจะอยากเป็นเศรษฐี เป็นซุปเปอร์ฮีโร่ เหาะขึ้นไปดวงจันทร์ หรือบินไปกับมังกรตัวใหญ่ ข้ามมิติไปเริ่มชีวิตใหม่ในต่างโลก เราทำได้หมด โดยไม่ต้องอาศัย Truck san เพียงแต่ การจะทำสิ่งนั้นได้ ต้องเป็นก่อนวาระสุดท้ายของชีวิตคุณ ติดต่อเราสิครับ ไม่มีอะไรสายเกินไป "

ใช่แล้ว Sigmund เป็นบริษัทที่มีเทคโนโลยีก้าวล้ำ ที่สามารถเปลี่ยนความทรงจำของมนุษย์ที่กำลังจะถึงวาระสุดท้ายของชีวิต และสร้างโลกเสมือนในสมองของพวกเขา ก่อนที่พวกเขาจะลาจากโลกนี้ไปอย่างมีความสุขในโลกเสมือนแห่งนั้น ที่เปรียบกับการมีชีวิตใหม่ในโลกใหม่อันเป็นนิรันดร์

บริษัทแห่งนี้ถูกผู้คนบางกลุ่มรังเกียจ ด้วยข้อหาที่ ทำตัวเปรียบเสมือนพระเจ้า ที่ปรับเปลี่ยนความทรงจำและชีวิตคนได้ และด้วยการที่พวกเขาไปหาลูกค้าและ " เนรมิตรความฝัน "ให้พวกเขาได้ ก็คือตอนที่ก่อนลูกค้าจะสิ้นลมเท่านั้น ทำให้ พนักงานในชุดกาวน์สีขาวของบริษัทนี้ ได้ถูกมองเป็น " ยมทูต " ไปเสีย

เราได้พบเรื่องราวของ Niel และ Eva ครั้งแรกใน To The Moon ซึ่งคนไข้นั้น ปราถนาอยากไปดวงจันทร์ ก่อนที่จะสิ้นลม ซึ่งกฏของการเนรมิตรความใฝ่ฝันนั้น มันไม่ใช่ว่าแค่เสกให้สมองสร้างโลกเสมือน ทำเหตุการณ์ขึ้นยานอวกาศไปดวงจันทร์ก็จบ เพราะนั่นไม่ใช่การ " ตอบสนองความฝัน " ของลูกค้า

Dr. Neil และ Eva ต้องค้นหาสาเหตุของความใฝ่ฝันนั้นก่อนว่า ทำไมลูกค้าของพวกเขาถึง อยากจะไปดวงจันทร์ ด้วยการท่องไปในความทรงจำผ่าน Memento ของพวกเขา ซึ่งเราจะต้องแก้ Puzzle ต่างๆเพื่อนผ่านไป และหาเหตุผลจนพบ จากนั้นก็ส่งเขาไปดวงจันทร์อย่างมีความสุขด้วยการ รีรันเรื่องราวทั้งหมดและปรับเปลี่ยนเหตุการณ์ให้สมเหตุสมผล และจบลงอย่างสวยงาม เรียกน้ำตาจากผู้เล่นเกมนี้ไปได้ทั่วโลก

แต่ไม่ใช่แค่เรื่องราวของลูกค้าเท่านั้นที่น่าติดตาม ในขณะเดียวกันที่ Niel และ Eva ท่องไปในความทรงจำ เราจะได้ทำความรู้จักตัวละครทั้งสองคนไปในตัว อุปนิสัยและเรื่องราวที่ซ่อนลึกอยู่ค่อยๆผูกปมมากขึ้น เพื่อให้เราติดตาม

เนื่องจาก Niel มีฉากที่หลบไปกินยา ที่ดูจะสำคัญกับเขาและเนื้อเรื่องมาก อีกทั้งใน Minisode ที่ทำออกมานั้น มีฉากของ Eva ที่น่าสงสัยหลายเรื่อง ทำให้แฟนๆยังตั้งสมมติฐานกันมากมายว่า เรื่องราวนั้นเป็นโลกเสมือนที่ซ้ำซ้อนขึ้นมาในสมองของ ใครซักคนในสองคนนี้กันแน่หรือเปล่า

กลับมาที่ Finding Paradise ในภาคนี้ ลูกค้า " ผู้ปรารถนา ที่อยากจะมีความสุข โดยอย่าปรับเปลี่ยนอะไรในความทรงจำของเขา หรือหากต้องทำ ขอให้แก้ไขเกี่ยวกับครอบครัวของเขาให้น้อยที่สุดเท่าที่จะทำได้ " เป็นสิ่งที่ Niel และ Eva ไม่เคยพบเจอมาก่อนกับคำขอนี้
...

38316767.review: I don't even know where to begin, I guess i'm looking forward to part 3. Aside from the future, I absolutly loved To the Moon, it was one of those rare perfect games that make you feel like you are enjoying a piece of someone's true passion. this game felt like a continuation of their passion and creativity. 38316710.review:
Finding Paradise is an absolutely amazing, breathtaking, bittersweet, beautiful, and all things wonderful and representative of people’s expressive nature in their lives kinda game. This entire series exposes our fears, worries, anxieties, challenging and exploring uncontrollable aspects of ourselves in a truly magnificent way. It never assumes how the player should feel but rather tells a story, a true story, about people living their lives warts and all. And despite its bizarre sci-fi elements, there’s nothing fake about it.

Out of all the games I've played this year, Finding Paradise tells the most important story in the smallest package that everyone needs to hear. What a masterpiece.

38316439.review:
Just like Kan Gao's other released titles this is yet another great game. Finding Paradise really is the sequel that To the Moon deserves and it isn't just a poor copy with a different story. This game retains the charm, emotion and mystery of the first game while telling a story in its own unique way, and it all concludes in a very nice ending that shows the player that there is more to tell.

I cannot recommend Kan Gao's games enough as each and every one is a great ride where you can simply enjoy reading the dialogue and listening to the masterfully composed music. Kudos to everyone involved in this 'soon-to-be' trilogy, I waited 6 years for this sequel and I will gladly wait 6 years for the next.

38315703.review:
To The Moon might possibly be my favourite game of all time, but unfortunately Finding Paradise didn't live up to nearly the same standard. In retrospect, while I was not thrilled with A Bird Story, I would have to rate the franchise: TTM > Minisodes > A Bird Story > Finding Paradise.

I didn't connect with Finding Paradise's main character or overall plotline at all. When the game ended, I was left saying "wait, that's it?" The vast majority of the game carried zero emotional impact for me, with the exception of a very brief scene near the end. It didn't offer any meaningful progression of Neil and Eva's storylines from the end of TTM and especially the stunning ending of the 2nd holiday minisode; it made a couple of references to that plot, and perpetuated the mystery just the tiniest bit, without offering the player any meaningful movement forward along that thread.

I think this game suffers greatly for being a sequel to To The Moon. If Finding Paradise had come out first followed by TTM, I might have been more positive about it. TTM was such a masterpiece, not just because of the plot and emotional impact, but also with its multiple breathtaking standout musical pieces that I regularly listen to years after it came out. Finding Paradise has decently good music, but nothing remotely approaching the magnificence of For River, Moonwisher, Once Upon a Memory, or Everything's Alright.

The gameplay is also a huge step backwards. I usually don't like gameplay-light experiences like TTM, but as I said, TTM is my favourite game. Finding Paradise, in terms of gameplay, is frustrating and tedious by comparison--the "memento preparation" puzzles are very poorly explained to the player and are tedious and trial-and-error based to solve, vs. the simple, clear requirements of TTM's puzzles; though, honestly, I think either game works far better without these little puzzles. The experience of finding memory links is generally comparable to TTM, as is the general gameplay, but there are a couple of "combat sequences" vaguely reminiscent of the "Zombievas" sequence from TTM which are far more frustrating to play. I repeatedly wished the game was over, and at one point, came close to just quitting it and watching a youtube playthrough instead.

I know I'm in the minority based on the overwhelmingly positive reviews for this game, but as a diehard TTM fan, I was really let down here. If I had to sum up the experience compared to TTM, I'd emphasize that the plot was hollow, with characters I couldn't bring myself to care about, no satisfying resolution, mediocre music, and virtually zero emotional impact; and that the gameplay was, at many points, frustrating and tedious, making me wish the game was over.

Prepare your tissues; you're in for a treat.
It exceeded all my expectations, being an emotional journey from start to finish, as well as being funnier than To the Moon. The music is great, the story is fantastic, but a little confusing at first. I had several moments where I was wondering what was happening, and where the plot was going.

There were minigames within the story which stopped the game from being a typical rpg maker product for a while. The memory link puzzle is different this time around, getting more difficult as you progress.

The person whose memories you explore is the same character from A Bird Story. You don't need to play that to enjoy this game, but for those who have will find Finding Paradise more heart clutching, as the character we got to know several years ago is now doomed to die.

Long story short, if you have the money, I recommend playing this game. You won't regret it.

38315075.review:
Finding Paradise. То, чего так долго ждали все — а этих 'всех', уж поверьте, немало — кому в своё время удалось прикоснуться к шедевру от Као Гана под символичным названием To The Moon. И несмотря на то, что про первый эпизод 'кроителей воспоминаний' я узнал всего-то чуть больше года назад (хотя датируется он 2011-ым годом), с не меньшим интересом следил за каждой новостью о новом проекте — продолжении рассказанной ранее истории. Но, прежде чем углубляться в дебри, хотелось бы поведать о некоторых личных представлениях.

Да, я действительно очень ждал. Но крайне опасался или, если угодно, даже боялся. Чего? Того, что ожидания не оправдаются, и продолжение ни на дюйм не сравнится с первой игрой. Почему? Ну, скажем так, для меня To The Moon стала такой вещью, которая... Как бы точнее объяснить — идеальна в единичном экземпляре. То есть, нечто такое, что неимоверно поглотило, растрогало, вдоволь набренчалось на всех струнах души, отложилось в памяти и больше не требует к себе добавки (хотя уже давно известно, что этой добавки не избежать). Знаете, как шикарный многоярусный торт — приставь к нему ещё одну кремовую розочку, и он под собственной тяжестью распадётся на кусочки. Ох уж эти мои аналогии... Но я это к чему — да, я продолжал ждать и опасаться, что что-то пойдёт не так. Что ж, настала пора для подтверждения (или же опровержения?) опасений.

С первых минут геймплея становится понятно, что Finding Paradise — всё та же старая-добрая To The Moon. На месте осталось всё: харизматичные и крайне годно прописанные персонажи, наиприятнейшие пиксельные спрайты и фоны, аллюзийный юмор, от которого иногда хочется буквально заорать в голос, и многие другие мелочи, которые полюбились игрокам. Единственное, что претерпело изменение (хотя и не кардинальное) — пазловые мини-игры при активации так называемого мементо: пятнашки сменили 'три в ряд', добавилось несколько интерактивных элементов, усложняющих решение. Но в целом пазлеры по-прежнему остались незатейливыми и просто-напросто разбавляют основное чтение-брождение. 

Сохраняя свою излюбленную манеру, я, как и прежде, абстрагируюсь от любых сюжетных спойлеров и лишь вкратце расскажу об основной завязке. В отличии от Джонни, последнее желание Колина — нового пациента Евы и Нила — нам становится известно далеко не с самого начала, что уже добавляет в историю своеобразной 'мистерии'. Да, это всё та же To The Moon. Но не в плане подачи сюжета. То, что Кан всеми силами постарался придать новому эпизоду уникальный стиль, который одновременно и связывает его с первым, и делает сильно на него не похожим, заметно невооружённым глазом. И это есть хорошо — в Finding Paradise отлично гармонируют как многочисленные отсылки к местам, событиям и лицам из 'На Луну', так и совершенно новые сценарные фишки, не отпускающие до самого конца. Особенно порадовало то, как тонко связались воедино два эпизода, два 'минизода' к первой части и тизер A Bird Story. И прямо здесь же подведу итог: в общем-то, я зря опасался. Новая история вышла не менее шикарной, чем предыдущая, а все эти твистовые повороты-мордовороты по-настоящему сносят голову в хорошем смысле этого выражения. Не обошлось и без классического 'слёзопролития' — градус эмоций в концовке всё так же шкалит до предела.

Долго думал, как описать саундтрек без всех этих эпитетов-клише, и решил ограничиться следующим: ну это ж Кан Гао и Лаура Шигихара, ё-моё! Вы что, действительно ожидали, что они запорят музыку для своего детища? Ну, если ожидали, облом — подвезли целый камаз мурашек. Ушки ещё долго будут петь дифирамбы, остаётся дождаться добавления в Стим полного пака с саундом. 

Помните, как в детстве нам хватало всего пары десятков бит для счастья? То-то. Игрострой огроменнейшими шагами топаёт вперёд, графика и режиссура в современных играх всё ближе к дорогущим иконам кинематографа, не за горами виртуальная реальность... Но где-то рядом — только руку протяни — мягко, осторожно ютятся инди-проекты, сродни тому, ради чего, собственно, и была затеяна вся эта авантюра. Которым не нужно системных мощностей и больших цифр бюджета. Но которые из раза в раз доказывают, что ничуть не хуже (а зачастую — куда лучше) своих 'больших братьев'. Ладно, пора идти смывать слёзки и... Ждать третьего эпизода. Ну а как иначе-то?

38314860.review:
A great game. The music is brilliant, the visuals are superb and the story is well-crafted as well. I wouldn't say it's tear-jerking like To The Moon, but there are certainly a fair few emotional moments. The lighthearted humour and general cheesiness is certainly a defining feature of these games, and I found it good for the most part, but I personally found it became a bit too overbearing at times with some of the action-y sequences. 

However, my main gripes with this game come from RPG Maker. Man oh man I wish something better was used. There doesn't seem to be any accounting for screen resolution, with the game instead stretching when in fullscreen and it really doesn't look good. Furthermore, only a small square in the centre of the screen is utilised leaving a significant amount of unused screen real estate. There is also intermittent stuttering when moving around, which is really distracting. The smoothing option enabled by default in the F1 screen seems to eliminate most of it, but it doesn't seem to go far enough. Even worse, the F1 menu doesn't seem to be usable with the mouse when in fullscreen mode, so good luck using your keyboard to navigate it.

Though I hope the issues above can be addressed, I fully expect they're limitations of the engine. But they still detract from the experience nontheless.

As a huge fan of the first game, To the Moon, I've been waiting for this game with baited breath since it was first announced. Today I was having a really bad day but seeing that this was finally released cheered me right up, and as ironic as it is, playing this game from start to finish just made my day a million times better. Ken Gao, the writer/director of this series, is a true creative genius for coming up with such beautiful, heartfelt stories that are also immensely entertaining due to witty dialogue and haphazard pop culture references. Now that I've devoured this one, I will wait just as hungrily for the next installment in this beautiful narrative experience!

If you are eager for some truly heartachy feels and a beautiful story with some hilarious characters, give this a shot! You really don't need to play To the Moon to enjoy it, though I would recommend playing that game to get a deeper experience with this one. And both of these games are about 6 hours long, so you could complete both in a day if you really wanted to.

PS: I'd like to thank FreeBird Games for creating wonderful masterpieces that fill me with such delicious feels! I love what you do, please don't ever stop!

6 Jahre hab ich nach "To the Moon" auf "Finding Paradise" gewartet.

6 Jahre!

Für 5 Stunden Spielzeit... Der größte Kritikpunkt also gleich Vorneweg: Das Spiel ist VIEL zu kurz. *heul* -.-

Der Humor ist etwas Alberner geraten als in den Vorgängern, was ich Persönlich aber nicht zwingen Negativ finde. Die Steuerrung hat einen Riesensprung nach vorne gemacht, auch wenn sie in den Action-Szenen immer noch reichlich Hackelig ist... Immerhin kann man in den besagten Szenen jetzt gezielt und überlegt Agieren anstatt einfach nur im  Panikmode auf den Tasten zu Trommeln. Der zwischenzeitig eingestreute "Paper-Plane-Sidescroll-Shooter" macht sogar richtig Laune. Und zudem sind derartige Einlagen selten und dienen der Auflockerung in dieser ansonsten eher Dialoglastigen Interactive Fiction.

Grafisch ist Finding Paradise genau das, was man erwartet; Extrem hübsche Pixelgrafik, aber trotzdem noch Pixelgrafik. Gut wenn manns mag, nicht so toll wenn mans nicht mag. Ich geb 10/10, denn Ich mag hübsche Pixelgrafik.

Der Soundtrack und die Storry sind DIE Argumente zum Kauf. Der Soundtrack untermalt dezent die Szenen durch die sich die Protagonisten Bewegen und drückt dabei auch schonmal sehr gezielt auf die Tränendrüse. Kan Gao und Laura Shigihara setzen hier Maßstäbe.

Also... ein sehr kurzes Vergnügen. Ist es den Kaufpreis wert?
Jup. Absolut. Zumindest meiner Meinung nach. Schon allein deshalb weil ich den nächsten Teil haben will, und das geht nur wenn die Macher damit auch Geld verdienen können.

38314037.review:
[h1]总体评价[/h1]

沿袭上作 [i]To the Moon[/i] 的大体风格，加入了一定的创新元素，但总体情节没有大的突破，对于老玩家难免少了上作的惊艳感。结局给我一种不够尽兴、戛然而止的感觉。同时仍有若干仍然让我很困惑的地方。

[h1]具体感想[/h1]

接下来说说游戏一些具体的感想。

相比上作以爱情作为卖点，这作以“遗憾”为主题叙述另一位临终老人 Colin 的未竟之愿。作品想要表达的哲理[spoiler]（人生中的遗憾也是组成人生的重要部分）[/spoiler]也很清楚，在结局时的确让我眼角模糊，只要 clear 一次就能完整体会到。只是我个人感受是冲击力不如上作。[spoiler]三个 Episode ，第一部分是中规中矩、略有创新的记忆碎片收集，第二部分抛出疑点，第三部分解决部分疑问并收尾。[/spoiler]

然后重点说 Dr. Rosalene 和 Dr. Watts 的故事。这系列作品最大的亮点莫过于虚拟世界外的两位 Dr 和希望实现愿望者自身的故事的交叠，因此我对作品中他们的情节是额外关注的。

首先，Dr. Watts 一如既往地在策划一些事，并且本作中直接明目张胆地在玩家眼前[spoiler]嗑止痛药[/spoiler]，基本坐实了[spoiler]Dr. Watts明显是知情人，且 Dr. Rosalene 所在的仍然是一个假想世界，真正的“现实”中 Dr. Watts 情况并不乐观[/spoiler]，作中的暗示也比比皆是[spoiler]（如 Dr. Watts 玩笑般对 Dr. Rosalene 说她说不定也在自己假想的世界里；Faye 所说的回忆编造的那一段台词等等，有点记不清了）[/spoiler]。

然后这次的 Dr. Winters 喜闻乐见地[spoiler]发现了 Dr. Watts 对机器做的手脚，并对 Dr. Watts 计划表示参加[/spoiler]。老实说这点让人颇感疑惑，如果按照我上面的推断，[spoiler]那么他们后来表示参加其计划却独瞒着 Dr. Rosalene，说明 Dr. Rosalene 是处于 Dr. Watts 制造的世界并且是被帮助的对象[/spoiler]。

最后说说让我比较困惑的几点。

[spoiler]其一，绿色的书。可以推断的是 Colin 仍然在用柠檬汁的隐形秘诀写日记，并且不是写给 Faye 了。那最后 Dr. Watts 用打火机烤书页理论上应该是写他在想开之前对种种人生遗憾的纠结和执着，而不是积极的情节。

其二，那辆迷之造型酷炫的摩托车是谁开的？

其三，Dr. Watts 将 Faye 拷贝了一份，应该是结尾所说的“解决方案”。这也是他对头盔做手脚，取消稳定器等的原因。那么其目的基本可以断定是希望获得能够突破头盔防火墙限制的虚拟个体，说明他目前并不处于能自由脱出虚拟世界的状态。那是否可以认为 Dr. Watts 因为某种原因被困在了自己为了 Dr. Rosalene 创造的虚拟世界里？

其四，Dr. Rosalene 在记忆地图里鬼魂状态快被陨石砸到的时候为什么会有纸飞机过来打碎了陨石？
[/spoiler]

[h1]总结[/h1]

总的来说，收尾略感急促，临终方的故事比起上作质量略有不如，两位 Dr 的故事略有进展。个人给好评70%出于作品质量，30%出于情怀。我觉得有必要回去复习一下上作的 Minisode DLC。

最后是一点战斗小游戏中的小 trick：

[spoiler]前两-三次战斗应该是默认玩家失败，不会让玩家复选是否要继续；Faye 被削弱后再失败都会让玩家重选是否继续，目前不清楚选择“接受结果”会发生什么。纸飞机和格斗游戏都会变得比较简单，而最后的回合制战斗记得在 Faye 第一次用驯鹿犬冲撞攻击后扔鞋子，可以收来当队友而且攻击力巨高，不然单靠 Dr. Watts 不可能赢。[/spoiler]

ps：看来汉化组你们很勇嘛（震声）

38313627.review:
Just returned from that long journey through Kan's world.

Scrolled through some reviews complaining about the fact that Finding Paradise didn't make them cry. Since when crying is a requirement for a good game? Because man, this was totally awesome.
I had a few years since the game announcement to think about how the story would be turned, but I have to say I couldn't foresee the exact nature of the events that happened at all, despite all the hints since the beginning of the story.
[spoiler]Also, I have to say that suddenly hearing The Mirror Lied's theme after so long was so thrilling! I almost thought you were going to break the fourth wall. (well actually you've done it in some way!)[/spoiler]

I felt that Kan took pleasure to make every part of his game, the humor from To the Moon is still here (even more, i'd say!) and the soundtracks... Oh, jeez, do I really have to comment them? I guess nobody had their expectations betrayed on this point :) and while Kan may have said that he just defined a recurring theme in all of his tracks, you can feel the emotion he wants you to feel with each single soundtrack (trust me, some of them will make you shiver!) -- also, there's nothing wrong with using leitmotifs.

I really had a good time. Thanks, Kan.

[spoiler]Well, I was expecting a bit more answers about the big cliffhangers from the Minisode 2, but I guess it'll come later :)[/spoiler]

38313431.review:
Before playing this game, I had expectations, theories, and some general idea of how certain characters would be unraveled. After my first playthrough, all of these expectations were blown away, and in a very good way.

This game is much like the style of the other games the developer has made, but it's clear to see that the presentation has been mostly polished and that the flow of the story is very different. But the true beauty of this game lies in it's music, it's themes, and it's cohesion.

The themes that are focused on in this game are distinct from the themes that are focused in To the Moon. Through the impressive score and expansive narration, Finding Paradise aims to intensify these themes to help remind us why they are significant to a person, as well as to create emotion and sympathy. This overall aim was executed beautifully, but then again, I am only basing off my opinion throught the fact that I played all of the other Freebird games. Speaking of which, for those who did play the other Freebird games, you'll find that Episode 2 is very unique from the other titles, but very much the same in that same regard.

Whether you have or have not played the other titles, you won't be disappointed experiencing this wonderful journey for a dying person.

38313370.review:
Что ж. Стоило ли это того? Да. Игра отличная и определенно нужно её покупать. Но из-за слишком завышенных ожиданий было некоторое разочарование.
To The Moon задала слишком высокую планку качества и к сожалению Finding Paradise, какой бы хорошей игра не была, не перепрыгнула эту планку. Хоть комок в горле и был в конце, хоть история и была интересная в итоге, хоть и музыка отличная в целом, но эта игра не смогла потянуть за те струнки, за которые тянула To The Moon.
Мелодии отличные, но они не запоминаются. Песня в конце отличная, но она не запоминается. История отличная, но... она только трогательная, и всё. Нет чего-то, за что можно зацепиться.
Не завышайте свои ожидания. С момента выхода To The Moon прошло много времени, вы изменились. Вас уже не так легко тронуть, уже не так легко удивить. Лично я считаю что проблема игры не столько в завышенных ожиданиях, сколько в выборе темы. Она не так близка всем, как тема, поднятая в To The Moon.
Просто не сравнивайте. Игра отличная и может быть при перепрохождении я изменю свое мнение. Пока что всё так. Хуже To The Moon, однако всё равно отлично.

38312733.review:
Hello All,

Finding Paradise is the followup to To The Moon and follows the character in A Bird Story.

I am a To The Moon addict. I love discussing the many different objects, the music, the story, the characters, etc. with everyone who plays games. (I have a 100% success rate in referal turnover to fans for that game XD) I also enjoyed A Bird Story for what it's worth.

Now, this is a Finding Paradise review so I'd best stop talking about other games and talk about this one!

Finding Paradise is another journey full of suspense and emotion like its predecessor To The Moon. There was much crafty humor implemented in this game that had me laughing frequently. There are suspenseful moments in the story where I was unsure of what outcomes were going to be. There were also a few moments that were presented well to draw sadness out of the player.

Kan Gao continues his witty humor in Finding Paradise. I think this game had the most humor out of the three I have mentioned thus far and it isn't just reusing jokes that everyone has heard. Finding Paradise's humor is unique in that you don't see it coming, but anticipate the next bit of humor that is assuredly going to occur at some point. The use of mechanics and names from other games and movies as jokes is also a nice touch (Loved the mafia Kan, lol).

Finding Paradise improves most on the previous games in aspects of gameplay. Gameplay isn't the most important thing in a story-driven game and I get that, but Finding Paradise added new game mechanics at regular intervals to keep it interesting (I just was sad that my shoe attack did NOTHING, lol).

At this moment if I were to rate the three games I have mentioned I would give Finding Paradise a 9/10. It really is a different type of game than To The Moon in my opinion. I think that each will appeal more to seperate groups though both will be enjoyed alot. My ratings of the Freebird games:

Finding Paradise- 9/10
To The Moon- 10/10
A Bird Story- 8/10

I highly recommend everyone to play all three and though it is said that Finding Paradise is a standalone game (It is), you will miss out on ALOT of references if you do not complete the other two games first. Do yourself a favor and pickup all three of these amazing games.


(Amazing work once again Kan Gao. This was my most anticipated game this year and I am glad to have got to play it. Tell the team to keep making great games like this, the gaming industry needs these kind of games that focus on story. Gameplay is good in its own right, but the majority of my favorite games lack alot of gameplay and excel heavily in story. Thanks once again).

38312538.review:
Finding Paradise hem To The Moon'un hem de A Bird Story'nin devam oyunu. To The Moon'da olduğu gibi Eva ve Neill ölmek üzere olan birinin son arzusunu yerine getirmek için tekrar anılarda yolculuğa çıkıyorlar. Bu seferki hastamız A Bird Story'de küçüklüğünü oynadığımız Colin. Colin son arzusunu tam olarak söylemez. Eva ve Neill ne istedğini bulmak zorundadır. Hikayenin devamıyla ilgili bir şey yazmayacağım fazla spoiler olabilir.

A Bird Story e tek bağlantısı Colin'in odası ve balkonu tanıdık. Bir de çok az okulunda vakit geçiriyoruz. Hatta okulun bazı noktaları To The Moon'dan tanıdık :)

 Oynanış anlamında To The Moon'dan çok bir farkı yok. Gene anı parçalarını toplayıp Mementoları kırıp anıdan anıya geçiyoruz. To The Moon'dan farkı gençliğimizden çocukluğumuza kadar sırayla geçiyorduk. Finding Paradise'ta sırayla bir yaşlılık bir de çocukluk anılarına geçiyoruz (Sebebini oynayınca anlıyorsunuz). Finding Paradise ın farkı kısa olarak çok minik bir karakter yaratma ekranı var (Neill sağolsun. Hatta kıyafetlerde Mitril vardı kalkana +50 diyordu orada yarıldım. Gerçi 1 dakika içinde Eva eski hallerine döndürüyor). Bir de kısa olarak JRPGlerde olan sıra tabanlı dövüş ve Street Fighter tipi dövüşte var ama bunlar kısa sürüyor.

Hikayesi To The Moon kadar vurucu olmasa da özellikle sonlarına doğru kalbinize dokunduğu yerler var. Neill ve Eva gene bildiğimiz gibi birbirleriyle uğraşıyorlar. Hatta bu oyunda Neill daha komik

38310316.review:
Freebird 新作，依旧是watts和rosalene，还是完成夙愿的故事，这次还有第一时间的汉化，有什么理由不买呢？
暂时只玩了个开头，说一下目前这半个小时的感受：
1、优秀的像素画，自己接触了RPG maker之后才意识到做出这样的演出效果有多不容易，我在上一作对本作品的画质提出了更多的期待，但现在我知道他们在自己的能力范围之内在尽力做得最好。
2、熟悉的音乐，音乐表现的风格和上一作很接近，想必游戏体验过后会和to the moon一样听到这一段讲故事一样的音乐，就想起这一个故事。
游戏已通关，期待后面的dlc部分！
3、刚进入童年部分就有一种既视感，发现Colin果然就是A bird story的小男孩。后面也有联动。

接下来是正经的测评：
+++优秀的演出，rpgxp这个老爷车跑出了卓越的效果
+++优秀的剧本和节奏，包括游戏里Rosalene和Watts的走路和跑动节奏控制相当完美，高瞰的故事又是一部极其优秀的故事
+++与故事相辅相成的音乐，一如既往的和故事融合在了一起，大提琴的单调音阶和吉他钢琴组合成的旋律带着这个故事走进了心里
++  优秀的首发汉化，最大程度上传达了作者想表达的内容，部分英文的梗也进行了高亮表达，让我们光看翻译就能体会到原文的内容，相当出色。

10/10 36块钱，尤胜一场奥斯卡电影半筹的体验。

38309674.review:
Лайкoдpoчepы ещё толком поиграть не успели, а уже настрочили свои нaxyй никому не нужные рекомендации ни о чём и плачут.

Было бы наивно предполагать что продолжение [url=store.steampowered.com/app/206440/To_the_Moon/]To the moon[/url] будет таким же шедевром. Хотя...
Здесь так же присутствуют простые, без лишнего пафоса, душевные диалоги, с немалой долей юмора. Прекрасная заглавная тема и тема из главного меню, звучащие в разных аранжировках и играющие в нужных местах, которые многим западут в душу. Интригующий сюжет в котором есть загадка и неплохой сюжетный поворот. Возможно отчасти, именно благодаря этой загадке здесь практически отсутствуют: сопереживание персонажам, драматизм, и нет по-настоящему трогательных моментов. Разве что в конце, да и то негусто. Главная эмоция простирающаяся по всей "линии времени" игры - это улыбка умиления. [url=store.steampowered.com/app/206440/To_the_Moon/]To the moon[/url] была способна разбудить самые потаённые чувства у самых прожжённых циников и в большинстве случаев у неё это получалось. И если ту игру можно было советовать вообще всем (и даже тем, кто в игры совсем не играет, но ты был уверен, что история тронет их до глубины души), вне зависимости от жанровых предпочтений. То у этой шанс будет значительно меньше. Безусловно найдутся те, и не мало, кого и эта история зацепит так же сильно как и предыдущая. Остаётся им только позавидовать и искренне за них порадоваться. Даже не знаю каково место было бы отведено этой игре в индустрии, не будь той, что вышла 6 лет назад. Прошла бы она незамеченной или тоже заняла свою нишу?!  И тем не менее, это всё равно неплохая интерактивная история, но уже которую, к сожалению, не посоветуешь всем и каждому.

38307789.review:
The full (German) review can be found on my [url=http://www.jack-reviews.com/2017/12/finding-paradise-review.html]blog[/url].

Finding Paradise is a sequel to To The Moon (and A Bird Story) that follows about the same beats as the original, especially where the gameplay is concerned. You dive into a dying person's memories, gather mementos and solve minor puzzles to descend even deeper into their past until you can fulfill their dying wish. There are a few new elements (which I don't want to spoil here), but they don't make much of a difference. And one of these didn't work so well due to being constricted by the limits of the rpg-maker engine.

So if you didn't like To The Moon, you won't like this game either. But everything feels a lot more polished, the soundtrack is amazing, and the story diverges more than enough to stand on its own. Not to mention that it's beautiful and funny and also really sad, as I couldn't help but tear up multiple times throughout the story.

So if you loved To The Moon, I'm sure you'll love this too.

Наконец-то! Действительно серьезный повод сидеть и реветь в темноте обернувшись в плед.*смахивает слезу*
Обязательно к покупке всем поклонникам "To The Moon". Ну и тем, кто считает себя серьезным и безэмоциональным.
Сразу в меню вас встречает все та же прекрасная и слегка грустная музыка и приятный стиль.С первых минут игры наплывает ностальгия. 
Определенно стоило ждать столько лет.

Ну и разумеется более честные впечатления после игры: вероятно ожидания будут завышены, поэтому игра покажется менее удачной. Здесь те же главное герои доктора, но с новым пациентом, о котором можно узнать из игры "A Bird Story". История пациента интересная, заставляет иногда задуматься, иногда погрустить. Но несмотря на это игра не цепляет эмоционально настолько глубоко как первая, да и история оказалась слегка затянутой.
Но несмотря на эти придирки из-за завышенных ожиданий, игру определенно будет неплохой покупкой как поклонникам преддущей игры, так и просто для тех, кто хочет провести пару приятных вечером наблюдая за развитием истории, но при этом с минимальным геймплеем. Концовка и сандтрек того стоят.
К сожалению на текущий момент сандтрек не вышел отдельно (или не был обнаружен), а жаль... Если нет пробелм с английским, то не стоит оттягивать с знакомством. А всем остальным желающим рекомендую к покупке, вы не пожалеете.

38306240.review:
汉化组成员Madmoiselle_Latence

我想了下，还是要泼一波冷水。

回想一下自己在To the Moon的那份感动，你是更加可怜Johnny还是更加可怜River？如果你即使在Laura的歌下依然无法和River产生一些情感上的共鸣，你可能会发现Finding Pradise平淡的犹如一杯冲过数次的茶。

在Kan的那个采访上，他说，这些故事从来都是孤独的故事。孤独的自我，不被世界理解，想要向世界表现自己的内心，或是逃避着那个更大的世界。如果你不曾有过这样的经历，不曾有过这样的童年，你将无法与这些故事至关重要的一些情感流露产生共鸣。

那么话说到这个份上，大家应该已经明白了，为什么我要泼这盆冷水。这个作品本来就属于River和Colin，属于Kan。属于吾的好友小安，属于YYJ，属于Prof. Mond这些人。这也是我进行汉化的一个动力来源：这是一个我想让几位朋友都看见的作品。不是因为他们喜欢To the Moon，而是因为他们或许真的需要这样的作品来感到一丝人情冷暖。

希望他们能够明白，这个世界上已经有人带着大家了解了你们的世界。
希望他们能明白，只要愿意走出去，幸福的生活就会来临。
尽管走出去是一个说起来容易，何其艰难的事情。可是，你总要去做的。

希望他们能够尝尝这杯温暖的啤酒，暂时赶走那些孤独感。这也是一种动力。虽然不知道能够持续多久，but let the wonder never fade.



这是一首诗。献给Colin。也献给他们。
如果你玩通了游戏的话，再来看看我这拙作吧。

[spoiler]音阶

梦想自由的鸟儿，飞翔在自己小小的世界。
孤独的心灵，受伤的心灵。一朵傲立的木槿。

孩子气地封闭起自己的内心。
本来美丽的世界蒙上一片阴影。
但人生就像音阶，有伴奏，才是动听的旋律。
只有拥抱世界，才知道生活的意义。

没有字迹的书页，你想隐藏什么？
遗憾也好，过失也好，总得经历。
但人生就像音阶，有起伏，才是真正的旋律。
只有懂得取舍，才明白生命的真谛。

最初的分离让你耿耿于怀，
再别的寒风刺痛着你的眼睛。
但人生就像音阶，有始终，才是完整的旋律。
待一切尘埃落定，再回味一世的追寻。
[/spoiler]

这不会是一个听得下去的故事。
但是我知道这个故事最好的听众都会是谁。
